Headings: Will not print to some Canon models
Base_Reviews: I thought this was finally going to be a great printing app for my kindle fire. It installed easy and picked up my Canon Wifi right away. Unfortunately it wouldn't print. It kept saying "broken pipe".  I have a Canon MX452 and noticed the driver only says Canon mx45. There is no mx452 option:(

Not useful for me and totally unnessary.

The built in print driver on my Fire HD 8 could not find my old Brother printer. I needed something else and I found this which claimed to support my exact printer. I was not fooled like other reviewers. I knew this app was not free. First I downloaded the free app and ran a print test page. The test page color pattern came out fine. Success! Then I paid for the upgrade to the full version to print real documents. But no matter what I do, it prints only the first page and then stops. I sent email to tech support and asked for help or a refund. Nothing. Not even a reply to say they could not help me.I have seen other reviewers says that it works for them. That is great, but it definitely did not work for me and I got no help from them... not even an acknowledgement. If this is the kind of customer service they offer, all I can say is buyer beware! The test page in the free app does not guarantee that it will print real docs for you....

Headings: Did not properly work with my Brother DCP7065DN printer
Base_Reviews: Under "MayDay" guidance, we tried this app today, but could not get it to print files to my Brother Printer DCP7065DN Monochrome Laser Multi-Function Printer/Scanner/Copier. There was no DCP7065 driver, so the MayDay technician, knowing that higher number drivers are supposed to be backward compatible, tried the next higher driver, but no luck. That driver printed a boatload of blank pages, and trying to use the Brother driver did not work, and the iPrint app was not available from Chrome for some weird reason.The tech helped me with a workaround. Save the file as a PDF, then print the PDF. The iPrint driver does work woth the DCP7065. Hallelujah.

The app's appearance gives a comforting similarity to the MS flagship tools for the office.I'm basing my current rating on use of the spreadsheet support. I've limited my usage because the differences between this app and it's rival suggest that an update through this one might either render render the sheet unreadable or missing the information this app doesn't recognize.This app for example opens the sheet with the cursor positioned not where it was in the last save, but cell A1.This app tried to induce me to save to it's home cloud, and to MS's home cloud only after a manual search and tree walk, rather than the sheep's original location.This app does not give access to the sheet's Properties/Comments section.Nevertheless having this app on my Kindle is the best option available on my platform. Headings: BOY DO I WISH I HAD READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING THIS SOFTWARE
Base_Reviews: CAPITALIZATION in this review is NOT screaming ... just highlighting ...My initial "review to myself" was positive, when I tested a plain, short "Word" style document. It seemed to work just fine, and NOBODY releases software that doesn't work do they? snort!!! So I bought the program, and BOY! am I SORRY! that I did so, because I can now no longer get a refund as I have struggled SO long and SO hard, trying to make this piece of software do the simplest tasks.There is SO much of this app that either just plain does not work, or has VERY limited functionality, or does not work quite right, that I CANNOT in good conscience recommend this app to ANYONE for ANY reason.I have written to Support twice, and beyond the "We have received your request..." email notice, I have received NO response whatsoever to my request for assistance or clarification.The so called HELP system is more a list of what the menu options are than they are instructions on how to use this app. As a help system, it is WOEFULLY, and PITIFULLY inadequate. So mix the fact that parts of it, despite being available to the user, just do not work, the lack of reliable support and the lack of a comprehensive help system, and you get a miserable, FAILED attempt at a piece of software that should not have gone to market for a SIGNIFICANT additional period of time for development.And when I bought this, my ONLY option was a subscription so that I have to pay for it again, and AGAIN, EVERY year. What the heck happened to just being able to BUY a piece of software?These people need a couple of million bucks of investment money so that they can do some more development on this software so that it WORKS, and works COMPLETELY before they start selling it. As it stands, it needs a LOT more development. While SOME small parts of it DO work, it is NOT a replacement for microsoft office. There is just too much of it that does not work to warrant buying this app.I just CANNOT imagine a greater waste of money. This is probably THE worst purhase that I have EVER made online.
Most apps I can remove from my Kindle just by selecting "Remove from Device". I can't see any way to get rid of this thing.

Headings: I wish I could give it less than one star.
Base_Reviews: I bought two Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32G tablets for my husband and I for Christmas presents.  He is a marine, I thought that for his deployment this would be great for entertainment and communication.  This app has worked correctly once.  Just one single time.  The speakers stopped putting out what he was saying, the screen freezes, calls are "busy" over and over again (even though we confirmed the other person is not making a call).  I'll be deleting this App and might try to re-download, but I don't have much faith.This is separate from the Skype review - but I'm incredibly disappointed with my Kindle over all.  It seems that most things don't work - except for things eligible for purchase off of Amazon.  I am an avid PC/Android user - and I hate to say it - but I wish I had just bought an IPAD.

Base_Reviews: This app works once in a blue moon. I am sad to say that I regret this app more than any app I have spent money on. Drops calls constantly and freezes my kindle.
It's so slow...don't work properly on kindle ! Something gotta be done better to the next version! I really really hate it right about now!!!.
To do not need skype this is why I am removing it from my kindle. Not Useful to me at all.

This app needs serious work. It should not only work for certain devices, it's not fair! I have the new kindle fire HDX 7" and I very disappointed. The person I call can see me fine but I can't see her. The video and the audio are not in sync with each other so as I talk the action follows10 seconds  later. It's annoying. Please fix this app. I rather just have the Google play store apps

I am very disappointed in this new update that Skype has put out. While the previous version had its cons, at least I could talk to family members. Since the new update on my flawless KFHD 7", I can't see and usually hear any conversation and the screen turns black and says," Skype not responding" and crashes. I am very upset and will be emailing them when I get the chance. New updates with SOLUTIONS to problems not an addition of problems is the proper way to go. Clearly, Skype needs to seriously reconsider their horrendous updates that they release.

Headings: please for the love of god don't use this app.
Base_Reviews: I've had my kindle fire hd for around a year now and the skype app has always been terrible. It crashes a lot for no reason and the volume controls are ridiculous. With every update it gets worse and the most recent one is a train wreck. Constantly crashing and freezing, webcam function freezese and doesn't work. It's beyond frustrating.
Keeps crashing.

Headings: I need Skype to work on my Kindle Fire HD
Base_Reviews: I purchased a Kindle Fire HD 2 days ago. Skype as a feature of the product was an important incentive for this purchase however I have not been able to get Skype to work on the Kindle.  I keep getting an error message that my skype name and user id are not a match.  It works fine on my laptop.  I am disappointed that I cannot get Skype to work on the Kindle.  Am I missing a step in the set up.  Please help me!!! I was looking forward to having a great experience with the Kindle.  Thanks.

Headings: crashes everytime i tilt the kindle
Base_Reviews: The app is very very unstable and crashes for various reasons.crashes when the orientation is changed.screen changes are not user friendly.

This is the worst app ever! It crashes every time I use it and it can't even send messages. My friends can never receive my IM but Skype does work on my computer. I definitely do not recommend this to anyone. It's very frustrating and useless.

Headings: No group video chat with Kindle Fire HD and Skype...
Base_Reviews: I am giving this app 1 measly star because I can't give it 0 stars. I have been reading online and it appears Amazon/Skype has removed the group video chat capability of Skype with Kindle. I recently signed up for Skype Premium so I could group chat with my sons who live in different states. They both have Kindle Fire HD's. What a waste of $10?! At least I didn't pay for the whole year up front, I guess. Many of the reviews about Skype I have read were posted by folds who signed up for the entire year! After about 30 minutes of trying and having various issues, we gave up and I started doing some researching. We also had various other issues with Skype when trying to video chat one-on-one. Everything from the video freezing, dropping calls, slow video, and the app crashing. I will not be renewing my Skype membership unless this issue is fixed ASAP.
When they or I try to call then presses the green phone to answer it freezes every time we try on my kindle fire HD 7" PLEASE FIX
I think that this kindle should have oovoo instead of Skype. First of all its too slow and most of the time I have to turn on my camera.

So got my kindle for Christmas and was happy that it came with this app cause I finally had a mobile Skype. Didn't enjoy the fact that if I had my keyboard up in the IMs that I couldn't see if someone was messaging me, from what my sister says she has the same problem on her phone. I learned to deal with it, simply close the keyboard randomly to check if that orange "1" is flashing. Most annoying was that even if I signed out Skype would still display me as online causing me to uninstall the app whenever I didn't want to appear online.Fast forward to today and I download Skype to find it has a new update,and a crappy one at that. Now it has "tablet mode" and "smart phone mode" which are supposed to be "optimized" for that type of device. Which is an outright lite given that I'm on a kindle and using the smartphone mode because it's the only one that flips with the screen. Why they removed the screen matching the position of the tablet but kept it for the phone is beyond me.While a complete and utter bell/whistle they even removed the profile picture that appears next to the person's name while in chat.

I got a kindle to take travelling with me, partly to use Skype to keep in touch with home. All worked brilliantly till an automatic up date, supposedly making Skype better for the tablet, downloaded it's self. I've paid to have a number on Skype and do use credit to make some calls and send texts, but I've found that being a paying customer means nothing to Skype, I am evidently worthless to them.  It was near impossible to contact anyone at Skype, it's really hard to get to the point that you can actually communicate with someone and when I finally did they weren't helpful at all.  So I got in touch with Amazon, they were great and gave me a way to overcome the problems I've been having. Albeit a temporary fix.The problems I've had have included, not being able to sign in, the control panel disappearing so I cannot sign in or out (once signed out automatically there was no way to sign back in), see what credit I have or access my profile. Losing all records of any texts that I have sent and paid for. The programme constantly crashes.Having got home from travelling I have again contacted Skype to try and resolve the problem.  Several emails have been exchanged, they have collected data from me about the problem and now have closed the case without having resolved the problem at all. I have lost money because of the problems I've had, directly from my Skype credit, I shall never see that again.  Skype is a disgrace, if anything goes wrong with the programme they are useless, it appears to be a waste of time contacting them, they don't understand their own product.

I have to say when I first got my kindle fire it was for one reason, To keep in touch with my wife while overseas. I really have been nothing but disappointed in this product. The older version was ok, at least it was steady, the video wasn't the best but IM connecting from thousands of miles away I understand it wont' be perfect. What bothers me is since the updates it's like this program isn't even made for my kindle,crash crash crash crash crash. Thats the story of my life nowadays. You pretty much cannot access any other program while it's running even though it keeps it running in a pic in pic screen in the corner. If you do it will......whats that folks?......CRASH. Absolutely the most useless program on the planet. I plan to sell my kindle back to amazon as soon as I get home for the measily 56 bucks they are offering after my 7 months of ownership and I am buying a IPAD thats right I said it. At least I know face time is reliable and wont drop after 1 to two seconds of use. This is truely a pathetic product and should be an embarassment to amazon. Both the Kindle fire HD which has crashed and had to be completely restored to factory 4 times on me since I purchased and the Skype as well. NEVER AGAIN.

horrible... it crashes too much and crashes during calls. then sometimes never loads messages when I'm on pc skype. it bugs me so much and it takes a long time to load messages. i say this app is not recommended.

To be honest, the fact that this app constantly crashes and drops calls makes me disappointed that Amazon nor Microsoft will work on fixing this. Thanks for nothing. So many problems. First, the user screen sometimes disappears behind the larger screen and theres no way to bring it back. The small screen also Freezes and glitches occasionally. And lastly, when someone calls and i open my kindle to answer, skype errors and shuts down EVERYTIME.

SINCE THE LATEST UPDATE IT KEEPS CRASHING I ANSWER A CALL THEN BLACK SCREEN WORKED FOR A MINUTE THEN CRASHED FIX THIS NOW AMAZON I BOUGHT YOUR TABLET WICH IS APP RESTRICTIVE ENOUGH U HAVE NO APPS I WANT BESIDES SKYPE WICH I USE TO TALK TO MY FIANCEE SINCE I'M OUT OF TOWN FIX THIS NOW

Since Skype has been updated I've faced a bunch of problems. One problem is that the volume is high, it doesn't matter if I put the volume on zero I can still hear the person on the other line loudly. Another problem that I have is that as soon as you click on the app it signs in automatically. If someone was to click on my Skype they would be able to access my messages and contacts immediately.  I want my privacy. Another problem is that it continuously crashes for no apparent reason. One minutes it's working and the next it's sending you a message that says "Skype is not responding would you like to close it" if you say yes it closes and if you don't the message will continue to pop up. Before the update I also noticed that Skype would just hang up my calls and I thought it was my internet connection but after reading numerous reviews I realize that I'm not the only one with this problem. Skype needs to be fixed immediately. The company should fix all the glitches before putting it back in the Appstore.

If you have an older version of Skype, keep it. The newer version/update is absolutely awful. No way to control the volume, and it constantly crashes. I've written to Amazon, but they continue to make it available in prominent position in their app store. DON'T DOWNLOAD IT!
I just got the update for Skype and now it crashes every time I try and make a call to someone. Before the update it worked fine this needs to be fixed
This app crashes non-stop! Often times it simply REFUSES to work!! I can't even log in!! I have to re-download the app numerous times if I ever want to get anything done!!!

Ad heavy, crashes

I am appalled that Amazon would put this on the kindle fires which are intended for children. My kids never downloaded it, yet it showed up on their kindled. How is this in any remote way safe for kids to chat with someone they don't know??? I took my kids kindles away because of apps like this... I was informed by Amazon that this app comes with the device automatically so my kids didn't have to download it.

Its so frustrating, constantly signing me out, making me sign back in just to erase all of my previous messages including new ones that I have just received an  haven't gotten to read. And now all it shows me when I open the app is a text that's sending, that I sent yesterday morning and wont let me do anything else. I have ran the repair app tool multiple times and contacted customer service for the issues. This app is being un installed. So annoying to deal with just to send texts. Not worth it.

I might need this for 2-step verification. So I chose the "free" app. But that's a lie. It's not free. To get a single text, it's $4. That's not nearly free. That's a ripoff. I could go to a dollar store and get a burner phone for ten dollars per month and get unlimited texts. But I don't want a cell phone. I suppose in the days of two-step verifications, that means I won't be able to function online any more. I certainly won't choose to deal with a company that lies about its price. That should not be allowed, and Amazon should remove their app from the Fire store. False advertising is wrong. Poor value is wrong. I have no idea why there are positive reviews here. All paid for, I assume.
I tried to get in touch with my boyfriend and it got hacked HATE IT

I am trying to work my way through the lessons I paid for but the app keeps crashing and seems to be getting worse.  Try to wait until it has improved or choose something else.

This app runs like crap on my kindle. I already use 'Duolingo' and 'Memrise' with 'Itranslate' to supplement my vocabulary, but I thought I'd give it a go because of its popularity. It wasn't worth it. It's big, and very slow. I spent more time looking at a black loading screen than I did actually learning. If you want an app that will teach you a language, I suggest the ones I mentioned above. They're similar in style, but each a bit different to cater to different learning styles, and both are WAAAAY better than Rosetta stone. Memrise in particular is pretty awesome, because it offers courses on tons of subjects, not just language. Don't waste your time with Rosetta. Es nicht sehr gut.
I was so excited when I downloaded this. Unfortunately, I have never been able to use the app.  Every time I select a language to learn (regardless of which one I choose), the app crashes.
I love Ted Talks but the app freezes & pauses the movie & once made my Fire Stick restart. Better off to watch them on laptop or phone.
Maybe I just haven't found this function yet, but I wish I could search it by topic and/or speaker.

I have used this app on other platforms. Great idea. Wish I used it more.The only reason I am giving this app 2 stars is because on my Kindle Fire HDX, it is not seen as an educational app. This is a problem with Amazon and how they are labeling apps in FreeTime. This is not the only app that does this. I would like to have my 8yr old "play" with app before she spends the next four hours on Toca Builder or My Little Pony. Please Fix this Amazon and the rating will be at 5, like it should be.
was good except it seemed to take control and I did not like that feature

When I opened the app it came up with a message, something about how I liked the app.  Since I hadn't looked at it yet I couldn't say.  After I looked at the app and can see it has some glitches I could no longer get the "what did I think of the app".  When I tried to access a recipe that was offered from the recipe picture pages a different recipe would come up - not the one I asked to see.  After doing this numerous times with various recipes pictured I have determined that this definitely "Needs some work".  Maybe it can stay on my apps, but I don't know if I'll bother using it it I can't access a particular recipe.  And, thanks for putting the How do you like this app feature upon the first opening of the app.  How did I know that it doesn't exactly work as advertised.  Not impressed.  Also, don't like the new Foodnetwork style.  Printing is WAY too big.  Like I don't need to use 1/4 page of a piece of paper for the title of the recipe only.  That, with all the "competition cooking" shows, and I'm about to write Foodnetwork off of my radar.
I haven't been able to use this app at all - it crashes as soon as I try to click on anything.

Base_Reviews: Several issues. App does not keep you logged in. Shopping list keeps old items and will not let you delete them. App crashes frequently and takes a long time to load.

When you are the page with all the chefs listed and click on a chef it crashes the app.  I downloaded the app because I wanted a receipe from a specific chef.There are some other receipes under different categories but that is not what I was looking for.
I love the food network, but this app is not worth it, WAY to many glitches-problems!! Crashes in the middle of looking up something ALL the time!!

I like the ideas but the recipe box feature shuts app down, I have registered for that feature but it doesn't work. No one to go to for help. So only getting a small amount of the recipes. The portion that is more inclusive of all recipes format doesn't sync well as a Mobil app.

Hard to navigate and slow to load. Did jot like this app at all. Not reccomended to anyone who wants an app that works.
the app Navigation system needs some more work. Not intuitive.
The developers of this app need to get to work.  This app crashes at least twice each time I open it.
Apps crashes with certain chefs selection (i.e. chef giada recipe wont seem to load). When clicking on her recipes apps crashes. Same goes for majority of the chefs

I spent an hour chatting with Tech Support to try an activate this app on my kindle, and then lost internet. I was curious to see what it had, but not enough to waste any more time on it. Everything else works fine, but this says my account is temporarily locked. I'm done.

I was looking forward to using this app, based on some reviews. Finally one place to compile all my recipes! Alas, there is one huge flaw with this app...there is no backup or storage of your recipes in the Cloud.  Lose or change your device and your data goes with it, unless you back it up. But you know you will slack on backing this up regularly, offline. So much management. Additionally the larger your recipe stash gets, the more space is eaten up on your device.  Also don't expect there to be sync'ing between your phone and tablet for example, since there is no cloud storage or account to login to and sync.I will save and revisit this app at a later date. I would like to see a one time pay, no ads, cloud capable app. Until then I will continue to keep my recipes in Evernote, which has all capabilities this app lacks.

Headings: No longer compatible with kindle fire 10!
Base_Reviews: Updated review.  This is no longer compatible with the kindle fire 10.....why?  I used the app on my kindle fire 10 because I could have the app up on my kindle in the kitchen as I was cooking.  Seriously disappointed!
This app is basically impossible to use. It must be for storing recipes that are on another device. I was unable to find recipes or enter anything that brought up any recipes.
Good resource. I hate having to write so many words. What a ridiculous requirement. I hope this ridiculous response satisfies you. I will copy and past it for every one.

Headings: $20 PER YEAR AND Different PRO features for different platforms? No thanks
Base_Reviews: I'm very disappointed in this. This has great reviews, but it's really not all that great. I registered on my kindle. I went to the website to input all my recipes (there's only about 50, so I have room on the free account) from my browser bookmarks. But the "CLIP" feature on the website is only for PRO users. But I can enter them in all by hand. On the Kindle app, it's opposite. The CLIP feature is free and the manual entry is a PRO feature. So now, what I wanted it for, it's useless unless I want to spend a few hours inputting everything. There's no reason why the PRO features should be different from one platform to the next if you're offering a sync method to begin with. On top of all of that, I didn't realize it was $20 A YEAR. That's way too much when my good old card holder and recipe cards have barely cost $20 in TEN YEARS.

I was an early, and enthusiastic user of this app, and encouraged many of my friends and family to use this app...However, of late, the technical support has really declined...I've also had an issue where the recipe count doesn't match between  my Android device and the website...I was finally  told that it isn't they don't want to fix it, but "t's not that I can't fix it; It's that I'm at the end of a major feature development cycle (meal planning and menus) and all fixes going forward will be applied to the that version of ChefTap."...I responded back to this on 05/31/19 asking when this was going to occur, but have yet to get any kind of response back...Why should I use (and pay) for an app when I can't get a timely response to inquiries/questions or issue?

Same as everyone else. Used to love this app. Hate the new update. Now have to register, and pay for ANY functionality. I dont mind paying a one off fee for a good app, but USD12 A YEAR?! Forget it. Evernote with webclipper anyone? Bad move cheftap. Say hi to myspace from me...

The app is ok but nothing special.  FUBOtv doesn't allow you to watch recorded programs until an hour after the original program ends.  The frame rate is slow which lowers quality for sports.  It's not worth the money.

I am happy any time I get to watch my favorite Bundesliga team (Borussia Dortmund). The U.S. has come very far in opening up some avenues to watch soccer. However, at this day and age an application should be able to show games in true HD quality and should also be compatible with various devices such as chromecast, fire stick/tv, and android TVs. So there are still some improvements to be made before I can consider jumping on the FoxSoccer2Go bandwagon. I know that is a different application but they are connected when it comes to functionality and quality for the things that I watch.

Headings: is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team
Base_Reviews: Just purchased new Amazon FireTV Stick and first app I installed is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team. Unfortunately, regardless of what live game or show I watch on this app, it consistently freezes and then continues and repeats that process, at least once or twice a minute. I can run Fox Sports Go app on my iPhone connected to the same WiFi router and it works without ever freezing or delay. I have 100Mb fiber connection with AT&T and a NightHawk wireless router. I get consistent download speeds of ~125Mb and under 10ms for latency, so its not the network (first thing that is blamed). I've watched shows on Amazon Prime on the same FireTV stick without any issues. I've restarted the FireTV stick, and even re-installed the Fox Sports Go app, no change.
Terrible. Always freezes, constantly skips and drops quality. Runing on a fire stick with 100+gb 5g internet speed. No issues with any other services. Extremely disappointing.
Too slow no sound on the games
Too many freezes with the program. Not as good as ESPN app.

Headings: FoxSports GO demanding provider, then UserID & PW, but won't accept UserID
Base_Reviews: Today, and today only, SAT 2015-10-31, FOX Sports GO won't let me log on.  It pops for me to select my provider, then enter a UserID & PW, but won't accept my UserID.  I checked w/my provider and UserID is fine, and can log onto their website fine. This is not a password issue. Since it's ONLY FOX Sports GO that does this (I can access ESPN and all others checked via Amazon Fire TV Stick fine), I'm presuming this to be a Fox Sports GO issue.  That, or the app has been hacked by a phishing app of some kind.  Can't watch OU today, that's a BIG deal in Oklahoma.

Headings: Get this if you enjoy being frustrated and miserable
Base_Reviews: If you're looking to seamlessly mirror content from other devices to your TV to follow along exercise/dance videos, learn a new skill, or enjoy general entertainment on the big screen...this product isn't for you.However, if you would like to be constantly dissatisfied or disappointed, you've come to the right place! Enjoy the frequent buffering and frame skipping of an inferior product that will never be mentioned in the same breath of a ChromeCast, Apple TV, or Firestick. But who values reliability and quality anyways? Being constant is dull. AirBeam TV keeps things FRESH by spontaneously throwing in wrenches into your streamed content. This app will take your favorite videos and movies, and mindlessly chop-and-screw it until it devolves into a hot/disheveled mess that once resembled your original content. But hey, everyone loves a good remix. Remixes are awesome and always better than the original!And if you enjoy horrible customer service, you can always count on AirBeam TV to not be there for you. If you had questions or comments about the product, but are repulsed by the thought of talking to a human being, AirBeam TV will gladly send you through an infinite loop of automated responses while deferring all blame to the user. It's not enough that I've restarted my computer and modem, closed all other extensions/applications, and checked the internet connection of my TV...I probably need to give up my left kidney and bladder too for my video content to be streamed without a hitch.AirBeam TV's connectivity strength and resolution may be inconsistent, but your disappointment with the product will remain constant over time!

This app barely works. It does send a picture to the TV, but it's low quality, constantly freezes and lags behind the source by up to a minute, despite 100Mg/s internet connection.  Expect frustration.

Headings: Don't waste your money or time on this free app.
Base_Reviews: Although the product will allow one to draw shapes and walls with their smartphone, the limited screen size prohibits adding much detail. Add to that the fact that everything is calibrated in metric units and the app is almost as useful as a piece of graph paper and a straightedge, which is what I'll be using instead.  If I could get it to load to my notepad or even my desktop AND WORK IN ENGLISH UNITS then I would be willing to pay for this.  As it is, using it on a smartphone is like building a ship in a bottle with ice tongs.

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

Headings: It tricks you into a month of service
Base_Reviews: BE AWARE! I attempted to try the free week trial. Once I set up the trail period, I canceled, so I wouldn't get charged for a month and continue with the free week. Fubo, instead, wouldn't allow me to try the free week trial. I selected the trial again, but now was automatically signed up for a month ($77). Be aware that Fubo's user interface is tricky and will have you signing up for a month that you probably don't even want. I called customer service and they wouldn't reverse the charges.

Headings: Be careful when/if you cancel your subscription.
Base_Reviews: I had Fubo for the 2021/22 hockey season. It was a decent streaming service, but no longer became worth the price when they increased the cost dramatically. I accidently "paused" the service at the end of the hockey season instead of canceling it and during the off season I found cheaper ways to watch hockey (NESN) so I decided not to restart the service. Little did I know they would restart the service 6 months later without any notice and charged me $80. I called customer service and they said there was nothing they could do and refused any sort of refund. I'm sure they have the terms written and I honestly just screwed up when pausing instead of canceling, but restarting the service without some kind of notice and charging me 6 months later has certainly put me off the service permanently. A simple heads up email before restating the service and charging me would have been a much more honest business approach.

Headings: Terrible streaming, and user interaction  terrible

In addition to that IÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢m supposed to learn new toggles, supposed to your typical back and forward, stop toggles. Terrible platform. I signed up for the free trial, to see if it was worthwhile for my husband (he watches every sport imaginable).  The first game he watched was Notre Dame, and the app had a picture delay... so we heard the play well before we saw the play.  We tried everything to fix it, to no avail.  I called customer service & they told me that there was no problem with their app & I should "just watch something else".  I'm sure you can guess how that comment went over with a diehard ND fan... The next day he tried again, only this time I could not even get the app to load.  So I called customer service AGAIN, except this time I was not nearly as friendly.  I told them that I wanted the subscription cancelled & my credit card information destroyed.  They told me that I had to request cancellation via email... WHICH I DID!!  Fast forward two weeks.  They charged my credit card for the subscription, which I cancelled over the phone AND by email.  I AGAIN called customer service and was told that I had not cancelled the subscription, but that they would "see if they could refund the money".  It wasn't ling before they told me that they would not refund the money AND I had to go through the cancellation process again.  I disputed the charge with my credit card and informed my credit card company that if they attempted to charge my card again it was fraud & I wanted to press charges.  They are currently fighting with my credit card company... so, the only thing I can say about Fubo TV is BUYER BEWARE!!!  It is not worth the headache for the crappy service they provide.

Headings: If you thought cable was bad, wait til you try fubo!
Base_Reviews: Oh where to start.....World Cup France v Morocco, oops, Fubo not available.  What???  Customer service, after an hour wait, suggested I watch on Fox streaming for free.  Fox only allows 60 minutes before you need to use your tv subscriber info, which didn't work with fubo.  ha ha...TV app is worthless.  Buffering with 1000mbps and new tv?  Will not rewind or fast forward on recorded shows.  You can watch on your big screen if you stream from iPhone to tv.  It isn't perfect though.Nevertheless, I imagine the slugs who took the company public are laughing all the way to the bank.I suggest shorting the stock (which would have been a great idea earlier in the year as the stock price is hovering around $2 and some change), you may be able to make back some of your subscription fees!Lastly, I do feel sorry for the customer service reps.  I am sure they get an earful daily.  I have had some nice ones in all fairness.All the best,FubismalPS: can't wait to I see my credit card continue to get charged after I cancel, which I have yet to experience, but the majority of reviews seem to allude to Fubo's inability to cancel accounts. Should be more fun!
Content is fine and when it works it's OK, slow to load channels. Problem is, it's unreliable and down too often. Slow to fix issues. Been down 2 hours so far today and no eta on a fix.

Overall, the service is not bad, and they do provide a nice list of channels. However, where they really fail is the ability to watch what you have saved on their Cloud DVR.  During the day, the system response is pretty good, but at about 8:00 PM (Eastern US time) through 11:00 PM, the ability to view saved shows is virtually impossible!  The system gives you the spinning wheel repeatedly, which indicates the streaming servers are not able to keep up with demand.  This happens every single week night!  And what's worse is that support does not respond to requests for help!

Headings: Absolutely horrible interface and regular crashing
Base_Reviews: I have had this service for over 8 months.  In that time, the amount of recorded shows that had technical difficulties and crashed without recording the rest of the episode or having to start all over and find where it crashed is substantial.  And they only carry the locally covered NHL games so if you are a hockey fan, this is a terrible option.  Ultimately, this service drove me nuts and was extremely more frustration than an actual "service".  The only benefit it had over some other services (ie. Youtube TV) is that they are actual recordings that you can fast forward and skip commercials (as long as it doesn't crash the interface which happens regularly).  Otherwise, trying to figure out how to run the interface was and still is a complete nightmare.  At least on an LG smart TV.  I have to scroll up to get to a menu 6 or 7 times before it actually does it.  The UI is completely unintuitive and a nightmare to figure out.  Even when you finally figure out the completely unintuitive actions you have to take to pull up a menu while watching a show, you have to do it over and over and over before it actually does it.  The frustration level with this service is way beyond what its worth at one of the highest price points of all streaming services.  I highly recommend anyone who's considering this to just move on to the next service on your list.  This one is terrible.

This app is unusable. I purchased the app expecting to be able to unlock features in video. Basic design features don't exist even though it appears advanced and simple in the vid (they changed background colors but you won't). There is no option for png/ PDF files even though it is shown in the video. Unfortunately AFTER the purchase I realize the developer last updated this app on the very day of my purchase BUT in 2017. It's 2021! This is my L for you, don't repeat my mistake. Sales are FINAL.
It crashes evertime I try to open the app??

BOUGHT this app/program but was never able to use it or get it to work. Kept telling me I needed to purchase the full version.  No customer support either. So I can not good heartedly recommend this app.

Every single thing is wrong with this company. To start with terrible customer service. It is basically a call center and nearly impossible to get ahold of anyone live. Once you do they are of no help. There are hidden fees you will most definitely find yourself charged with. There are many other companies out there providing good, honest streaming options. Fubo Tv is the worst. Wish I could give it negative stars. You have been warned.

Overpriced and computer automatically "added on" features that I did not order and the WORSE programming around.  Our family has NOTHING to view because of the lousy coverage and lousy "free tv"THE WORST

Headings: They continually remove some of the best channels that you prob signed up for
Base_Reviews: Loved this service when I first signed up!  The channel line up was unmatched to other streaming platforms.  First they removed the entire  Lifetime/A&E channel family, which was a huge bummer!!  Then this new year, they removed the entire AMC family b/c they are looking to be more "sports" oriented.  This is so upsetting to have the channels just removed & there isn't even an option to upgrade & add the channels back.  Its no longer part of their service, period.  Disappointing & will prob be looking for a different platform after this.  If they want to be more sports focused they should offer a sports upgrade package for those specific customers.  Not punish all their other customers w a blanket removal of services.

Headings: Not any better than an antenna
Base_Reviews: Used 7 day free trial to try it out. Picture and sound quality was worse than what I get with an antenna!Canceled on day 2 online however was them billed $74.99.Called customer service- wait time was an hour to speak to someone and then they said it wasnÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢t canceled.Had to escalate to get a refund as they refused to give me one.Horrible experience

I signed up for a 30 day free trial on Fubo December 14, 2022. This also happened to be the day they were hacked. I hadn't gotten around to checking it out until today, December 31, 2022. As it turns out, Fubo unilaterally cancelled my account on December 19th after only 5 days. After a 30 minute hold with customer service, I was told that they couldn't "reinstate my free trial", even though I literally had never signed in or used it and I have an email confirmation that it is active until January 13th, 2023.I understand that computer glitches happen, and they can't override the computer so I asked for a comped month to make up for it. Apparently there is nothing in their system that allows for comps, either.Fubo definitely has a way to go before they can truly compete with the big boys (cable, YouTubetv, HuluLive)

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

Headings: It tricks you into a month of service
Base_Reviews: BE AWARE! I attempted to try the free week trial. Once I set up the trail period, I canceled, so I wouldn't get charged for a month and continue with the free week. Fubo, instead, wouldn't allow me to try the free week trial. I selected the trial again, but now was automatically signed up for a month ($77). Be aware that Fubo's user interface is tricky and will have you signing up for a month that you probably don't even want. I called customer service and they wouldn't reverse the charges.

Headings: If you thought cable was bad, wait til you try fubo!
Base_Reviews: Oh where to start.....World Cup France v Morocco, oops, Fubo not available.  What???  Customer service, after an hour wait, suggested I watch on Fox streaming for free.  Fox only allows 60 minutes before you need to use your tv subscriber info, which didn't work with fubo.  ha ha...TV app is worthless.  Buffering with 1000mbps and new tv?  Will not rewind or fast forward on recorded shows.  You can watch on your big screen if you stream from iPhone to tv.  It isn't perfect though.Nevertheless, I imagine the slugs who took the company public are laughing all the way to the bank.I suggest shorting the stock (which would have been a great idea earlier in the year as the stock price is hovering around $2 and some change), you may be able to make back some of your subscription fees!Lastly, I do feel sorry for the customer service reps.  I am sure they get an earful daily.  I have had some nice ones in all fairness.All the best,FubismalPS: can't wait to I see my credit card continue to get charged after I cancel, which I have yet to experience, but the majority of reviews seem to allude to Fubo's inability to cancel accounts. Should be more fun!
Content is fine and when it works it's OK, slow to load channels. Problem is, it's unreliable and down too often. Slow to fix issues. Been down 2 hours so far today and no eta on a fix.

Overall, the service is not bad, and they do provide a nice list of channels. However, where they really fail is the ability to watch what you have saved on their Cloud DVR.  During the day, the system response is pretty good, but at about 8:00 PM (Eastern US time) through 11:00 PM, the ability to view saved shows is virtually impossible!  The system gives you the spinning wheel repeatedly, which indicates the streaming servers are not able to keep up with demand.  This happens every single week night!  And what's worse is that support does not respond to requests for help!

Headings: Absolutely horrible interface and regular crashing
Base_Reviews: I have had this service for over 8 months.  In that time, the amount of recorded shows that had technical difficulties and crashed without recording the rest of the episode or having to start all over and find where it crashed is substantial.  And they only carry the locally covered NHL games so if you are a hockey fan, this is a terrible option.  Ultimately, this service drove me nuts and was extremely more frustration than an actual "service".  The only benefit it had over some other services (ie. Youtube TV) is that they are actual recordings that you can fast forward and skip commercials (as long as it doesn't crash the interface which happens regularly).  Otherwise, trying to figure out how to run the interface was and still is a complete nightmare.  At least on an LG smart TV.  I have to scroll up to get to a menu 6 or 7 times before it actually does it.  The UI is completely unintuitive and a nightmare to figure out.  Even when you finally figure out the completely unintuitive actions you have to take to pull up a menu while watching a show, you have to do it over and over and over before it actually does it.  The frustration level with this service is way beyond what its worth at one of the highest price points of all streaming services.  I highly recommend anyone who's considering this to just move on to the next service on your list.  This one is terrible.

In the app world, there are plenty of free programs that aren't really free. Once you get the app up and running, you realize that you will want a dictionary if you want spell checking. It is hard to argue with that, although one might have assumed a word processor would already have a dictionary. That's $9.95. Then you discover that you don't have the premium software that can handle the dictionary. So I bought the pro version, thinking it was the premium version. That's $9.95. Then it turns out that there is something called a premium version, and it is that version only that works with the dictionary. Apparently there is a premium version that is not the pro version because the spell check dictionary still says I must have the premium version. So I still can't use the spell checker dictionary. I now have an automatic subscription to a word processor that displays in what looks like 7 point type--seriously! maybe this software isn't intended for an android phone--and this subscription is automatic and a bargain ($9.95 a year). Support showed me how to cancel my subscription, and the money I spent was, I think, a good learning experience.

Have not used yet, but not pleased to find that the incorporated dictionary will no function with my Fire tablet O/S, so spelling will not function automatically.

I use this suite on a Kindle Fire. It works but I think it could be a lot better. When using the spreadsheet app especially, it requires too many extra keystrokes. Some it's operations seem counter intuitive. I live with it because it's free but I really don't enjoy using it.

It did not work properly because it failed to total a filtered column, which was one of the primary functions that I wanted.  For simple spreadsheet it is fine, but for a mor comples spreadsheet it did not work properly.

this appears to be a broken product.  a simple copy and paste of a cell containing a function results in the value, not the function being pasted.  then a "cannot recalculate some formula" error appears.  very disappointing so far.

I find it annoying that I am asked to upgrade to the premium version every time I open a file. Since I downloaded it I get ads wherever I go on my phone. All the functionality is negated by the ads and pushing the upgrade.
A free app that wants a annual fee for something as basic as spell check is not useful.  Fortunately the new Fire I got had other word processing apps to choose from.  I returned this one.
The app will randomly crash and fails to properly save files. Don't use this for anything improtant/anything that you have a deadline on because your work will magically did never to be found again.
FrEE  - that is, FEE not FREE.  Not worth much unless you pay MONTHLY FEE to open up the app to other devices.  This smacks of bate-and-switch.

Thought I have found the solution to my wordprocessing needs on Kindle Fire until I received a File Corrupt error or three of my documents. Lost hours and hours of work. Contacted Customer Support twice and have not gotten a response. Will discontinue using and will not buy the Premium version. FRUSTRATED
I did not get to use it. It would crash every time I opened it.

Downloaded Free OfficeSute to use on my tablet.  Was able to create and email spreadsheet. Would not save without upgrading, but worked around it. Do not want to pay a monthly fee or annual fee for support.

I started sending reports on a Thursday. Need got a reply.I would use extreme caution in purchasing this app. The only reason they have top ratings for mobile devices is the fact that the others offered are poor to begin with!I give this app an Ffor performance, an F for reliability and whatever is lower than an F for customer support. Headings: Ok, but sucks at the same time

Headings: Amazon's Skype is inferior to Skype on other formats
Base_Reviews: I have used Skype across many platforms but this one installed on a brand new Kindle Fire HD tablet does not work well.Like other users the sound is an issue. Even turned up it is hard to hear anything.Also the connection is poor. I am using this were I use multiple other devices to connect via the same 5G connection. I have used it back to back with my phone on IOS (again same spot and wifi) with drastically different results suggesting it is specific to this app. The connection for everything else I do on my Kindle works well and is fast (streaming videos, etc.).

Skype used to be an absolutely amazing app. Jumpback was an amazing feature. Every update it gradually gets worse. For one thing, i've been using Skype since I was 8 years old. Recently I had to manually scroll back years in chat since they removed the jumpback option, just to realize Skype deleted all of the old messages. I had memories in those! I met my best friend over Skype, you shouldn't delete those old messages! I've recently moved to Discord, seeing as it DOESNT DELETE MY OLD MESSAGES. It doesn't have Jumpback either though, but at least it has one of two things.TLDR: stop deleting old messages and bring Jumpback back.

Headings: Can't use it on my Kindle Fire HD
Base_Reviews: I was very disappointed to find that new version of the Kindle Fire HD does not have the same functions available as the older version.  I checked the Amazon site for the Kindle to see if Skype was available on the Kindle Fire HD and was very happy to see the statement that it was pre-installed.  Once I had the Kindle and downloaded the Skype program I called customer service to find out why I couldn't find the program on the Kindle.  It was then that I was given a very confusing explanation that the newer Fire HD did not have a camera, while the older version did, and if I wanted to use Skype, I could trade in the Kindle I just received for Christmas and pay an additional $100 for the Kindle HDX.  ALSO, I bought a Kindle Fire HD for my granddaughter for Christmas only to find out it isn't the same as the Kindle Fire HD as mine, even though they were both purchased from Amazon and within 2 weeks of each other, the Kindle Fire HD protective case does not fit her Kindle HD.  Why when you purchase 2 Kindle Fire HDs are they not the same? Are they getting rid of old stock or is this a bate and switch?

I use Skype without a camera on my computer, and I love it. I was hoping to do the same with my kindle fire, but I don't have a built in camera, so the program is not compatible with my device. I wish they had labeled it that way up front. I had to do a lot of searching to find out why it was incompatible, and finally checked with online help who explained it to me. Sad that I can't use it without a camera.

The Skype app for BB10 through the Amazon app store is extremely lethargic and very slow. It's unstable and hangs quite a bit on my Blackberry Leap. I've uninstalled it twice and re-installed to try and get it to work smoothly. However, it still takes long to load the app and hangs after loading. To get it to load sometimes, I boot the device. I would have expected Skype to have some updates to ensure these issues, which I'm certain they would have received feedback, are resolved. The Skype app through Blackberry World was so much more stable and had a decent performance. I do hope they have some updates to iron out these issues

Headings: Does not update-you have to uninstall and reinstall whenever microsoft updates this product.
Base_Reviews: Could be a wonderful product so you can keep in touch with your family, however on the fire tablet is has issues. It does not update so when Skype is updated you have to uninstall and then reinstall this app.  And recently stopped being able to send pictures or video. Also lost all previous conversations and you don't receive new pictures, videos or messages. Plus you cannot contact Skype customer service, only their community page. NOT convenient, especially when it auto updates on some pc's and tablets. Apparently Skype has reformatted their platform, which effectively made many tablets, pc's and phones unsupported by the new version. Skype says Amazon version 7.3 is supported, however then why are conversations not coming through?Without a way to communicate with customer service you have no avenue to address the loss of $60.00 annual fee for services no longer available or supported. HOPEFULLY Microsoft and Amazon can work this out .
Eats your battery and responds slowly. Avoid it if you can.

This did not work on my Fire HD 8 (6th Gen).  It would not receive incoming calls.  There are a lot of notes on the Web about this problem.  Put support tickets on Skype support, they asked me to try a few things but it still didn't work.

Outstanding video and audio links internationally with telephone calling ability as well.  Search function and several other features diminished after Microsoft acquisition, which appears to have been an overall bad thing for Skype.  As a long-term Skype user, I would have given it 5 stars pre-Microsoft but can now only muster 2 and that is being generous.

Headings: This is a garbage app for my kindle
Base_Reviews: This is a garbage app for my kindle. I love Skype on my phone but screen is small & I wanted to use my kindle to talk with my family. Please update so this so can be used by kindle. It freezes the tablet after 5 mins or less & volume is horrible!

Skype 7.* wasn't perfect, but it worked.  Skype 8.* is a buggy disaster.  It typically takes five tries to establish a video connection (the first three it will connect, then spontaneously hang up, the fourth it will connect without video and, with luck, the fifth try works).  The user interface is less useful and has new "features" I'd best describe as childish, if not outright useless, while having lost features that were actually helpful.  They couldn't even be bothered to alphabetize the contact list.Unfortunately, Microsoft, in typical arrogant, high-handed fashion, has rammed version 8.* down everyone's throat, willy-nilly.  For personal reasons I have little choice but to use it, for now.  As soon as those reasons go away, so does Skype.

Skype is normally a good video chatting software service, however I am very disappointed that the Skype version from Amazon doesn't have several features that are standard and essential for my purposes. The Automatic Video Call Answering function was not available in the version I installed.  It is crucial because my 92 year old grandma has dementia and cannot operate a tablet. We rely on automatic answering in order to communicate with her as she is completely locked down in a nursing home.

Headings: Very Disappointed Paying Skype Customer + Update
Base_Reviews: Paying Skype customer for years.  It was great but just gets worse.  Skype for my most recent Fire tablet never rings when someone calls.  Tried everything and then tried everything again.  Been through the support threads.  It worked fine on my older Fire.  It seems to be an issue with many Android and Fire tablets.  Also this is the worst version of Skype and hard to use. Tried a couple of free phone programs apps similar to Skype and they work just fine.  Very disappointed.Update.  Skype has had a fairly substantial update since my last review.  Now it rings and sometime I can answer the call successfully.  Often it just closes and disconnects.  Hard to get to messages and sometimes impossible.  Now when I make a call there is no ring sound. only silence until someone answers so hard to tell if it had dialed out and connected.  I miss the good ol' days when skype worked well.Update: Guess what... it's worse.

When I first updated this, I liked the new look. However, that was all that was nice about this version. The first time I tried to call my Mom, I was upside down on her screen, and the screen crashed. Then I had the same problem as everyone else, Skype is not responding, would you like to close it? And tbis was on my Kindle Fire HD 7". After three times of having a black screen and just hearing sound, I promptly uninstalled it and found the version I used to have somewhere else, and installed that. I wish Amazon would retain older versions of apps in case you needed to downgrade back if the new version didn't work. So, that being said, Do not update this until they get a version that works!Update, September 10, 2014:They did an update this past spring. Then, another update in late August. The spring update worked fine, now we're back to Square One, doesn't even connect when I make a call. I use it to talk to my Mom who lives about 300 miles away, so this is unfair. Why do we have to keep enduring these non-working updates from Skype? When it works, just leave it alone already! As of this date, my one-star rating still stands.

It's been what, a decade? Microsoft still hasn't released a single version of Skype that isn't excruciatingly painful to use due to either stupid design decisions or being buggy. Headings: Deception & Mendacity now that MS owns Skype
Base_Reviews: While overseas, comencing some 5 updates ago: First it would not allow purchase of Skype Credit via PayPal & Support would not answer to a request for solution. Second, after returning to the US on July 27 began an agrssive search for a solution with no help from Support other than acknowledging I existed; the fourth update allowed PayPal purchase of Skype Credit but would not allow overseas call even though more than sufficient credit was in my account; Third, over 2+ weeks "games" are played re promised return calls, i.e. "provide date & time for [us] to call to resolve the problem" (or words to that effect) BUT no calls or calls an hour or more later with a phony apology has been voiced. Fourth, "chat" cannot be copied in it's entirety & pasted unles one wishes to copy & paste each & everyone of the statements individually; allegations are made that transcripts will be automatically sent at the end of the chat; promised "chat" transcripts are not delivered confirming standard MS practice of deception & mendacity. This subscriber as forced to subscribe to MajicJack to make his longdistance calls and is now only debating if he wishes to keep a deceptive and mendacious service which still, after a fifth update, blocks calls overseas and a number of domestic numbers!

Run! If you pay for a phone number it won't work. Skype no longer supports service to Skype enabled phones. Good luck trying to find customer service, even more luck trying to get your money back. I had Skype for years, no problems, now they decided to drop support to Skype enabled phones.So run until thou can't hear the word Skype anymore.

I am very unhappy with the events surrounding the purchase of the Kindle. I bought the Kindle specifically for my daughter to read books and Skype while she was on her five month trip. We promptly got our purchase but were unable to open the download of the Skype app. We phoned for technical support and the agent went through the download process with us. It did not work. The agent was aware that I had read a number of product reviews that the new Kindle Fire was capable of Skype. They thought there might be a licensing issue and that they would make my concern known and that someone would contact me with an answer on way or another with in a week or so.. That was December 19th and no one ever did. I could have returned the Kindle and gotten another tablet if I had known. I think that Kindle/Amazon should be dealing with this discrepency and communicating what the issues are rather than avoiding a customer. I am a new Amzon user (first purchase was a Kinndle) and I don't feel that the customer service reflects the amount of emails I am receiving promoting specials etc. Maybe the company should focus on keeping customers by responding to issues.
I don't like the new skype version.  Its very laggy amd when video chatting the ad is larger than the video screen.
I dont use this at all so I have no idea when I opened it tho camera kinda sucked loaded slow

Skype was supposed to be preinstalled on my Kindle Fire HD, but I can't find it or use it to make a call using my existing Skype account...so I can't rate it! I'm very disappointed in "customer service" response..."error." And Skype closed my "case" without resolution.

Headings: Skype compromises privacy and allows for exploits to back door into your computer
Base_Reviews: This program now has  Back doors which allow black hat hackers to get into your computer on the front end allowing them to control your computer without root. If left  On they can easily gain root access and steal your identity or Worse. When this operation  Started before Microsoft bought it this was a peer to peer application where no middle man can just access video and audio that is absolutely private. Now that Microsoft owns it they run it through their servers and keep your video and audio in possible perpetuity. I suggest anyone who has this program to audit it if you have the ability or just not use it. There are better applications out there that don't compromise your privacy.
Poor pitiful piece of software. Trouble with all my devices when I put this on

I knew they had my money, the bank account shows that!!

Headings: Video chat not possible between fire 8 hds.
Base_Reviews: I have two brand new fire hd 8 tablets with updated software and updated skype app. It indicates with a green check that the tablets are linked and messaging is possible. Hence the reason why I gave it the lowest score as it doesnt work with my machine. Never mind.

Headings: Skype on Fire issue with incoming calls
Base_Reviews: The app listens to the incoming calls only when it is open Iand is in foreground. On other platforms Skype is always on when device is powered on. This needs to be fixed on Fire.
This app is only compatible with Kindle Fire HD, so it's of no use to me at all. Very disappointing.

I've used Skype for years and it gets worse instead of better. I even paid for the premium Skype. It was the same each time I video chatted. Freezes up all the time. It's blurry and the sound goes crazy. It doesn't matter which computer I use.  It's always the same.
I gave it a 1 star because I couldn't get it to download! It said it's not compatible with my kindle fire!!!

Headings: Absolute crap since the latest updates
Base_Reviews: I have been using Skype for 3+ years now and I loved using it at first. I didn't use it much but now I'm using it to contact my friends every day. Since the latest updates I have been fed up with this app. I don't receive any messages until an hour or so after my friends send them, the call screen stays on my screen while I'm in a call and doing other stuff, and I keep getting kicked off of calls and the app all together if I open and use a different app. Skype has been going downhill for a while now and I'm tired of the app being an absolute piece of garbage. Hopefully the developers get their heads in the game and make the app better and working properly. I'm not going to delete the app because it's literally the only form of communication I have, but I expect the developers get the app working properly again for mobile devices, or I'm done.
WEAK, works great BUT INCOMPATIBLE WITH GROUP CALL!!!!????
Maybe I'm missing something, but I've never heard of anyone who's gotten this to work. It'd be great if it did!
Latest version stopped working. Microsoft is terrible for how they are dropping support for old versions but the Google market version is ok still.
I cannot connect with my family on this device...I am very unhappy!
It made me reset my account and now I lost all my stuff on Skype. I don't know if someone hacked me or it just reseted by its self. Please fix this. I used to like this but now I don't.

This game is so crappy!! Don't get it!!! I tried to log in once my new account FINALLY worked, but it said, "Unable to log in"!!! I was like, "WHAT THE HECK!!!!!" If you already got it, get rid of it!!! Then if you ever see it again, (god forbid) then just shut off your device. Right there and then. Headings: No longer on Kindle Fire HD
Base_Reviews: Stopped working with Kindle Fire HD. Literally stopped working overnight on 10/24/17. All troubleshooting tips no help. I've read reports that it's no longer going to be supported on Kindle Fire HD but no official word from Microsoft or Amazon.

Headings: Sorry that it was purchased by Microsoft!
Base_Reviews: I have used Skype for years but now that it is owned by Microsoft , it is absolutely terrible from the standpoint of purchasing a credit, changing passwords etc. The interface on this Amazon tablet sucks but I think that is due more to Microsoft than Amazon. I have tried to change my password but don't receive the code on email or my phone. Microsoft has been in bed with the NSA in helping them spy on law abiding citizens in the past and I am sure they are still doing it. If only there was an alternative I would relegate this app to the virtual dung heap. Amazon, you really need to create an alternative app . Microsoft screws up everything they touch if Skype is an example.

Headings: Unable to refresh or revive most recent Text messages.
Base_Reviews: I have no idea why there is no refresh button. But I am no longer getting my most recent responses that I am normally getting on my pc. There is no way for me to know anyone's response to my messages. This is very frustrating. I am using kindle fire to attempt communication with this.
as soon as I or someone else picks up, the app immediately closes out and crashes, I can't even say anything before it closes out

Skype no longer connects on any type of call (Skype to Skype, or landline) on my kindle fire. Support link on app doesn't load, and microsoft community message boards are no help, they just refer you back to the useless app support. Very disappointed because Skype is really the only option for kindle fire and my only way to conduct some business while overseas, not to mention stay in touch with family. Prior to the bug, which started around 25 Oct 2017, I was very happy with the app. Please fix and update version for kindle fire!

Headings: Mobile app became unusable after recent update
Base_Reviews: Last week my mobile Skype decided to update on its own without even asking my permission to do so as any other app would do. Update brought back bunch of garbage from 2 years of prior communications, including all of the blocked and deleted people and bots! To make the matter worse - the is no option to delete the from the screen either.And now the most important issue that mames this Skype update totally worthless - you CAN NOT see which of your contacts is online. The green light feature is gone, it doesn't appear even on Skype echo which is always online. They need to fix that bug,obviously. It is a bug, because yesterday i did see that green light at some point, and after i closed the app and opened it again - it was blind as usual.Please fix it!

Headings: Cannot use it on Kindle Fire
Base_Reviews: It seems that I cannot use it on my Kindle Fire. I keep getting a message that it is not supported. Bummer!

Headings: Bad port of a good service.
Base_Reviews: The worst aspect of this app is that it continually fails to push messages from people. Often I will message someone only to suddenly have several messages sent to me hours before suddenly load. To the other people, it just appears I am ignoring them. Signing on to the desktop app at the same time will make the messages show up and be received immediately, but then what is the point of using the app if I have to use the desktop?The interface was already bad and they continue to make it worse with each update. Now contacts are separated into a long alphabetical directory rather than simply allowing you to see who is online at a glance. The desktop interface is fine, and I'm not sure why they feel the need to try and deviate from it.You cannot choose any status but online or invisible. Worse, you can't see if anyone else has their status set as away or busy. You simply see them as online, when in reality they may not want to be disturbed.The desktop program is fine. The mobile app however is handicapped in several ways. If you need a way to use Skype from your phone or tablet, this is unfortunately your best option. If you are just looking for a video/instant messaging app that doesn't need to be Skype, then choose something else.

Skype keeps signing me out. When I try to sign back in it says unable to sign in. I have had to change my password more than 5 times. I use this app to stay in touch with friends. This app is irritating and needs an update. The call quality goes from clear to EXTREMELY blurry in a matter of seconds. Sometimes out of nowhere it just hangs up my calls! The calls are laggy and it's really aggravating. I don't recommend using this app.ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ°ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¸ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ

For such a popular program you would think they'd have th  money to higher a decent programmer. This app is garbage. About half the time it won't let me go online unless I call someone. If you are  on a group call on you're computer and log off and call one person from the group back on the kindle it will call the whole group back even though it shows you are only calling the one person. It also crashes a lot and tends to just sign off in the middle  of calls which is frustrating cause it's hard to get back on with out crashing. Also if someone calls you while you are working on something it will close that program and delete your progress. To much stress for what it's worth.

I can not Skype at all. Right in the middle of something important to this dying women,  something that will never happen again and Skype started acting up, erased all contacts, won't let me sign in, even after I asked for Skype to send info on username and password to me, still wouldn't work.  Then it tells me I have to pay to proceed, PAY? Since when? And still wouldn't even let me pay and continue video chat birthday party I was participating in. It kept bumping me of telling me I had to pay before looking at my settings without being logged in.. what's going on? Wouldn't even let me look at anything that was on the page, it would change then go back to PAY PAY PAY. I felt I was being extorted.  I missed the party and now I fear they're mad at me cause they haven't returned my landline calls. I couldn't even get to help or customer service, kept diverting me to h home page of Skype or pay page. Terribly disappointed in Skype.

Headings: Skype for Kindle, a total failure! Thanks to Amazon Fire OS...
Base_Reviews: I've been using Skype for years and It's been a good experience, but not with my new Kindle Fire.I'm not sure what thebig Idea is with amazon and propietrary versions of lots of apps. They all have problems, crashing all the time and making you sorry you bought a kindle and not a Nexus or something different form another manufacturer that can download from the official Google Play Store.Skype is one of those failures, when a nice app you love just drives you crazy for the sake of Amazon's own version of Android. I'm not sure they're aware the ammount of trouble they're causing with that. They think this is the way to capture more customers, but they're totally wrong. And since I hate being forced to buy something that doesn't work, I use alternative stores, even if I can't use the Google Play Store.I updated Skype using a version I found in another store and it works perfectly. Stay away from the "official" kindle version, it's crap, and you'll be sorry in the end.

Headings: Skype does not work on the Kindle Fire so don't even try
Base_Reviews: i have tried to use skype on both my fire kindles. the older 1st generation and the new HDX I just bought. The kindle fire itself is pretty amazing but I really had hoped to be able to use skype on it. I have been a skype user for 6-7 years and it has been great on my desktop and works great on my samsung galaxy S-3 but it's a no go on the fire. I have 2 Fires and 2 1st version monochrome monitor with the keyboards at the bottom. Streaming video on Fire is great with netflix, hulu or amazon prime which I bought when I got the Fire TV streaming device which is fantastic. The fire TV exceeded all my expectations but skype won't work on the Fire end of story. I have been trying with the older fire for over a year and now the new HDX i got a month ago it won't work either. It will not give you a dial pad to make calls. Don't waste your time with the skype until they do major updates just for kindle.

OLD review: The pre-installed version on my fire HD was buggy: if I made the mistake of typing an IM, then any subsequent calls was a matter of chance whether they would happen. Even if it crashed, I just had to reopen Skype. However, as long as a call (either voice or video) was active, the thing worked. I saw there was an update, so I gladly installed it. Disaster ensued. Video calls are flaky and the app crashes frequently; as soon as it crashes, only a tablet reboot will release the camera device; it remains locked/stuck/whatever and any app trying to use the camera hangs.I would like to downgrade to the previous version but I can't (or don't know how to). So here's hoping that a bug fixing release will soon be available.Otherwise, call quality is excellent, given available bandwidth.NEW review: the Kindle Fire HD 7 version no longer can connect to my account.
