There is no way to download it, and sync'ing the tablet does not update it.I believe that Amazon does not care about old devices, so I'm simply out of luck.

This will be my third Skype account.  So far none of them work properly.  My first attempt with Skype was about five years ago and it worked perfectly.  Since then, it is constantly degraded to the point where I get garbled sound and no video.  I thought by having it on my Kindle.  My problem would be resolved.  No such luck.  I think Skype just does not like me.  I know it is not my Internet connection because the next step up would be to full commercial satellite receiving.  It does work okay for instant message, though, but that's not why I bought it.  Yes, I even purchased an upgrade version for my computer and it still does not work.  Skype and me just don't agree.  I sure hope someone from Skype reads this review and offers me some help because their customer service is probably the worst in the industry

I had been using skype for a long time now and the skype before the update was great! It worked very well and I didn't have many problems with it..most of the time..but now that it had updated it's basically like crap now, it's slow, the typing slows down simwtimes and the cursor goes back to the start of the message, it's really annoying....another thing would be if you wanted to scroll up to see past messages it would be really slow and sometimes freeze and not move and you have to force close it...and exciting out of pictures it a pain as well...I feel like the whole update ruined skype...if they could at least fix it up some more I think a lot more people would be happy.

Headings: Used to be great until most recent update.
Base_Reviews: This was a terrific program and my chat of choice.  It had very intuitive chat, great voice chat and decent video chat.  Now it got a facelift in this last update and now you can't hit enter to send messages...it's now a button up in the chat area that the keyboard covers up.  You used to be able to change your status from online to away or invisible or offline....now you can't.  You're online as long it's running and have to completely shut down the kindle to turn it off.  Before this update I rated this at about a 5*....now that's no longer friendly to use at all it's down to 2*....and that's being generous.  Looks like this is now a PC only program again for its useability because that platform hasn't gotten the horrible facelift.  So much for talking to friends elsewhere in the house!

I used this up for years, but last 3 days I can't connect with anyone in my contacts, the app for Apple devices word but on my kindle fire it doesn't connect. I don't know if it is w New update or what but i really hope they fix it soon. Very sad that we can't use it.
The app crashes automatically

Half the time the app does not start, just quietly quits and gets you back to front screen of the Kindle.When it does start, the interface is horrible, a set of light-blue and darker-blue squares..what is that?When the app starts, if you select "People", it gives you alphabetized list of your contacts, all OFF - becausethis app is not smart enough to come up in ON-LINE mode. Like I want or need it running in off-line mode!!!!!The only way to go on-line is to use ECHO, then it asks you (!!) if you really truly want to connect. Pathetic.Overall, very disappointing app and interface for a great product.

This app does not work. I set this up so I could video call my aunt. She can't here me on the other end and it doesn't support stickiers. Good thing we both have iPhones so we can face time. That works a lot better! Headings: FIX ALL GLITCHES....IT'S A NECESSARY APP
Base_Reviews: When I first downloaded this app to my tab, it worked excellent for the first day. It's the second day and O.M.G. it is always crashing, sticking, volume is too much, can't adjust it, it's forever not responding.It's an app that I need at the moment but it's making me regret the decision of downloading it. I really didn't want to because the rating is ridiculously low for such a well needed app.FIX THESE GLITCHES PLEASE.Too many apps starts to malfunction on tabs, especially the Kindle Fire. It make  No sense you design the app for the Kindle and then the app slows it down or is not too compatible so it crashes.

This app was okay I guess. I mean its good for video chatting and I love to do it but every time I try to call someone and they don't pickup even after I have quit I can still here that really annoying ringing noise! Its so frustrating! I even completely exit out of the app and I can still here it so I have to shut down my tablet and restart it all over again! So annoying! Also very laggy and sometimes slow. The picture is good I guess but please fix the stupid ringing noise!!!!! So annoying I just want to pick my tablet and throw it! ( I'm not that stupid don't worry) please fix this app so it will actually be good for video chatting. Yes I'm done now

Headings: drops calls, lags, the new update
Base_Reviews: In 2013, my kindle fire HD worked AMAZING with Skype, I wanted to Skype my friends all the time and now I don't. Skype got a recent update and now it drops my calls, completely freezes, and makes the app almost worthless. I hope Skype soon fixes the issues so this wonderful app can work just as good or even better than before..

It looks like since mid 2013 on forwards, Skype isn't worth downloading.  I bought two Kindle fires just so I could keep in touch with my parents, and the app crashes non stop. Call drops, app closes, calls won't go or come through (I called on cell phone, and could hear their Skype ringing from their end but I never got the call and vice versa). Once it gives you the error message if you don't close it, it'll crash your system. Freezes the screen, and you have to full power down. The only reason I bothered to review and rate one star at all is voice calling is superbly clear with minimal lag.  However two minutes into my voice call (because I gave up on video), I got the error that Skype was not responding.  My screen then froze completely. Couldn't even hit menu to go to home.  But my voice call never dropped, so I guess that's the one thing it has going for it.

Maybe it's because the Kindle has a proprietary Android OS, maybe it's because Microsoft wants everyone to buy Windows-based devices, idk. All I know is that Skype for Kindle never shows anyone as being online, even though I can log on from another platform and see that they are in fact online. This app also very rarely notifies me about new messages. It really just doesn't send notifications unless I'm in an active conversation, even then... expect to have to leave the app open 24/7 to receive notifications 25% of the time.

Headings: can't see who is online or ho is my contact
Base_Reviews: With the new version of skype it is not possible to see who is online(the yellow or green status) or who has accepted your contact request(the question mark sign) . I wish this features be added to a new relese to make skype, the great messenger app it has been.

It won't send me notifications for when I get messages or calls from other people, even though I listed it as a Priority under the notification settings on my tablet. I've looked around the Skype app itself and I can't find any option to turn on notifications. So basically this is only a useful app if you're willing to sit and stare at your messages all say to make sure you don't miss any. No thanks.

I recently updated to this skype from the older version and regret it immensely. This "updated" skype is hands down the worst app I've ever had the misfortune of using. If you try to load a webpage on the silk browser, skype will crash. If you adjust the volume, skype will crash. If you plug in your kindle to charge, skype will crash. On top of this, if you attempt to watch a video while in a call, skype will distort the audio of the video and play increasingly loud static noises until the video is over.How a professional company managed to mangle and ruin an app so absolutely is beyond me. All I know is that I won't be using this app until these app breaking crashes and bugs are fixed.

Headings: Skype is good, but the app for KFHD is AWFUL!
Base_Reviews: I like Skype on my computer, but this app is horrible. It's not compatible with Kindle Fire HD, no matter how you look at it. Not only does the app keep losing video and crash, it makes my device crash which is always terrifying because I never know if it'll ruin my Kindle forever. I uninstalled it from my device, and will not reinstall it until I hear it it once again compatible (if it ever is again). Until then, Oovoo is a much better and more reliable free video calling app.

Man, where to begin.#1 Trying to text chat while on cam is super hard because you have to keep switching between windows#2 I don't usually get text alerts if I'm surfing, making my friends think I'm ignoring them, it's buggy#3 When people try to add me, it never works, I have to add from my end#4 Kinda slow and laggy sometimes, and occasionally closes by itselfI can use it, but it's a pain sometimes...

Every time I try to video chat on my kindle it doesn't work. It always freezes and it exits me out or you can't hear me. I fixed everything that was wrong with my kindle or thought that was. And that wasn't the problem. Please fix it so I don't have trouble in the future.

Let's just get this straight: Skype for Kindle Fire HD is probably one of the WORST apps to ever exist. The calls drop, my kindle freezes, I have  to restart kindle, I can't see their face, or I can't hear them. The only thing it does correctly is the messaging. But I don't want Skype for messaging. There are tons of messaging apps out there. I wanted it for voice calls. The updates just keep making the product worse and worse. I don't know what the developers are doing and I understand it's a tough job, but this is ridiculous.Highly disappointed.

Everything works great... except I can't receive calls on my Fire Phone.  When I test, I get an error stating that "your device currently cannot receive push notifications".  My device can receive push notifications from other apps.... so I am not sure what is wrong.

Headings: Anything that Microsoft touches the ultimately ***** it up.
Base_Reviews: Anything that Microsoft touches the ultimately ***** it up. Skype started working way worse since they bought it. There is not support. And they have the passwords completely messed up. There are privacy issues they seem to be turing in keys to the system to oppressive regimes. This is why I am burning through the last credit i bought from them and turning to a better more user friendly solution.

This app is terrible. If there was a way to rate it with minus stars I would. Main reason I bought my Kindle was to skype with my son away at college. It crashed 14 times in 40 minutes and each time I had to restart my Kindle to even try to open the app. Same thing happened 3 times last weekend so not just a one time occurrence. I'm so angry and frustrated I just gave up. Amazon, you can find a better app to include for your customers!

Headings: No notifications on incoming even if app open
Base_Reviews: Bought kindle fire HD 8 Plus and Skype number and plan just for Aunt on nursing home. Calls out fine with Alexa. But incoming calls from Skype-to-skype, cell or landline never trying device or have a notification. Receive notification if voicemail after only. Useless. No refund from Skype even though does not work. Is fine on an android device but not fire HD.

Headings: Kindle Fire HD SKYPE doesn't do group calls
Base_Reviews: Skype is a wonderful tool, and the paid susbcriptions are worth the investment, however the version installed in the Kindle Fire HD does not allow adding people/contacts/phones to a call.I was told by SKYPE technicians that the Kindle Fire HD Version does not have the same functionality as does the Android application (in spite of what this page - and others - say).  It is June 2013, 7 months after the Fire HD came out, and they haven't solved the bug???Its a shame that SKYPE for the Kindle Fire HD is not as capable as other SKYPE versions.

When I had first gotten this app, it would work fine. I was able to video chat, call and message perfectly. Now, I can barely send a message. I would write one, click send and it would say "pending" in the corner. My message wouldn't be sent. This app lags A LOT, and sometimes won't even let me sign in! From time to time some of my contacts won't show up. If I am doing something wrong, I have absolutely no idea what it is. Now I have to use my laptop on Skype instead of the easiest way. I am very disappointed and I should hope an update will fix these problems.

Headings: Untested - Poor usability - NSA spy tool
Base_Reviews: Who actually tests this stuff?  After the recent "update" it's even harder to use my pre-existing skype contacts that are my favorites in the Skype application.  It's how I communicate with Skype.  Now I can only access my favorites if I was in recent conversation with them only so I need to walk back to my computer to use Skype on my iPhone or Kindle.Skype has always had unneeded animations and poor usability.  I remember from the PC and Mac Skypes, if you wanted to make a phone call you would need to click this tiny icon and wait for the animation of it to flip around a keypad.  It just has a poor layout just like the Horrible Windows 8.  I don't expect anything good to come from this software since M$ owns it.  Also, since it has been revealed that Skype is unsecure because it allows the government to steal your conversations.

It's been well over a year since I've been able to send photos via Skype on the kindle fire. Both of my nieces have kindle fires and they have the same issue. I can send them photos from other devices (traditional computers, iPad, iPhone, and my Microsoft Surface) and they can receive those photos. But one cannot send jpegs via Skype for Kindle. This update did not address that issue.

It drops calls, and the only way to fix it is shut down the kindle and reboot. Then works again for another 10 minutes and drops again. If you don't reboot it just goes crazy. It comes on the kindle when you buy it new so why isn't it more compatible. Used to love it now I hate it. Amazon fix it please or offer us a better app for video chatting.

Headings: Skype on Kindle no longer works
Base_Reviews: Since updating to the latest version of this app (Oct 2017) I can't receive calls on my Kindle Fire HD.  Inbound calls don't ring or appear on screen.  I can call out to another device AS LONG AS IT ISN'T ANOTHER KINDLE because those calls don't ring on my contacts' Kindles, either. After the fact the app on the Kindle shows a "missed call" as if it had rung and you just didn't answer the call.  Basically, if you are using a kindle, you can now make calls to non-kindle devices but you can not receive a call from any device of any kind.  The text chat feature works, so at least that's something...

Skype was preinstalled on my Fire HD. It did not include the video calling feature as described and one primary reason for purchase. I uninstalled and downloaded this version which also does not have video calling. Very disappointed. App provider should correct the description and so should Amazon!

I don't know what update people are referring to, but this app has never worked properly on my Kindle fire. It crashes ALL of the time. Every time I try to give it another chance, I regret it by the first call. Hate it. I wish they'd get it together because this would be a great app to have on the  Kindle.

The main issue I have with Skype is the fact that it crashes constantly. I could be video chatting with someone or simply rotating my kindle before Skype decides it's too much for it to handle that it will crash. After the update, I also noticed I wasn't able to hear the person I called, even after raising the volume all the way up. Took me a while to realize that you can raise the volume specifically for Skype calls that you can ONLY access just as you are calling the person before they answer (you do this by pressing the volume control on the side of the tablet).PLEASE FIX THIS. It is very annoying and highly inconvenient.

I used to use this app all the time, so that I could talk to my boyfriend and my friends since I'm away at college, but the app updated and now I can't make calls. I can't accept calls. AND THE APP KEEPS CRASHING. This is the only app I have that does this. And I'm so sad and frustrated. Yeah, I can call my friends, but I'd rather see their faces AND hear their voices. It looks like I'm going to have to fuss with and deal with Google hangouts or the Facebook video chat. Please update the app, SO THAT IT WORKS, HAS NO BUGS, AND DOESN'T CRASH. Thank you!

Headings: How was this better years ago?
Base_Reviews: I don't understand how the ORIGINAL program was so much better. I have not made one single successful call.  Every single call is pixelated to the point that you never can actually see anything, and the lag is so bad that it's like being in a call with an English dubbed Asian film from the 60s. Every call freezes and drops a million times or just doesn't work at all. It doesn't matter if you're on a tablet, phone, or laptop. This app made my KINDLE freeze. I didn't even know that was possible. Deleting and never downloading again. Horrible.
This app worked ok when I first downloaded it, but now it crashes my Kindle. If the program even starts to work, it freezes then crashes within about 60 seconds. Completely worthless.

Headings: I bought a Kindle Fire HD & I use Skype ...
Base_Reviews: I bought a Kindle Fire HD & I use Skype often, however upon receiving my Kindle fire Skype was not preinstalled on my Kindle, I called support & was told I am out of luck & Skype download is not available for the Fire..IF I KNEW THIS I WOLD NOT HAVE BOUGHT KINDLE FIRE..I feel Amazon swindled me !!!  If you use Skype do NOT buy Kindle Fire.

Before the update, my kindle could take video calls with no problem, recently I can't get a video call to last longer than a minute before the screen goes white and the app goes unresponsive. If I do manage to get back to the message screen without turning the kindle off, I can't call of anything without it crashing completely, so I have to turn it off and then on again. It will only take voice calls, which is very frustrating since I'm trying to keep in touch with close people across various countries and we would like to speak face to face. I have no idea what this is, and it's driving me nuts. Fix this app! I would like to be able to make video calls again, and I would like for files to show up again like it used to. Very annoyed.

The new Skype download is nearly useless. Calls always fail and the video simply never works. If you are lucky, sometimes the audio will work in the background as the software crashes. Just don't press the wait or OK for a restart, then you can at least get a few words in. But that does not always work. If you video call, it crashes immediately. Too bad, it use to work.

I was having trouble with skype, so I called their customer service number and long story short, the tech man was somehow able to remote control the computer I was trying to use skype on. He controlled my mouse and was able to click on my settings. When I told him to stop, he threatened me. It was a nightmarish experience and I will never have anything to do with Skype ever again.

This app is a great app, but when you try to turn on the video, the video will freeze and so will skype. You will have to restart your tablet to have it working properly. This is most of the time.Another glitch is, when you try to use some apps and the internet, skype will stop working. This may be just my tablet though.

In the middle of all my video chats, Skype will randomly crash and go back to the main page. After it crashes and I bring it back up, I can't make calls or answer calls without it crashing again. I always have to reset my kindle. It seems to work for a little bit, sometimes only a few seconds into a video chat, but it always crashes. I have very little way to contact people back home and this is the only way get to see them for months that I am away so I would really appreciate if all the s*** that is wrong with the app would be fixed.

Consistently crashes and requires an entire restart of kindle, sometimes no picture on either side but sound and other times sound and picture don't match. I can usually only get about 5 minutes with no problems. My friend has older kindle and it always works, which was the primary reason I got a kindle! Very frustrating!
It won't send me push notifications saying my device can't currently receive them, but i can with facebook messenger and was woeking last time i used it.

Headings: Please, I am begging you, fix this app!
Base_Reviews: I would give Skype a 5 star review for the Mac program, and I SO wish I could do the same for this app... It started out fine and was such a blessing! My husband is a musician and tours a lot abroad. My whole family lives overseas, and this is the way we stay connected. Until about 3 months ago things were running smoothly, the app was user friendly, and the connection and reception were great. Then came the "upgrade"... the graphics were supposedly fancied up, but not in my opinion, and all sorts of crazy things started to happen. The little window that shows our own image became so huge that it's hard to see the other person, and our camera shot keeps rotating, every few seconds, and it beeps as it's happening. Most calls to my husband, who also has a Kindle Fire HD and Skype, get disconnected, my Kindle battery gets drained out, and my Kindle keeps crashing. :( On behalf of my 3 year-old who misses daddy so much, I'm desperate and shameless enough to BEG you to PLEASE fix this app or go back to the previous version! I will come back and give you your 5 stars when you do. ;) Thanks!

Allow me to explain why, the update completely jumbles it and ruins it. It's somewhat buggy and glitchy and while it sort of works at first hand, there's a chance that you won't receive notifications AT ALL. And this is one of the issues.I tried the best I can and I couldn't get the notification to notify me. Now I have to check hours later or so to get to things. It's really unfortunate you can't receive notifications somewhat. By the way, this has less features than PC Skype so you can still use it, but it won't have most important stuff like a Video Group Call and such. Get it if you want but you'll be disappointed.

First few months were fine. Everything worked great. Then a few months ago when I tried calling, it would crash. Same with other people trying to call me. When it finally actually worked, my joy didn't last for long. My side, the one they see, would freeze and then the app would crash. Again. Just because it's free DOES NOT mean it's worth getting. You can find other free video calling apps that work waaay better. That's what I am going to do right after I post this.

This app used to work when I first got my Kindle. Then it updated and has never since worked properly. First there were problems with audio while on calls. Then it started crashing. Then the audio problems resolved with no aid from support. Now the video has started completely going black and the app will freeze and take me back to the friends screen. When I try and call back (it crashes the call) the video still does not work. Restarting the app does not work. Reinstalling the app does not work. Restarting the Kindle briefly worked but it quickly went back to doing the same thing. I have uninstalled the app and it will stay that way.

I can not for the life of me get this app to work. I thought it was my tablet so I tried my husband's and it crashed on. His constantly and froze the device. Please fix this so I can talk to my family again. I really liked to be able to video call them. I can't anymore :/

The new update is horrible. First of all, if you are on a video call with someone and you try to put your video on, within ten minutes the whole page will turn white and crash. Also, it constantly will say "Skype has stopped working, would you like to close it?" You have no choice in the matter. If you don't close it, the same message will keep popping up, therefore FORCING you to close it. If you have an older version of Skype, keep it. You will not be able to get your old version back if updated to this version. Also, if you want to type a long message out, your keyboard will lag like crazy. I do not recommend this update to anyone.

Headings: Low volume, constant crashes - install android version
Base_Reviews: Kindle version crashes constantly and volume is adjusted to be too low. Installed the android version (5.2) by installing the .apk file from the web and problem solved. I couldn't install the android version from the amazon webstore and had to enable 'install from unknown sources' in kindle settings for .apk to install.Amazon needs to either work with skype to improve kindle version or allow the installation and also recommend the android version.

The app was perfect until it updated recently. The updated layout is terrible and there are too many problems during Skype calls.My rating for the older version is five stars. The better version only gets two.Please change it back!

I don't know if this app is just needing a overhaul or what, but I'm constantly getting kicked out while in a Skype session and also having problems with it being unresponsive during a session. I only have android phones and kindle fire HDX to use Skype with, no I phone to do face time or I would use that instead! This app has been more trouble than it's worth for not only myself, but the people who have to also use it with me. Glad it's free, because it's not worth paying for.

Headings: Used to good but now worst than ever
Base_Reviews: Every update make it more unstable, lit off black screen starting the video call, than not responding. Volume control only after conversation start, before that you can only adjust an other volume, look s like the warnings. This is the only app what adjust something else what they should. No Mic sensitivity setup, on phone no camera or selection. They made a good app to pain to use, so you look for an alternative. If Google hangout stars to work on kindle, this one is gone.One star because the last version was broken too, but at least that was worked.

Headings: Used to love it, but now...
Base_Reviews: I had heard of this happening, but was skeptical until it happened to me.Skype simply kicked me out of my account for no apparent reason at all.  I was blocking a contact request and, next thing I know, I'm out of my account.It will not recognize my username.  It will not recognize my password.  I can't recall what email address I used to open the account, so there's nothing more to it.  I cannot regain access to my account.I don't know what the latest upgrade did, but it's messing everything up.Now, since it belongs to Microsoft, it wants me to use a Microsoft account to sign in.  Maybe they are trying to twist arms to get this done.  Although, if they want users to be loyal and not migrate to other free apps, they should aim to make it more user-friendly than it currently is.Very disappointed in what used to be a favorite.

Headings: Always crashes when in Free Time
Base_Reviews: Using on the Kindle HDX, while not in FreeTime, the app is very sluggish and has a large delay while in calls. When trying to get it to work in FreeTime, so my daughter can Skype her grandparents, the application crashes immediately after log in.

I had this app on my kindle fire HD before the update and the difference is astounding. The update ruined everything! Volume won't work, video glitchy, and trouble with sign in. If you have the old version DO NOT UPGRADE! Waiting for an update with bug fixes, though i will say i like the look of the new interface. Patiently waiting a fix!

Headings: Skype does not work on Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Base_Reviews: Second time in a few months Skype has come out with a new version which doesn't work.  Apparently Skype developers do not perform Quality Assurance, nor do they have a QA department.  Skype is rude and they don't care.  Please if you have an older version of Skype please keep it on your device.  Make sure your settings do not have automatic  update for Skype on.  Mine the sound did not work but you can fix by pressing the side volume button.  Then the chime keeps going off and the device powers off every 2 to 4 minutes.  Please fix !  Main reason for this purchase.

Beware of "Free" in this case.  It does have a significant "Cost" called lockup.  You will experience frequent instances where the application just freezes and you have to reboot the device.  I use it to communicate with family and only use it when no other device is available.  Very frustrating experience.

The first time I got Skype, it was okay, until the update. . .the worst update ever that didn't even increase the quality of Skype, but it worsened it ever so much more. I Skype my best friend, which lives 3 states away, but we can't even talk with our faces showing, because it freezes up and crashes both of our Kindles, and we both have 4g wireless Wifi. The only time it hasn't messed up, is when my friend was in his basement. Yeah, it is TERRIBLE!!! Please fix Skype, so it doesn't mess up, and Please no more updates, unless it's 100% better.

Headings: It's not working like 35% of the time
Base_Reviews: This app is absolute bulls*** for me. It keep crashing, I can't join many group calls, and there's no way for me to update it. There are times where it won't even let me send anything. Please make this app better for kindle fire users.

I am using this app on my new Kindle Fire HDX and I am not satisfied with its quality. For a few seconds immediately after the start of a video call there is thick green stinge on both the caller 's and the callee's videos. It goes away shortly after but is very annoying. The worst thing is, the app cannot do the logout properly. When I try to sign out, it crashes and when I reopen the app I am still logged in. The only way my wife could login is to uninstall the app and reinstall it! What a nuisance!

Headings: New mandatory update does not work
Base_Reviews: (Kindle Fire HD) New update crashes constantly for no reason, audio only works with headphones, and calls are 99% immediately hung up. If you read this before updating after 3.2.505.13 DO NOT update. Skype will become completely unusable. You'll know your app is updated if you get a different menu theme.

There is always a lag between sound and video.  The sound is often distorted and I experience horrible sound quality. There is no way to adjust the microphone or speaker volume which causing horrible feedback and sound quality.  Please fix these issues! This version of Skype leaves so much to be desired.  I really hope it gets better.

When I first downloaded this app it would crash constantly. If you want to multi-task it will crash the second you come back ane messages from your computer won't sync to your Kindle for weeks. This past week an update became available and really find zed the aesthetics of it, but of course there came a major flaw. I can no longer receive audio from the other end w/o using headphones and even then I can't adjust the volume. THIS APP IS MEDIOCORE. REFRAIN FROM UPDATES.

Headings: Not working on my Kindle Fire HDX
Base_Reviews: I installed Skype on my 8.9" HDX and on my father's.  So far it only works on mine.When he tries to answer a call, of any type, the screen does a quick back-and-forth between the app and the home screen before dropping the call. restarting the tablet and reinstalling the app did not make any difference.  Have not found very useful info on the web to diagnose, let alone resolve this issue.A bit frustrating since one of the reasons for going with the HDX was the front-facing camera for Skype video calls.

Version 4.4 really dropped the ball. The layout is disorganized and unwieldy and each time I get a message I have to re-sign in. Extremely disappointed, Skype. Should have just kept what you had before.....

I cannot write how unbelievably awful the new update is but let's try shall we. It CONSTANTLY crashes not only the app its self but my whole freaking kindle! You can no longer control the volume when you have it on in the background, you could have it on nothing and still have the call blaring on full blast! When it has crashed and you restart the app it can still call, although for a video calling service you often end up with no video at all! Just freaking perfect and the best part is, there is no going back, you can no longer get an actual fully functional version of Skype. At the moment, you are better off with Oovoo!!

I downloaded this app for the HD 7", and so far I have been pretty dissapointed.  I constantly have to re install due to freezing on the sign in screen that restarting my kindle wont even solve half the time.  This occurs on multiple different wifi connections, i know its not on my end.  Constantly drops calls when i have great connections, and the video freezes more than i care for.  I was kind of counting on this app as a way of communicating back home to the family, as im often in areas with wifi but no cell phone access.  As a matter of fact, its the only reason i bought the hd.Best case scenario, its free video calling thats the best thing in the world when it works.  Worst, i wouldnt waste a cent on the skype credits when the app wont launch or connect properly 75% of the time

The only time I can Skype is if we are both calling each other simultaneously.  If not, then it rings incessantly, even if I shut the app off or even TURN THE VOLUME OFF!  The only solution that stops theincessant ringing is if I turn the device completely off.

I love Skype and use it on my smartphone without any issues but I have yet to have more than 1 minute (if I'm lucky) on my Kindle Fire HD before it freezes. It is soooooo frustrating!! I've read some of the reviews and it seems I'm far from alone, I hope the developer keeps tabs on reviews and fixes this problem. For now I've moved on to Tango but would love to come back to Skype!

Headings: kid's no longer able to Skype nana and papa
Base_Reviews: Skype freezes and reboots kindle fire hd constantly. We are lucky if there is a minute of video chat before it crashes. There will be lots of disappointment on Christmas as all of our family lives out of state.

Headings: I can't sign in. I could on my computer ...
Base_Reviews: I can't sign in. I could on my computer, but not on the device. after ONE ATTEMPT to sign in. I get bombarded with captchca codes. I changed my password & it STILL wouldn't let me sign in. I.give.up. this is not user friendly.

Profile_Name: My Pen Name is Pen Name.
Base_Reviews: It freezes your kindle ruins your keyboard lags apps lags your keyboard lags the app itslef makes u end calls when u didnt randonly ends calls so you get the point IT IS HORRIBLE

Headings: after update Skype no longer works for kindle
Base_Reviews: Skype was fine for awhile, sometimes it would freeze or I couldn't do two things at once but recently there's a new update that it forces me to get ...now it's saying Skype is incompatible with my device wtf

Well I would have thought that they would have fixed Skype by now. Mine crashed and burned big time. I uninstalled and I reinstalled. I guess I'll have to see what happens but I'm not too confident considering all the reviews.

Fix Skype .... it ends my calls , it has lagged reception and it lags when I talk, its about a 4 second delay .... I can't call people either , I have to have them call me ... Cause when i call , it says connecting then drops call. And when in my Skype call it drops call randomly . And I hate this update .I'm really sad they don't fix this with so many bad reviews. Its garbage, out of all respect fix this . plenty people want the same....I think you should look into this and fix . haha real talk .

I use Skype regularly on several devices and as much as I like the program, there are frequent hiccups. I just downloaded the most recent update for my kindle hd and now the call volume is very low. My mother's new kindle experienced the same problem with the most recent version as well. We have both ruled out device/hardware issues. If this is resolved quickly, I would be happy to bump up my rating.

This app has been mediocre at best and is currently horrible.  Freezes and constantly drops calls.  Does anyone have a better recommendation?  Everyone talks about how good face time is.  Problem is I have Android and the wife has Apple.  Is there a better video chat app that works well between the two.

Headings: Awful version of a great app.
Base_Reviews: The Amazon version of this app destroyed logins on every other device I own. I now cannot login to Skype at all--and Microsoft/Skype seem unable to help.

Despite many tries, reading support post, reading comments on Kindle app page, deleting and reinstalling app I have not been able to place video calls on my kindleI know the camera works on other apps but in skype it doesn't even give you the ability to video check. I have checked the video box in settings to no avail.My cousin who also has an 8.9 HX is also not able to get the camera to work.If i find a solution to this problem i would be glad to give it 4 stars (1 star off for bad video quality.

App is pretty awful. Totally non-functional on my Kindle Fire HD. It dials and doesn't connect. There are no meaningful settings you can change other than to de-select Microsoft targeted ads. No help or troubleshooting in the app. Another example of a once great thing that Microsoft borked. This app used to work on this device. Since it has been updated to enhance 'the experience' it no longer functions. Good job - NOT! How sad.

No matter how good my Internet is this program is always laggy. Terrible video quality and it will freeze and crash. Also the pip of my camera is large enough to obscure who I'm talking to, why can't I remove or shrink it? This app needs some serious fixes. Look elsewhere for video chat.

Headings: Does not work with Kindle HDX 8.9 sound lags behind picture
Base_Reviews: I have  kindle 8.9hDX skype doesn't work right. the sound lags behind the video. Skype wrote to me in their forum it is a known issue. they still haven't fixed  it. If you are planning to SKYPE do not buy the KIndle HDX. Very disappointed with Amazon who dont say a word about it..

First of all it asked me for my Microsoft account whose password I don't remember second of all when I filled out the forgot password thing and instead of sending a password  reset it asks to make a security code and when I fill that out every time I make a code it says sorry code didn't work try again I try again and again but it just doesn't work.

While it works, it works (kinda) fine. Unfortunately it crashes about every five minutes on my Fire HD. Also, getting video enabled required an uninstall/reinstall. For being free, it's not awful, but the navigation of menus and options is clunky and counterintuitive.

I downloaded Skype with the expectation that It was a good video calling app. Guess what? It is NOT. I had no problem with anything except for this major flag on the play: There is a glitch where you will be stuck on a screen and Skype will just shut down.

I really want/need this app to keep up with some of my friends who don't have phones and I can't spend all my time on the computer but when I tried to download it said it was incompatible. :( Very disappointedNote: I have a kindle fire 2013

Headings: not made for the kindle fire.
Base_Reviews: Works great on my computer but does not work on the kindle fire. It will shut off in the middle of a call. Of course you have to open it first which is a problem because it will either shut down or freeze the tablet. Needs an upgrade to be functional.

COMPLETE GARBAGE! I had to uninstall it on my Kindle Fire HD 8 because the option for "keep me signed in" wasn't there even though the Skype chat agent says it's supposed to be on every platform and also because no form of sound or vibrate notifications were coming through for an incoming call. When I tried to reinstall it, it opened the first time as if it's going to successfully reinstall, but when it had downloaded and in the installing step, it stopped at around 90% and wouldn't go further. I thought it was because of a bad Wi-Fi signal, so I out it on the router directly and still didn't work. Cancelled the install attempt and tried to search for Skype again to download and experienced the whole it trying to open but closes after half a second.
Worked fine for 2 days, now it freezes and stops responding EVERY TIME i make a call. So i delete it and re download it. Now it force closes and stops resonding 8 TIMES before i even sign in. Fix it.

Skype used to be nice and easy to call my friends up, but then the update came..it crashes all the time, it hangs up in the middle of my call, and its always taking forever to load.Then a note pops up that says: Skype is not responding.would you like to close it? Wait or CloseSo you click close and then go back into it.Then it crashes again!! I hate the new Skype update!! They need to go back to the old version, it was perfect!!

I like to Skype with a friend who is stationed in Korea, well I'd like to. I'm unable to because the app constantly crashes or logs me out and won't let me log back in. It's really annoying. I can't wait for a company to create a different and better version of Skype so I could jump this sinking ship for something that actually works. Would not recommend to anyone and will never use again.

I own 2 FireHD's and this app worked great on both devices at the beginning. However, lately I have been having problems with the volumn and issues when trying to login and crashing problems. Just uninstalled the app on one of my devices and will reinstall.

Headings: Can't Do Group Calls from Amazon Devices
Base_Reviews: Since this Recent update which is great but have caused me great pain in butt because now I can't do group call literally totally...I am using Amazon Device Tablet Model Fire HD 7 and I have updated Skype and all but I just can't do group calls. So please please someone help me , I will be really grateful. Developers please do something, ty.
It's awful. It's crashing constantly and causing additional issues with my kindle. FIX IT. I want to be able to use it, but it needs work.

Works fine for maybe about 40 minutes, then the camera stops working on both ends (the other party is on a laptop, and isn't able to see me).Assumed it was me, the app then stops responding as I try to go back to the Skype menu, and then kicks me out of Skype completely.  I go back on, and now there is no camera at all, just voice.  Any attempts to fix this freezes the app and kicks me out.  It pretty much does this until I turn off the Kindle Fire entirely.  Logging into Skype again repeats this again and again.Please fix this, I miss being able to talk to my friend in Minnesota anywhere in the house :(

I was using the skype app on my khd for a couple months..there were a few minor glitches but nothing too bad. Now it just straight up doesnt work. It doesnt allow me to even sign it, crashes and thats it. Reinstalled it about 4 times. Please fix this!
The update ruined the app. Constantly logs me off, crashes and will not let me login. Wish there was a way to use the website to Skype as I can log in there no problem.
WON'T DOWNLOAD ON KINDLES AND FREEZES EVERYTHING.  FIX IT PLEASE AMAZON....I USE  TO TALK WITH MY KIDS WHEN THEY  ARE AWAY.  THIS IS ALL I HAVE, PLEASE HELP

The application worked well in its original form. Sense the update it will not hold a call and crashes frequently. If the app doesn't crash it goes black and freezes the kindle. Skype is still a great service and other devices and their subsequent applications work well. Amazon's app for kindle, not worth the time until the problems are fixed. All of my friends and family report the same problems.

This app does but crash. I can't even open the app without it wanting to crash. If it doesn't crash, it wants to freeze up and then crash. This app really needs to be fixed. I'm using the 2012 Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet.

The last update its unbelievable bad and completely incompatible with Kindle Fire HD 8'9. You just hear nothing and cannot control the volume. Plus the application crash constantly. Avoid this update.

Used this app when I first got my Kindle Fire and it was GREAT.  After the updates it is awful!!!!!!!  Kids love to Skype with Daddy at work, but this app now freezes after less than a minute.  So frustrated, bring back the old app!
This keeps crashing. Everytime I go to call it freezes. Please fix this problem! This so used to be one of my favorites. PLEASE FIX!!!!

Plzzz suport the kidels for skype. Like I wanna groupd call my friends but I cant bc im on. Kindels. Yo should. Do the same. As other mobile devices. Group call. That stuff and. Group chats. That stuff is needed in the kindel fire hd

I used to like Skype. A lot. But after it got updated, I HATE IT. Now I can't multitask as much anymore (as in talking on Skype and doing something else). Sometimes when I'm talking with someone on Skype and I go off the app to another one, it stops and disconnects my call. Yes, the appearance looks better, but technological wise, it sucks. Please get the bugs fix :/ I hate it. The camera on Skype is disoriented for my Kindle Fire. I thought maybe it was my device or internet connection, but I tried restarting it and everything, but the condition still is the same. It's bad for me that's why I'm leaving a review for those of you who haven't updated Skype yet to NOT UPDATE IT. Hopefully it gets better so I can change the star ratings :/

I have this app so I can talk to my friend when she goes on her yearly trip to another country but because of this new update i cant without paying. You had a great app before! Why would you change what isn't broken?!

Headings: UPSET ABOUT THE LACK OF AN UPDATED VERSION
Base_Reviews: I used to love using this app on my kindle until every other device had their Skype apps updated. Now, I can't Skype any one through video or Mic because the kindle version is too old. FIX THIS ISSUE.

Headings: Not the greatest, but what else you gonna do.
Base_Reviews: It crashes for no reason, doesn't stay connected.  Text messages are not always delivered or only part is.  Status messages don't display reliably.  Other than that it's great.
The first few days all was fine, after that I stopped getting notifications and missed calls every time! It crashes for no reason, you can barely hear the person on the other end. It's all crap!
No longer works and no response via any sites or community or forums....it's a dud. Kindle fire...

Tried using the app twice this month.  Used to work perfect,  apparently since the update keeps on saying there is an issue about 2 mins into a call, or goes to a white/black screen and freezes... Hopefully there is a fix soon.

Profile_Name: fun game, obsessed with it. XD lol
Base_Reviews: I got the new update and boy was I disappointed, it's extremely glitchy and does not function properly at all. It will notify me of a new message hours or days late, and you can't send/ receive pictures anymore. The new update is awful. Before the update it worked great, so if possible do not update your Skype.

Whether or not it actually works varies from update to update. There are virtually zero adjustable call settings. It's hard to believe an app specially built for a single device can be so awful even YEARS after it was released. Skype for my junky phone works better than this.

Skype keeps crashing on my kindle and it's super annoying. I use my tablet to participate in meetings and talk with my family and it has been horrible since this latest update. I have to turn off and on the tablet repeatedly to reboot skype. Please fix this glitch or we'll be moving to an alternate application.
Since the last update on Kindle, Skype will constantly freeze video calls, drop calls, crash, and distort video, It desperately needs to be fixed by developers.

I got this app to be able to talk to friends, however after signing into my account, each time I wished to call someone it would freeze, or the app would force close. This is still a problem no matter what I do, therefore I do not recommend it.

Notifications stopped comming through. Notifications still come through on other devices. Reinstalled and now it won't let me make any calls. Just keeps saying there was a problem making the call and to try again later. Also makes me sign in every single time. I tried enabling every permission and letting it use unrestricted data. Still doesn't work.
This is ridiculously buggy. It logs in whenever it wants to, crashes the entire operating system when attempting voice calls, and exhibits other issues. Would be a good app, otherwise.

I do not use this program anymore because there is a problem with the Volume control -- I contacted customer service about this and they worked me through this, but with every new update -- the problem comes back -- low volume and no way to adjust this on the Kindle Fire!

I recently received the Kindle Fire HDX 7" as a gift so I can travel and be able to Skype with it rather than having to use my laptop. I was very disappointed when I tried to skype with it and the audio was just horrible. I was getting a lot of background feedback and so was the other person. I tried to lower my volume but that only made it where I can't hear the other person on the line. We tried with laptop and Skype worked fine. I even had the other person use another device to check if the issue was was the Kindle Fire HDX 7" and it was. I think it has to do with the microphone volume settings on the kindle. Skype and Kindle, please fix this issue.
For some reason Amazon doesn't have the update but I really need to update Skype because it ALWAYS CRASHES
This app is horrible for calling. Everytime I would try it would force close and freeze. The messaging is actually good and it's easy to navigate.

At first it worked fine I was like "Pfft it works fine compared to what people said online the reviews" but when I try to skype with cousin luke it crashes. Texting works fine. Kindle FIR HD SUCKS IT DOESN'T have amazon play!!!

The program works, but that is the best I can say about it. Aside from basic tasks, the program does not seem optimized for the Kindle. For example, I gave up after four tries to reset my password. The keypad covers most of the screen and it is too easy to make mistakes. I will keep the app but make admin changes on a different device.

Headings: Did Skype stop supporting my BlackBerry?
Base_Reviews: Love the BlackBerry, unimpressed Skype not supporting BB10, great OS. Skype buggy on the Android tab as well. Trouble picking up.Skype sucks

Terrible update, along with frequently not making any notification that I have any messages waiting, it constantly crashes my entire tablet without warning and forces it to restart whenever I am checking my contacts, messages or even just trying to open the app. Don't use of you don't absolutely have to, try to find an .apk online of an.older version if you can.
Skype was bad before always dropped my calls would crash randomly.. did update now it won't let me in at all just says I need to update!!  Skype needs to fix this

It doesn't even let me turn the view sideways when i turn the tablet vertical.ever since the update our whatever they did, the app has been crap, and hasn't gotten less crappy since. I'd rather just buy another Google powered tablet, but I'm stuck with this one for now...

The app works, an  it is free, but you will encounter volume problems as well as dropped and lost calls. Reinstalling the app after deleting it from both the device and the cloud seem to fix it temporarily.

Because of the new update, when I type a message, oftentimes it will glitch, and when I answer a call or video call, it will always freeze up for a moment, then the screen goes dark, then it will force close. Please fix this for a better rating, for now, if there was a half star, you would see it.

Horrible. It won't let me sign in. And it logged me out without me pressing the "log out" or "sign out" button. I hate this update. AND the app won't download even after deleting a few apps from my device that are still on my cloud. I'm very annoyed.

So at first it was a pretty decent app... but just a few days ago it automatically logged me out... so I typed in the info and for some reason it wouldn't let me .. it wasn't that i typed the info incorrectly because  it didn't say so... so I changed my password and for some reason it worked... BUT THEN it kept crashing so it's impossible right now...

The app before worked just fine, with the update it now crashes very easily and I am unable to call back or answer calls after without 're-installing or turning off my kindle. Please Fix this issue, considering they are the only app like this we should not be having problems.

This app is terrible. I've updated this app multiple times in hopes that this app would get fixed. It crashes all the time, calls always drop, and it's overall terrible. I don't know if this is the case with other devices. I have the Kindle Fire HD. In all honesty, this app does not deserve one star. DO NOT GET THIS APP.
No picture, frequent crashes and the other person has to hang up because you can't. Old version was awesome and needs to come back now!

Well Skype is new on my kindle fire. I have had it for over a year with hardly any problems. Until now. It keeps crashing and I can't video chat at all. I don't know if it is just my kindle fire or Skype itself...but something needs to be fixed and I think it is the app.

This was an absolute must have app for any Kindle owners. Since the recent update the app loses video and crashes on every call. Very frustrating. I would go for another option until they can address the issues caused by the latest update.

whenever I try to call my friend, it crashes! everytime it tell me to sign in, I have to go through this long process of fixing my password! at first it worked totally fine, and then it all of a sudden, it stops!

I have used Skype for many years, desktop and smart phone, and always rated it high, but this Kindle edition sucks! The amount of time the application needs for start-up is ridiculously long (last time it took it 4 minutes to start up), and the application crashes too often.Fix it Skype, or you will have lost a user!

Dear skype: this new version lags so much, that it's impossible to text anyone. There is lag everywhere. In the photos, in the text, in the phone calls EVERYWERE it's the only thing I have to text with, so...........crap. don't download.

Not only is the other complaints true. It is a pain to download. It takes up SO much space on your device, it's not even funny. I hate it. But I have no other way to contact some of my friends. I really wish they could fix this piece of epic profanity.

Great idea, seems to work on my computer... But doesn't work at all on my Kindle Fire HD. I tried this for about three or four months; people would call and the programming is so poor that it can't even stay loaded to receive calls. Only good to attempt out-bound calls, only stays loaded for a few hours at most before crashing, barely dependable as anything more than an empty claim.It's clearly  a  conspiracy by Microsoft--introduce an app on another operating system (not Microsoft) and use it as a platform to say that Android is unstable--there Are lots of applications that stay loaded dependably,  you just don't know what you're doing

I love Skype on my computer but I hate it for kindle. My calls always drop and the sound is bad. I can message people fine but when I go to make a call my kindle eventually freezes up. Skype is the only way I can call and see my boyfriend because we have a long distance international relationship. I hope it works soon.

Headings: It's a dud... Come on Skype
Base_Reviews: I'm hoping the product manager from the Skype Android app team reads reviews because this app needs help. On my KINDLE Fire HD the app will freeze, or the camera will freeze and then crash every time we use it. The volume when connected is absurdly low, and the other party complains about the picture flipping. One of the more (if there can be more) annoying parts of this spp is the constant beeping while the camera app tries to adjust to light and dark, and resizes the image box that shows the view of herself.Come on Skype! I have never had an issue with the ios version of Skype, and this version has so many bugs it feels like it was done on purpose to send us running to Apple.
it will not work and crush when you make a call to another device we need a new skype for HDX from "AMAZON"

Base_Reviews: I used to love this app, but now its a failure, crashing and not connecting all the time, I have to blame Amazon. For making a closed software tablet. I can't use Google apps at all (hangouts), what few apps are made for kindle are lacking compared to their Android counterparts. This was the last straw, I wont be buying Kindle Fire tablets again. Open source is best for consumers.

Skype works flawless, seamless on other devices except. It's not internet speed because Skype works without sync issues on other devices. Updated latest kindle software (July 2,2014), uninstalled installed Skype, cleared data etc. Reset device, installed Skype. Same issue. Good job Amazon/Skype/MS fire screwing up this app.

It was ok before the update but now since the update Skype won't let me accept some calls or make calls and if they do accept my Skype stops would give  a higher rating if they fixed the crashes and stuff :/

Headings: Read the permission list before you download!!!
Base_Reviews: It is unbelievable that access to your device you are giving away when you download this app. This is every hackers and data collectors dream come true. Basically with this app whenever you have a Wi-Fi signal or connection with your service provider, you're giving this company and anyone able to exploit it access to all of your personal information and all of devices functions without you being aware.

Don't do it. Just....just don't. Save your time...back out of this and don't do it..don't even consider it...Amazon...fix your ish. :| it crashes the volume is ridiculous and once you delete it it won't let you reinstall (at least for me) skypes update ruined Skype.

Ever since the update, I have had to constantly redownload because notifications work about 5 times and then never work again unless I redownload the app. I deleted 4 GB of data to keep this app and Terraria from crashing (both update problems). Fix it please.
It crashes every for everything!! I can't make or receive calls. When I do I can't hear anything from the other person. Super pissed off.
Sucks. Every time I face time my friends for studying in the middle of technology conversation my screen freezes up and turns black... then it shuts down... is just awful.
There is always an issue with my Skype. I can't see the person, they can't see me. It always freezes. It always shuts down. When it does work, it's choppy. I like Skype but it's not for my Kindle.

It's a great app, if you're a fan of constant crashes that require a full restart of your Kindle before you can use it again.  And if you like five minutes intervals between crashes.  I've waited a few months for a fix and haven't seen one.  What gives???
It crashes every time I connect to my grandson. Disgusted. Don't download it.
Wow.The whole point of Skype is being able to video chat,and I can only do that for about thirty seconds before Skype crashes. -_- Uninstalling until it's fixed....DON'T WASTE SPACE DOWNLOADING.
It doesn't work properly. It opens but has no volume and then constantly crashes. I was forced to update and it was a waste of time, I'm deleting it!
Crashed, tried to uninstall and install again but same thing. It won't work any more

The update wad horrible!!!! It's glitchy, crashing and it give LESS not more features. You took away things in th  update not added!!!!!!! I hate the new look to! Why do I have to look at my friends stupid profile while texting!!!! If u don't update it again were it's like th  older  one I'm getting rid of it!

Headings: Not a working app.  Will not allow area code to be entered
Base_Reviews: I am really peeved that the Skype download for Kindle Fire HD 8.9 does not allow for you to add the area/local code, so that you can obtain a number for your device on the local network.  This renders video chatting with other friends on Skype useless, since they have no contact number with which to reach you.  I tried to delete it twice and reload the application, and even tried the android application.  Nothing I did corrected the problem.  If you don't put the area code in and just have the state, like Texas, it gives you a phone area code for San Antonio, which is 5 hours away.  Someone needs to seriously look at this and make a correction to the app., or give us a way to fix it.  Skype is one of the main video chatting apps that most people use.  Had I known it was useless I would have spent my money on the Ipad, but i figured all i needed was to video chat and didn't need to have a camera on the back for vidoes and pictures that the Ipad includes.  At least Ipad can use SKYPE!  I'd give this app a zero if it allowed....

Freaking lag all the time and it cut off my video calls and I can't seem to call them back. So i have to shut it down and reopen but just to find out that it freaking bug again. I thought you guys were supposed to be the official trustworthy brand or something. You guys let me down.
Very upsetting!!! Was running on my device just fine, then decided to update itself and failed... kept failing and when tried to redownload it failed time and time again...

Skype used to work beautifully but ever since an over all Kindle update it crashes like crazy, stops randomly or glitches out to the point I have to sign out. What happened to Skype it used to be a good thing....clearly someone f-'ed up badly.
Won't download or update on my kindle fire both kindle will only make calls  not receive them need to update 7.46 version for kindle. All my other devices updated working fine.
Crashes constantly. Sometimes I can have an hour call, sometimes it crashes every five minutes. The sound and picture are off by a decent margin half of the time. Extremely frustrating.

I tried to avoid getting the update, but login issues gave me no choice.  After setting everything up, I made my first call and the app crashed 10 seconds into it.  After that it crashed every time I tried to all, what a waste.

When messaging, it actually stops the app. When I'm receiving a video call by after a minute the video actually stops, as after 15 sec. , we cannot get to the app anymore, unless we restart this device. Please I need a bug fix here so I can still stick with this app. Thank you.
Ever since the update, the app constantly crashes. Calls don't work, camera fails, and freezes up the entire Kindle. App needs a lot of work. Don't waste your time downloading.

This is the worst application ever made! I give one star because I cannot give 0.It crashes, locks, hangs and does a lot ot bad other things.If I'm so lucky to be able to establish a video chat, it crashes after few minutes.All of this after that MS bought it....sigh!
It crashes. It won't stop ringing. Lack of audio options.

The app worked great until the new update. Now it completely crashes my Kindle Fire HD (purchased December 2013). It just stopped working and made me restart my device 4 times in less than an hour.  it is very, very frustrating. Please find a fix for this, Skype.
Over the summer I was gone and Skype is the only thing I could use it crashed I cried I missed my family don't get it updated

Headings: it was great, until.....(kindle fire HD user)
Base_Reviews: There were some things at first, that were annoying,and I learned to put up with. Then the update came out. and now I can't even open the app without a message saying "this app is incompatible with this device. AM I MISSING SOMETHING?! please unbreak Skype.Please.
The video lags several seconds behind the audio. It's not a network issue as I have fast internet speeds and have tried it on several other networks.  Very annoying and I wish they would fix it
I can't get the update to work and I've tried 29 times and it keeps crashing and won't let me get the update
Always crashes  hang up and every time it happen i need to restart my kindle for  the skype to work again. Way to go skype!!
It crashed and freezes within minutes of opening a web site.Is there an alternative? How do you fix this problem?
Worse app ever! Please fix asap! Crashes repeatedly, does not make calls. Would love to use this app but no luck. Skype my a$$
Couldn't figure it out. Not user intuitive.

Skype appears to be using every permission I've ever seen. The list of permissions is so long I can't begin to know whether or not there might be somethin sneaky. It's reputable enough, but the fact this crashes soo often and with so many bugs, it's simply not worth it.

Headings: Skype for Kindle DOES NOT WORK. Garbage
Base_Reviews: Zero Stars. Skype for Kindle Fire HD simply doesn't work. Connect for a few seconds and then it crashes. There has been no update for a year [Jan 2014~Dec 2014] so obviously neither Amazon, Skype or Microsoft care about Kindle users. If one of the reasons you carry a tablet it to keep in touch, then not having skype is a very real reason to throw your kindle in the bin  and upgrade to another android, or apple based tablet. SKYPE SUCKS.

This app really needs major improvement especially on Kindle gadgets. Always Hangs & crashes. I hope this issue will be resolved.

keeping getting black screen on my new fire phone and still waiting for solution from amazon support.

So disappointed with the upgrade. Skype crashes and disconnects every time I try to talk to someone. Needs to be fixed  or I'm switching  to a different app that is more reliable like it was before the update. Skype sucks now :(
Skype consistently lags out for me and crashes itself, this is rediculous, it should be usable on all kindles. Fix your shotty app.
Breaks up, drops calls, poor video quality, sound feedback delay , Pixelated screen, lagging , fails to connect on repeat, I don't know what happened, it used to be good.....

Keeps crashing. Needs to be fixed!!!!! Let's me make the call and then as soon as answered it crashes. Please fix!!!!

Headings: Some things to note about the latest Skype version
Base_Reviews: I have had a 32GB 8.9 HD kindle since it first came out in late 2012 & some earlier models. If you read through many of the reviews you should notice that most of the 5 star ones were written shortly after the release of the HD series in late 2012 & early 2013. On the other hand, the poor 1 & 2 star reviews were written since late 2013 & later.I would agree with this as it matches my own experience. The original Skype for the Kindle Fire HD series worked very well but an update issued sometime late last year changed all of this. There appears to be two main issues:1. SOUND VOLUME:Even if your volume is set all of the way up before launching Skype, conversations are barely audible. This may be because MS/Skype expect you to use ear buds which is a common way to use the app. If you in fact do this then you will find the audio level to be okay. HOWEVER, if you don't use ear buds then check the volume setting within Skype using the hardware volume switch and you will probably notice that the volume is way down around 25%. If you raise the volume to 100% using the hardware volume control then conversations can be heard okay just like the earlier version and it stays this way in subsequent sessions. They may have made the initial setting this way to prevent ear bud users from blowing out their ears.2. CRASHES:I don't know what to say about this except to confirm that I have had the same experience. Skype starts okay but invariably crashes (frozen screen, no sound, etc.) within 5 minutes and will then the Kindle will spontaneously reboot. This makes what is otherwise an excellent app next to useless.So, this problem has been around for over 6 months without being fixed. Amazon gets a failing grade from me on this issue as they should at least make the original version available for download from their app store for folks having this problem while they are sorting out the issues with the latest version.

I got this app for my daughters kindle so that she could message her dad, her cousin, and me. Some random person texted my child! And I could not access the messages from the TextMe website.I wish that only people her in contacts can contact her but not sure that's possible. I don't feel this app is safe for children.I also feel that the app isn't user friendly. There are some issues with functionality and ease in adding/naming/deleting contacts.UPDATED March 2017: while our account was still active, TextMe issued OUR phone number to another person (I'm assuming a child). My husband and I have iPhones. When our daughter first received her TextMe number we input them into our Contacts and texted her several times over the course of a few months.Well this morning my husband texted our daughter to get up and get dressed but someone else responded: "I don't know you! You're not my dad!" At first my husband thought our daughter was joking around. It led to a series of texts. Our daughter denied getting or sending any texts. She showed us her app, we tried texting her, and nothing showed up. Instead someone else replied.I apologized to the other person and told them to notify their parents about this. His or her last text to me was them telling me that they were SCARED and to stop texting them.They should be scared! This is BAD! I immediately deleted my daughter's profile (which was still active) and uninstalled the app. This is not safe.
You had to give it info I was not wishing to give and I felt it would be a security risk to run this app.

And an email sent to customer service got the auto-reply - "get back to you soon" a week ago but nothing since.If all FIRE apps are like this I will use it to read my Audible Books and little else.

Headings: The 6 month update, tldr = not free, more like "Bugmeware!!!"
Base_Reviews: All the things I said before are true. The app works, the price for the "No Add's" version is high, to high unless you are using a fire tablet as a primary texting device. The App gets more of a "PIA" the longer you use it. Dire warnings that unless you text or call someone in the next "X number of hours" you will lose your number ! If This was after 6 months of more I could see it... But the way This App works it's like blackmail to keep your phone number... It became such a pain that I removed the app. This is why I made This edit and dropped my rating from 3 stars to 1Star.  I think the "Free" label is false advertising, Free Trial would be closer. If these folks came up with a tiered cost system it could be a workable texting app. But with the $14+ a month price just to use the app without adds or use it or lose it threats, it's not worth it for my use. Why they don't see that  a $20 a year for 250 texts a month or something like that would give them a larger user base and how hard is it to count texts? Software! They have to have This for billing and management anyway.  Look elsewhere if you are just looking for an app to send a text to share a story you found reading the Washington Post with a friend.This App works. It gave me a way to send Text messages from my "Fire Tablet" I wanted to be able to share some news articles without having to use email. I have not used the phone call function. What I don't like is the amount of "Please upgrade!" Messages... I know they have to pay for the service they provide and make at least some profit from the effort. I normally do buy the "no adds" version of any app I use. But the price these guys want is more than what I really use is worth. If you needed the phone call function and if it worked as good as the text function... The the price could be worth it. The only reason I used this app was I didn't want to add Google's play store to my fire, if not for that I would have just used my Google Voice account.

Headings: Why do you keep changing my number????
Base_Reviews: I like the idea of it and the features , but they keep changing my phone number!

Had minimal trouble installing Textme(Kindle Fire Edition), received my NEW phone number, no problems, yet.  Purchased more credits, a little over $15.00 for 1000, text a couple of friends, no problems, yet.  All was going well until, 1)-I tried to enter a new contact.  No joy.  From there all started to go downhill.  2)-had a few missed dialed numbers on the screen tried to delete them according to the online help.  No joy.  3)-lastly, the app stopped, no response, whatever.  So, I deleted the app, and reinstalled.  Went to sign in ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ got a response that I entered the wrong info.  Tried again, same response.  I sent my email information to reset password, and waited.  No joy.  I waited about four hours. No joy.  I sent my email information to the rest password, again, three times.  Waited 3 days. I checked my email , according to the information on the screen. Nope.  4)-I tried to make a new account on the Kindle Fire HDX, got response  there is an account with that information. 5)-Okay, I logged on the internet site and got a response that I entered the wrong info. Therefore, I made a new account using the original email address and password.  Logged in to the internet site, bingo looks good.  Went to my Kindle Fire HDX, signed in to the site.  No Joy.This information is not to be negative, but to help others and me.  I am out the money, and I am going to delete the app.Regards

Headings: BE CAREFUL OF SIGNING UP FOR THE PREMIUM SERVICE
Base_Reviews: I bought a Kindle Fire 8 HD this year and began looking at ways to use it besides just Kindle. I had given up my VOIP landline phone service so decided to look for an app to use on the tablet as a replacement.  I chose this one.  I decided to go ahead and buy the premium service so I could keep the number and use this as a backup to replace the VOIP in case something failed with my cell phone.I tested it out and found that it worked ok but I needed to use headset to hear clearly.  This was about a month ago.  Today I needed to use it and when I opened the app on the tablet, it did not recognize my account and wanted to start me as a new user.  So I went online on my PC to their web site and it would not let me log in with the Username and Password I used to set up the account.  I also could not access support without logging in!?!I am having other troubles right now and am not in the mood to wrangle with software/app problems so I deleted the app from the tablet.  It turned out to be really squirrelly so keep this in mind.  It may work ok as a free app; I'm just not willing to deal with now.

I don't want to start a new acct because I don't want to llosr all my msgs -.- Someone please do something!!!!!!!!

Continuing on I entered the info it asked of me including my age which again I decided was for advertising purposes. I was sure I would be bombarded with ads since the app was "free".  I sent a text to my son's iPhone first since I was sure he was going to tell me all the reasons why I should've installed this app.  As soon as I sent the text more ads than I could have imagined flooded the page.  I had to search for the text response from my son which simply said "where did this number come from, what did you do"? Haha!  I decided all this 'free" wasn't worth it. I uninstalled the app right then.  I do want to text from my Kindle Fire so I'll keep looking for a compatable app where I can hopefully use my own phone number.

Headings: A not so mobile mobile app.
Base_Reviews: While the workflows for this app feel better than the PC version of the software, the app is severely limited by it's requirement for an internet connection.  I started using the app at work, which luckily has WiFi, however as my device has no cellular connectivity, I have been unable to use it during my recent travels, nor will I be able to use it to study during the 12+ hours it will take to fly Germany,With the Kindle Fire version of the App, the only apparent need for the internet connection is to sync your progress to the Rosetta Stone servers,  which is useful if you are going back and forth between your PC and mobile device while learning.  However, even this functionality does not work reliably; in my experience the App and PC only synced automatically every third or forth attempt.  While the PC has a force sync option this is not available on the mobile app so you are forced to restart the application through the device settings and hope that your PC synced properly at home.With these issues in mind and the fact that I like to use my Kindle while away from work or home, I wish the Rosetta Stone would have chosen a different method to generate a micro purchase income from their users; such as charging a one time fee to download the App, or charging for some of their more advanced online services.  The fact that I can't use the App as a a true mobile learning platform is endlessly irksome.I also wish that Rosetta stone had built in better orientation support for the app.  I have yet to figure out how the app is determining it's orientation for the session, but more often than not, the app will be incorrectly positioned in relation to how I wish to hold my device.  This is especially troublesome when attempting to use the app while charging the device.TL:DR - While the orientation problems with the app can be annoying, the biggest limiting factor is the requirement for an internet connection.  Which if you are using a device without cellular support effectively makes your mobile device about as portable as your home PC.

Headings: That's fine since I can only use one at a time
Base_Reviews: I have a problem with Rosetta Stone. I have Apple and Google devices. I can login to RS on one device at a time. That's fine since I can only use one at a time. BUT Rosetta Stone requires me to have a separate license for Google. I must pay them a second time for the Android device. It's not because different people might be using both devices at the same time, because both devices can't be logged in at the same time. When you can only use one device at a time you should not have to pay double to have a choice of which device to use. I'd rate RS at less than one star if it would let me. I'm not buying anymore languages until they change this feature.
