Headings: Do NOT buy, try something else
Base_Reviews: I bought the full Rosetta Stone and installed it onto my computer along with the apps on my devices so that I could continue practicing Chinese. I went through levels 1 and 2 each in one day. I figured that as the levels increased they would get harder. As I went through all 5 levels I realized that they did not introduce much for new vocabulary from one level to the next. The difficulty was also just as hard from level 1 all the way up to level 5. I had quickly completed all of the levels and after a couple weeks decided to contact Rosetta Stone to get my money back. I say that if you really want to learn a language stay away from this course. I've had a much more difficult time learning through other sources. Rosetta Stone is not challenging nor will it introduce you to much. I tried the Portuguese version as well and it was just like the Chinese, even with the words and sentences used.

The app itself works great. In a lot of ways, it is better than the desktop application. You can push through the lessons quickly on a tablet and the voice recognition on tablets seems to work really well. That's where the good traits end. I spent a lot of money on levels 1-5 (the French desktop application). 3 months of "online" access were included. That means in 3 months, I can't use this app anymore unless I pay even more money to access the features and course progress I have already paid for in the desktop version. If you're going to go with Rosetta Stone for learning another language, it's a great program. But don't count on being able to readily use this app. I believe you need another, separate subscription for any other languages you're learning (and have likely already paid for). The subscription is annual, so you will have to resubscribe every year if you plan on taking more than a year to learn the language or just want to brush up on your skills. Unless you're willing to pony up more dough for the subscription or just go with the online access itself and be willing to let that expire at some point, save yourself the trouble and get the desktop version. It's expensive, but it's also pretty good. Either that or, depending on the language, try something that is absolutely free like Duolingo first (also very good).

I love TED. I've been a fan for years. However, this app is abysmal.  I have never had problems streaming any videos on my network, but this particular app, on my Fire TV Stick CANNOT stream any videos, it's buffering very slowly. I wasn't able to watch even ONE talk with it.Not sure if it's Fire TV stick, or the app to blame, it's probably both.

While I love the content, the app which I downloaded to my Amazon FireStick today just doesn't work. I've seen other reviewers describing the same problem: When I select a talk to watch, it plays for 1 second and then an error says something like "this video has been paused due to a network error". Then I click ok, and click play, and the video starts. But the red circling hourglass indicator remains on screen as I watch and will not go away. Soon the error occurs again, and again I press play and again the hourglass stays on as I watch the program. My bandwidth is variable, but it isn't low. When I test it, I always find my test app sees 10 Mbps on the first run, 20 Mbps on the second, 24 Mbps on the run after that, and about 34 Mbps on a fourth test. So my impression is that my phone company (AT&T) always gives up to 10 Mbps a new stream, and then bumps it up if the demand continues. Also if I try streaming HD video on another devices or if I don't, it makes no difference in the TED app errors, and the video on the other devices works perfectly regardless of whether the TED app is running.  So I conclude the app isn't able to handle changes in throughput, even though all my other devices and apps (with one app exception) work fine. I suppose it's also possible that AT&T is using software to sabotage the app, but that seems extremely unlikely in my opinion. So fix this app!

I've watched several episodes to trying figure out the purpose of it and all I can conclude is that it consists of "famous" people wanting to hear themselves talk and try to be experts on things they know very little about. One's personal experience does not an expert make .  Don't bother responding to my opinion as I'm not interested in yours;  simply because you're not an expert on me and what I know . I'm just trying to spare people from wasting their time . If you really want to learn about something , don't listen to one person talk about it , do the research yourself . The Internet has a plethora of information so that you can be well-informed with varied views and be able to form your own opinion which is more important than all of the hot air hacks on this show.

I was hoping this would be a real app that would be compatible with my Kindle. 5 stars to Duolingo for the web based program.  1 star for misleading customers by calling this an app.

I studied German in college many years ago.  I selected the Duolingo German option.  I found it difficult to clearly hear each word that was spoken.  Too bad that native speakers cannot say a word slowly and distinctly, then say it as in normal conversation.  Also, just beginning, I found strange situations.  The word for "boy" in German is "Der Knabe"..as a second choice "Der Junge".  Duolingo offers only the word "Der Junge"...which generally means "the youth"...and the article "Der" makes it male.  Maybe a little knowledge is not a good thing.I also found it very difficult to go where I wanted to in the program.

Duolingo In my opinion is an okay app. Why? It teaches you an entire course free. But the problem is is that it only supports 6 languages for English speakers: Spanish, Italian,French, German, and Portuguese. The language I do want to learn (japanese) is not on here. You have been warned.

Headings: DUOLINGO (05/24/2018): "We no longer have the app on Kindle"
Base_Reviews: SKIP THIS KINDLE APP BUT DO GO ONLINE VIA WEB BROWSER TO USE DUOLINGO:This is a GREAT program for learning a wide variety of languages. My two children are using the program for additional practice outside their German language class they take in school and they can't get enough!  My daughter is also using it to help with preparing for her upcoming trip to Germany as part of the HS student exchange program. My son also wants to start learning Japanese (big anime fan) and my daughter will be begin learning Italian in preparation for her band trip in 2020.HOWEVER, we have to use the web version on our Kindle because Duolingo no longer has the app on Amazon Kindle - it is outdated and the app can no longer support the latest versions of their program. See my original support request and Duolingo's direct (and very prompt) response below.DUOLINGO CUSTOMER SUPPORT RESPONSE (05/24/18):"Hello, Thanks for reaching out! Unfortunately, we no longer have the app on Amazon Kindle. After many updates, the Kindle app has been outdated & can no longer support the latest versions of our app. But you can still access Duolingo via the web version (on the Kindle) or on the others app via Android & iOS devices. If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out! - Diza, Support | Duolingo"ORIGINAL SUPPORT REQUEST:"Unable to Create Account/Login to App (Kindle):  I cannot get into the app from the main start up screen. When I click "get started" & choose a language from the long list it goes to a blank white screen (which looks like an Internet screen) it has a circle w/a timer but then it goes back to the main start up screen. It does not allow me to start/create a new account. So I logged on to the Internet & created an account through the website. Then I came back into the app & tried to login using the account that I set up & it still won't let me in. After I put my username/email (tried both ways) & password in, it brings me back to the start up screen just like the getting started process does.
Too random to be useful.

Headings: Just use their website.... app is useless

I realize this is a free service and we will continue to use it on our PC, but I don't recommend the app or bothering with their "Customer  Support"

I"ve installed this app on my Galaxy S2 phone & my android tablet.  On both devices it crashes when I try to open a folder in my recipe box.  Left feedback  weeks ago with developers, and they said they are aware of problem.  Installed new update hoping for a fix, but problem still exists. On both of my devices it crashes as soon as you try and log into the recipe box.  It is a nothing more than a glorified Website shortcut! Headings: Good product but I expect more from the Food Network
Base_Reviews: First, let me say that this is a good product, not great. It marginally improves upon the foodnetwork.com experience on a tablet. It does the basics of allowing you to search for recipes on foodnetwork.com by show as well as save those recipes into a recipe box that are linked to the website. However, the recipe box does not allow you to create folders, only store in folders you create on the website so a little less functionality than the website.A nice (but incomplete) feature allows you to create shopping lists from recipes. However the app does not combine ingredients from multiple recipes so you have a short, concise list. It should also allow you to scale recipes based on the number of servings you would like to make.Likely the biggest complaint is that it has even less video than the website (i.e., no video at all from what I found...) Given that this application is published by the Food NETWORK you would think that they would have lots of video to include.  Also, when shows have multiple recipes that are pared together, there are no links from one recipe to another meaning you have to find it on your own.The app itself runs ok. It did crash once on my Galaxy Note 10. In short, I'd wait for them to put in a serious upgrade until paying the $1.99...

Uninstalled...(the last update took away features that you have to go pro now to use...ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ°ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¸ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ ).  I found another app that works much better...

I had to update my glowing review of this app because of the updates and changes they have made.  It is no longer user-friendly.  The ads, which were noticeable before, but small, are now annoying and often blocking area I want to read or edit. I absolutely love this app.  I have never had an app device before so I am new to this.  Because of frequent updates I lost my recipes numerous times.  They now have a subscription fee where you pay for a monthly or yearly subscription that expires, it is not cheap.  I would prefer to buy the app outright, that is not an option.I have since deleted this app from my device and found a different one.  I was SO, SO sad to let this one go.  It was my most used and favorite app on my Fire.Former review:  I cook differently than a lot of people focusing on healthy, fresh foods without the use of canned goods or processed foods.  These types of recipes are difficult to find in standard cookbooks and cooking sites.  But with Chef Tap I can read my favorite healthy cooking blog and instantly transport the recipe into Chef Tap, it is easy, painless and fast.  Editing is easy as there is an option to view the whole blog post and import any text that didn't make it into the recipe.You create your own tags and then you can add those tags to any recipe.  So I have my breakfast tag, beverage, salad, etc.  The recipes are searchable by its tag, but also by a title word.You can also add your own personal notes to any recipe which is a great way to make note of changes you made or even when it was prepared.I do have some wishes for the program:  I wish it did weekly menu planning including breakfasts.  I would also appreciate a generated shopping list.  And more than any other function I wish it could sync with a computer version and even a phone version.  I would LOVE this program on my browser.  Then I could STORE the recipes on my computer, but then access them from the Fire when I am in the kitchen.One of my biggest complaints is that the back-ups take a long time once you have several recipes in the program.  Additionally, the back-up runs automatically when you open the program so you can not access your recipes until it is finished backing up.  I would rather the back-up function operated in the background or even when the program isn't being used.  You can amend how you want the back-ups done and how frequently, which is helpful.My other complaint is that when you are making edits in your recipe you can't stay in an edit mode and have to click your options and start over for each step you edit.Overall it is the best recipe import program I have used including my experience with computer versions.

Headings: Down grading for changes to a paid subscription
Base_Reviews: You can see my original review below this update.: what was once 4-5 star app has become a 2 star due to the change over to VERY expensive paid subscription if you want to have more than 100 recipes stored. Eleven to twelve dollars a year is ridiculous, I understand they need to make some money to be able to continue to improve and support this app but the cost is prohibitive to what this app does and I refuse to pay them their current fee just to store and import recipes from the internet. And I do not buy their excuse that there is no way they can afford to keep this app running without such a high cost. They do not need servers to store all our recipes, those get stored on our devices and do not cost them a dime. Yes they want to be able to fix bugs and make improvements but please do not insult my intelligence by saying they cannot afford to do it without having everyone shell out for their price. I have far more sophisticated apps on my devices that were free. Yes many of them are supported by larger companies but this program does not require as much tinkering at say a spreadsheet or WORD document writing apps. I might consider an annual fee that actually was fair(at least a 50% cut on their current fee would be smart.) but until that time I won't be upgrading and will just go back to how I used to do it with Pintrest.To sum up; in my opinion while this is a very nice app but it is not worth the price tag they set to upgrade to the "pro" version.Original 4 star review:I love this app it works very smoothly 80% of the time...I downloaded all my saved Pintrest recipes with very little corrections needed and adding new stuff is a snap. Where it loses a star is downloading from personal blogs like Blogger etc..I had to pretty much retype most of each recipe myself. Now some of this is probably due to the nature of my blog which has a lot of non recipe storytelling stuff mixed into my entries. But what bothered me was the random stuff this app did not load at all. I would rather it loaded my entire blog letting me delete what I did not want than for it to pick and choose what it wanted to collect.

Rewrite to my last review I had gave it 5 stars but now it's 2. Before I installed this newer version I could hold as many recipes as I liked ,now I am limited to only 100 recipes. If  we want more space we have to upgrade to pro, which I think is ridicules. I had 200+ recipes saved before this new addition and now I have to pay to store them. I will be looking for a new program and I will warn all of my family and friends who I recommended this app to about the changes.----------------------Love it' great way to store recipes I find online and ones I create myself.I'm clumsy, my paper cookbooks and written recipes would always get destroyed either by ripping or being stained. With this app I have them at hand at all times and if my device malfunctions I have backups to restore my recipes.

The way the app functions is amazing but now upgrades are required if I want to add more recipes.  I don't want to put my recipes on your server.  I liked having what I want , where I want it and under my control.  I had that until this last change.

I already use My Cookbook because it imports/exports Mastercook files which I needed but it ALSO imports recipes from a number of websites. You can also easily copy and paste others. However I was very impressed with the description of how this app worked. What's not to like about basically a grab and go recipe app from what sounded like practically the entire web. So I downloaded, read through opening instructions and finally got to the home page.The app comes with 5 recipes and I am geared up to start my searching.  But wait, there on the left side it says that since you have 5 recipes you get 45 more until you need an account and to start with a free account. 45?? Seriously??? Worthless!Sure didn't see anything like that in the advertising description!  They say you get what you pay for, well in this case it may have been FAOTD but it wasn't even worth free. Unless you plan on paying whatever later don't even waste your time. Headings: Was great, but greed ruined all

Headings: Cost of this app is too high!
Base_Reviews: I love this app - it's so easy and convenient BUT I'm not going to pay $20.00 per year for it. I might pay a one time fee but that's way too much! I found Paprika Recipe Manager for the one time fee of$4.99. It's almost like Chef Tap. Most recipes can be directly downloaded into the app. The ones that don't can be highlighted and then directly loaded in. It has all the same features as Chef Tap, just arranged a little differently. I'm loving Paprika as well as I loved Chef Tap for a much better price!

Headings: wanted to like this product, not for $15.99/year subscription fee
Base_Reviews: The customer service is horrible.  At first I thought the customer service was horrible, because I was not a paying customer.  So I decided to pay for a year to test out the product.  My youngest son wants to be a chef when he grows up, so I really wanted a great recipe tool.  So I paid my money, and reported the software bugs to the developer.  The programmer's bug fix completed trashed my database.  Images on my tablet were deleted, and all changes that I did to recipes on my tablet were erased.  I import recipes and then modify all of them to suit my family's needs.  Anyway, the programmer's response when I told him my database was trashed was to give me my money back (which I did not ask for), and to downgrade my account from a pro version (which I legitimately paid for) to a basic version (again, which I did not ask for).  Yes, once my database was trashed, I knew that I would never renew the subscription to this product.  But now I have to do it before I hit 100 recipes instead of having a year to find the right product.This product have too many bugs that can serious damage your database of recipes.  It is not worth the price, especially when the programmer wants you have to have a 20+ year relationship with his product.  Over 10 years, that is $156.  Over 20 years, it is over $300 for a simple database to store recipes.  After you reach 100 recipes in the database, you have to pay a yearly subscription fee of $15.99/year.  That is $156.00 over 10 years and over $300 over 20 years.The only software that I re-buy each year is tax software.  Everything else I pay for with a one-time fee, and I will upgrade when I believe that I need to upgrade.  If I need to synch my database on a cloud, I will do it on my own cloud.  I don't need or want to pay a yearly fee for each type of data I may want to back up on a cloud.I believe that programmers should get paid for software they develop, which is why when there is a paid version and a free version of a product for a tablet, I usually buy the paid version.  Plus, I don't want my kids exposed to ads.  But subscription software?  The product has to be a the best of the best, no stone unturned, you can't live without, level of product.  This product does not fill those requirements.

very handy! it works well on my kindle fire 8.9 hd. i have it on my htc evo too. absolutely love it! BIG CHANGE! As of 4/13/2013 it has quit functioning on my Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It mentions that I must update it, but it won't update when I attempt to do so.

Headings: Get this if you enjoy being frustrated and miserable
Base_Reviews: If you're looking to seamlessly mirror content from other devices to your TV to follow along exercise/dance videos, learn a new skill, or enjoy general entertainment on the big screen...this product isn't for you.However, if you would like to be constantly dissatisfied or disappointed, you've come to the right place! Enjoy the frequent buffering and frame skipping of an inferior product that will never be mentioned in the same breath of a ChromeCast, Apple TV, or Firestick. But who values reliability and quality anyways? Being constant is dull. AirBeam TV keeps things FRESH by spontaneously throwing in wrenches into your streamed content. This app will take your favorite videos and movies, and mindlessly chop-and-screw it until it devolves into a hot/disheveled mess that once resembled your original content. But hey, everyone loves a good remix. Remixes are awesome and always better than the original!And if you enjoy horrible customer service, you can always count on AirBeam TV to not be there for you. If you had questions or comments about the product, but are repulsed by the thought of talking to a human being, AirBeam TV will gladly send you through an infinite loop of automated responses while deferring all blame to the user. It's not enough that I've restarted my computer and modem, closed all other extensions/applications, and checked the internet connection of my TV...I probably need to give up my left kidney and bladder too for my video content to be streamed without a hitch.AirBeam TV's connectivity strength and resolution may be inconsistent, but your disappointment with the product will remain constant over time!

Headings: Does not work as a means of mirroring an iOS device to a FireStick
Base_Reviews: March 3, 2020I was looking for an app that would allow me to display photos/home videos etc. from my iPhone & iPad to a non-smartTV via my Amazon FireStick.  This app supposedly does that using the Apple AirPlay protocol built in to the newest Apple mobile devices.  I downloaded the AirScreen app onto the FireStick from the Amazon website and installed it on the FireStick according to the instructions.  According to the pre-loaded tutorial video bundled with the app, I should then have been able to go to any iOS mobile device with AirPlay enabled and from the ControlCenter, scan for other Airplay compatible device connected to the same WiFi network (which the FireStick was) and select that device and begin mirroring.  Unfortunately the app was unable to detect either my iPhone or my iPad although both had AirPlay enabled and both were connected to the same WiFi network.I then called Amazon Tech Support and spent about an hour on the line with them while they logged in to remotely view my FireStick screen and operate it remotely.  The were unable to solve the issue so the called Apple Support, making it a 3-Way conference call.  The Apple support rep remotely logged on to my iPad and operated it remotely.  Again, no one was able to make the iPad connect with the FireStick.  Since I had already tried and had the same problem with an AirPLay enabled iPhone also, it seemed unlikely to me and to the Apple rep that both iOS devices were malfunctioning but rather that it was either the FireStick and/or the app itself that was the problem.  The Apple rep came to the same conclusion, so she departed from the conference call.The Amazon rep remained on the line and we did some further checks to determine if there were any other problems with the FireStick itself, which there were not.  Every other non-AirScreen related function of the FireStick appeared to be working normally so we all concluded that there must be a problem with the app itself.I had downloaded the free/demo version of the app, which claims to function fully without upgrading to the paid version, but with advertising pop-ups.  I was not going to pay to upgrade until i saw the app work as advertised, which had it done so, I would then have paid to upgrade to the ad-free version.  Accordingly I do not know if the upgraded version would have worked properly or not.In short, this app does not do what it claims to do and therefore should be considered useless for the purpose of mirroring an iOS device to a FireTV device.

Recommendation: Use AirReceiver insteadPicture is acceptable, but delayed by several seconds. Keeps warning me that my network is slow. Disconnects after 15 minutes or so to show an ad, requiring a reconnect from the projecting computer and occasionally restarting the app. Ad display is unreliable, in which case it asks you to purchase *a subscription* and waits for 15 seconds.The ad tries to guilt you into a purchase by claiming expensive server requirements. But Miracast is a Wi-Fi Direct connection, and AirPlay and Google Cast go straight to the display... so the servers are either collecting your data or serving ads. Either way it's a ridiculous cost.  (Possibly they're saving the "recordings"? I don't want that.)We used AirReceiver and Chrome Cast's "desktop" source. It worked with much less delay, smoother video, no ads, no "slow network" warning, and stayed connected for hours with no issues. AirReceiver was satisfying; AirScreen experience was user-hostile and distressing.Uninstalling ASAP.
It is easy to maneuver but the lag is so bad that I just gave up. Not worth the time.

Headings: Will not let me view live sports with my Spectrum Account logged in
Base_Reviews: I stream using the Amazon Fire Stick, though I have cable through Spectrum.  Spectrum offers a fully functional streaming app that provides its whole listing of live channels, but it is unavailable on Amazon.  Thus, I use the different sports apps--ESPN, Fox Sports, NBC, CBS Sports--to stream games.  Recently, however, the CBS Sports app will not let me stream live games.  It lets me log in with my Spectrum account, but then tells me that my area is not supported.  I do not know what changed, but it is extremely frustrating because I love watching SEC and NFL football on CBS.  If there is a solution to my problem, I would love to hear it.

After first use CBS required a code be entered to log on.  The code they sent ( twenty times) was a seven (7) digit code.  The app would only accept a five (5) digit code.  Attempting to reach them for clarification got me to a chat box where you leave a message for an IMMEDIATE response!! The IMMEDIATE response took two (2) days.  This caused me to miss two important events.  I am NO fan of CBSSPORTS.

The CBS presentation has always screamed boring, but the monetization of CBS apps have made these apps nearly unbearable. You have to log in to your provider each time you exit the app and load it back up, which is far too tedious, and even still you may get the "Sorry, your TV provider is not yet supported in your location" message. It's a true waste of time far too often, and I only have to try when my NFC NFL team has to play on the network. You may find yourself relegated to using a tablet and starring at a nine inch screen for three hours on the Yahoo Sports App if you're relying on this one.

Headings: Didn't  play live video when I first got the app but it does now! A CBS update may have fixed this original problem
Base_Reviews: Update: 9-10-2017Well the latest app update removed the ability to watch a live NFL game on my digital projector. Dear CBS, you are going the wrong way. I pay for full cable TV and yet I can't stream a live game of my home team. My rating has gone from a 1 star to a 4 star and now back to a 1 star.Like many of these streaming apps they are tending to get worse rather than better in what they offer and in performance.Update:When I first got this app I tried for over a month to watch multiple sporting events and I could not stream any live sporting events. My primary interest was to watch the NFL games on CBS. Today I was in the basement working and I turned on the digital projector and the CBS Sports app and the NFL AFC playoff game was on line between the Patriots and the Pittsburg Steelers. It was streaming perfectly in HD quality with no issues. I have raised my rating from 1 star to 4 stars.I hope CBS keeps streaming live sports like this. This will make this app much more useful with my Amazon Fire TV stick. Many of the people that gave this app a poor rating should try to see if it is working now.  Thanks CBS for fixing this issue.----------------Original review:I have full cable service and I use multiple apps to play TV channel programs live on a wide screen projector in our entertainment room. Many of the apps for TV channels allow me to sign in and prove that I am a customer of a TV provider, like ATT U-verse, and it automatically lets my watch live video on the projector wirelessly. I use a Fire TV Stick to do this. This app will not let you watch live TV at all. For my purposes of watching an NFL game I find this app useless for my application.I find it amazing that so many other national channels allow you to stream live video for free once you register that you are paying for cable TV, but not CBS!  It shows a lot of bits and pieces of talk shows about sports that I don't  care about. This app for me is a 1 star and I would rate it lower if I could. CBS needs to catch up with its competitors and show live TV. ESPN, TNT, FOX, NBC, Disney, and ABC do it properly and there are other stations that also stream live TV. CBS needs to wake up and realize that this is 2016 and a digital world and not 1950!-------------So far the app is still working reasonably well.

Headings: What's the point of a CBS Sports app that doesn't ...

This is two different apps depending on the device, so pay attention to the app description above to see if you'll be one of the 5 star or the 1 star folks. On phones and tablets it is a full featured app with live streaming and things like bracket challenges. On the Fire TV devices it's a horribly useless app where you can only stream seemingly random clips from different shows, but no live streaming. This makes one of the most useful use cases (streaming the live game that is being preempted by a game running late) for TV devices a no-go. It's not like this is a premium paid channel, so blocking from streaming while freely broadcasting makes literally no sense.

This is the sleaziest garbage sports network I have ever seen. A waste of money on every level, and a major disappointment from CBS.

Headings: It has stereo audio only, like it's 1975 or something.
Base_Reviews: I got this for both my AppleTV4K and my Amazon Fire Stick 4K to see the Super Bowl in higher rez (1080p/60) with less compression than the overly compressed 720p garbage Spectrum Cable spews out. For whatever reason, it didn't work worth a damn on the Fire (unless you consider sub-VHS quality and constant freezing to be OK), and on the AppleTV4K, where it looked fantastic, it went less than 15 minutes before it crashed. I suspect the servers had far more traffic than Fox and whomever they hired to do the streaming expected.However, the MAJOR disappointment was that the audio on both hardware platforms was 2 channel stereo. Despite the highly compressed video performance, at least Spectrum had decent 5.1 surround audio. I wound up just watching on Spectrum Cable.I would not have even written this review except that I noticed the stereo audio a few days before the big show, and contacted Fox Sports tech support to ask why, and they couldn't make up their minds while I was on the phone whether to just be condescending, or condescending AND rude. As a television engineer (now retired) for 45 years who knows exactly what he's talking about, it was like dealing with the DMV without the warmth you get from the DMV.Seriously, Fox Sports, hire some competent support people and then train them to be less snarky, especially when someone calls to ask why the outfit handling the Super Bowl stream is only capable of two channel stereo. And get whomever is writing your apps to understand that two channel stereo is what you get from the local PBS side channels, not a major event where I KNOW (because I talked to the guys in the truck doing the feed) that they were being handed 5.1 audio from the site.

Headings: Fox Sports Stop is a more appropriate name.
Base_Reviews: Wouldn't start before the game had to reset my fire stick to get it working. Then in the last quarter with a houseful of guests the feed stops and I look like a total jerk. I'd change the name to Fox Sports Stop.

Headings: Not very so great without a cable subsciption
Base_Reviews: You have to have a cable or TV subscription to get anything out of this. So whats the point of the app. I cut the cord so I wouldn't have to have a subscription and get channels that I don't want to support. This app is useless IMO.

Occasionally will not load-gets stuck on "warming up" screen- and requires an uninstall/reinstall when this happens.  Biggest issue is the low volume.  All other streaming apps on this device have no volume issues but this app is very low..until a commercial comes on.  Commercials are way louder than any game I've watched on this app.

I love the xbox Fox Sports Go app. It's quick, reliable, and has no issues. Compared to the xbox live app, the amazon version of their app is garbage.1. Jerky video on a brand new 4k fire stick is unacceptable.2. Scrolling is in TEN SECOND increments. Unlike the xbox where you can scroll at 128x, the amazon app forces you to click the fast forward button repeatedly for like minutes and minutes and minutes. So if you want to see the fourth quarter only, your thumbs are going to be sore.3. Crashing video. Often the playback gets all jerky but when the audio starts to go out of sync, moments later you get a gray screen, it crashes, and takes you back to the main menu.Fox Sports Go needs to get their heads out of their butts.

Same "no internet connection issue" as noted by others.  Please fix this!Is Amazon and Fox completely ignorant and stupid to ignore so many users!This app simply does not work on Firetv 4k and I am assuming all the other fire platforms.  This is crap, fix already!  Amazon are you listening?  Fox are you listening?  About ready to give up on all of it.  So frustrating.

Recent derogatory  remarks made by the announcers after a military flyby just shows another reason I no longer support NFL, NBA, MLB.  You can have FOX SPORTS back.

Headings: Unless you plan to watch live, don't bother
Base_Reviews: This is the worst app I've ever purchased. It's terrible on every platform. I've tried SlingTV, Spectrum, and Fire Stick. Live tv is ok, but it glitches quite often and kicks you back to its home screen. The absolute worst part is the replay feature, though, which I'd imagine is the reason most people purchase it in the first place. You can only fast forward 10 seconds at a time. That means that If you only want to see the third period, the 4th quarter, or the last three innings, you have to click that button around 700 times to get there. 700 times!!!! Once you get to where you want to start, pray the app doesn't decide to just shut down and kick you back to the fire stick home screen (which it does ALL THE TIME). Because, guess what? It doesn't remember where you stopped! Looks like you've got 700 more clicks in your future. C'mon, Fox. This is the 21st Century and this app is a POS.

The app crashed three times !!!!! Why ??? Who knows! Finally found Verizon and selected it. The app then wanted my Apple ID - why? No idea - I put it in - it said it was incorrect. Tried three more times - all failed. Gave up. Removed the app. Repeated the whole process including the app crashing another two times and asking me for my Apple ID again. Finally got over that hurdle. Then had to put in my Verizon log in details. App crashed again - or rather this time it just 'hung' - for 20 minutes!!!!!!!. Removed the app again and tried again. After it hung again, I gave up. What trash!

Headings: This app made me hate using my FireTV Stick!
Base_Reviews: Massively frustrating! The screenshot in the Amazon App Store should be a gif of turquoise circle spinning! This app consistently freezes after 30-60 seconds with every game I watch. After it freezes, I'll hit the back button, select the game I want to watch again, it will play for 30 seconds and BAM - spinning turquoise circle! Sometimes, if you wait for a minute or two, it will eventually start playing again for another 30 seconds, and then freezes again.In my experience, this is the WORST streaming app from any cable channel or broadcast network. I have such a negative attitude towards this app that it's bled over to my feelings about my FireTV Stick. Since the NBA season started this year, I've been using my FireTV Stick less and less and using my Roku more. Now, I almost never use my FireTV Stick. The only time try to use it when I try to watch the Mavericks play.  I noticed that I was using the Roku almost exclusively a while back, but I couldn't really figure out why. Outside of FSGO, I was using mostly the same apps on both devices. But the more I thought about it, the more I came to realize that it's because this app is making me associate a bad experience with using my FireTv.

Headings: Watching replays of games is almost impossible. Fast forwarding on Fire TV - ridiculous.
Base_Reviews: The app works fine for me while watching "live games". I just tried to watch a replay of an NCAA football game and the video started to just freeze up completely, even though the app seemed to be working fine. I made it through 2 1/2 quarters and then it knocked me out of the game to the main page. I restarted it and it took forever to fast forward back to where I was in the broadcast (10 or 15 second bursts to mover forward or back). Can't hold a button or make it go 2x, 4x, 8x speed to catch up. What a joke!!! Finally made it back there, but the video would freeze over and over through quarter 3 and I finally gave up with 10 minutes left in the 4th quarter. Thankfully, my team was winning handily and I didn't need to really watch the end.

So I tried the 7-Day free trial.  I realized I couldn't use the service (wasn't worth it for the price), so I tried to cancel it on day 2.  I think there was an issue with my browser, but the cancellation didn't go through for some reason.  Anyway, I was charged $39.99.  I noticed the day after the charge, contacted customer service and asked if I could get a refund explaining the situation (and the fact I was strapped for cash this month).  They told me no, which I can understand due to the agreement, but it is still frustrating considering I will not be using the service at all in the time I'm paying and I haven't used it since the second day of the trial.  I had this situation once before with Hulu, and they quickly refunded me and I subscribed again once I could afford the payments (yay Hulu!).  They earned a customer for life by doing that.  I think Fubo could learn from that example, honestly.Recommendation: Sling TV offers a better bang for your buck (that's the service I decided to go with since it's less expensive and offers the channels I want).  I had considered going back to Fubo in October, but now it's for sure no.

Headings: Frequent channel buffering and pixelated video
Base_Reviews: I was pretty excited when I first tried Fubo TV.  They have a wide selection of channels including the local sports channels I no longer have with my limited cable lineup.  Unfortunately, during my free trial period I experienced a lot of problems with the video being pixelated.  I thought it was just one channel, so I switched to the Weather Channel.  It worked well for a while, but then began to do the same thing.  This issue occurred while at my vacation house.  When I got home I installed the app on my Amazon TV.  There were no pixelation issues but no matter what channel I watch, at some point the video freezes and buffers.  This some times only occurs for a few seconds and other times I have to close and re-open the app.  It's too bad this channel doesn't appear ready for Prime Time.  I was looking forward to consolidating my video on Fubo and getting rid of Hulu and Sling.  Looks like at the end of the month I'll be getting rid of Fubo.

Terrible app and service.  The only one I have ever experienced that was worse was SlingTV.  Both buffer constantly, freeze, and require reboots often.  I ordered this to watch NBC Sports Network so I was seeing all the 2018 Winter Olympics.  Don't count on watching your favorite competition without lots of interruptions.  I literally couldn't watch a single Luge run (all under one minute runs) without it buffering at least once if not more often.That's truly pathetic.  We have a stable and speedy connection and have no issues with amazon prime, netflix, youtube, and a myriad of other streaming types of content.If you're looking for a streaming service app, this one is a real drag.  Don't subscribe to these folks...  Run, don't walk away...

Headings: Random commercials on certain channels are a feature, not a bug
Base_Reviews: We switched to fuboTV from another streaming service because the other service dropped a key channel for us. The service works well enough, though for a live sports-focused streaming service, the lack of anything ESPN and the lack of alternate/back channel functionality on the remote are curious choices, but something we've adapted to.What really bothers me about fuboTV is their ad delivery. fuboTV has figured out a way to insert ad breaks into live events like soccer, which are generally broadcast without commercial interruption. My issue is that they are using this technology on channels that run pre-recorded programming that already includes commercial breaks. For example, when my kids are watching a show Cartoon Network or Nick/Nick Jr., in the middle of a show segment an block of one or two ads for products not targeted to children (Geico, Red Lobster, etc.) will pop up. The show returns when the ads are complete, but since the technology doesn't pause the underlying program, part of it is lost. Keep in mind that this is in addition to the pre-set commercial breaks in the programs where they will sometime insert local or regional spots over the national spots. I've contacted fuboTV about this issue on a couple of occasions, and while they seem responsive and it does stop for a while, eventually it starts up again. At this point I'm convinced that this is by design.Fix these things and I'll stick with fuboTV. Otherwise, I'm waiting for YouTube TV to be available on FireTV so I can switch.

Headings: Terrible interface. UI created for 1980 cable TV
Base_Reviews: I have been testing the various streaming services and the fubotv has the channels I want for the BPL, HOWEVER, and its a big HOWEVER, the interface is utterly horrible on the amazon fire tv. I dont get it ! The slingTV is great, DirecTV is great, Hulu Live is OK. If you are listening Fubo, you need to look at how others setup their UI. Yours is so poor, I will probably not continue past the trial. There is no realtime guide onscreen during a broadcast, you hit the back button you go to a guide at the first listed channel, so you have to scroll down again and again. It buffers but no more than Direct TV and Hulu (Sling did not). I would love to use fubo but the interface was written by someone who obviously does not use it.I would rather pay more for a UI that you can navigate than this. It looks like a third grader wrote the Fire TV interface. You can not change channels without going back. When you go back it defaults to the first channel in the list. It is beyond annoying. Improve the UI and I would happily pay for this.

Headings: it's good deal. But their Amazon Fire support s*cks big ...
Base_Reviews: The service is cheap, when it works, it's good deal. But their Amazon Fire support s*cks big time, the forward/backward buttons are of no use, the signal constantly skips some minutes forward, or the sound is gets out of sync with the video... Also, sometimes the programming has some last minute change, and their system simply cancels (And keeps the announcement in in the DVR list, even if i want to erase the notice), instead of figuring out what the change was and adapt the request... Come on, is not that difficult, there are several services already out there that can do all that. Even the Pirates can do it better!GET SOME DECENT ENGINEERS! The service has a lot of potential (You already have some good agreements with some great channels), and for the price, I'll keep supporting you since I know it'd be a matter of time until you get your service stable.... But boy oh boy, right now you s*ck.

Headings: One of the worst functioning Fire Tv Stick apps
Base_Reviews: I'm doing a free 7 day trial of FuboTV on the Amazon Fire Stick I've had for about a year now. I've tried a lot of streaming apps but this one just won't stream without difficulties.  My WiFi router is a few feet away and Fast.com says I get about 35-40Mbps, and everything else I watch works fine, but I can't get Fubo to go more than a few minutes. When I Was watching Dr. Who live Saturday night it woudln't go more than a minute w/o freezing, stuttering, dropping to SD, having the sound go but the picture freeze. My wife thought maybe it was just b/c Dr. Who was live streaming, so tonight we tried DC Legends of Tomorrow from a few weeks ago. It worked much better than Dr. Who, but about halfway through the screen went black but the sound kept going. Then everything stopped. Then it jumped back a bit. Just awful. I'd blame it on the WiFi or Fire Stick but really over a year of so many other services I've never had any problems like this.One thing which did work for awhile was hitting the Options button and changing the resolution to 480p from Auto in the drop down box. It didn't look very good but at least it played after that.I'll be stopping Fubo after the free trial and going back to watching The CW shows for free on The CW app. It has commercials, but it works like it should.If you want live streaming but don't need The CW channel PS Vue seems to be the best service out there right now. Not cheap, but the best experience. Philo is cheap, but the app is lacking. It does work though, unlike FuboTV.

Headings: All the Sports - Time Blocks May End Your Viewing
Base_Reviews: Absolutely every sport you can imagine is on Fubo. No exceptions. Even the most obscure sports were available. Ultimately, we discontinued use of FuboTV for one reason. Each game or event has a specific amount of time. Until the program starts, you can't select it. When the time ends, REGARDLESS of whether your sporting event is finished, the stream stops. Period. No saved recording, no continued watching, it's just done.We switched to YouTubeTV and found we had none of the same issues. Sport options are severely diminished, but if you're looking for something that will stream all major football games, YouTubeTV is the way to go.If you're into Soccer/Cycling/F1 Racing/etc, Fubo is way better for you, but may result in missing the last parts of a game.

We have used this service for the last 5 months.  The attraction was getting Redzone, that being said the quality of the broadcasts are poor at best.  We have a 1g Wifi plus the smart tv is connected via Ethernet.  The ability to navigate the home screen with Samsung remote is not intuitive at all. Headings: This is absolutely the worst product out on the market today
Base_Reviews: I bought this service and cant log into my account using my firestick. I have searched all throughout the internet. I have changed my password 3 times hoping that would help. I deleted the app on my firestick and re-downloaded the application onto my firestick and it still doesnt work. I can log on using my browser. Not my amazon firestick. This is absolutely the worst product out on the market today. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT it is not seamless, not intuitive and after you spend your hard earned money you will NOT be able to use your amazon firestick to log into the product you legally purchased. For the love of god do not buy this product. It is a huge waste of money, fubo should be working tirelessly, it is the world cup and they would get a massive following if they offered a great product, but they can not offer this product they want to laugh as my brasilian family weeps.

1.  Pricing is deceptive.  Advertised at $54.99 but you are forced to take 2 add-ons at signup that increases price to $59.99.  2.  Large portion of the channels air classic TV.  Can get these for free with other apps.  3.  Experienced technical issues.  One time the audio began repeating. Tried changing channel,  closing app, turning off fire stick, unplug fire stick from tv, etc.  Audio continued.  Was like a horror movie.  Finally unplugged fire stick from outlet.  That worked.  Another time both TVs suddenly displayed a message that we had reached maximum devices.  Plan allowed 3.  Only 2 even had the app.  Same day,  little Later, streaming stopped during a live broadcast.  Was 10 minutes before I could get program back on.  Horrible 5 day experience.

Buffering issues!! this is the real deal breaker!!!and way to many unused channels that are being counted as "total channels" plus not all content is not HD,If I wanted standard definition I'd get basic cable. Interface is horrible, useless guide if you cannot select channel's from it.I've tried just about all online streaming services, playstation vue,sling,hulu and now fubotv. Buffering with fubotv is nowhere near as bad as hulu but it's a close second, also they advertise 70+ channel's however a lot of these are not being used, it's more like 40-50 channel's.

Headings: Flasely Advertised the Eagles vs Cowboys Game
Base_Reviews: It was advertised on Google search engine that the Eagles vs Cowboys game could be viewed on FuboTV. After signing up for the free trial, logged into the website and could not find the games broadcast on a search on the FuboTV website. I immediately cancelled the free trial subscription and after cancelling, I still continue to get emails about their services and links to reactivate the service. I have emailed them to confirm my cancellation (no response) and requested that no further contacted is needed because I do not deal with any company that advertises one thing and does not provide the actual solicited service. If the game that I was looking to view was blacked out or not available, it should have been indicated in the advertisement. I signed up and provided my credit card for services that were not provided. FuboTV completely wasted my time and after I cancelled the service, I am still receiving emails stating: Your trial is still activeIf you're no longer interested in watching fuboTV and you'd like to end your trial early, visit 'My Account Page' and click 'Cancel Subscription' and follow the steps to cancel. To visit 'My Account Page', click here.I have already cancelled FuboTV and not interested in hearing from FuboTV since I missed watching the game I wanted to watch already.

Headings: terrible user interface, unreliable streaming, slow to connect, lower res "HD"
Base_Reviews: Boy do I regret believing the reviews on Fubo.  Yes, they have some sports coverage that's hard to get elsewhere.  But it's not worth it.Firstly the user interface is really really bad.  Who designed this thing?  It's clunky, allows very little customization, gives limited information about shows, makes it difficult to change channels, etc. etc.Then you find that it takes some time after you switch to a new channel to get a non-blurry picture.  What?  Are you running this out of your basement, Fubo?And every so often there's an outage.  Unexplained and usually unreported, but there you go, you can't get that stream now.  Has happened to me more than once, and usually right when there was a "I don't want to miss this" event.  I've stopped keeping track.Finally, all the so-called HD streams are really at 720p, not 1080p.  There's one "experimental" 4K channel, rarely has anything on it.Yeah, I've already cancelled my service, just waiting for the current sub to drain.  (Yes, drain is the right term.)  I'm considering Hulu -- it has most of the channels I want, and works well with Fire boxes. I'll miss the occasional La Liga and Ligue 1 and Serie A matches I was able to catch, but I can't justify Fubo for access to the few games I have time to watch.

Headings: Bait and Switch on the Free Trial
Base_Reviews: I signed up for a 7 day free trial of Fubo.tv to test it out using my AmazonFireTV service. I wanted to review the channel lineup and the UI to see if it was a good cable TV alternative. When I signed up it asks for a credit card but says that only $1.00 will be charged. I signed up and moved on with the testing. Three days later I canceled the service and decided to go with another provider, but I had already been billed in full for the month.I contacted support and they told me that I already had an account. I had completely forgotten that 2+ years ago I did a free trial as well and didn't like it. If they had told me I didn't qualify when I signed up I wouldn't have signed up for the free trial. It said it would charge only $1.00 and then proceeded to charge me $45. Don't fall for this bait and switch.The UI is terrible anyway so I would advise others not to sign up. It's very difficult to use and the only good thing they offer is BeinSports.

Headings: Junk doesn't work and bilks you after you cancel
Base_Reviews: This has to be the crappiest app I have ever downloaded for streaming. It froze up every 20 seconds, did not have the BS how's to watch on channels you you pay for, reduced quality picture . Just a horrible experience. This App makes Amazon look bad. I'm still ticked off I paid for a month of service and received about 30 minutes of crashing d streaming. Amazon needs ton dump this app off their firestick

Headings: Don't bother if you have Amazon Fire TV
Base_Reviews: Amazon Fire TV implementation is terrible. No entry for "Settings" at the top. The navigation between features is much less useful than any other alternative internet TV offering that I've seen. Like when you press the menu button on Playstation Vue, you see the current show, the next couple of shows, and can switch to the Guide if you want. On Fubo, you press the menu button and you can change the video resolution, worthless. They really need to work on navigation for users with Fire TV. About the only thing that you get for live TV are select, the arrow buttons, and return. I assume the Roku is much better, not going to pay $100 to find out, though. The only plus is that the local stations seem to work well. Not the stuttering that I see on Playstation Vue local channel, or all the myriad of problems with the local stations on Hulu with Live TV. But the navigation with Fire TV is so bad, I can't use it.What I'd really like to do is rearrange the guide to put all the sports channels together at the bottom of the guide, instead of having some at the top, and another group at the bottom. Really wacky the way that the channels are arranged. Some are alphabetical like you'd like (the non-sports ones), and the sports channels are just disorganized.But in the end it doesn't matter. Unless I can find another way to use this app without the Fire TV, ain't going to happen.

Headings: Everything was working fine for a few minutes then the app crashed
Base_Reviews: I downloaded this app to watch the Peru vs Colombian soccer match on October 10. Everything was working fine for a few minutes then the app crashed. For the WHOLE game!. I had people over my house very upset at the situation!. I contacted the support team and they said that there were too many people streaming the game and the application crashed. This is not a good excuse! FIFA qualifier games and FIFA matches overall have a huge volume of viewers specially if the game is not being shown on a regular TV network and the application developers need to be prepared to satisfy that need special if people are paying for a membership!.......Now I don't know if can rely on this app and invite people to my watch because I don't know if it'll work.

They had a phone number you could call but it kept rolling over and making me choose an option every five minutes. Needless to say, I chose this app to see a football game, and I started one hour early to do so,  and I never got to see any of the game. Headings: FuboTV repeatedly charged my credit card - User Beware
Base_Reviews: Do NOT use FuboTV! I signed up for their free trial access and canceled the same day because they hardly any of my MLS games. The next month, out of the blue, they started randomly charging my credit card (which you had to give them for the free trail.) There was one charge for $384 from FuboTV!! I emailed their support immediately. They replied that they see the charges but needed my expiration date on my CC repeatedly to confirm. I wasn't going to give them any more CC info, so I went to my CC company to dispute the charges and they blocked FuboTV from any further activity. I can surmise that either they got hacked and didn't want to own it, or they are involved in illicit behavior. Either way, their "support" was not willing to do anything about it, even though they saw the problem. User Beware!

Headings: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch ...
Base_Reviews: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch an important soccer game for World Cup qualifiers. It crashed down and could not see even any channel at all. It kept saying that I didn't have network and yet my other apps like Sling or Amazon were fine. I understand that this happen to many people too. First Bad impressions are difficult to forget.

Headings: There's a Sneaky Catch to This Service.
Base_Reviews: I think FuboTv is a very good service that provides great channels, including MSG so I can watch my Devils lose mercilessly every other day, BUT!!!!! Beware, there's a sneaky stipulation to their service.  You are unable to stream FuboTV on 2 devices at the same time if you are on 2 different wifi networks.  Example: my sister has a house and I have a house.  The home network is my house, therefore if she wants to watch fubo on a roku/firestick/ smart tv app/ apple tv / xbox at her house while im watching it at my house it is not allowed. This rule only applies to TV Devices.  So in that case she or I would need to stop using the firestick to watch fubo and start watching on our phones or laptops.  Extremely inconvenient for people using the same account in 2 different homes.  I spoke to fubo about it and they said there's nothing they can do and it's part of their contract.They need to make it so that we can pay maybe like $5 extra per month to add a TV Device outside of the home network cuz this is going to make me cancel their service.

Headings: So glad there was a free trial
Base_Reviews: The interface was confusing to me as a first time user which was a huge turnoff. There just simply wasn't enough value for me to pay $45 every month. I have live TV through a different service at $20/month and since it includes ESPN, I get the majority of sporting events that I like. I would not recommend this service.

This is an extremely expensive streaming service. BTW, they don't carry ABC as a local. Plenty of Euro football though. 59.99 a month is ridiculous. Streaming services are slowly creeping up to cable prices. Stop them. Don't buy this content. There are other services, like Sling, which is much more affordable. Doing doesn't carry local stations but a decent antenna will solve that problem for you.

Headings: Problems with receiving channels & out of market games
Base_Reviews: I tried FUBO tv. I first problem was I could not get out of market NFL games. The second problem I could not get ESPN. I contacted their technical support spent 55 minutes on phone, he could not fix the problem. He said the he would elevate the support call. Did not here back from support. Cancelled service. The problem was that when I went  into ESPN, I would just have spinning circle and then get rebooted out the FUBO, then would screwup Fire TV.When I uninstalled the APP, rebooted, everything went back to normal and has been working great!

Headings: If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want towatch, then this is a good
Base_Reviews: Not reliable application. Live streaming LAGS during main sports event (Real Madrid vs Barcelona),  DVR records wrong events (requested to record Mexico vs Jamaica, recorded a boxing fight), becomes unresponsive even if application is deleted and reinstalled. When you ask for technical assistance, you are ALWAYS told to delete and reinstall app and to check with your internet provider, contact your device vendor (i.e. Amazon, Chromecast, Roku, AppleTv, AndroidTV, etc).  Most viewing issues or wrong DVR recordings are FUBOTV issues. If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want to watch, then this is a good app.

If you are looking to watch your home team sports you may want to look else where. My wife is from New England and is, like most of New Englanders, a fan of all their sports teams. I was excited that we had found a streaming app that gave us channels that made her feel at home. She even started to tear up when she saw a Shaw's commercial. Then our world crashed when I checked for the game time on the guide and discovered that all of the New England channels were removed. We were using her hometown zip as our home zip which the website promises that you can watch the regional channels of your home zip even if you aren't physically in that region. This is a lie. I called the support number and the person I talked to contradicted what the website said and keep explaining in circles. When I asked for a supervisor the rep kept trying to talk to me. After I kept repeating I wanted to talk to a supervisor the rep put me on hold and came back approximately 40 seconds later to tell me that a supervisor wasn't available. How convenient!

Yet another service that throws software together overnight and puts it out to the general public to see who bites. They do not have a customer service department. You can not call them. There is a robot that will respond to emails days later that makes you thinks someone is responding. The user interface is poorly designed and they Do Not care to make it better. Just here to collect money. It is really sad that there is not one streaming service out there that is good today, Not one! It's all about collecting that money!

Headings: Buggy app lowers value of subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is functional and may be worth it for you if you have limited options to watch the programming they offer.  The app however could use a lot of improvement to make the service more appealing.  My experience has been the app  freezes from time to time when using the DVR function requiring a forced stop to reset the app. Functionality in DVR and in the program guide is weak.  Streaming slows from time to time causing lower resolution.

Headings: App is good, FuboTV's service is not.
Base_Reviews: Terrible.  I signed up for the free trial to watch the USMNT play in the World Cup Qualifiers.  Feed goes down about 5 min before the match starts and is down until after half time.  Heard plenty of other complaints about how the services tends to crash during big matches.  Their support person running the twitter account seemed overwhelmed and kept suggesting temporary fix that wasn't working either.  They finally sorted out the issues and I did watch the 2nd half of the match on Fubo and it was fine.  Ended up canceling my free trial, so I won't be using this app any more.  As for the App itself, well designed, was fairly easy to navigate and find things.  It ran well until their service crashed.

We got this on the one week free trial to watch the Monday Night Football game. It took the better part of an hour to get it installed and working, only to get an error that said it didn't work on our Apple Fire device even though it was downloaded specifically for that device. We finally had to back out of Apple and go through Roku to get it to work. They are also extremely overpriced for what you get. For the money they charge for their basic service you could get several other channels or regular cable and still have money left over.

Headings: FUBO tv look elsewhere for live TV
Base_Reviews: It may let you watch NFL just not Monday night football, my local channels were very laggy and you could not watch for more then about 15 seconds or so without a skip in the picture or audio. The over all picture i think was ok and it was very easy to navigate. It was convienant to watch missed shows, and the recorded playbacks were good with none of the above issues. But i already have a free option for that. Im looking for a "cut the wire" live and local channel option

Headings: I'm ditching FuboTv and going to Hulu January 2020
Base_Reviews: Both of my subscriptions were just pre-paid for January but I'm getting rid of Fubo on January 24. The product was ok but had issues with subscriptions from day one. I held on for five months now but am sick and tired of when they update their software that I have to go through and reactivate most of the channels that are included. My current configuration is Firestick TV 4K with Fubo and Sling Orange for ESPN. I should have dropped both of these in September and stuck with Hulu only. I have had multiple FuboTv issues with my subscription especially Showtime and wasn't able to receive or activate multiple channels for weeks. FuboTv SOFTWARE IS BROKEN and desperately needs to be fix.

Headings: Fine if you don't have cable
Base_Reviews: A long way to go before I cut my cable.  Very clutsy interface and not user friendly.  Had lots of pixilation and drop in picture quality.  Support is poor.  NO ABC so my wife hated it.  Some of the games I wanted to watch were not available but I could stream them on my iPad.  Cloud service is basic and problematic -- can't fast forward while recording in session, cant programs until they are scheduled.Thought I hated my cable until this!

Does not work 95% of the time. If you would like to watch this on your firetv stick, understand that under peak load this app will not even start. When this app does work (games no one is interested in) expect lag, poor image quality, and tearing. Autogoooool. Stop wasting our time FuBaRTV.

so i signed up for fubo tv, thinking their offerings for streaming would be a great deal. would be if it actually streamed anything. i got slow to no streaming altogether and then if or when the picture actually held, the quality was blurred and unclear. the selection of shows to watch seemed great. but of no use to me if they don't actually stream. hope others have better luck than i did.

Headings: not the Answer unless you like missing 4th quarters, 3rd period, 9 innings or 2nd halves
Base_Reviews: I MEAN 7TH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES AND IT GOES TO OTHER PROGRAMMING IN THE 7TH INNING. HOW CAN YOU DO THAT AND EXPECT TO CALL YOURSELVES A SPORTS APP FOR FANS? This is a great app if you don't mind the games shutting off in the 4th quarter, 8th inning or 3rd period. On multiple occasions this app just shuts down because it ran out of time and in the most important part of games. And the price of $54 per month, you might as well get cable and you will be looking for other options if you are a sports fan after missing the 4th quarter, 2nd half, 3rd period or 9 inning one too many times.

This is the slowest and most difficult app of the roughly 50 downloaded on my Amazon Fire stick. It also did not offer all of the NFL games I was hoping to watch. I cancelled this option after my trial period because I could not believe how few shows it offered. I kept thinking there was something I had missed. It turned out the only thing I was missing was the shows I wanted to watch.

Horrible streaming.  Feed kept losing sound, then freezing, then going to a white screen before sending you back to the fubo home screen.  You have to reset the channel every 5-7 mins.I have fast and reliable internet service and no issues with the fire stick.Customer service only offered a partial refund $20/60.00 USD monthly advanced fee  (which could take up to 2 weeks to come back to me) and to close the account.  They said it could take up to 24 hours for a supervisor to call me back.  Unacceptable.Not worth the money.

Pros of Fubo:1. 4K Channels / On-Demand Content2. Amazing Stream Quality3. Good variety of Sports Channels4. Easy to useCons of Fubo:1. No Disney Channels in any packages (Deal-breaker for my family)2.  Limited screens that can be watch content at a time3. Customer service is lacking4. Local channels are lacking

Headings: FUBO sucks!  I was not able to watch even one show.
Base_Reviews: FUBO sucks!!!  I was not even allowed a free trial.  FUBO demanded that I give out one of my Credit Card numbers over the Internet or over the telephone to a total stranger.  I refused.  I was then denied access to watching any show on FUBO.  The "Free 7 Day Trial" is a total sham.  I even called Amazon's Customer Service to have them help me to subscribe to FUBO without the necessity of giving FUBO my Credit Card number.  Even with Amazon Prime's Customer Service representative's phone call to FUBO, they were insistent on getting my Credit Card.  I do NOT trust them.  What they could have done is to have given me a Free 7 day trial and after that week they could have billed me on my Amazon Prime bill.  FUBO has lost me as a customer forever!!!  Again,  I DO NOT TRUST FUBO!!!

Headings: Avoid this, wait until work out the bugs. Terrible performance.
Base_Reviews: Awful feed, choppy and freezes constantly. Sling doesn't do this on the same internet connection, Direct TV doesn't do this either. Also, the DVR just doesn't work. I couldn't watch a single match.

(only worked on my computer?). I went back & forth w/ the customer service reps for over two days but nothing worked. I will note that the customer service reps. were courteous & seemed to go out of there way to try to help but nothing worked. I do have a friend w/ a Rokku stick & it works fine for him. Was easy to cancel but I will keep watch of my bank account just in case.

Headings: Very disappointed, falsely advertised getting my local channels
Base_Reviews: I was very disappointed. I tried several times to get questions answered from their customer service before trying it, and the answered some question but not the ones I asked. After signing up, none of my local channels were available. Lots of sports channels, but none that had the Super Bowl or any NFL for that matter. Also no NHL. Overpriced for what you get in my opinion.  I'll still with Sling Orange.

Headings: Would be nice, if it did anything.
Base_Reviews: Nothing worked. None of the links. The connection would time out trying to connect, in WiFi and without. When it finally loaded and I clicked on any of the channels, they said the link was broken. Definitely not worth $30 a month.

Headings: Cancelled trial subscription after a few hours
Base_Reviews: Although the price and offering sounded good at first, there were several show stoppers. There is no ABC service currently. I missed that when reviewing available channels. The web interface for fubo.tv would cause my browser to freeze. The additional charge for DVR services seemed excessive. I cancelled the trial subscription before I had a chance to give that a try.

Headings: Did not like the user interface
Base_Reviews: Very annoying to watch part of a movie and then to come back later and not have that movie resume at the point you stopped.  Happened more than one and the forward feature was "unavailable".  Not my cup of tea.

Headings: Good line up but otherwise very very poor. Only useful for live games
Base_Reviews: The options for streaming sports are limited, but fubo is not the answer. Although they have a good selection of options, the service overall is extremely poor.The apps are atrocious. The majority of the apps available, including for roku, the worst of them, are very poorly functional. On roku you can only watch live - no access to your DVR, prior games, or even to fast forward or go back. Plain simple live is the ONLY option.If you use chromecast or other way to use the app on a phone or tablet, it is slightly better, but as you cast to tv, the fast forward and all other commands no longer function, unless you stop casting.Then comes the worst part of it - say you recorded a game, or want to watch a game that happened a few hours ago. First, you need phone or app - again, no roku functionality (they have been on beta for over one year). Second, good luck watching it all. The app saves what they think is an average time for the game, and if it is a bit longer, you miss the end. On football and baseball, you reliably lose the end of the game more often than not as they record only 3 hours!!!!Bottomline, barely useful, and only for live games.

The only problem that I have is how I got ripped off by these Futbotv thugs. I have complained 5 more times to NO REPLY from customer NO SERVICE. As you can notice I am VERY PISSED OFF!!!  i ASKED FOR A REFUND AND NO REPLY!!!! Don't be suckers like me, stay away from these amateur channel people. Not worth their weight in chicken feces!!!

Headings: Doesn't really work, not ready for prime time
Base_Reviews: I was very excited about cutting the cord and still being able to watch EPL and Champions League soccer games as well as being able to record games to watch later.  Also much cheaper than cable.  I downloaded the app and tried to watch a few games.  No luck.  It asked me to wait, and I gave up after 5 minutes.  Tried with a college football game, no luck.  I tried MSNBC, which I could watch, but the video quality was slow and glitchy.  Cancelled 2 hours after I downloaded it.  My HBO and Netflix apps worked great, so it was a FUBO problem, not one of my internet.Maybe it's okay if you don't care about reliability or the quality of your channels.

Headings: PLEASE if you think you canceled read this
Base_Reviews: I won't post my entire experience however there is a detailed review on both trustpilot and the BBB.  The most important thing from my experience to be careful about:1,  Don't let them put you in a loop towards the end of your trial .  I canceled after 1 hour and still was put into that loop where you will get replies to emails where the goal may be to run out the clock on the 7 days.2.  VERY IMPORTANT - They will tell you that you have to cancel through the app, and that was easy enough to do. but thank god I didn't hit yes , i confirm I want to cancel, and look away from the screen as it went back to their home page.  A statement that really blended in with everything else and was only on for a second or two said that my cancellation was not successful.  This is where I knew it was a scam.  It should have given me an error when I hit that confirm button and not let me cancel or I should have gotten and email generated by the system stating that my cancellation was not successful and to please contact customer service.  Of course neither thing happened.  I can only imagine how many people have hit that button and looked away, went to a different tab quickly, or just didn't notice the hard to notice or because it was so fast thought it said that their cancellation was, instead was not, successful.If you are reading this before signing up with these people, unlike me, Don't!  Run and don't look back.And if you know you canceled through the app within the 7 days and still got billed, you are not crazy rather you were scammed.If you do cancel through customer service ask for a confirmation email and if you don't have one within 15 minutes call back.  I received my almost immediately.Hope this helps someone either get the money they were scammed back or prevents someone getting taken in the first place.

Headings: Pointless - The content is available elsewhere. Sometimes for free.
Base_Reviews: It seems Fubo has missed the point of the  cord-cutting "targeted streaming content service" trend. Or, at least, they want you to think it's cord cutting. Unlike NFL, NBA and MLB apps that offer the user the ability to focus on just the content they are after (baseball, hockey, US football), Fubo delivers packages of fairly low bandwidth sports streams that force you to channel surf in order to find the content you're looking for. (Let's face it, there are hundreds, if not thousands of football matches going on around the world all year long),The truth is, when you're forced to buy bundled packages that resemble what you are already paying for with traditional "cable tv", you've just exchanged one cord for another. For most people, internet and standard cabe tv use the same physical wire to the house. Using Fubo to stream the same channels means you are actually using a SLOWER (lower bandwidth & quality) stream to watch the same channels in lower quality. PLUS you are paying for the additional data/bandwidth usage that goes against your monthly allotment...- And before Fubo says "but you can watch on computer or mobile device"; most cable providers already offer mobile apps or web access to live channels. Most major networks already offer mobile/web access to streaming content if you can prove you have a traditional cable tv contract. (NBC/ABC/FOX/SKY etc..) - So (MAYBE) Fubo has missed the point on cord cutting and targeted streaming, (MAYBE) Fubo knows but wants people to think it's a cable/cord killer service, or (MAYBE) Fubo is an initiative sponsored by a major cable company to rope former customers into a service that, at it's core, is exactly what people are trying to get away from or already paying for.NOTE to Fubo: The point of targeted steaming apps is to allow customers to pay for ONLY the channels they use. HBO, Showtime, Cinemax, Mhz, MLB,, Netflix, Amazon Prime all do this very well.. So if Fubo REALLY want to impress customers, they will figure out a way to corral all of the network relationships they've made into apps or options within their app that allow customers to purchase focused content like EPL, Europa League, Bundesliga League, specific team matches or cup competitions without the need to channel surf and slog through irrelevant content to find the content they're seeking. Otherwise, there's really no point. The content is available elsewhere. Sometimes for free.
