I can see myself really changing how I think about eating. HOWEVER The app has been terrible. It crashes all the time. I was told to update, so I did. It got even worse. It's literally crashing my phone. I rated low because I can't even use it consistently because of the app failure.

Pros: Really helps you to rethink how you view food. As well as finding those issues that sand bag your diet attempts. The group coach and chat are great for extra motivation and additional insights. Cons: They cut your calories much further than my doctor recommended. Their calorie count on a number of items is very off. They don't give you the ability to add personalized items. Finally, and this maybe my phone, the scanner doesn't always work. Overall I'd definitely recommend it.

I lost 50 pounds and have keeps it off for two years! The psychology was life-changing! It took more than the 5 mins a day advertised. That was just enough to get me hooked, but to actually do the work and lose the weight took more time, but sooooo worth it! There are a few minor tech issues, but overall really great app. There's a way to enter home recipes that is time consuming on the front end, but great once it's all in there. I have a BUNCH of personal faves stored. Anyway, I love NOOM!

So far, my experience has been positive. The app itself is easy to use. It includes meal tracking, daily lessons, and a dietitian who all use CBT-based guidance to improve your relationship with food and your body. I have only lost a few pounds, but my choices in food have become healthier the more I challenge my thought distortions which keep me reaching for junk food more often than the good stuff. If you have thought you needed therapy to fix your food issues, this is a good place to start.

Overall, I'm losing weight and feeling better, so the app works if the entire program is followed. I definitely am shifting how I view food and although I HATED calorie counting, it is making me think about all the foods. The coaches are also help The app is missing a few things: a way to look up calories before logging, percentage of green/yellow/red on the chart, showing pounds lost vs only the trend line, BMI, and a place to record measurements. But I haven't found an app that does all this.
Update: 6/28/22 (a little later): app issues have been resolved in the latest update! Back to losing weight instead of my mind! Ã°Å¸â

A year later as 2020 was a difficult time for us all so a refresher was the right choice for me. Noom's updated program with a new format is more streamlined. They cite their sources less frequently than the previous ( or maybe first timers run thru ?) This makes it less cluttered. But still includes motivational & psych tips that one tailors to their own life. It really is an individual plan because it's all in your head and your hands to make change. And the support is always great!

This is my 4th week using Noom. The articles have been informative and engaging. I was pleasantly surprised when the personal coach popped up and shortly after, a support group made of people who had started the program around the same time as I had. It is really nice to have a place to check in, let out thoughts and get feedback from people who are going thru the same issues. The graphics help visual peeps. My approach to weight loss is evolving, and that is awesome!

So far I find it very helpful. Even without a group I find being able to log my foods and keep an eye on the food categories extremely helpful at changing my lifestyle for the healthier. I like how the program focuses on whole life changes like getting more sleep, reducing stress, mindfulness and swapping better choices in for unhealthy ones. Nothing is "off-limits" but it focuses on small changes over time.

*Edit. After the issues i had signing up i got an automatic email from Noom. I clicked the link and it connected oitside the app and most of my answers had been retained. Since that point the app has worked very well. You might want to sign up on a computer and use the app after that. "If the app can't handle a micro-second of interruption, or at least retain the answers I've already given, I'm not going to pay $179 with any confidence that I'll be able to access it when I need it."

I am very much enjoying the Noom experience. I love how lessons and introductions to the apps tools are broken down into bite-sized pieces. They also have the most inclusive and extensive food list I've ever used, as well as the ability to add your own items in. Love the colours and the graphics. I appreciate the ability to read and have it read to me. All the trackers in one place. Oh, and did I mention live coaches to ask questions and support? Wishing I signed up sooner. Excellent app

I believe I will keep the lost weight off, as there is so much flexibility in losing weight. My preference is generally skipping breakfast (intermittent fasting) because I prefer saving for more substantial meals later, but equally it does accommodate those who prefer small meals with healthy snacks in between. And I can still have curry, cheese and peanuts, 3 of my weaknesses! I'm not finding the changes difficult and I'm not going hungry. The latter has sometimes been a theme on other diets

This app works great; it, helps you to make the lifestyle changes required for permanent weight loss, teaches you the science of nutrition, teaches you how to make good food choices, and teaches you how to manage your weight before it bounces back and becomes out of control. The coaching feature is a big help and I highly recommend it.

It's such a great app that doesn't only help you lose weight it also helps you understand what foods to eat . It gives you little quizzes to see how & if you understand everything. I've never dieted before. Never would I, but this is different it doesn't make you feel like that Ã°Å¸ËÅ  I'm losing weight slowly & feeling much better in myself already & its only a month Ã°Å¸Ë

One way ticket to a healthy lifestyle! The information given is different and fun; and most importantly keeps me interested and excited for the next day. And, yes! I have seen results already during my first week. No app issues, works great. Thanks Noom!

I like how the calorie count is calculated for each individual, and creates a losing zone that allows for more calories than most standard diets, so I'm not afraid of slowing my metabolism. I get quick help through the message support chat within the app. I'm surprised at how much the 5-8 minute readings help me just when I need them.

Excellent program if you are looking for a plan that is long term. You have to commit to logging meals, daily weigh ins and reading daily lessons No food is off limits. Noom emphasizes enjoying food in moderation, eating balanced meals and steering away from good food/bad food concept. The program syncs with my fit bit. I use android and have not had any technical issues. I see Apple users commenting on the group chats that they experience technical difficulties with logging meals. I recommend.

Nothing worked for me...until I discovered Noom. I'm not dieting. I'm eating mindfully and counting calories. I still mostly eat yellow and orange foods but within the boundaries set. And I'm losing weight...slowly, but constantly. I am convinced that I will reach my goal. I'm still in the trial period, and while Noom is really expensive, I consider buying it. Sometimes it is a bit annoying to log smaller amounts of food, since there are no units eg. 100ml. You have to log 1/2 cup.

This app is easy to use. The instructions are very clear. I like ALL of it, especially that you can delete a food item that you choose but later decide differently. You delete anytime BEFORE ending the day. I like the thoughtful lessons you get. The one to three minute lengths are enough to keep you listening. If you're a reader you can read instead. This feature is great also. A+++ NOOM!!
Already lost 20 pounds I live the calory budget feature

I am very much enjoying the Noom experience. I love how lessons and introductions to the apps tools are broken down into bite-sized pieces. They also have the most inclusive and extensive food list I've ever used, as well as the ability to add your own items in. Love the colours and the graphics. I appreciate the ability to read and have it read to me. All the trackers in one place. Oh, and did I mention live coaches to ask questions and support? Wishing I signed up sooner. Excellent app
The app is easy to navigate, being able to scan labels makes logging meals easier, and the coaches check in and offer support and requested resources every couple of days!

Just started, one month, learning so much about how thoughts affect eating, slowly breaking really bad eating habits, keeping track keeps me on track, so far, so good, I believe this will work for the 'long' haul .. try it .. to be continued ..Ã°Å¸Ëâ¹

One way ticket to a healthy lifestyle! The information given is different and fun; and most importantly keeps me interested and excited for the next day. And, yes! I have seen results already during my first week. No app issues, works great. Thanks Noom!

"Some of the programs and features are free"....some? No, more like 99.9% of it requires a subscription. The only free thing that i was allowed to use was the 2 sleepscapes that had crickets, one of rainfall, and one of space, which doesnt have any audio so its not even considered a "soundscape". I wanted to try out the app to see if i liked it, but i dont like doing the "Free 7 day trial *charges apply after trial ends*" stuff because if i forget to cancel, theres no refunds.

A strong app, but I don't see any disclose that this app costs money to use it. I'm on a mission to stop misleading advertising and sales pitches. This is not click bait, rather bait and switch. Disclosure of fee's should be listed prior to downloading. To the person who got caught up in like-term renewals aka automatic billing. Google has an feature that lists what you bought, bought on a subscription and when that subscription ends. You can cancel anytime, but no refund.

I love the sleep stories. But the app itself has gotten progressively worse over the two years I have been using it. It is slow and clunky and the user interface has gotten cluttered and cumbersome. I repeatedly report my unhappiness with the "improvements" but nothing changes. I ask for the ability to customize - nope. The latest update has pretty much rendered it unusable on my tablet. It tries to open and just shuts right back down. This is definitely not calming. Edit: Still not fixed

The app is worthless because you can't make custom playlists. There's stories, music, nature sounds, etc... And I discovered a book narrator I really like, but I can't just play her stuff until I fall asleep. It's absolutely stupid to not have this feature. It should have been there since day one, but the devs don't know or don't care how to make a functional app. You can't fall asleep if you're clicking the next thing to play every thirty minutes like an even dumber version of Lost.

Not worth it. Drains battery at an alarming rate and needs to be forced closed every time. Somehow the icon even jitters around when you try to hold down and uninstall it, have to uninstall through play store. You have access to very few choices and sounds with the free version anyway. Paid version is $60 for one year. It's too bad because the app looks great and the tracks i could listen to sounded good, but it's just broken in such a way that it effects phone functionality in general. Note 8.

In theory it's a great app, but unfortunately it's attempt at health moderation is completely stifled by expensive subscriptions, processing errors and a faulty user interface. Although the application does incorporate unique features like "soundscapes" or "meditation" guides --as well as others-- none of these features allow you to even try them unless of course for the minimum subscription price of $69.99! That's right, 70 bucks for some stuff you can do for free anyway. 0 stars if I could :).

Misleading!!! "Calm is free to download and use. There are never any ads and some of the programs and features are free forever. Some content is only available through an optional paid subscription" This is a lie! I downloaded and everything is locked. There is not a free item to use at all! If your items are only free to use during a trial period then just say so up front. Honestly is appreciated by people. This should have said try it free for 7 days then continue with a subscription.

The first few times I used it, the app drained my phone completely before I could even relax. I'm sure I cancelled the subscription/free trial. Then this year I was charged the recurring charge of nearly $70, with NO reminder email to see if I wanted to continue or that it was even happening. So now I'm completely the opposite of Calm. I was able to cancel the sub. but I could not find out how to get a refund. The site is so confusing. Not recommended.

I was immediately charged the yearly fee of $59. I was under the assumption that I wouldn't be charged unless I surpassed the 7 day free trial period. This is a rip off. I only downloaded the app 5 days ago and went to cancel the "free trial" I thought and then saw that my "subscription" will renew August 12, 2020. Checked my bank account and sure enough I was already charged the yearly fee. The app is useful but there are cheaper apps out there that have similar features. Not worth the money.

Really loved this app, until you decided to take everything away and turn it premium only. I understand you have to make money. Thats why I didn't begrudge little ads on my screen, or that some of the features (maybe half of the songs) were a premium only feature. But to go and change the conditions under which I downloaded the app, to lock all but 2 songs when previously there was a decent amount for free, is lame. It was an instant uninstall for me.

False advertising. Beware. Claims most features are free but I could not find a single thing that didn't require a payment. Literally every single thing had a lock icon on it. And the "green sound" mentioned in the TV commercial I saw this app on was nowhere to be found. Basically everything in it requires a subscription and it's not easy to find specific things in it. Garbage. Uninstalled immediately.

Terrible app for many reasons. It will pause by itself a minute into an 8 hour sound session all the time. It won't save all your favorites. The diversity in the soundscapes is not good, you get a couple nature sounds and that's about it. Also I tried to send them a refund request and the app wouldn't let me. For 70 bucks for a year subscription I'd expect so much more.

Doesn't seem to have any guided meditation. Also, for a relaxation app, the interface is very hectic and overwhelming, and starts playing some loud forest sounds by default without any quick/easy way to turn it off. And after a free 7 day trial (when not all features are available to try), you have to pay $70 for an annual fee! How is this app so highly rated?!

Was very disappointed to see an annual subscription (and rather pricey too) as the only way to access the large majority of features. Found three 37 minute videos as the only items available without the subscription. After seeing various videos available from professional speakers- I can understand those creating a need for a subscription. I just wanted sounds to focus on and to relax to. I'm not going to pay over $40 to access that.

It keeps crashing. Even when I uninstalled and reinstalled it. It crashed. I turned off my phone and turned it on and it still crashes. I have to force close the app because it freezes my entire phone. When it worked I like It. They have majority of everything pay to play. But I suppose since there is no ads they have to pay for it some how.

I'm sure it's a nice app, but as many have said, it has virtually no free content. Why mark it as "some in app purchases" when really it's all or nothing? I kind of thought it was going to give me the option to purchase individual sleep stories. I could only find one free meditation after lots of browsing and I found the voice grating and the content stressful. Also, the app throws you directly into an unintuitive menu with no guidance, which isn't helpful when I came here for anxiety reduction.

I don't understand. The description says that much of the app is free, but I can't find any of the free features. I was really looking forward to trying out some of the free content, because I'd planned to subscribe if I liked it, but this bait and switch has made a terrible first impression. My galaxy phone automatically loaded 4 "stories" from Calm into my native clock app - I'm guessing these are the only free items in the entire app? Disappointed.

Now, after after just downloading this app, in order to access (unlock) most of the features, I learn that after a 7-day free trial, I have to shell out $70 ($69.99) for a year subscription. Wow!.... it used to be $60. That is quite a lot of money to pay yearly for an app. I am disappointed. But just the thought of paying $70 causes stress... to both me and my wallet. Will be uninstalling. Sorry.

App worked great at first. Haven't been able to login for several months. I have unstalled the app several times hoping it will work once I install it again. No luck. I have requested a login reset email. I never receive the emails. I can get emails about events but not the reset login ones (the ones that I need). It really sucks because I have a year subscription for nothing.

Very frustrating that I set the timer and the feature I'm using will just quit. I'll push play and the same thing will happen again. Very disappointing when trying to ensure a good and solid night's rest. Additionally, should you cancel after the free trial, they will not refund any of your money. They tell you to enjoy the app until your current subscription ends. YouTube has white noise (& others) recorded for ten hours straight and it's free.

Used to love it, until they started piracy. You used to be able (a couple years ago at least) to access some cool soundscape features, some guided meditation, etc, as part of the app. Now almost everything is paid only. I get needing to make money, but maybe if they weren't paying a fortune to hire celebrity voice actors, they could give a product that's reasonably priced. My ears are not that precious, they do not need an A List actor reading me a bedtime story. I miss the old app.

Absurdly overpriced. Plenty of free resources exist that do similar things and this provides no added value apart from a couple things read by famous people. What they advertise as "bedtime stories for grownups" are actually just bedtime stories for children packaged slightly differently, which is not what I was looking for. Several of the narrators have a style that many people must life, but I find really annoying (I don't find a really slow, exaggerated "sleepy time voice" to be calming). Biggest issue is that they do everything they can to trick you into a paid subscription. I tried to cancel in the app, which you can't do for no apparent reason...tried to cancel through the Play store, but this was not working on my phone... since the free trial window is so short, I ended up wasting $60 on a thing I never wanted in the first place.

Updating my review after another year of usage. Content is 5 stars, technical features are 0 stars. Given the high price, I can't recommend this app. Content often freezes, the audio glitches. It randomly stops your current session midway to give you the "great job" messaging from the end of your last session. There's no playlist abilities and it's all EXTREMELY difficult to navigate. They need to take some best practices from podcast and audiobook devs and fix the user experience big time.

The only thing free is one breathing exercise. You have to sign up for a 7 day free trial to use the other features. Ã°Å¸âÅ½ "Calm is free to download and use. There are never any ads and some of the programs and features are free forever. Some content is only available through an optional paid subscription"

This disgustingly priced ($70) app with limited features spams your screen with various things that you can technically get through without creating an account or paying a thing, but it's such a ridiculous circus of jumping through hoops just to try the free version. You're better off finding a more decent app or website. I tried this because my elderly mother wanted to try it, but this is not recommended for the elderly because of the aforementioned issues, though it would be good otherwise.

New update that makes Night/Day sounds to reflect Light/Dark Mode on phone. I do not like this! I take naps during the day and I enjoy listening to the Blue Gold day version. I can not use light mode on my phone to switch back and forth because the light mode makes my phone extremely white and bright and hurts my eyes. I suggest a feature to switch as we please, especially for those of us who pay for all access to the app.
Sucks. No features

I did not find this app was as advertised. Poor quality tracks that were too short and generic. Looping tracks had obvious transitions. Selections in all categories were far too few. Canceling the subscription was also a lot of back and forth between the app and Google Play because of unclear instructions from Calm. This app made me anything but calm.
They couldn't even let you test one feature without giving them a credit card. I have no idea if this app is any good. No clue. I think it may have caused anxiety...

Wanted to try it, but almost all the content is paywalled. Plus, they tried to trick me into subscribing through an unintuitive workflow, which I reeeally didn't appreciate. The whole thing reeks of a seller not having confidence in their product. Will not try again.

I love this app and use it every night, but it has so many bugs. The app won't stop playing the background music even if you completely close the app on your phone. I've never seen another app behave like this. I have to go into the settings every morning and manually stop the background sounds, and then manually turn them back on again every night. Also the app is terribly slow and can take a very long time to respond. For an app I paid premium for, I'd expect it to work much better than this.

I'm sure this app is great should you choose to pay for a subscription. If you have no interest in paying, however, this is NOT a great fit. The app has dozens of options for a myriad of things from sleep issues to anxiety (so much so that the general organization is a bit dizzying), but these options are only available when you pay. Even simple things like the sound of rain or the ocean is barred off. Super disappointed with the lack of general availability.

I'd really like to love this app, but for an audio app it has a ton of connection/playback issues! I'm happy when it plays, all too often though it shows that it's playing but with no sound coming out. Restarting the app doesn't do anything. After a huge lag sometimes the app will then catch up with the fact that you restarted it earlier, and will then get back up to speed. Most of the issues seem to be when I'm switching playback from the phone to my headphones or my car.

It's a low "meh". Don' get me wrong, the soundscapes are high quality. But there was already very little in the free version and since I first got it you've moved even MORE stuff to premium. Speaking of payments, why isn't it an option to just permanently buy individual selections for a small one-time fee? I'd gladly pay for PERMANENT ACCESS to an individual item but since its premium or nothing, I've just gotta do without, which means you don't get my money. Dont you want my money? Needs work.

This app isn't special in any way. It is just simply good. The price for premium account is way too high and isn't worth it. I would not pay more than 40$ per year or probably 3.99$ a month. I enjoyed a few guided meditations. Not all narrators are good. My favorite one was with LeBron James, but the series was VERY short. The app itself is laggy and lacks perfection, it is hard to find the specific meditation you need.

I used to love this app! But now they've intertwined all of the paid stuff with the free stuff, and the free stuff is constantly changing. This app needs a tab for all the meditations that are free, especially if they keep changing. It is too difficult to find the free meditations. I know they want you to pay, but be a little user friendly. Will get 5 stars if this feature is implemented. As of now 2 stars because I lost my calm when Body scan all of a sudden becomes locked when it's been free.

love the app, recent glitches. recently sleep stories stop playing shortly after they started and i have to pick up the device and press play again...which doesn't help with sleep. Sometimes the story will play through to the end, but sometimes it continues to pause and i just close the app and move to another app. This is very disappointing becuse this is a fairly pricey subscription and the main feature i use is not working right now.

Content is not working properly. Have had the premium version for over a year and have not been able to use all the content since beforey renewal. No way to contact Calm directly to get a fix to the issues or to get a refund. Very disappointed especially since I cannot use or listen to some items in my favorites lost any longer. I woulddelete this if it weren't for the fact that I paid for a premium subscription!

This app has some issues. The music constantly skips and does so more frequently over time. My alarms don't sound when I'm using the app, the alarm that wakes me up for work will not go off when the app is playing, it will just skip momentarily at the time of the alarm and deactivate the alarm immediately. This is dissapointing because I was hoping to use Calm to help me sleep on work nights when I have a noisy environment. Alarms should not be cleared automatically by an app like this.

A lot of the features (much of the majority unfortunately) I can't use because it's locked.. (I have to "upgrade") There are features that are free to use - few of them from what I seen tho so.. It's a bit limiting and I feel kinda obligated or in need to pay and (with minimum wage especially at the moment) it's hard for me to do. A little sad and frustrated when the point of it all is to distress and relax. At the least - to make more options available for a free version - have it balanced out

Ran into a lot of issues when casting to different devices (namely Chromecast with Google TV and Nest Hub Max). Content plays fine on Chromecast initially, but after about 10 minutes, the Chromecast shuts off in the middle of playback. Almost as if it cannot detect media is playing and turns off due to being idle. I've had better luck with the Nest Hub, but the media player eventually "pauses" after about 30 mins. While Calm's content is OK, the app just feels shoddy.

I've had this app for a few years now, referred by my therapist at the time. The free version was great at first, it had a few lessons and meditation techniques available for different subjects; anxiety, sleep, 7 days of gratitude, etc.. Over time they've added more features, lessons, stories and narrators but the free version is now so  limited that I can't get anything new out of it. If you plan on getting the free-version app and not paying way too much for the annual fee, might as well go to You-Tube and get some meditation videos from there. Free version not worth it

Calm app has very good contents. There are so many great meditations to chose from. I especially enjoy the Daily Jay where I pick up little pieces of daily wisdom. However, the app constantly freezes each time I scroll through the meditations or to change my home page background. I followed through their trouble shooting guides to resolve the issue, however, that did not help.

I used to love this app. I used it for free and used the breathing exercise and mood check-ins every night before bed. From time to time, I'd listen to a free sleep story. I tried the free trial and decided that I didn't want to pay for all of the features as I didn't use them. I canceled my trial subscription. But now, I can't go back to using the unpaid version. I get stuck in a loop of "Which subscription do you want" and when I hit the X, it just reloads over and over. Very disappointing!

My main gripe about this app is that your can't create playlists so that you can listen to multiple stories, classes, meditations, etc, one after the other. If I'm having trouble sleeping, which is when I use this app, I have to constantly open my phone and X out the "Still Awake" screen. Yes, still awake and having to stay awake to find something else to listen to! Also, if you don't like Tamara Levitt, good luck. She is the most featured creator.

I like the thunder rain sound because I only want thunder instead of tinny rain (which this has but... Less), but otherwise everything is paywalled to hell and the app itself is so broken. It doesn't work in landscape! It forces itself to portrait, then falls into landscape then forces itself up etc etc. Make sure to keep your screen rotation locked if you actually want to use the app. The sounds are soooo quiet, you have to listen at full volume regardless of your headphones.

It's a real shame, because I actually enjoy this app. I've always enjoyed sleep stories and the like. However, to use literally ANY feature, you have to pay $79.99 for a yearly subscription. At least other apps will allow you to use some features without being locked in. It's slightly misleading to say it's a free app. Yes, to download the app is free, but to USE the app (which is why you download it in the first place), is a relatively hefty price. Unfortunately, will be uninstalling.

2 years okay. 2023 app is slow, glitchy...shows me multiple copies of same sleep story in a lineup..I click on one story and it plays an entirely different one. After update, got worse. its updating my status/playlist all the time...freezing constantly. yesterday night it would not work at all. kept saying I had no internet connection. after 2 hours of trying to play my sleep stories I was anything but calm. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling. would not let me log in or change pw. 4 hrs later

Very greedy app with extreemly limited free features. They are so stingy that recently have removed even inspiring messages that one used to receive by the end of a meditation when simply using their free meditation timer. The subscriptions is also too expensive.

The breathing feature on this app for Wear OS doesn't work. The vibration works once and the screen falls asleep immediately so I can't do the breathing exercise with it on the watch at all it's unusable

Doesn't work well on my phone or tablet. The soundscapes cut out which is actually very irritating. Little blips of silence. It doesn't happen if I play their songs. I also found the advertising to be misleading. The ads feature hypnotic and nature videos but this is all just sound. Using desktop version improved playback but the menu is missing soundscapes. Other things on the menu are easier to find on desktop. The whole thing is a hot mess IMO considering the price point and branding.

Notifications galore and slow. I love the soundscapes, and the other content but as someone who downloaded this app to reduce stress I found that there were notifications every other hour telling me to 'relax' and also it's so slow! I downloaded one of the soundscapes to play and everytime I click play it still takes 20 seconds before it starts playing

I liked the content, it's pretty good. I didn't like the multiple times it froze up on my phone upon startup. Maybe it is my phone's fault but either way it isn't calming for any app to crash...but a paid one? I also don't like how the unsubscription process went. It shouldnt be tough. That exposes your business model as a bit predatory in my mind. I prefer to deal in the realms of transparency, not bad faith relationships.

The app itself is OK but the connectivity itself to other devices is appalling. It does not have a casting feature to connect to other devices, which is a must this day and age . I had to download a super watered down app on my Sonos controller that is nearly unusable and there is no way to find your favourites from the normal calm app. Cancelled the subscription within 30 minutes when I couldn't cast to anything.
Why can't you repeat the same song? I'm sure this was a feature before? (Edit) stability worse than ever. No new content

I like the thunder rain sound because I only want thunder instead of tinny rain (which this has but... Less), but otherwise everything is paywalled to hell and the app itself is so broken. It doesn't work in landscape! It forces itself to portrait, then falls into landscape then forces itself up etc etc. Make sure to keep your screen rotation locked if you actually want to use the app. The sounds are soooo quiet, you have to listen at full volume regardless of your headphones.
Everything is a premium feature

Very greedy app with extreemly limited free features. They are so stingy that recently have removed even inspiring messages that one used to receive by the end of a meditation when simply using their free meditation timer. The subscriptions is also too expensive.

Dosent really make me calm as I would like to be. When I scroll through the app, its very laggy, im very disappointed in this app, and of course many sounds and musics are locked, im not paying a subscription fee for only 1 sound or music I wanna listen too?! Pathetic! Made my anxiety worse Ã¢ËÂ¹

The breathing feature on this app for Wear OS doesn't work. The vibration works once and the screen falls asleep immediately so I can't do the breathing exercise with it on the watch at all it's unusable

2 years okay. 2023 app is slow, glitchy...shows me multiple copies of same sleep story in a lineup..I click on one story and it plays an entirely different one. After update, got worse. its updating my status/playlist all the time...freezing constantly. yesterday night it would not work at all. kept saying I had no internet connection. after 2 hours of trying to play my sleep stories I was anything but calm. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling. would not let me log in or change pw. 4 hrs later

It's a real shame, because I actually enjoy this app. I've always enjoyed sleep stories and the like. However, to use literally ANY feature, you have to pay $79.99 for a yearly subscription. At least other apps will allow you to use some features without being locked in. It's slightly misleading to say it's a free app. Yes, to download the app is free, but to USE the app (which is why you download it in the first place), is a relatively hefty price. Unfortunately, will be uninstalling.
Why can't you repeat the same song? I'm sure this was a feature before? (Edit) stability worse than ever. No new content

The app itself is OK but the connectivity itself to other devices is appalling. It does not have a casting feature to connect to other devices, which is a must this day and age . I had to download a super watered down app on my Sonos controller that is nearly unusable and there is no way to find your favourites from the normal calm app. Cancelled the subscription within 30 minutes when I couldn't cast to anything.

I love the content of this app but I hate it's UX. So confusing and often I can't find the content that I want. I need to browse and keep browsing, which is super frustrating. The contents are calming but the browsing process and the whole UX is the opposite of calming.

Too political. The bedtime story meant to calm is instead working me up because the narrator keeps saying the word "they" and "them" instead of "he" or "she." Why must everything be aimed at pushing trans or gender issues? I just wanted this app to help me fall asleep

I previously mentioned the long standing Casting issues of this app and got a response asking me "to contact support"... Well I already did almost 1 year ago and this was the little useful response redacted to fit here: "[...] Our developers are currently looking into the issue of audio not being correctly cast to multiple speakers. We apologize for the inconvenience [...] In the meantime, I would recommend using headphones, or playing through your device speakers [...]". Sure, thanks, I guess?
The app will play a few minutes of a sleep story, then crash.

I thought this would be a decent app to add to my meditation routine. Currently, I am not impressed with the offered content because it is overly commercialized. The meditations are either too short to induce a meditative state; or the narrators are speaking too much and not leaving enough quiet for the session to be beneficial. So far, I find the soundscape feature to be the highlight, but I hope that with continued use over the coming year, I can find the best way to utilize the app.

I love this and it's improved my mental health over a period of four months but I've been having technical issues with it, the longer it's installed the more unstable it gets. Sometimes the meditation audio stutters hard or it randomly stops playing music or meditation audio even while in app over wifi,then crashing when I try to play it again, there's also losing whatever I was listening to when I pause the audio and being unable to find it due to the history only recording completed sessions

Calm is a great concept, but know in advance there's some major limitations. For instance, sometimes it takes me a while to fall asleep. The Sleep Stories are wonderful, but when a story ends, there's no transition to another story. Without a continuous playlist or a timer, I have to pick up my device at the end of each story, get blinded by the light, and activate another story. Understandably, the light and the movement wake me up again. I wrote the company, and their response was a template thanking me for my "thoughtful feedback." The two longest stories are 45 minutes in length, but most run about 30-ish minutes, with others lasting 20, 19, 15, or even a mere 12 minutes. Those people who can consistently fall asleep in 12 minutes probably wouldn't need this feature. But what about the rest of us?  If this app had a playlist or a timer feature for Sleep Stories, I'd surely give it 5 stars!

I like using calm. The combination of daily philosophy and nature sounds is really helpful for me. I'm giving 3 stars because I think there is a major problem with how the app is organized. one of the goals of the app is to help with feeling overwhelmed,but the presentation is extremely overwhelming. Even when using the favorite feature to save good meditations, the page they are on is hard to get to and cluttered. You can't even organize it. I would give a 5 star if the app was organized better

Great app with a variety of exercises for all areas of your life. Unfortunately, a 7-day free trial isn't long enough to determine if this app is right for you. The minimum features you can access to during the free trial makes it more difficult to determine if you feel it will be helpful. The premium version is a bit expensive for what I've seen even with 40% off. You can find other apps with all the premium features for free with the same leaders. I will uninstall and use a an equal, free app.

Good content but not a very good app. The home screen content seems random. You would assume that if I've been doing a particular mediation course everyday that the next session of that would be there at the top ready to go each day, but it is not present at all and there are other things. You can favorite things, but navigating around the app and searching for stuff is confusing. So far I've enjoyed most of what I've heard, but the user experience is sub par considering their subscription cost

I love basically everything about this app - except that it runs at a snail's pace. Everything is delayed, even just opening the app takes a long time and then I have to wait longer to be able to scroll, search, or select. It slows down anything else that is currently running on my phone as well. Amazing app and I won't delete it...but I would definitely use and enjoy it more if there was an update that made things run more smoothly.

I used this somewhat pretty much exclusively for sleep stories, but I've mostly moved on. The app needs features one would expect such as playlists, looping, and most of all for sleep stories, playback speed control. Many of the narrators read the stories too quickly and it's impossible for me to fall asleep that way. These are not difficult features to implement and not having them is pretty much a hard stop for me.

I wish that this app was not so expensive I would definitely purchase it. The free trial is very limited which does not allow you to get a true feeling for the app. I have looked for discount coupons that would help on me possibly purchasing this product. Perhaps a slightly moderate price for less features would help. I am interested in the sleep stories or a package that can be used on several devices within a family.

Not all Sleep Stories are created equal. Some are perfectly dreamy, but, sometimes, the reading is less than professional or the vocabulary is narrow. Calm's idea of A-list artists differs from mine, but, discovering new voices can be good. I've only just seen the rating feature, but, as the goal is to be asleep by the end of the session, it will probably go unused. If there is a timer, I haven't found it. I fell asleep to train sounds and was awakened by same, several times in the night. (ÃÂ¨_ÃÂ¨)

This app is great for calming anxienty and relieving stress. However, there is a reason for giving only three stars. I can't really have an experience. I don't have a subscription, so I can only listen to 2 sleep stories. And only some meditations are available. My one request is that you make more sleep stories, meditations, etc free. It is hard listening to the same things. I want to have more of an experience. Thank you and god bless.

I really think this app is too expensive. I mostly use it for sleep stories lately but have used the meditation in the past and while I think it's a great tool, there really should be more features included when it's so GD expensive. One main frustration I have is that you can't make a playlist for sleep stories. I can try to find the longest story but it will still quit before the story is done most of the time. Please add this feature, I think it's a pretty simple ask when I'm paying $70.

having mental health issues, I found this app to be helpful in clearing my mind so i can be the best version of myself. also helped with reducing some stress and is still helping me meditate daily. however I give it 3 star because it's not free. it's a yearly subscription for $60. They added some free content and features but in order to use this app's concept to it's full potential the subscription is recommended.

I love this app but it is buggy *all the time*. Music frequently stops playing. Organizing saved music or content is miserable. It's hard enough to tell whether or not you even downloaded something. Tabs don't always load when you select them. Support is slow to respond. I'm holding out hope but the tech needs to catch up with the content. If Headspace had music and was the same price, I'd switch in a heartbeat. Content = A+ Execution = C-

I've had a subscription for a couple of years and I mainly use the app for sleep stories. The content is fantastic! However, there are some obvious things missing that you'd thing are easy to add: -repeat? -creating playlists? Moshi, this app's sister app has had these features forever. There's nothing more disruptive than waking up in the middle of the night and having to fiddle with my phone to put back on a sleep story. I wish these would be added, as this would make the app 100x better!

Calm is a great app for the category, but I'm not the type to subscribe to a service like this. theres just so many features I dont really need or want access too. it would be awesome if I could purchase individual meditations or sleep stories for like 99 cents instead of being forced into a 60 dollar yearly recurring fee. or even better if there was just a few more freebies included and rotated monthly in the free section I might understand better why it would be worth the money.

The interactions are intrusive and slow, and this app kills my battery faster than any app I've ever used. I've accidentally unplugged my phone while sleeping and missed alarms while it was running, all I'm doing is playing white noise that I've already downloaded. The content is mostly good but I'd never pay for this app, only using it because I got free from work.

The content is ok. I subscribed to the app for meditation, and I find the topics to be limited . Honestly, it's mostly just breathing in silence, followed by a very brief discussion on the topic of the meditation you select. It could be more guided and more directive. The stories are a neat feature, but I'm not that interested in them

Getting more unreliable and glitchy. This app used to be rock solid but over last few months the sessions start jumping. Doesn't matter if I download or stream. Close to being unusable which is a shame as otherwise I enjoy the app

**Updating my review** I've been using the app for the last few month's and it's made a significant improvment on sleep. The meditations are excellent! However, the app constantly crashes. It usually happens when I first open the app but can be very disruptive when it happens during meditations. Has been happening for a while now and still hasn't been fixed. Very frustrating..
let some basic features be premium free so that the beginner could understand whether this app is useful for them truly or not

Getting more unreliable and glitchy. This app used to be rock solid but over last few months the sessions start jumping. Doesn't matter if I download or stream. Close to being unusable which is a shame as otherwise I enjoy the app

It would help me if there was a way to search for sleep stories based on how fast they talk. My brain processes words at a slower pace, especially when I'm trying to fall asleep. Either that or have a way to slow down the speed of the audio.

I thought this would be a decent app to add to my meditation routine. Currently, I am not impressed with the offered content because it is overly commercialized. The meditations are either too short to induce a meditative state; or the narrators are speaking too much and not leaving enough quiet for the session to be beneficial. So far, I find the soundscape feature to be the highlight, but I hope that with continued use over the coming year, I can find the best way to utilize the app.

The content is ok. I subscribed to the app for meditation, and I find the topics to be limited . Honestly, it's mostly just breathing in silence, followed by a very brief discussion on the topic of the meditation you select. It could be more guided and more directive. The stories are a neat feature, but I'm not that interested in them

The audio of all the meditations I've listened to keeps getting lagged so the voice sounds super robotic, and it's so annoying because it interrupts all the relaxing-meditation mood!! This happens when I'm on WiFi and mobile data so definitely not my phone nor connectivity problem.

Sounds great, app not so much. App constantly crashes on me. Sometimes I have to restart it 3 times before it'll play the sound I want. Otherwise the meditations are great and have helped me sleep many times and the sound is great for my newborn.

Calm changed my life thanks to the sleep stories. However I have to remove stars in my rating because every updates is making it harder to navigate the app. Their latest UX change has been to actually remove the menu. They make these nonsense changes and still don't address basic features like the ability to remove a download, if you want to remove one you have to remove them all! Such a shame... And lately, I can't even see my downloads... Buggy...

Great meditations, the app itself constantly seems to have technical issues, flickering all over the place and stopping downloads have way through. If people are going to pay this much money per year ( personally i think it should be heavily discounted) then sort out the app eh? Not sure anyone monitors these apps like others but might be time to check out all the feedback...

One story is missing from this app, which is the Elvis and the shoe maker loved that story, made me fall asleep in seconds when I heard it for the first time, please bring thr story back on clam, please!! Ã°Å¸â¢

I love the app and I'm obsessed with Tamara! She's so soft spoken and down to earth, it's a breeze to fall asleep to her sessions after a long & often stressful day. I have one feature suggestion to request, being that on some days I forget to plug my sleep data, I'd like to be able to go back and add it after 24hrs has passed. sometimes I'm super busy and don't get around to it. Obviously I'm not gonna recall a night 7 weeks back, but let's say having a 3 day window isn't too crazy sounding.

It's a amazing app, but can be frustrating when you see the little lock symbol on a lot options in the app. I know you want to make money too..but I wouldn't pay more then $1/mo for the app. You want to charge me what Netflix does but deliver on a fraction of the content available. I would also love to have a alarm feature that predicts what time I will get up(I see other apps that have the feature) and they are free! The app is well built, but the pricing is way too high in humble opinion.

I really like the majority of this app. The music and sleep stories have greatly helped keep my mind from racing at night. I love the timer feature to play until the set time then turn off. If you pick a time longer than the track you select it selects another track and when it's a track that's much louder its actually woken me up. Not cool. Other than that it's been a great addition to (pun intended) calm down.

First, I want to say I really like this app. But there are a few features that would be good to add to the app to improve the flow.The scenes themselves are great but it would be nice to be able to sort the ones you have downloaded and make some sort of filtering for the scenes like water, forest etc. In the profile area, being able to clear the recently played list would be nice also being able to make your own playlists with ones you have downloaded and one you haven't or something like that.

I really enjoy this app. However I have routinely had issues with the music selection not actually repeating overnight, and instead getting stuck playing the final 5-15 seconds of the song over and over and eventually waking me up. I would love to be able to create a Playlist as well so I could start with a sleep meditation or story and then move into a list of music selections to play overnight.

I've been using the "free" version since the beginning of this year and I enjoy it. I was reading another comment where someone said the speakers speak to slowly...I think the speed that they talk in is fine for trying to fall to sleep. Would I see myself paying full price...I can't say because the free options are good but I don't think they are tempting enough for me to make that commitment. I do believe that the free options are nice-your trying to fall asleep/meditate- not active listening

EDITED: Calm has done a good job of addressing their technical problems on Android. It can still be slow to respond, but the behavior is more consistent now. I like the array of different options: sleep stories, meditations, music, and soundscapes. [old review: May be good for some, but I dealt with a lot of buggy behavior: files not playing, background audio continuing even after a force close.]

It's an awesome app. The only thing that I don't like is that when you just want to listen to waves or fireplace, there some tracks listed as such but they are instrumental tracks. Great app, 100% recommend. Also have to point out that it desperately needs to have a chromecast feature (specifically for the stretching videos).

Love the content and the design. My main request would be to be able to create a sleep playlist. So if I started with a story to fall asleep, a sleep song playlist starts on the back end. This way if I wake up in the middle of the night, I can use the music to fall back asleep without having to look at my screen. Voice control of the app through Google assistant or Galaxy or Siri would be nice too. I'm trying to avoid blue light around sleep.

This app really helped me slow my thoughts at night, and really relax before going to bed. The bedtime stories gave my mind something else to focus on instead of racing thoughts, and I am able to fall asleep better. The breathing exercises have helped me to self-soothe/ calm down when I am faced with anxious situations. It's sad though that it requires one to subscribe to get the full usage out of the app, but I understand that people have to make money.

I use the app for the sleep stories. They REALLY help calm my mind allowing me to go to sleep easier. I'd give the app 5 starts, but it's a memory hog and freezes when doing my mood check-in, in the middle of the night when I have to change stories, very slow to start, and other times. If that could be fixed, I'd like it a lot more. But overall, the app really does help with my sleep and I won't let the slowness stop me from using it for that reason alone.

I really only come here for the sleep stories and *some* of the background sounds (which I do enjoy), like a crackling fire or train tracks. I don't use a lot of the content here which is focused on guided meditations and music that I personally do not find relaxing at all as an autistic person. I won't be renewing because this is too expensive to only use 2 features, I wish they had more autistic friendly music and meditations on this app. If this is not an issue for you, it is a very nice app

Would be great if a feature was added that allows you to play the next session. Something like an add to queue or up next feature. Even better if you could create a Playlist of meditations. (You can send me a check for the idea at 6... Ã°Å¸Ëâ°). Thank you for a great app to help me mediate, move, and have good clean entertainment throughout the day.

I love the interface, and the overall feel of the app. The only reason I'm rating it 4 stars instead of 5, is because of the price. i believe there are similar, if not better stories narrated on YouTube for free. The convenience of having all the features in one app really shouldn't warrant such a high price, compared to YouTube being free that is. With the exclusive content in mind, it's good for what it is. The stories are nice, and the narration is amazing.

I really enjoy the app. I have just completed an outpatient mental health course and they would offer meditation everyday. I could never meditate or complete a breathing exercise but I enjoy the circle and options. This app has been very helpful with my mindfulness. I would like to go premium but I think it is too much money for this. It is disappointing because I would like to benefit from some of the other features.

I enjoy the app but there are a few things that bug me. If I miss a mood check in at my scheduled reminder time there is no way that I can find to check in. And a feature that I wish this app had is a random mindfulness notification. You can set one at a specific time (and only one) but I'd like to get several throughout the day at random times.

I really love this app. I relax and get to sleep incredibly quick now! The only thing holding back from 5 starts is that there is not a feature to select multiple sleep stories to play in a row (like a playlist). As someone who wakes up frequently at night I wish there was a feature like that so I didn't have to fumble with my phone to put another story on every time I wake up. Even with that though this app is my favorite I've ever bought and I will continue to use it.

Been using the app for a few days and the UI is great besides being a bit laggy at times. There is plenty of content for beginner and advanced meditation, sleep, and relaxation that isn't repetitive and it appears that new stuff is added frequently. The sleep remix series is my favorite so far, and the app has a ton of ambient sounds that have been great for my newborn baby.

Great app with an odd bug. When using the app to track my sleep, my entries get assigned to the wrong date. The calendar indicates today's date (3/31) correctly, but when I logged how well I slept last night, it shows up as two days ago (3/29)! A minor thing, maybe, but it's super confusing.

I love the music it is really calming. But on the music theres a timer you can set for when the music is supposed to stop. There is only (for example) one hour and five minuets instead of just being able to do one hour. Also it would be really nice if you could watch some ad's to get Calm Premium for a day or something like that. I feel like it would really help with a lot peoples stress, Anxiety, sleep issues, etc.

This app is great, definitely worth the cost; however, it would be perfect if the company would add a playlist feature. I want to be able to listen to a meditation then play music. Meditation to get me to sleep, music to keep me asleep.

The app works great. I think the UI could be improved and transitions between screens as well. On top of this there's a consistent crash when I open the app after a few days; It's like the home screen stucks in a loop loading the contents infinitely until a crash happens. After the crash with a re open everything works ok. Might be worth a check as is 100% of the times reproducible.
I love this app, but I was heartbroken when they removed the pop song sleep covers, they were so relaxing to listen to.

Great app! I like the various check ins for sleep, mood and gratitude. The meditations are nice. However, I'm surprised there's no closed captions? (Unless I'm completely missing it) It would be nice to be able to follow along without headphones and keep the volume low for my partner
I love this app, but I was heartbroken when they removed the pop song sleep covers, they were so relaxing to listen to.
this app does a lot and I'm still finding new features.

This app is great, definitely worth the cost; however, it would be perfect if the company would add a playlist feature. I want to be able to listen to a meditation then play music. Meditation to get me to sleep, music to keep me asleep.
Very cool app, has some nice free features.

I love the app and I'm obsessed with Tamara! She's so soft spoken and down to earth, it's a breeze to fall asleep to her sessions after a long & often stressful day. I have one feature suggestion to request, being that on some days I forget to plug my sleep data, I'd like to be able to go back and add it after 24hrs has passed. sometimes I'm super busy and don't get around to it. Obviously I'm not gonna recall a night 7 weeks back, but let's say having a 3 day window isn't too crazy sounding.

Nice, but missing things. I got this through my husband's work. My main need from the app is help with managing toxic shame from PTSD. I imagine this isn't too unusual. PTSD is common, and if the cause was in childhood it often expresses as toxic shame. You have to search for meditations on topics, there's a bit of talk in many of them. Both "PTSD" and "Shame" leave the searches floundering and empty. Lots of other topics are covered... Those are not.

I suffer from high anxiety, and insomnia and this app is so wonderful. sometimes my partner and I will turn on the soothing sounds and use them as background for romantic, comfortable dinners. I like the free features so much that the yearly price for the full thing doesn't sound too bad, though I might find it easier to purchase if it was a one time fee, or a smaller fee? Not sure about that. But I really appreciate the free features, and it has improved my life considerably.

Long time subscriber to this app and used to LOVE it, recommended it to all my clients and friends. But now, the breathing circle, one of my favorite features, is limited to TWO MINUTES! I can't change the time or switch it to unlimited. It's basically useless. What's the point of meditating if you have to restart your meditation every 2 minutes?!

Great app for anyone getting started on their meditation journey. Easy to use and very approachable for newcomers. I've been using the app consistently for 3 months and have noticed improvement in my mental health and feeling of well being. The narration is excellent and the additional app features (sleep stories, music, stretching, etc.) are a noce bonus.

Tried a few other well known meditation apps and this is the best. If I need a bedtime story, it has that. If I need to listen to music, it has that. If I need to specifically work on an emotion or work concern, it has that. If I want a generic meditation to calm, or even visual scenes with sounds to watch, soundscapes... new content added daily. I have logged many hours on this App and I am no where close to going through all the content. Well worth the investment.

This app had way more features than I was originally expecting. I started with the relaxing music, then tried out some meditation, and there are still other features or options I haven't touched yet. I'm really glad I downloaded this and it outperforms other apps that offer calming, mindfulness, or stress reduction. It's totally worth downloading.

This is a gorgeous and easy to use app! It is chock full of features to help you find your calm, including music, bedtime stories, daily meditation programs, masterclasses, and more. If youre just looking for some help to sleep, you can get away with the free content, as most of the music and some of the bedtime stories are free (try the german ones, theyre very effective for me!). If you want to actually meditate, youll need the subscription to fully experience. If youre just looking for white noise, i recommend an app called sleepo.

I love this app! The Daily Calm session itself is helpful but there are so many other features that I use as well... the music during my workday, the sleep stories at night. I also like that I can favorite meditations that are particularly helpful so I can go back to them again if I'm struggling with the same issue on a different day. I would highly recommend this app to help control stress and anxiety, and to build better daily self-care habits.

Thoughtful app with many wonderful and effective features. I've been using it every day for the last month and I'm so thankful that I took the leap! The daily calms and meditations are new to me, someone who works all day everyday, but I am glad to take 10 minutes to myself every morning. The app has resources and strategies for many forms of anxiety, (including sleep, plane and travel, etc) these are great and much less expensive than medication or therapy!

There are so many helpful features in CALM, that anyone can choose to use one or all of them. My Favorite is the bedtime stories. I'd like to say, although the beginning of the stories are interesting, I've not yet been awake to listen to the Whole story. That's because I fell sound to sleep before the end. That said, my mind puts aside all the daily activity that keeps me awake rethinking. I like that the app has a timer that turns off the Sleep Story so I don't have to wake up and turn it off

I started using the Calm app during a period of extreme anxiety last year. It helped me regulate and get control again. I use it almost every day. There is much to explore and there seems to be something for most situations. I would love to see a search feature in addition to the broad genres. Please keep these great work.

very effective and affordable for the quality narration and sound effects. I used this app mainly for falling asleep more efficiently and practicing mindful breathing, and I'm very happy with the results. There are alot of customizations to the settings and even a great selection of background/white noises (my favorite feature). The special stories is a wonderful feature as well. Ã°Å¸Ë

Along with Headspace, Calm is my favorite method to enjoy guided meditation! The app has lots of variety and guided playlists for what you'd like to focus on. It keeps track of time meditated, sessions completed, and how many days (streaks!) you meditate in a row. The option to switch between female and male narration is a neat feature, and for $60 it's hard to beat for a year subscription! I'll continue to use this as my platform for guided meditation, and recommend it for daily use and your meditation/mindfulness goals :)

Calm is an amazing app, even if you only use the free version, they still have useful tools that you can use on a daily basis to help keep you grounded and focused on the present or whatever you may be searching for. I do highly recommend the full subscription though because it's a fair price if you struggle with concentration or just need an escape from every day life and it unlocks so many different features for you to utilize. Plus it's cheaper than a therapist!

so far so good. I love the many different features. very helpful to me. the only downfall is the price. I just got back to work and cannot afford a $60 payment at this time. if you had it where it was a monthly payment id definitely do it. Maybe someday I'll be able to afford it. should really do monthly bc after reading reviews that seems to be one of the biggest hang ups. update: thank you making it where we can pay monthly

I love this app!!! So much of it is free, and everytime I use it I almost instantaly fall asleep. An amazing feature is that you can download the music so anywhere or time you can listen. Also it has everything! From rain to sleepy time stories. I haven't yet tried the meditation part but I am sure it will be amazing as well! I use it almost every night. I found this app because I couldn't fall asleep. I tried multiple apps however this is the only one that worked perfectaly!

Amazing app! I downloaded it to help me begin my journey with meditation. Although that journey has stalled a bit for me personally, I couldn't imagine living without it because of the sleep features. Whether it's a sleep meditation, stories, sounds, or music, it's become invaluable to my nights! Also love the amount of updates being made to the app, with a new meditation options, sleep stories, podcast, and even a movement option!

Calm is an excellent app! very well done. simple to use yet elegant in design. im really enjoying how i can customize the background and music or white noise. the quality of the meditations and music are above my expectations. and the Breathe feature is si helpful for creating a mindful breathing practice. i haven't tried the paid version but the masterclass trailers seem legit. good job, way to go!

Life changing. I love this app. I use it for daily meditation and sleep, and sometimes I listen to thunderstorms or humpback whales just because I like the sound. I started as a total beginner and have been hooked since. Great way to help you sort out thoughts and emotions and just accept things for what they are at that particular moment. They are also very responsive to technical issues!

I genuinely love it. It significantly helps falling asleep. There's countless (free) "scenes" such as rain, beach, etc. These are very relaxing! There's also countless (cost) nap and bedtime stories, ranging topics and authors. they surprisingly work! i never make it through a story. There's a reminder feature I when to start winding down for bed which i like, is helping me get on a more regular sleep schedule.

Well rounded mediation and mindfulness app with tonnes of features that can be utilised to destress and unwind even if mediation isnt your thing. The various free guided mediation series are amazing for beginners or even long time practitioners of meditation. There's nothing to lose. This app has taught me so much and is one of the best things that has ever come into my life.

it is the best, most top of the line meditation, breathing, guidance, progressive app. I have used it for 4 years and it has only improved and added more features that are useful and creative such as the breath bubble; fun and soothing like bedtime stories; and tried and true like the guided meditations. there's so much more on this app and I cannot recommend it more for management of mental and emotional wellness.

I used to pay for hypnosis therapy; this is the same if not better quality meditation on all levels. The detail and options are fantastic. My sincerest thanks to the developers who made this so easy to access, share, and use positively! I am honestly amazed at the amount of thought put into every app feature: the app is always giving options with NO PRESSURE. I will be a lifelong user, keep up the beautiful work.

I've used this app for over 2 years I believe. It's a great meditation app, even if you've never meditated. I like that there are series for meditations, as well as a daily meditation and open ended meditation with or without bells. I like that it offers focal scenes if you want you eyes open. I love the walking meditation - it's nice when I need a break. I've just started playing around with the Calm Body (mini stretching sessions), the masterclasses and the sleep features.

I have subscribed yearly for 2 years now. I love this app so much, I am considering the lifetime price. There is so much they offer & they are always adding stuff. 1 new feature is a daily check-in. You select how you feel (only certain options right now but they cover majority of every day emotions) & it gives a little encouragement w/suggestions of meditations centered on your feelings. They also have amazing narrators, sounds & stories. I reccomend it to anyone looking for a meditation app.

A lot of people have complained about this app bc of the price, but as someone who struggles with major clinical anxiety and panic disorder it is worth every penny for me. The meditation sessions work on so many extremely helpful techniques that have transformed the way I handle anxiety. Another feature that has been extremely helpful is the body scanning. It has even helped me in the midst of full panic attacks. I know it's not for everyone, but I hope more people will give it a try.

Early returns- this is far and away the most useful 'leisure' app I have on my phone. The guided meditations are spot on and the music selections are wonderful (super stoked to see Sigur Ros featured). My OCD leaning, anxious personality is already showing some softening with only a handful of days into one of the many anxiety focused programs. This is a phenomenal app, and I'm excited to keep progressing further into it's offerings.

The absolute best app for sleep, rest, yoga or meditation! I've had a few app issues,but now everything seems to be working really well! The sleep stories are wonderful, and the scenes with sleep sounds are just beautiful. I purchased the subscription for the premium services. It's worth it for me!

It's not just the most beautiful meditation app, but my favorite, in regards to features. Tried other apps out curiosity, on both ios and Android including headspace, but I always go back to Calm, to be calm(haha). Love the fact that it looks identical from the time they first started it, always with a simple, easy to navigate layout, no matter how much they add to it. Those additions are awesome, from sleep stories, to music, to the master class, and kids section. I love Calm!

I truly enjoy reading the negative comments. If you have half a brain, you can figure this app out! It is simple, straight forward and easy to use. I love the option of it going to the sleep sounds after the sleep stories are through. I use the nap features almost every day and the sleep stories EVERY night! The only suggestion I would make is to have multiple readers for the same story. I'm not a fan of Mr. Sklars voice. I do not find his voice soothing at all but I like the stories he reads.

I would like to have the ability to create a playlist. This way I could do a nice 10 minute meditation when I get into bed. Then a story could play after while I'm trying to drift off and then maybe a sound escape to play for the next while. Hopefully I'm asleep by now. The ability to create a playlist would be a great feature to compliment what calm has to offer.

This app is amazing. It contains so much helpful information and ways of coping with life in healthier ways. I love the sleep stories and have just started a master class in breaking bad habits. It has fantastic meditations, relaxing music, classes to deal with specific issues and more. I love it!

Far more features then I realized, there are little nooks and crannies in this app that i keep finding. When I first got the app, i was very hesitant to sign up for the subscription, glad I did. Make sure to poke around in the other areas, very well done content with daily mindfulness meditation, videos, music, and longer meditations.

Excellent app! It's many features aren't immediately apparent - it requires due diligence to discover it's many features. Has extensive catalog of programs to choose from. Something NEW every day: The daily Calm, ~10 minutes of Guided Mindful Meditation. New Sleep Stories (~1 hour in length) every few days. NO bugs encountered after ~6 months use. The app's cost seemed expensive at first, but if you use all it's features on a daily basis, it's well worth the cost.

I've been a subscriber for years, because Calm does so many things just right. I use the daily guided meditations and masterclasses regularly, and I like several of the other features (sleep stories and mood tracking, for example). My favorite thing about the app is the team's commitment to improvement and innovation; they're consistently making their great service even better. Highly recommend!

Great app, been using it for about a month now and what I love most about the app is how it just isn't so time consuming and how the people share wisdom along with the meditation rather than just give you stuff to practice. Easy to navigate, very practical, user friendly and even has a music section. Amazing features that I think deserve full stars man.
Am doing the 7 day trial to manage my anxiety (due to current issues in my life.) It DOES help me, though I can't afford to continue with paid subscription right now. Maybe later...

I love the sleep stories on this app. They really help me fall asleep when I am struggling to do so. 1st edit: Lost two stars because this last update took away the favorite feature. The list is still there but it doesn't show my favorites but everything Ã°Å¸Ëâ.2nd edit: giving them back thanks to the swift response. Now if only my favorites were not so far down the list.

This app is an important tool in my PTSD recovery. I've never been able to meditate because it often triggers PTSD for me but the options on this app have given me space to explore without getting overwhelmed. There is even a meditation for when I wake up and can't go back to sleep in the middle of the night. It's been the only thing that lets me fall back asleep because not even sleep meds helped me with my PTSD related sleep issues. I can't recommend this enough.

The best app ever! There are some reviews saying it freezes, but I don't think that happened to me. I've used this app for 2 years, and I'm really satisfied with how the stories, meditations, or soundscapes are keep added. This app really helps and taught me gratitude and confidence. Using this also made sleep more fun and relaxing if that makes senseÃ°Å¸Ëâ It helps me fall asleep and relax in any situations. It also helped me anxiety issues over the years too. I really recommend this appÃ°Å¸âÅÃ°Å¸

I've been using Calm for over a year and love it! Never had any issues as other reviews suggest. My only complaint is that it works too good!! I have no idea how any of the stories end because I'm passed out midway! Ã°Å¸Ëâ Ã°Å¸Ë

Edit on 10/23/23 Having issues today and getting customer service is arduous to say the least. They emailed me. I responded and an hour has gone by with no response from them. Very frustrating. This kind of customer service is no appropriate. I had to uninstall the app. I reinstalled and it lost all my info. Not even realizing I'm a premium member. All of their fixes don't work! At this point I just want my money back. I'm over it.

I used to love it (old review below), but now there's not a free version. Also, every line runs off the edge, I can't see if something is 10 or 100 calories. Bubye ... I lost 75 lbs with this app. Advice: 1) slow & steady is best 2) I had BEST results eating ALL of the calories and 3) avg calories across the week was just as good as maintaining daily calories. I took Sundays off too, but ate reasonably. Big Mistake: not enough protein, I lost over 25% of my hair because of this!

They updated the weight graph and wrecked the app. It's awful. I can't see the weight in the graph anymore. When I tap on a point in the graph, instead of showing me the weight I was on that day, a huge screen pops up from the bottom and takes over the UI. This new design is ugly and not elegant like the previous version. Typical case of fixing something that was never broken. They complicated a great UI and made it cumbersome and added steps and taps for no good reason. Yuk.

I've never written a negative review. And I didn't think my first would be for lose it! But as others have been mentioning lately, the ads have gone over the top. I'm currently on a 842 day streak. The app itself is great, but over the years since my initial use of it, I've seen the ads slowly become more intrusive. It's at the point now I have no choice but to switch back to MyFitnessPal. Half the time, trying to click out of the ad actually opens it. You have to completely exit the app.

Used this app for quite a while, but finally had to give up on it. It now asks you to buy the full version every single time you open it back up. The app just freezes for several seconds and you start to think your phone is frozen, but nope, the app is just loading it's "do you want the full version" dialog box...

Basically what MFP used to be before it got bought out and became a bloated commercial mess. Simple and easy to use interface, very customizable and neat. Please keep it as is, if it ain't broke don't fix it. UPDATE: For some reason, my macros no longer show up on my dashboard like they used to. Not sure if it was a sneak update, but it's very infuriating. Why "fix" something that isn't broken? Ffs

Very frustrating to use. The database that this app draws from doesn't agree with the label on the package. In most cases you actually consume more calories than you think. Correcting the numbers is very difficult. I thought this app would save time counting calories but it has increased it a significant amount, while reducing the accuracy.
