Everywhere you look "get premium and this feature will work", can't even track exercise without paying $40. This app is more trouble than it's worth... FREE.

Used this app for a couple years now, no issues. Recent update started the full screen ads every time I log a meal and while I've tried just ignoring it, I've found it too much to bear. Unless that is removed, I'm sad to see my streak and progress gone, because I'm not able to use something that stresses me out so much like this.

If your expecting customer service DO NOT USE THIS APP. I used it every day with my cousin who lives in another state. Recently we were unable to access each other's logs, kept getting an error message. I uninstalled the app, then reinstalled it, but unfortunately forgot my password. I have tried to contact this developer for 2 days via two different ways, requesting an email on how to change my password, which I've never received as well as sending a message through the Play Store.

I have used LoseIt for a while. I switched to the yearly premium subscription and loved having access to the paid features, so I upgraded to the lifetime membership. Unfortunately that's when the problems began. They now have my money, but my subscription has reverted back to a free account. I am getting bombarded with requests to join a premium account and I have paid them for a yearly account and now a lifetime. I contacted their help and got a single response and now silence!

This use to be an awesome free app. Now that they have put all the features behind a paywall, it is only good for calorie counting alone. There are better apps out there, especially if you are already using a fit bit or other movement tracker. I would be fine paying a one-time charge to upgrade, but not a monthly/yearly subscription. I'll find something else.

I've used this app for years and had a yearly membership for years but the last few updates have wreaked the app. Exercises from days before appear out of nowhere and it won't accurately tract my steps. It randomly adds steps from yesterday and will not zero them out. Have uninstalled and reinstalled 3 times in the last month and still have issues. About ready to call it quits! Update - trying all day to get the steps to stop messing up my counts. Nothing works! YOU NEED TO FIX THIS!

Have the paid version, every time I scan a barcode, the app freezes. I have to force close it and restart. I only can find and enter foods if I manually search for them. I have deleted and reinstalled the app but still it does this. Kinda bs that this happens when it is a primary feature of the app. If it gets fixed/resolved, I'll change my rating.

I've used the app for almost a year and really enjoyed it. The macronutrients changed and no longer get a daily total breakdown, just a percent. It now only provides daily total calories. I contacted the help center to and received auto email responses it has been received but no follow up to my issues. I'll need to find something else for my daily tracking. I'm disappointed since this app did do everything I was looking for.

The new dashboard appeared out of nowhere with inaccurate totals and now has completely disappeared. I can't add anything to my "favorites" because the options fail to register input within the gear selections. Even the widget that displays macros just has completely missing data. This almost makes the app unusable as calorie counting alone is not sufficient.

The new dashboard has literally ruined this app; THE most useful stat for weight loss for me, the "if every week was like this week" summary, has now disappeared. Please fix this. Otherwise, this app is five stars -- simple to use, has all the features you could need to track calories quickly and easily with no gimmicks, integrates with Fitbit. But the new dashboard practically makes all that moot if my weekly summary is gone.

Imported data from years ago as opposed to setting up as new account with no backup data. I canceled the free premium trial, deleted the account and tried twice more. Same issue. Ridiculous that premium nembers can't start new and erase all data. Seems like that should be an easy option to add. I'm about ready to look elsewhere. Update: tried once more and now tech issues with my Garmin watch and Google fit. I'm continuously told to deactivate fit yet fit was NEVER installed. Useless to me!

here we go again. another update... and I can't restart my device without removing all calendar reminders for Monday am from my systems calendar. EVERY SINGLE UPDATE.... no wonder you pushed lifetime renewal. PLEASE delete all food items you mark "verified" with only caloric content. We PAY for macros and should get them without searching 15 entries only to have to manually enter them. Every time they issue an update app will crash. Make sure you long into your account through a web page if you don't want to lose all your data when you have to re-install. Also gives an option to enter data until problems resolved. Also terrible graphing.

I really loved it but lately I've been plagued with issues. The calorie count is incorrect when you future plan, the calorie count also doesn't change if you adjust it which is a huge problem considering you have to constantly lost your macros while losing weight! Why does the iPhone app get widgets and themes and Android gets nothing but issues its terrible and I hope they fix it as they won't give me a refund. Choose your apps wisely

Worked fine for 2 weeks. Then maybe they get sick of me using the free version? Now, the app crashes on startup. I reinstalled the app, restarted my device and cleared the cash and data. The app will start, but still crashes once I sign-in. So, its something to do with my account. Using the free version. Disappointing. I was seriously considering the paid version until this happened....I guess I'm going with a different app...

I've used lose it for a long time now and preferred it to mfp, but I got a new phone and forgot to install it for a little bit after and when I did now you can't even customize your BASIC calorie allowance! You can, but you've got to PAY PAY PAY! Don't get me wrong, I understand you gotta make money and gotta paywall a lot of stuff, but a fixed budget is the most basic feature. I don't want to consume 2500 calories a day, I would prefer to set to lower number. Will be sadly Uninstalling.

I used to use this app because it was simple and easy to read and use. Now it's complicated, ugly interface, and EVERY click leads you to an ad for premium service, and also shows you features that are locked for non-payers. If it was a one time fee, I'd consider it. But it's a sub so forget it. Get off my phone. I'm replacing it with something else.

Tried to claim the discount price less than 24 hours on free trial but kept getting an error message. I tried several times before troubleshooting through app and on their website. Nothing worked. Tried to find customer service but unable to on app or site. Now I can't cancel the subscription because that feature loops you around and around. When I tried to submit a ticket for support it tells me I need a valid email (which I am entering). I've wasted 3 days trying to figure all this out.

It works the same as every other calorie counter on here. Ultimately uninstalled because the endless pop-up ads trying to coerce me into buying premium are not only annoying but also majorly slowed down the app. EDIT: downgraded to one star because the automated "customer service" reply is a complete joke and just shows that all they care about is lining their pockets. Next time, try programming your bot to say a variety of phrases.

Used to love this app, but now it freezes and crashes all the time, typically after input of a food item when it wants to launch into a full page ad. Wish I'd never updated app. Now I hear scanning is going to cost $? Yeah, never updating this app again.

Soooooooo Slow. I used to love this app and was even paying for it. I'm migrating back to my fitness pal due to the slowness and, mostly, due to the terribly dismissive responses from tech support. Obviously others have mentioned the issues since the last update, don't try to make customers feel stupid because your app isn't working properly.

Been crashing ever since the new update. At first it just wouldn't let me log anything without freezing up now it won't even open the app even more. I'm not completely sure if it's not just my phone but none of my other apps have the same problem and I've read other people dealing with the same thing. Until lose it gets fixed I'm forced to download a different app. Which sucks because I've been using this app since June. Please fix it! Ã°Å¸â¢

Hi. Lose it app has been very very slow and stalling. At first I thought it was me. But... Then I downloaded the competition app and it's faster than idk what. I really love lose it but I'm REALLY tired of taking 10 minutes to add what I eat in my phone because it's a slow app. Like really.

Free version sucks. Just finished a plan and met my goal weight. I make small goals instead of big ones because it's easier to lose 10lbs and celebrate than to lose 100lbs. So I need to make a new plan to keep going and it's so hard to do.

I have attempted to put in a request for a refund through the app, it says a reason for requesting the refund is required but won't let me select anything to put the information in. I simply just want my refund, and the date it is to be charge to 10/6. I was under the impression it was monthly and was sorely mistaken.

A garbage app ran by garbage devs. This is the 3rd time this p.o.s. app has erased all my progress. These devs will happily take your money for everything (You get to pay for the barcode feature now! Hooray!), but they provide ZERO customer support when it hits the fan. I've deleted it off my phone and I suggest you turn around and download MyFitnessPal instead. One last shout out to the garbage devs! I know you all won't be but really you should be ashamed of yourselves.
They used to have a lot of great features for free, but have now locked all functionality behind a pay wall.

Garbage. Kept crashing in the middle of logging food. Finally became unresponsive and randomly logged me out. I uninstalled and reinstalled the app to find out that all my data was lost, including custom foods I've made for myself. Not synced to my account, not in a local cache, nothing. Went through troubleshooting process advised on loseit website to zero effect.
Hides option to unsubscribe from very heavy subscription fee. Removes features and gates them behind said predatory subscription fee. I would not recommend this app any longer for this reason.
Havent used for a while. Installed again amd old features like barcode scanning now locked behind a subscription.
Your latest update has made the app worse it is slower harder to type harder to upload and it freezes up more what you did is atrocious

Soooooooo Slow. I used to love this app and was even paying for it. I'm migrating back to my fitness pal due to the slowness and, mostly, due to the terribly dismissive responses from tech support. Obviously others have mentioned the issues since the last update, don't try to make customers feel stupid because your app isn't working properly.
They used to have a lot of great features for free, but have now locked all functionality behind a pay wall.

A garbage app ran by garbage devs. This is the 3rd time this p.o.s. app has erased all my progress. These devs will happily take your money for everything (You get to pay for the barcode feature now! Hooray!), but they provide ZERO customer support when it hits the fan. I've deleted it off my phone and I suggest you turn around and download MyFitnessPal instead. One last shout out to the garbage devs! I know you all won't be but really you should be ashamed of yourselves.

Free version sucks. Just finished a plan and met my goal weight. I make small goals instead of big ones because it's easier to lose 10lbs and celebrate than to lose 100lbs. So I need to make a new plan to keep going and it's so hard to do.

Used to love this app, but now it freezes and crashes all the time, typically after input of a food item when it wants to launch into a full page ad. Wish I'd never updated app. Now I hear scanning is going to cost $? Yeah, never updating this app again.

I only downloaded this app for the barcode scanner feature which my roommate ALWAYS used for free. But now it's apparently premium only and you have to pay for it. I wasted 30+ minutes setting up my profile for no reason. Do not install, samsung health serves the exact same purpose, but won't use up extra space on your phone. Ridiculous.
lagging all the time, not functioning well

Edit on 10/23/23 Having issues today and getting customer service is arduous to say the least. They emailed me. I responded and an hour has gone by with no response from them. Very frustrating. This kind of customer service is no appropriate. I had to uninstall the app. I reinstalled and it lost all my info. Not even realizing I'm a premium member. All of their fixes don't work! At this point I just want my money back. I'm over it.
Scanning is a premium feature.... uninstalled
The search function is extremely slow and the app crashes frequently
Hides option to unsubscribe from very heavy subscription fee. Removes features and gates them behind said predatory subscription fee. I would not recommend this app any longer for this reason.

Hi. Lose it app has been very very slow and stalling. At first I thought it was me. But... Then I downloaded the competition app and it's faster than idk what. I really love lose it but I'm REALLY tired of taking 10 minutes to add what I eat in my phone because it's a slow app. Like really.
Once you pay for the app it stops working. They won't issue a refund and it won't sync up ANY of my fitness apps. Customer service is AI or an unresponsive person. Either way, waste of 40 bucks.

Been crashing ever since the new update. At first it just wouldn't let me log anything without freezing up now it won't even open the app even more. I'm not completely sure if it's not just my phone but none of my other apps have the same problem and I've read other people dealing with the same thing. Until lose it gets fixed I'm forced to download a different app. Which sucks because I've been using this app since June. Please fix it! Ã°Å¸â¢

This completely stopped counting my steps and activities. I paid money for this, and despite what you dumb little neurotypicals think, YES, as a paying subscriber, I expect 100% uptime with zero issues. I expect 24/7 realtime customer service. I expect not to be blamed for the engineers' incompetence. This is my health, we're taking about here. It's not small, it's not inconsequential; it's important. I gave you money to help me be healthier, and you're refusing to do that.
crashing!
it started crashing out of nowhere everytime I search foods lol

I have attempted to put in a request for a refund through the app, it says a reason for requesting the refund is required but won't let me select anything to put the information in. I simply just want my refund, and the date it is to be charge to 10/6. I was under the impression it was monthly and was sorely mistaken.

It went over this amazing plan with me and I was feeling really hopeful because it was showing everything I wanted and after I filled everything out if said I had too pay or do a generic plan which really disguraged me, will not use again

It works alright the first year using it I went from 290 to 190 in a year. However, the ads are insufferably obnoxious and ultimately counterproductive to what they are selling. It also makes the app a chore to use. You get an ad practically everytime you go to the main screen and lately it's been running extremely slowly at unpredictable times but an ad drops right away so I'm inclined to blame that. I would give this app 5 stars for the success that i have had with it, but the ads let it down.

Too complicated. It seems to have extra features that some people would like, like lots of nutrients graphics, images of some foods, etc. But I wish I could set my own goals, and I absolutely hate having to answer all these life questions if I haven't used the app in a while. Why are you trying to lose weight? How do you feel? Etc. I just want a simple interface to count calories at my custom amount, maybe log weight, and make sure I get enough protein. I miss my old app that was discontinued.

Your app is driving me mad! I know it's free, but it's freezing EVERY single time I scan something. It's so bad I have to keep info open to force close and open every single time I scan. It even freezes up my phone briefly. I'm probably gonna switch to another app very soon. Samsung Galaxy S9, Snapdragon 845. This is still a pretty powerful processor.

Intrusive ads that take up the whole screen when you try to put in a meal? I close the app and come back. I don't mind the small ads in-between segments that take up only a fraction of the screen, but since the newest update, the fullscreen ads are too much. I've been using this app since 2018, and it's definitely put a sour taste in my mouth how hard you're pushing for people to pay for the service. No thanks.

I used to love this application because of it's fair premium price subscription compared to competitors and it's simple, utilitarian vibe. It honestly helped me lose 70 pounds. But lately it has been crashing on the most important of functions - adding a food. So disappointing that if this isn't fixed, I'm going to have to move to another service. In it's current buggy state, I would not recommend.

Used happily and successfully for many years. Didn't mind the ads until lately, they are now beyond intrusive, they hinder use of the app. Sadly deleted the app and am here shopping for an alternative. Yes, I tried the paid version for a year and did not need the features and can't justify the cost in my budget. Hoping to find an app that plays nice with Samsung.

I've used this app for years and I really like the usability and interface. It always allowed you to connect your fitness tracker to it to keep track of calories burned. Now all of a sudden you need to have a premium subscription to connect your tracker. Really disappointed and will probably use a different app now that has kept that as a free feature. Shame.

I've been using this app an extensive amount of time (6 years) and have found it very useful and easy to log both food and exercises. Recently, pop up ads had been introduced and are extremely intrusive. When adding an item an ad will pop up and only some of the ads are skipable. I completely get that it's in a businesses best interest to monetize but the number of pop ads have made it harder to justify the use of this app. Editing nutrition of an item after scanning it is also broken now.

Good-ish, but has some issues. It says you can adjust calories on the "daily calorie budget screen" by using the adjustment field... but that is not possible because there is no adjustment field. No mention that it is only for the premium service... So frustrating. Often gets stuck searching for a food. Some barcode scans can be adjusted which is helpful, but some are juat plain wrong and I cant adjust. Ugh.

Used this app several years ago to track carbs and meals. Bought the upgraded version even. Extremely annoyed to return to it to discover that most of the useful features (configuring meals per day, carb tracking, etc.) that used to be free are now behind an annual subscription, and no way to just go back to the old version where these things were free. Massively overpriced for annual as well. Greedy. I'll be saying "nope".

Very simple to use but, it can get a little tricky at times. I think it would be a much better experience if they added some features such as ... 1) CSV import/export for weight, 2) Sync water consumption with Google Fit (for premium users), 3) Add an app for WearOS smartwatches for quick & easy access, 4) Quick add option so it is faster and more convenient than searching for a specific item.

I used this program years ago on my computer and really enjoyed it. I reinstalled it today but I can't use it. I'm legally blind and if I have my font sizes turned up on my phone, it cuts text off Lose it or it still keeps much of the text at a default small size. This is just the lastest in a long line of apps with disappointing or non-existent accessibility features.

I loved this app. strongly visual and compelling for meal and nutrition tracking for weight loss. i had success! unfortunately it caused my pixel device to malfunction. issues included: No calls in or out, calls would freeze phone, froze and shut down System UI often, inability to play audio or any media, or use the microphone or record audio. i thought it was the phone, but unfortunately it was this app. i would give it more stars but that wasn't my personal experience

Basically a less useful version of MyFitnessPal I downloaded this because it was "editors choice." I wanted to like it because I find MyFitnessPal really judgemental with all it's terrible nutrition goals and its unalterable color coding. Lose It is definitely more neutral so that's a win. Unfortunately the take a picture of food feature doesn't really work. What I want is something using advanced image recognition to calculate the food and portion size. I expected less. I got even less.

This is a slick, but slow app that's free crippleware. I love the interface and selection of foods. The calorie counts seem about right. But slowness OMG. On my Moto G6 it takes forever to load, and the main screen freezes for about 20-30 seconds while it gets itself ready, even when switching between apps. The usefulness of the free version is crippled, but there's no realistic preview of what we're missing. In this genre, the $39/year premium fee is not expensive but too laggy to pay for.

Tracks you and your information just like any other invasive app. Disappointing that you cannot use the barcode scan feature without giving the app full access to your files and media. This hasnt always been the case. Years ago, when I first used Lose It, it didnt require anything but the camera. I understand that you have to get paid, but dang... Just show a commercial based on workout gear or something. You wouldnt even need to collect user data for that.

I liked the free version of the app, so I paid the yearly subscription. I like the ease of use and it definitely helps me keep my macros in check. However, the app is constantly crashing! I've uninstall/reinstalled several times. Not to mention, it seems to mess with some of my phone's functions. Not sure if I will continue to use the app or if I'll just cancel my subscription, delete the app, and move on.

After the past 2 updates the recipe logging is borderline unusable as it does not accurately calculate calories per serving because of this. Also, it has started frequently crashing in the background and android is flagging it as a high battery usage app. I loved this to start with as its helped me lose over 50lbs and want to get back to that again.

To many ads. With the recent update, an ad plays after every time you log anything. They decided to add this "feature", rather than fix any of the bugs (recipe sharing doesn't work half the time, sometimes typing the first number of a quantity is ignored, etc.) or adding features people have asked for (samsung health integration). I might be looking for an alternative app soon.

Bought this app and premium because its supposed to sync with fitbit. Tracking calories is good. But exercise, calorie burn, and water intake are not syncing from fitbit even with a forced sync. This is not what I expected, if I wanted to do double data entry, I could have kept the one I had. Not worth it, wasted the money on a premium feature thst doesnt exist!

Good, but crashing a lot lately, probably for the last six weeks or so. It's getting really annoying as it stops while I'm inputting my foods. It even stopped immediately after opening following applying the latest update. Uninstalled & reinstalled, but STILL constantly crashing. May have to cancel my subscription, which is a shame cause i really like the program.

Paid for this app to get Fitbit integration, yet the metrics don't even match up. Nowhere does it explain how it comes up with the calorie bonus it receives from Fitbit.. it isn't even a third of what I actually burn during exercise. Also.. the app has a major problem displaying current synced information off my fitbit. It's bad. Most times, not even half of the numbers get pulled over from Fitbit.. I have to pretty much manually go into each area of both Fitbit and Lose it apps before it finally updates all sections with info.. and even then it doesn't always work. And even then.. That calorie bonus makes zero sense. The confusing layout of this app is a mess. It needs a complete redesign overhaul. Have fun getting lost.

I've used the app for years off and on with the struggles of weight loss and stopping use in fits of depression. They keep removing features and putting them behind paywalls. You used to be able to track exercise, DEFINITELY so when I had an apple device with this app. It is a premium feature now. The user interface has become less friendly and dumbed down from the past. Currently looking for a more comprehensive free app for this. Dont take things away like that. Old pay features were fine.

It was helpful at first so i bought the $30 full version but it never worked for me after that, wouldn't connect to my Fitbit properly. I had to input stuff manually all the time. And it would crash and i would lose my records idk how it happeneded. Many of the food dont even have enough data, I lost all motivation to use it again. I purchased my subscription last June but i dont think i even used it after July. Waste of money. If you're going to use this, just use the free version.

I installed the app over a year ago. I immediately lost 10 pounds, and another 5 over the first month. I was enthusiastic. I am not fond of the constant pop-up asking me to pay for a premium account. Update:. After using the app for a year and a half, I have uninstall it. The constant pop-ups were annoying, but the last straw was when they made excersize a premium feature. Looking for something new.

It was nice, but didn't suit my needs. I'm trying to gain weight and it only gave me the option to maintain or lose. So my calorie goal was low and I was surpassing it everyday. Most features require you to upgrade to premium unfortunately. But it has a barcode scanner for easy tracking. Overall it's nice, but not suitable for my needs

I usually love this app, but every time it updates, I get a bug. It won't let me change my plan. First off, I set it to maintenance a month ago, but it always defaults back to losing 1.5 pounds a week when I log my weight. Now the option to change it is missing altogether. I can't even edit my goal weight. Edit: I was able to change it online, and the app reflected it. Still annoying, though.

App itself is fine. I use it daily and would have given it 5 stars for being easy to use and having a simple to read UI. I give it 2 because after one of the latest updates, it went from small ads that you could avoid to fill screen unskippable ads. It's clearly predatory. It's not enough that the pay version has tons of features, now they are trying to force it will massive ad vids. My advice is just close the whole app if an ad starts. Otherwise, use something else.

I loved it at first. Because weight is such a struggle, I started with a smaller goal, with the intention of later adding more. After reaching the first goal, I reset it to my new goal weight. I was prompted to choose "keep data" or "clear data." I chose "keep." My data was still erased. I was paying close attention to specific eating habits and foods, at the direction of a healthcare provider. Now I have lost nearly 2 months of food tracking, taking away valuable information for my next visit.

Works well enough and the food database is nice, but I don't need any of the paid features. Unfortunately, the app bothers me multiple times per day with a very intrusive reminder to subscribe. I'd be happy to pay a one time fee of $10-20 to support the app, but since subscribing is the only option, I might try to find another app that bothers me less.

I've been using the app for months now. It's gotten so much worse with each update. It took me two weeks to figure out how to find my groups. I can rarely make a post without an error message. After each update friends are unavailable. Messages to friends lag or disappear. I am really unhappy with the overall ease of access in this app.

Pretty let down by Lose It. I've been testing the waters to see if there was anything better than NyFitnessPal, and Lose it loses me with their lack of barcode widget. Instead, they decided to give app shortcuts to each meal... which is just extra taps in the end. Add a barcode scanner shortcut and show me how many calories I have left in my day without opening the app and I'd give it a higher review. These are basic asks and Lose It got lost in feature creep.

Switched to this app from MFP after their barcode scanner went premium. Everything was fine for about a week until the app started freezing and shutting down after every barcode scan. After I scan and save the food the app freezes and closes down every single time. I've updated the app, my phone, and restarted both. Hopefully they're working on this issue as it leaves the app nearly unusable.

I rated it two star because it is accurate, and it worked, but I want to make this notice for everyone. If you get a new device, you will lose everything you saved. There is no way around it. I spent 2 hours trying to get my info back and was unsuccessful. There is no help feature in basic mode, so I lost everything. With that in mind I am deleting this app and just use Samsung health.

Almost everything requires a pro upgraded account now. Used LoseIt for a couple years and stopped in 2016 after an update. Decided to return to try to lose some weight after becoming a Dad. I don't understand why good apps consistently get wrecked by UI changes and unnecessary features that cannot be turned off. Deleted and won't be back again.

This app would be much better if they would fix their intergration issues with other apps. I shouldn't have to wait days to see my exercise, if it shows up at all. I've tried multiple times to fix this using their support. It's just done poorly with absolutely zero effort of their part to keep and maintain a good product. Find something else.

I started using this app as an iPhone customer 3 years ago, and it was great. I had a premium subscription and used it a lot. But then I switched to Android before the end of the premium period and found that LoseIt premium wasn't anywhere near as useful on droid, and a lot of features were missing. Now I'm being badgered to upgrade to the now-useless premium every single time I try to log a food, and it's so relentless that I'm ready to delete the app and find another one.

I really liked the app at first so I went ahead a purchased the premium year membership. I didn't have access to Premium Content/ features after paying $30 for a premium membership. I even went through several trouble shooting steps with costumer service and nothing worked. Requested a refund. they can take the money out of the account immediately but it takes 2 weeks to put it back. highly unsatisfied. customer service was nice though.

Been a user for a long time and generally the app has been great and helped me lose weight. However it has a major bug that crashes the app whenever you import a recipe from link, which is major bummer. The bug has been there for at least a month. Will adjust rating once fixed.
App is slow and clunky now, didn't used to be. Was supposed to be the replacement for MyFitnessPal but at this point it might be worth it to just pay them instead. Ads after EVERY entry, ridiculous!

App updates makes it unusable, search lags on text input for 8-12 seconds per entry, most listings are empty when opening. Uninstalled and reinstalled, cleared cache and data, but nothing seems to fix. Otherwise app was great and performant.

Nice app...when it doesn't keep crashing. Constantly taking way too long to add food because it keeps stalling out every ten seconds. Other than that it is a nice app. If you want to spend half an hour adding food then go for it.
it's been slow, it keeps saying "cooking up an update every time I open the app or imput some food... I like this app and I wanna keep using but. not if this keeps happening

I bought the premium version to be able to connect to other apps. This feature doesn't work. I've tried to connect this app to Garmin Connect and Strava and they both fail. With Garmin I get an error that Garmin needs to connect to null. Like honestly, how do you miss the name of your own app? It's not a terrible app but definitely don't waste your money on premium. The features don't work like they advertise

The app is normally awesome. But what happened after the latest update? Sync between the android app and the website version is completely broken. There is also a glitch in the app when you scroll down, the calories bar keeps randomly moving very fast and most fields are unclickable. Please fix it^^
App is slow and clunky now, didn't used to be. Was supposed to be the replacement for MyFitnessPal but at this point it might be worth it to just pay them instead. Ads after EVERY entry, ridiculous!
it's been slow, it keeps saying "cooking up an update every time I open the app or imput some food... I like this app and I wanna keep using but. not if this keeps happening
Recently started freezing and working slow while trying to enter my meals

It works alright the first year using it I went from 290 to 190 in a year. However, the ads are insufferably obnoxious and ultimately counterproductive to what they are selling. It also makes the app a chore to use. You get an ad practically everytime you go to the main screen and lately it's been running extremely slowly at unpredictable times but an ad drops right away so I'm inclined to blame that. I would give this app 5 stars for the success that i have had with it, but the ads let it down.
I have the premium version and it's so laggy

App updates makes it unusable, search lags on text input for 8-12 seconds per entry, most listings are empty when opening. Uninstalled and reinstalled, cleared cache and data, but nothing seems to fix. Otherwise app was great and performant.

I really loved this app until a month ago. It suddenly became so unbearably slow. It takes 20-60sec for any search item to load. Regardless of wifi speed or data. I can't handle it anymore. You will be missed. I hope the bugs get sorted out.
Selecting certain foods makes the app crash. Tried to share a big report within the app but just opens the general "share" dialog, as if I'm sharing a file with a friend. Other than that, good app.

Barcode scanner behind paywall and inability to set custom macro targets. Preset macro targets also behind paywall. Did seem to have more takeout options than chronometer but going back to that as the tradeoff of more food options for less features isn't worth it to me.

Nice app...when it doesn't keep crashing. Constantly taking way too long to add food because it keeps stalling out every ten seconds. Other than that it is a nice app. If you want to spend half an hour adding food then go for it.
App is too good but from yesterday its crashing
App crash . Keluar sendiri

Too complicated. It seems to have extra features that some people would like, like lots of nutrients graphics, images of some foods, etc. But I wish I could set my own goals, and I absolutely hate having to answer all these life questions if I haven't used the app in a while. Why are you trying to lose weight? How do you feel? Etc. I just want a simple interface to count calories at my custom amount, maybe log weight, and make sure I get enough protein. I miss my old app that was discontinued.

Been a user for a long time and generally the app has been great and helped me lose weight. However it has a major bug that crashes the app whenever you import a recipe from link, which is major bummer. The bug has been there for at least a month. Will adjust rating once fixed.

I bought the premium version to be able to connect to other apps. This feature doesn't work. I've tried to connect this app to Garmin Connect and Strava and they both fail. With Garmin I get an error that Garmin needs to connect to null. Like honestly, how do you miss the name of your own app? It's not a terrible app but definitely don't waste your money on premium. The features don't work like they advertise
I love this app with the latest update it keeps crashing and it's frustrating.
There are issues with the app duplicating meals. Log your meal, come back later and the whole meal is listed as a Lose It previous meal. The web version is becoming my preferred method for logging.
Recently updated. Now my app crashes in the middle of creating recipes, losing all food scanned to the recipe, and the weight of the food. Please fix!
it's crashing :'(
Screen is jam packed with disabled premium features and ads for premium. Claims that your privacy is top priority but makes you make an unnecessary account.

Great app, if it actually updated the over-time tracking of protein & other metrics on dashboard when meals/recipes/weight edited. If it isn't tracking accurately, it does me no good. Mis-entered my weigh once, though corrected, it still says I gained 83 lbs in 1 day. Not pulling in Google fit data & I cannot delete custom recipes. Fix issues & I would rate it 5+! Plz add: track nutrition (iron/vitamins/minerals/nutrition) vs recommended daily allowance & vs recommended for post bariatric.

The app is normally awesome. But what happened after the latest update? Sync between the android app and the website version is completely broken. There is also a glitch in the app when you scroll down, the calories bar keeps randomly moving very fast and most fields are unclickable. Please fix it^^

made a rash decision to download this and subscribed to premium yesterday. They have you fill out a refund request form that requires a refund reason, but doesn't have a way to input one. Calorie counting can be really dangerous, and they don't have any information about how to try to stay safe about it. I really shouldn't have signed up based on the name itself, but it looked like an okay way to track food patterns. It's not worth the rest of the app to me.

Looks like a great app. But I researched beforehand to ensure I could use the IF feature and connect to my Fitbit. Only after I went through the whole 20-minute account creation does it tell me I have to pay for both of those. Nah ... That wasn't right to do. Will have to look at the other apps I first passed on.

Your app is driving me mad! I know it's free, but it's freezing EVERY single time I scan something. It's so bad I have to keep info open to force close and open every single time I scan. It even freezes up my phone briefly. I'm probably gonna switch to another app very soon. Samsung Galaxy S9, Snapdragon 845. This is still a pretty powerful processor.

Intrusive ads that take up the whole screen when you try to put in a meal? I close the app and come back. I don't mind the small ads in-between segments that take up only a fraction of the screen, but since the newest update, the fullscreen ads are too much. I've been using this app since 2018, and it's definitely put a sour taste in my mouth how hard you're pushing for people to pay for the service. No thanks.
I really loved this app. The tracking day streaks really helped me not quit. It kept crashing and crashing until finally it deleted all of my progress. If it got its stuff together I'd redownload it.

At first, all was great... I bought into the paid account. Then... It started to slow down and get glitchy. Now, it freezes and needs to be restarted frequently. I looked for a way to communicate with the developer, but failed to find any contact info... So... Here is my telling them it seems broken and I am no longer a happy customer.

Overall easy to use, but a major and much needed feature is absent here: the ability to collate notes, workouts and photos. There is no way to view or export notes, workouts performed or photos. You literally have to search day by day to find that info. I pay for Premium and due to that missing feature I am not renewing anymore. There must be a better app to really track all this.

Good app but really needs few features to be easier and reduce friction: a. Make sure we can filter items that only have a weight unit (I only want to see items that have grams for example at times to scale my calories), b. Allow to enter direct calories numbers instead of scaling to the units. Sometimes I know I am eating 240 calories of chocolate and I don't want to enter 8.237 units of a known chocolate item

I'm changing my rating to a 3* for the following reason: After using the app for 2+ yrs, I decided to try one of their pre-set plans, where I skip breakfast & fast a certain number of hours. The 1st time worked great, however the 2nd time I tried to implement the plan, I had issues. Ex.-If I completed my fast at 5pm and was ready to start again at 9pm - this option was not available. I could not start a fast on the same day I ended on. It needs to be more flexible. Maybe it's a technical issue?

I paid for a year because my daughter uses this app and I thought we could share things, but have regretted it since day 2. The scan feature is lacking. If I eat a bag of salad that is 100 calories per serving and the bag has 3.5 servings in it, and I eat the entire bag, I should be able to scan and say I had 3.5 servings. All of this input is grams ounces or pounds. The math that goes in to each of my foods eaten makes this not a helpful app. The UI is not very friendly. I disappointed.

In the past few months the app has slowed considerably when searching for foods or scanning barcodes. It used to be instant and now can barely do it. Intrusive full page ads are also ridiculous. Other than that the basic version has enough features to do what you need.

For calorie counting on its own, this is a great app. It is extremely intuitive and the systems it uses to recall data make it very easy to enter after you've been using it for a while. That said, it has gotten extremely aggressive in its sales pitch. Between the launch pop-ups, the "flash" sale ticker that has been going for months, and the full half of the data entry dashboard taken up to show upgrade features, the self-promotion is easily as intrusive as any ad-supported app I've used.

Hi! I have used this for several years. It used to be more user-friendly when trying to change grams to ounces or pieces, etc. Used to do automatic conversion when changed, too. Not anymore. This version has a bug trying to save nutrition updates manually input, especially if the item was originally scanned by the barcode. Irritating when you have done all the math and it throws the changes out, keeping the original data. Please fix these issues. Thanks!

This app is pretty good for the most part, but I have been having an issue for with the notifications for quite some time now. It used to give me the reminders at the wrong times, and now it doesn't even give me any reminders at all. The only somewhat of a fix I've discovered is to make a new account and then the push notifications will work for like a day maybe. It's frustrating too that the reminders can only be set for the beginning of the hour, so I usually have to wait to see if the notifications will even go thru. I've contacted Lose It Support about this issue, but it still remains unresolved. I'm really bad at remembering to log my meals so with this feature basically missing I can't fully recommend this app.

Just not what I was looking for. To be fair, I didn't give it enough time, but I found a couple of other apps for tracking keto specifically that impressed me more than this app. One thing in particular about this one was that it has a button or a gold key to unlock premium EVERYWHERE. It was just a little too cluttered with the focus of getting me to subscribe for me to put enough effort into trying the app. Sort of an "over selling" situation IMO.

Maybe I'm missing something, but there doesn't seem to be a way to enter fractions of servings? e.g. if a chocolate bar is 56g and I eat half, I need to do mental math (56/2 = 28g) instead of just entering 0.5 like I can in other apps. This really slows things down and I can forget to enter foods while trying to figure out the correct portion size of others :( otherwise great app. Edit: some foods do have an "each" or "serving" option which makes this slightly easier, but that's not great.

I really liked this app, it has helped me lose 15 lbs thus far. However, lately the app has been constantly loading and or freezing anytime I try to look up a food in the app. Because of this, I have been having to leave the app to look up how many calories my food has online to manually create food. This has become super inconvenient and really slows down the process. I'd like the option to search foods again.

This app is fine. I switched to this from MyFitnessPal a few months ago on a friend's suggestion. I loved their "pattern" recognition where it would notice I was more or less likely to go over or under calories with certain foods. However, they moved this behind a paywall. They also used to have more statistics and carb goals but then they moved those behind a paywall too. Almost every reason I was using this over MFP has been moved behind a paywall, and while I'd be happy to watch some ads or something to unlock features for the month that's not an option. I'm moving back to MFP because, while I think this is a better app for paid users I am not one. Now the free version is just a tracker with less features than MFP. Good app, stable, great pay features but too hollow as a free tracker.

The premium features sound interesting, but while I would be willing to pay a monthly subscription (right now $2.50 per month) for the premium features, I don't want to pay for an entire year (on sale right now for $30) at once and up front. If a reoccurring monthly subscription is ever offered I might reconsider this app, but not now for $30 up front. The free features seem accurate and easy to use, and I consider this free app a good choice for nutrition management as is.

The app is good at what it does and easy to use: entering foods is simple. The confusing interface beyond entering foods leaves a lot to be desired, and dealing with a pop up add for the paid version every single time you open the app is exceptionally tiresome. It's a shame that there are not more options available for simple calorie counting.

Basic version is about useless. If you want people to try your premium product give them a free trail THEN give them the option to upgrade. That is not what this app does. It gives you the basic version which pretty much only tracks calories and if you want more features you have to pay $40 for a year. Yes, it is a trail but how many people remember to discontinue their free trail after the 7 days is up? Very few. That is the business model here. If you have a product you are proud of, show us.

I have used this app for 3 years or more and have loved every bit of it! HOWEVER. after this latest "update" the app crashes. ALOT. I have an andriod. i try to open my account info, crash. Change a date to begin carb counting, crash. Try to imput a food, crash. And when i try to send feedback, even that crashes. Im trying to stick with it the best i can, but if this continues i will not be continuing my subscription when the time comes.

Quite decent app, with one problem. Please allow removal of those "upgrade to unlock" features from my view and leave those options in a settings hub or something. Seeing them once is enough and if I don't want to unlock, I don't want to unlock. If I want to, I'll go to the settings to add them. Those "features" being in the view every day is annoying and distracting. They make the app feel a lot worse. Other than that, it's a good app. Easy to use.

Love it. Great app with great features! Makes it really easy to keep track of stuff though and the search feature is awesome! The bad: Premium is an annual subscription so I'll never end up buying it. If it was a one time fee I could understand, but any subscription based app, regardless of features, at $20 a year seems a bit greedy. Shame cause I really like the app. Maybe they'll have a $5 and $10 one time fee tier that maybe just has less stuff but opens up more content.

The scanning of barcodes was slow and their database does not include grams for some foods when entering foods. How can an app even call itself a calorie counter and not have the grams for butter (Smart Balance actually) in their database? This is supposed to make it easier to track your calories. How is having to measure the butter for your toast out in teaspoons easier?  I also find the interface when entering food to be confusing. The designers did not take into account that when the text entry field is active, half of the screen is taken up with the keyboard and it covers up all of the options they show you from prior meals.  It also has the same perverse obsession that all of these apps with classifying food intake according to breakfast, lunch, and dinner. But I did not take any stars off for that since that seems to be a pandemic problem in all of the counters.   One star off for the clunky interface that does not focus on what they user actually wants to see and one off for a database that lacks important data.

It was great. But the changes they keep making, make it worse. I'm about to delete it and use another app mid diet. The changes are never better. It's like whoever is in charge of updates is desperately trying to make it look like his job is needed. I don't think they've ever heard of "don't fix what ain't broke". Each new change is really glitchy and you lose the ability to use useful features. The goals update is the worst update so far.

I really enjoy this, makes keeping track of everything quite easy, and it does all the counting for you. However all of a sudden the fat carb and protien tracker wont show me how many grams I've had a day, have had the app for not even a full week yet and all my tracking of those are gone/hidden. If it's a premium feature I wasnt made aware upon downloading, and if it stays that way I'll saddly have to find a new app to track these things. Other than that it's very user friendly

Great before the photo update. I loved being able to drag my finger across my weight chart and quickly see what my weight was on a certain date. Now it just annoyingly brings up a prompt to add a photo no matter what I tap. Sure, add new features, but not at the expense of old useful ones. Will probably cancel my subscription in January before it renews since the old weight timeline display was one of my favorites across all weight management apps.

Works great... Sometimes. It's a pretty good app it's very colorful I like that aesthetic. It's having a lot of technical issues at the moment. often I am getting stuck on certain pages it's not swapping back and forth from days very cleanly. For example I work second shift so the way I log means I may behind the actual when it's 3 in the morning and I'm logging. Another issue is its if you accidentally log something for breakfast that's lunch you can't just drag that item to the lunch slot.

It's OK. I stopped using the app back in 2018 and recently reinstalled it. It does what it says but the look is off putting. It's very cluttered with so many grayed out items it looks like the the app is broken. I know revenue is generated by ads and subscriptions but if 100% ad clicking and subscriptions are the goal for all your customers I'll likely go with another app recommended by a friend. Again, the app does what it says. It's easy to enter meals and track exercises (Jan 2021 on S20)

Look, I really like this app. Unfortunately ever other thing I look at in it is something telling me how I should upgrade. Please give me the ability to remove the adds. I'm NEVER going to pay for an app annually. If you want to charge to unlock for features that are basically addition, subtraction, and sorting, fine, I'll pay once for that, but please stop accosting me ever time I open your app or add a meal to upgrade. It's really annoying. Other than that it's really a great app.

This once was a great app. It has a lot of features, but now the free version is getting more and more ad heavy. The database is now so cluttered with inaccurate data that every time I scan a food I have to double check against the product nutrition label, and often make corrections. I am searching for an alternative app.

Having very frustrating issues with setting servings for saved recipes. The serving size is showing as the total calorie count of the recipe regardless of it being 1 or 1,000 servings. The calories per serving never change on the recipe but if you add it to your daily meals, a 1,000 total calorie recipe with 8 servings will come up as 8,000 calories per serving. This is a very irritating bug that has been happening intermittently nearly the entire six months I've been using this app.

Don't pay for the upgrade premium!! It promises extra features, but they disappear when I upgraded. I regret paying the subscription, and just kept the free option. App in general is great, I'm just disappointed that the extra features don't exist. I sent an email 2 days ago and still haven't received a response.

Some useful features that I really like but I really don't like that your macronutrient levels (shown as percent/grams for fat, carbs, and protein) are inaccurate. E.g. 90g of fat being shown as 31% of my daily when I calculate it as only 16% independently. There is no option to list a goal as gaining weight either only maintaining or losing. Also, on the daily and weekly breakdown chart of your nutrients the numbers for some rows are white text on a white background and cannot be read?

Even without paying, it is a nice app for calorie tracking and weight loss plans. However, I would like to be able to see possible badges to earn instead of randomly finding out I earned something. Challenges are also hard to impossible to access as the search feature is not working, so you're stuck with the top options.

I purchased the Pro version to get the exercises. However, the pictures are so blurry you cannot tell what you should be doing. I emailed them but no response. Also bar code scanner is slow to come up. Calorie tracking is good & is on the free version. Overall, for me, it's not worth what I paid for the upgrade.

Just started using this tracker app and committed to a year of the premium version. Thought the price was worth it for a year. App feels a little cluttered doesn't have that intuitive feel. Biggest complaint is that it doesn't stnc with my Samsung watch for gathering data. Would definitely increase rating if it would sync with my Samsung watch.

I could like this app better if it did a few more things, like track my water for the day and some of the things my friends say it used to do. Now we have to pay extra for almost every feature and apparently can ONLY do that thru the app, not in the play store on a computer. For those of us who are a bit old school and don't believe phones should be wallets, this has me looking at other apps.

Mediocre in every way. The UI is good and I like the idea of having fasting tracking in the app, however... One of the most important features of any food diary is the ability to manually edit your calorie and macro targets. This app puts those behind a paywall. While the premium is very affordable, I'll just find another app. Also the library of foods isn't that extensive vs competitors. If you're looking for the next serious food tracker after MFP made their app unusable then look elsewhere.

Not a bad app but not the best. What I really need is to see how many macros I actually have left without having to click on them individually. That would be extremely helpful. I see what they did with displaying them when you click in them but I'd love to he able to open my log and see how much more of each that I need to eat. The database has almost everything in it that you can imagine. I am a premium user because on black Friday it was on sale for $20 for a year. Too cheap to pass on. I'll put up with my small gripes but aside from that it's a good app.

This app is easy to use and helps keep me on track. Recently my update added full screen adds with sound that pop up after adding meals. Beyond obnoxious! I prefer the ads on the bottom of the screen or smaller adds between the sections of meals. The full screen ads interfere with me adding items and discourages me from using.

It feels like a very good college project. There are crashes that annoy me, such as when I'm trying to upload a photo and the app dies because it's too big. There is unverified food that is ridiculously incorrect and a default "share my food" option that is probably to blame. Auto adding food to recipes is hard because I have no idea if they added verified food or not. Let me drag and drop food between meals. Let me add a timestamp to a calorie entry. Perk: it's cheaper than other apps.

I met my weight loss goal of 45 pounds with this app without spending a penny. EDIT: Still using this app to this day, but I'm frustrated with how ads have been added to the user interface and play after recording meals. Not user friendly. Not only that but they've started multiple 3-day long sales since the ads have been introduced around 3 weeks ago, it's definitely on sale more than not. TLDR: App is good, monetization isn't. Sell premium with features, not annoyance. Dropping some stars.

I have used this app for a long time and used to tell everyone about it but now I've stopped spreading the word. It was streamlined and easy to use. With each upgrade it has become more cluttered and difficult to find what you're looking for. I still use it and think it's the best free app out there but I am frustrated every time I try to review goals/set a new one. I wish I had the ability to "turn off" features and options I don't want to see.

I am enjoying this app so far to help keep track of what I eat but I wish for the fraction to reach more over than Ã¢â¦Å¾ in measuring food. A fine example is pizza or sometimes some of the multiple foods that are similar are a bit confusing because of the calories are different. But overall it is a decently good app except some things like the fractions need and calorie calculations need work.
App has declined significantly over the years. Used to be quick to look up items, but now it is so slow and freezes up a lot. Works good though when it does work. The free version is all I use.
The app keeps saying "Cooking up and update" aka loading window since for a day now and I'm a paid subscriber. The app features are handy.
Used to work great, but recently it started running so slowly while entering logs it's become borderline unusable.
Used to be good. Now poor performance (slow). Food database is filled with junk!
Decent but crashes like nobody's business. It slows down and then crashes. Needing to be uninstalled and installed again. Over its nice.
The app is running slower and slower by the day

At first, all was great... I bought into the paid account. Then... It started to slow down and get glitchy. Now, it freezes and needs to be restarted frequently. I looked for a way to communicate with the developer, but failed to find any contact info... So... Here is my telling them it seems broken and I am no longer a happy customer.
Changed my review. It's still worthy of 5 stars, but as of the last week, it has been super laggy and unresponsive when I go to search and enter food.

Overall easy to use, but a major and much needed feature is absent here: the ability to collate notes, workouts and photos. There is no way to view or export notes, workouts performed or photos. You literally have to search day by day to find that info. I pay for Premium and due to that missing feature I am not renewing anymore. There must be a better app to really track all this.
Love the app. After the update it freezes and disappears.

I've been using this app for a year, and it has been very helpful. But, the app hasn't been functioning properly for about 2 weeks. It is taking forever to log my food. I use to get on the app and be done in 30 seconds now it takes 2 to 3 minutes due to the lag. Thinking of switching apps
Great but extremely laggy after recent update

Good app but really needs few features to be easier and reduce friction: a. Make sure we can filter items that only have a weight unit (I only want to see items that have grams for example at times to scale my calories), b. Allow to enter direct calories numbers instead of scaling to the units. Sometimes I know I am eating 240 calories of chocolate and I don't want to enter 8.237 units of a known chocolate item

Using the paid version and since the last update, after every barcode scan the app freezes I have to force close and restart app. Weird thing, it adds the food I scanned. Please fix this. Afterall I am paying for this.

Really good with a lot of option. But the app is very buggy. The top bar that shows your consumption acts like it has a seizure, and when that happens you basically need to scroll down and press a very laggy and specific button just to log your meal. I am adding only 3 stars due to this since if your main feature is that busted, then it is a problem. I will update it if it ever gets fixed.

This app does everything I want and displays everything in a nice way. My only real issues are the ads and the performance. It's just so slow. Everything stutters and freezes and bounces around so I click on the wrong thing, which makes it take even longer. I'm using the free version so I can't really complain about ads, but full screen video ads after entering a meal are pretty intrusive. It never used to be this bad so I'm removing a star.

Love this App! Used the premium version about a year or so ago, but has some features i didn't really need. Currently using the free version. It would be nice if there was a lifetime premium available similar to the ad removal. Having a monthly or annual payment is ridiculous.
This is a good app but lately it's buggy. Every time I scan something it freezes and force stops. Please fix

In the past few months the app has slowed considerably when searching for foods or scanning barcodes. It used to be instant and now can barely do it. Intrusive full page ads are also ridiculous. Other than that the basic version has enough features to do what you need.

Delete Creepy DMs-- maybe I'm missing something but it doesn't seem that there is any way to delete the messages that you get from "friends". If they comment on a post and it's weird, yes you can delete it. But if they send you a direct message you don't want to ever see it again you have no option that I can see to remove the message... I am contemplating deleting app even after I pay for a subscription just because I don't want to see these types of messages...

I paid for a year because my daughter uses this app and I thought we could share things, but have regretted it since day 2. The scan feature is lacking. If I eat a bag of salad that is 100 calories per serving and the bag has 3.5 servings in it, and I eat the entire bag, I should be able to scan and say I had 3.5 servings. All of this input is grams ounces or pounds. The math that goes in to each of my foods eaten makes this not a helpful app. The UI is not very friendly. I disappointed.

Started using this app at my doctor's request. Like the ability to scan a bar code and having the nutritional information come up. Considered upgrading from Lose it free to the premium, decided against it as it's a yearly subscription rather than a one time payment.

I'm changing my rating to a 3* for the following reason: After using the app for 2+ yrs, I decided to try one of their pre-set plans, where I skip breakfast & fast a certain number of hours. The 1st time worked great, however the 2nd time I tried to implement the plan, I had issues. Ex.-If I completed my fast at 5pm and was ready to start again at 9pm - this option was not available. I could not start a fast on the same day I ended on. It needs to be more flexible. Maybe it's a technical issue?

I like this app better than FitnessPal now only because you can still use the scanning feature. However, I wish I could synch my Galaxy Samsung watch. You'd think that would be a top choice for wearable by now. PLEASE ADD SAMSUNG WATCH!

I've been planning to rate this five stars but haven't taken the time to rate it untill now. But by now, when I finally am takeing the time to rate I've been disappointed. I still love the app it is very helpful in tracking calories and nutrients to get me the results I want. The reason I give it four stars is that, for some reason the app has become very slow. I don't think the problem is my phone because lose it is the only thing affected. It often freezes up and is "not responding".

I've used the free version of this app off and on for years. I'm now seriously working on some health issues by changing my diet. I need to be able to input homemade recipes in order to get correct calories, sodium, protein, etc. The ads didn't bother me. I'm trying Premium for one year to see if it's worth it; if it makes entering recipe content easier.

It's a great alternative to MyFitnessPal. It scans UPC codes, which is convenient. It also had the option to take photos of food, but it doesn't work well, and I would recommend they remove it to save on resources. The app freezes when certain things are clicked - even the link to get the premium version freezes and I need to force close the app. Otherwise, I felt envoy using the app, and no longer use MyFitnessPal (which is insanely expensive, and its free version is limited).

Best app I have tried for tracking so far. Could use some expansion in devices and apps it connects to, and refreshes could be quicker and easier, but the app is intuitive and simple to use. They are planning to remove their badges, which unfortunate as it is a popular feature for beginners to get them moving.

The free version is excellent. I love the food tracking features including the food lookup abilities. I also love the progress graphs for your weight over time-it helps with motivation. I just don't like how frequently it bugs you to upgrade to premium. I have upgraded in the past and haven't found the added features very useful, but maybe that is just me. I wish they had a "don't ask me again" button instead of asking you to upgrade each time you sign in.

I got the pro version for a year and the app works great for what it's meant. I'd love to see under the "Health" option, along with the water/step/weight tracker, a multivitamin tracker. Just as an additional option, such as the water goal, to be able to keep track of everything in one place. The look of the app (visual, not layout) could use a little work to be more visually appealing as well, but the way it looks now isn't an issue as the features make up for it.

I really like this app. It has helped me lose about 15 pounds in about two months just by being a great food journal. The search capability is great and, if you're super small, you can input your own food items work nutrition information. I only gave it for stars because it keeps asking me to upgrade and I feel like there should be a snooze button on that advertisement for a week after someone clicks "no thanks".

The free version of this app is really good at what it does. I upgraded to the premium version, which is garbage, it crashed repeatedly and I was unable to access the information I upgraded to see, plus a bunch of features require linking to other devices and services that I don't own. Download this and don't upgrade it and it's great for tracking calories.

I have used the paid version for almost 3 years. No experience with the free version. It is fantastic for recording food intake, particularly after developing some history since you can easily select food or whole meals you regularly consume. The app is updated regularly. The reason I gave it 4 stars is that changes suddenly appear and you have to figure out how to use the changed features. Right now the history features have changed and are less useful than when I first started with the app.

Great software. Lose It helped me get my calories under control and I lost 36 pounds and feel so much better. My BMI is now normal and I look and feel great. The UI is intuitive and clean and the free features are good. They have a great food database and the search and auto complete are decent. Also they let you scan barcodes, which is very helpful. Regular ads are not obtrusive. Lows- premium feature ads are annoying. Also their maintaining weight recommendations are too high.

I've been logging for over 230 days and I've definitely lost weight in part to the app (around 20 lbs). It's great to be able to see a number and get a more realistic idea of the energy count of the food I eat. App is easy to use compared to similar apps. A bummer is there are features on the iversion that aren't available on android, like the ability to copy one of your own recipes and the constant updates are nice, but sometimes they break the app and take up a lot of space

Great tool to get STARTED on a healthier lifestyle! I could never get the ball rolling & would always fail right away on my own. The food tracking feature is fun to do & helps you keep putting one foot in front of the other in more ways than one. I like to challenge myself to keep doing better: meal by meal; day by day; and so on to truly create a healthier CHANGE in habits. I read the community support system several times a day. It's filled with tips & pointers & inspiration.

I've actually lost weight using this, which I am flabbergasted by. I would definitely recommend, but just remember to not get overly obsessed with counting calories, and remember that you should also be considering your macros, not just calories! Overall, a great app that's really helped me improve a lot, and I'm planning to continue! Edit: since the new discover update came out, it won't load groups, social, or inbox. Before mine crashed I saw others saying they had difficulty loading as well.

I like LoseIt better than My Fitness Pal. For me, it's easier to use, but they could make some of the features a little smoother. Like being able to edit your custom foods without creating an additional food. Or having to switch back and forth between Search and My Foods when trying to log meals. Other than that, this app is awesome! Would definitely recommend.

Customer/technical support is amazing. I love the app, it has a ton of great features but it could be a little more organized. If I want to create my own food to log for a day, it's difficult to find. The food database is submitted by users so many of the foods are missing nutrition info. And only have calories. If every entry could be verified with calories, carbs, fats, etc. It would be friendly to keto folks, macro folks, calorie counting folks, etc.

As far as calorie tracking goes, this is my favorite app. There's a huge database of foods and the UPC scanner works great. Some of the features are buggy. I added my husband as a friend, which was a bit of an effort, but the real drag was my inability to share recipes with him. Like, the option is there, but it doesn't follow through. He never received the recipes I sent. Other than that, I love it.

I'm currently using the free version of this app and I really love it. The layout and features are exactly what I was looking for. It makes keeping track of your weight and eating habits a breeze. One thing I wish it did - where it shows you your weight record it would be nice if the app calculated how much I lost/gained since my previous weigh in. On another note, I am trying to purchase the full version of the app but it won't let me. I have tried updating the app and restarting my phone.

Trying to lose weight. Formerly used My Fitness Pal and thought it was a great help. It has changed quite a bit since I've used it. Even though both apps charge for their "premium" services, I can still scan with lose it which helps a great deal so that it is the exact food I consumed. This is my first week using it, but, I am very satisfied with the app. It is exactly what I needed and as long as the scan feature stays (and anything extra is a bonus) I will remain satisfied!!

This app fulfills everything I need it to do. But here's the thing, having the premium offer pop up every day I start the app is not going to convince me to upgrade. Annoyingly redundant when there's a"go premium" button at the top, golden keys, and padlocks over any premium feature. I don't need to be asked everyday to upgrade. Most of us using the app are not oblivious to the option to upgrade, we simply don't want to.

I am using the free version of the app. I like it so far. I enjoy the ease of using the app. I like the icons they show for the food, it gives you a nice visual besides numbers and words. I like the badges they give you, it is a nice touch. I also like checking in on the social feature. What i don't like is when you start a new day it takes a while for the date to switch over. i also don't like that their exercise calories spent are different than the planet fitness machines. i have to tweak the

I am a 55+ male and used Lose It! to lose 30 lbs in 5 months spanning the holidays. It is very good and easy to use, The paid version integrates my fitness watch. The food database, barcode scanner, and ability to store recipes makes tracking calories easy. With a few enhancements, it could be great! The food database allows the user to enter a food item by only one type of measurement: count (e.g. number of pretzels), volume (e.g. cup, teaspoon), or weight (e.g. grams, ounces). The nutritional information is often provided for at least two of these types. Further, when searching the database, it is unclear which of these entries will be useful for the measurement you have. The other issue is the unfortunate emphasis on "net calories", those consumed vs burned. When looking at your personal history, it is difficult to distinguish between a day on which you simply sat around and starved yourself versus a day in which you took a long hike and ate a hearty meal. The latter contributes more to overall health and should be more easily displayed and tracked. The app also provides the ability to look at your food history to see where you get your calories and the balance of your nutrition. These features are interesting and informational, but not as critical as the shortcomings expressed above.

Writing down my meals daily has been very motivating. I like Lose it because it is easy to search for the nutritional value of most of my meals, however the nutrition value of many food items are not complete or have not been verified by Lose it. So I find myself checking for myself. Also more instructions are needed for recording your meals. You eventually figure it out, but you end up using the Save feature erroneously at first. Still, it is a very good app for weight loss goals.

Love this app!! I have tried other apps, but this is the best I've tried. Very easy to use. Love that I can just log quick calories if I don't want to enter a new food. The database for restaurant foods seems to be pretty accurate. I would have rated it a 5 a couple of weeks ago, but they took away one of my favorites features, which was the quantity "spin" feature. Now you have to enter fractions on your own. So now if I eat 3/8ths of something, I have to figure out for myself what that is to enter. Sounds like a silly complaint, but fractions have never been my strength. Other than this one little thing, it's the best app around!!!

Been using free version for about one week. Like the UI, extensive data base, graphs. Am considering up grading to premium, but I have encountered some inaccuracies in the calorie counts - one as much as 50 cal difference. All have been under calculated. Wonder if all the other macro would be off as well? These errors were also noted as "verified" . If the database is not trustworthy there's no point in paying for premium which is a shame because I really am interested in the extra features.

I like this app. Do I love it? No. But it's adequate for starting out on my health journey for now. I use the free version, which allows me to track my exercise, weight, what I eat (calorie count) and also see my daily food intake divided into fat, protein, and carbs. The "upgrade to unlock" parts are a little in your face, as well as the frequent "sales" for premium, etc. It would be nice to not have the premium features on your dashboard. But overall it's doing what I need.

Update: Trying to unsubscribe from the yearly fee crashes the app. (Did it via desktop website) I did the yearly program which unlocks a lot of insightful things. I like that it tracks progress, goals, and shows you calorie counts, but I am not a fitness person so I may be missing features or where it could be improved. I'm just taking the app at face value & following its suggestions. One thing that's cool is that you can just scan UPC codes of the food container and add it to your meal.

Lose it has really helped me. I have lost over 10 lbs. I would love to have the premium subscription, but I can't afford all of it at once. If they broke it up into 2 payments, I would do that. Adding a new recipe is confusing and I if I mess up, I have to start all over, I can't delete an ingredient after I save it. Also the weight loss configuration does not account for body frame.

I love the app. But I've had the small problems that drive me crazy. All of a sudden every couple of days I no longer can get to my groups app it shuts off the app when I try to tap on it. Now my steps are not being automatically recorded. I'd love to know why that's happening. Cancelled the app and reloaded it and it still giving me a problem as far as the steps.

This really does help me stay accountable. Very easy to use. Saves meals for easy reuse (rather than entering each item all over again). The bar code scanner works great. They have most restaurants/brand name foods. Lets you track macros. My only wish is that I could meal plan my days for a week at a time without paying for premium as the other features arent that exciting for me. Otherwise love it.

I had stopped keeping track of my meals, but when I did, it was extremely easy because my usual Foods were right there for me to add again at new meals. The delete feature is helpful and easy when I made a mistake and put it on the wrong Meal. I continued keeping track of my weight daily which is important for me as it is an easy system for being accountable to myself!
