App keeps crashing!! I can't even open it anymore and have a paid subscription. This has been happening for about a week now. Very disappointing.

Everytime I try open the app it gives me the option to log in with Facebook or email and everytime I click either it lags out. I haven't even gotten to try the app because I'm unable to get far enough in it to try it. I've restarted my phone, I've uninstalled and reinstalled. Idk what the issue is..

Anytime I try to click on something thats in my saved list of things I've scanned, so that I can see the ingredients and their ratings; the app crashes and my phone tells me the app has a bug and to wait til developer has created a fix. Can we please get this fixed? I love this app and its been helping me change to healthier products.

For the most part I really like this app, but until it stops working so inconsistently I will not be paying for the full features. I can usually get five scans out of it before the app goes offline and won't respond. Wifi and full service doesn't matter and it won't work again until I've force quit it half a dozen times. Really adds a lot of time to grocery shopping. Another feature I'm hoping to see added is identification of seed oils. Right now it still shows those foods as good options.

This app is very inconsistent when you use the search feature. I looked up an inkey list product and got mixed results. One said it was excellent and others said it was bad. For a paid experience I expected more. Maybe I am using it wrong. Also, there A LOT of main stream products that do not show up in the search feature which is the main reason I went on and paid for premium version. Overall, I am pretty disappointed that I spend the money.

Great concept, execution could be improved. The scanner is very unreliable. It doesn't know if the picture is in focus or within a good distance, and it doesn't have an UI for me to help out. You'd need a lot of free time and patience standing in the grocery store trying to scan products correctly. At which point just Googling the product is faster. Also doesn't seem to work for non-american products.

Helpful with most products I own so far but there are some that are not in the app. I have scanned and added a few so I like that feature and that they add it with the new info pretty fast. This app has informed me of ingredients I wasn't aware were harmful. What I don't like is that you cannot manually type in to look up products by name without using a barcode in the free version. Some products I look up online don't have an image of their barcode for me to scan.

This app is convenient for looking up and learning ingredients to avoid allergies, but the ratings are so unreliable. It mind blows me how they would rate a makeup product "poor" just from having a single essential preservative. They don't take into account the dose. Also some foreign products are rated "good" when the ingredient list isn't even complete. It's like all the database is manually updated by users, and reviewed by robots.

Good app, but needs inprovements. It's fantastic that it shows the additives in items and their inherent risk, however the app should show full ingredients as well. Food labels can be a difficult to read due to the small fonts, so seeing them on the app would be great, simply saying "some vegetables" is not good enough. Maybe show more nutritional info too like RDA etc. I also recommended the dev responds to reviews. As it stands not worth paying for, but a solid 3.5 stars and has potential

This is a great app, but one thing could be improved. I saw many products that have ingredients missing because someone didn't scan properly. Then you have an option to report a problem, and you have the option to scan the package that has ingredients in it. And here is the problem, because there is no option to choose between flat or round packaging. Last time, I reported a change, scanned round package, and still ingredients were missing because I could only upload one photo.

I paid for premium. I am going to give it a year to see if the issues with the app are fixed. Some of the descriptions don't match the product. I scanned fish seasoning and it said it was alcohol. Multiple entries for a product. One says Excellent but with no ingredient list while another says Bad with ingredients. It doesn't list Talc as a harmfull ingredient which is frustrating as that is what led me to wake up to the fact that there are harmful chemicals in our products and download the app.

Its great if you have knowledge of nutrition. I wouldn't recommend otherwise. I like the feature that explains additives and their risks, although some information does seem biased and there's a lot of 'may', 'might', 'could' etc. I'm not a huge fan of the ranking system. I've had things rank amazingly because theyre low in calories despite being nutritionally inadequate and had things that are much more substantial rank low because they're higher calorie or have naturally occurring sugars.

Was so good, but now it constantly crashes. Even when I'm navigating other apps on my phone and it runs in the background, I get pop ups that it stopped working. I've done the "send feedback" option a few times now. It's been a while since this app had an update, it really needs one.

The app is great when it is working. Recently there have been a lot more crashes and continuous loading spinner. I've even tried reporting this as a problem in the app but it kept crashing. Not sure what happened but I am paid for the premium level.

Wonderful idea for an app. I would be happy to pay for the full version of this app if it was more accurate. Some additives that they list as NO RISK have many risks. Also they don't put much negative weight on high fructose corn syrup. Which everyone knows is horrible for your health. Scanned water case = 100/100 bottle =71/100. Same water. There are many issues like those. I hope they keep improving the information on this app because it has the potential to be amazing!!

I wish you could put in your own goals,, I'm trying to get healthier after an ed relapse and I'm struggling to eat anything. Everything I've scanned is "a bit too caloric" which is really stressing me out. Like pistachios are rated as excellent but "a bit too caloric" serving size is 150 calories which I think isnt bad for a meal but I don't wanna have any now because I don't know? Seeing that is causing me more issues than its solving so idk if I'll actually be able to keep using the app :o/

Great App if it works. It crashes ALOT. That's why I gave 3 stars. Since they are independent, I trust them enough to give unbiased reviews of products. I pay for the full version. I hope the bugs will be straightened out soon.

Great Concept but....... it has too many duplicate products one saying good and the other one bad. It get very confusing. Also the products recommendation don't match the orginal product genre. Great idea just needs work.

It's useful although unreliable. Some products on this app are apparently carsonagenic for example it says salicylic acid isn't very good and that it could be dangerous although there's not scientific proof it has any issues , a bit disappointed and as someone with Paranoia i know it would have me think my whole house was unsafe , I scanned multiple items and it seems to say that the only safe things to eat or drink is water and apples . Even if soemthing has other nutritional values

The item descriptions seem a little biased... If it's not made from water, flour, oil, etc... "It's bad for you." Plus, the addition of a missing item is tedious telling me that I input the wrong unit of measure for calories... Uh, okay?

Excellent food scanner, it very seldom fails to get the correct product with all the associated nutritional content. Have you thought about maybe adding the ability to save the products scanned to a csv file to export to a spreadsheet? I'm thinking for keeping track of all the food in your cupboards around the kitchen and freezers

Fantastic app, but does need a way to add custom weightings.. eg as a diabetic id love to be able to weight sugar even harder than it is in the app... Also doesn't distinguish between good fats in say organic coconut flakes and bad fats. As others have mentioned would also be good to be able to negatively weight some ingredients that you were allergic to. I really should rate this 5 stars as it is generally an awesome app, but just a reflection that's a few extra features would make it +++

Great app, tells you which additives can cause you problems in food and cosmetics, used this to pick my shower gel, shampoo and deodorant today :) been using a couple weeks and love it, it could do with having a bit bigger data base but it's amazing for a small team!
search hostory os missing, it would a great feature to add. otherwise it's just perfect

Great app. Missing Compare feature. Sometimes I pick up two similar items (for example two types of milk) and although I can scan and analyze each, it would be great if there was a Compare feature where I could scan two items and it would show me their analysis side by side. Right now, I have to memorize the numbers of one and then compare to the other one. Thanks

I really like this app and use it a lot. My main complaint is that sometimes the ingredients are inaccurate when they are printed in multiple spots on the product. (Such as "active ingredients" and "inactive ingredients".) When I try to report these listings, I often get told theres no problem, even though some of the ingredients are missing. My other complaint is that there are a LOT of duplicate, inaccurate entries by other users. It makes the search function frustrating.

Yuka is excellent at telling you which ingredients are bad and why. The recommendations feature now works for me and is very useful. However, the categorisation of foods as good or bad based on sugar/calories has the potential to be harmful. It would be great if they added a feature where you could ignore certain features (i.e. turn off the allergy function, since I'm not allergic to anything; or turn off the sugar/calories if you've had an ED). Overall, great app and I use it all the time :)
Great, I'm obsessed with using it lately. Gonna trash my entire medicine cabinet. Recommendation: the app needs a search feature. I have things that don't have the bar codes anymore.
The app is great, but it would be amazing if you could flag products that have given you bad reactions so you could identify ingredients they share.

I love this app! It's a very user friendly interface, no set up needed, and the features are very efficient and intuitive. My one real issue, is that it considers calories a negative nutritional quality. As somebody with an ectomorphic body type (skinny with a high metabolism), I NEED high caloric intake throughout the day so lower calorie foods are actually MORE unhealthy for my dietary needs. I wish you could customize your dietary needs because of varying body types which is why I rated 4/5.

I like the app and I have some suggestions for the premium features. 1. The ability to make lists of products and sub lists. 2. An extension to the premium membership for every new product entered. For example an extra week free for each new item entered. And an extra free week for each incorrect or changed ingredients detected. 3. The ability to customise the scoring, for example to ignore sugar or fat or additives, etc content in the scoring.

I like the app but the recommendations dont always load. Its also sometimes confusing because something like Sodium hydrogen carbonate (baking soda) makes a product show "red at risk" when really its not a toxic product. Maybe adding in a directory would also be beneficial. A lot of cosmetic apps are doing this which is nice. Anyway just wanted to make known about the recommendations not loading.

So far I think the app is great! My only complaint is when I try to add a product that is not listed, it won't accept it. I'm only putting in the information I see and it's asking you me to make sure that what I put in is correct (it is). It won't let me do anything after that so I can't add this product, please add like a skip feature or something or an okay button to verify that what we put in is correct. Keep up the hard work thank you so much!

I've only used it a few times ( scanning things in our pantry). So far so good. It's interesting to see the good and bad of certain products. I just wish it had the feature to save items that are better choices to a shopping list. Would be a great added feature!

Only issues is there are some duplicates of the same product. That and sometimes a product will only have 1 ingredient listed when it's something like a sephora concealer which will likely have 15+. That's mostly users navigating the app so it's not a huge deal, but could be a problem later.

Great app! Edit: I can't delete any scanned product. The trash button doesn't work and the delete menu item neither, or it crashes the app. Edit 2: the app started behaving correctly after a while, now I can delete the scanned products.

Amazing concept - Inconsistent product info. The app is in serious need of curators to check that all fields are completed correctly. Many products have ingredients missing or names missing from products. This makes the search functionality a little hit and miss.

Love it. Easy to use and is very informative. FEEDBACK: Let me search individual ingredients from products that you don't provide info for. Also, the nutrition rating system is flawed and doesn't appropriately evaluate density of nutrition in serving sizes. If a serving size is really small, of course it's ok to have a little sugar or salt.

It's fun to see how all of the companies that provide us our needs have essentially let us down when it comes to healthy and environmentally friendly options in pursuit of cheap stuff. This app helps alleviate some of that suspicion by giving you different/healthier options that contain less additives and address the same problem. Beauty products have been the most eye opening for me.

i Love the app. its quick, enables users to add products and gets uploaded after validation, gives alternatives to poor quality products.. I would like if the developers can add a feature of adding a 'note' or something to a product so that users can add information like price or something for their info.
Amazing app. Just one feature missing. Please add the chance to write a bar code if it cannot be scanned. This would be very useful for products that we want to buy from online! Thanks!

It would be great if there were a free trial for the premium membership, like 3 days or something. I don't have a lot of money so I don't like committing to services and subscriptions unless I know they're worth it for me, and I'd like to test if the premium features are worth me paying for.

Perfect absolutely lovely, but you'd get five stars if it became possible to change the importance of certain measurements (like saturated fats > salt or macros > additives), this app also needs to consider sugar more strictly for drinks imo. Another very welcome feature would be to ignore certain additives.

There is more than 2 billion muslim users interested in this request

Yuka should really do a more in-depth read for bottled waters that are known to have flouride/high amounts of plastic leaching/ bleach/ perfluorooctane sulfonate / perfluorooctanoic acid / etc. Zepherhills spring waters and especially purified water. It should rate a water like Fiji alittle better than say a generic purified water.

i really like this app 10/10 but i don't like how if I'm online shopping i cant use this app to check if the product is healthy. could yall add a feature when you can take/upload a picture of the ingredients and scan them to see if their healthy?

This app has changed my life! I have cleaned out my cosmetics drawers and tossed so many things that I have been buying for YEARS, never knowing how bad they were for me. I love the feature that gives you better options / alternatives. Another great thing about this app is that if you are buying a product anyway (for example, almond milk), there are always choices. This app just lets you pick the best one for you and shows you the ones that have the risky additives.

This app seems to be extremely useful when scanning products. I decided I liked it enough to pay a yearly subscription so I could search my own items without scanning. There must be an issue with the search feature at the moment because nothing will pull up and just says no results found. I do hope this is fixed soon or I wasted my money. Ã°Å¸â¢

Great app to find out what dangerous things are lurking in your food and household products! I love that it gives you recommendations for healthier options if you scan an item that isn't the best. Tons of features in the free version. I'll be upgrading to the paid version just to keep supporting Yuka! The paid version is pay as you feel/can. The lowest tier is $10 per year. A great value based on what is provided for free!

Great app concept that is executed well. It helps me to avoid preservatives. In general, I strongly dislike it when companies put new or even existing features behind a paywall and was disappointed to find Yuka following suit. I changed my mind after discovering the new premium subscription is pay what you want at a minimum of $10 per year which I find to be very reasonable.

So quick and easy to use! Everyone should have this in their phone. Just scan the barcode and it is rated between excellent and poor. If you come across a poor rated product, alternative options are recommened. Nutrition facts and ingredients are broken down health wise. There are also links that further discuss toxic substances. 1st app I don't feel the need to add or edit anything.

This app works great! Even when there was an ingredient missing, I reported the problem with the ingredient list, took a picture of the ingredients and the app changed it immediately. Love this app! I love bringing the app into the grocery store and cosmetic stores because it takes away the overwhelming feeling. The comparison tab is nice and being able to sort the products by beauty and food is helpful.

I love this app. It is one of the few that is worth paying for- it is so helpful in finding good, healthy foods and products and identifying items that are unhealthy or just not worth buying. It opens up the choice of what we put in and on our body. The premium account is affordable and the company seems like a good, small business worthy of support. Thanks team!

Several items say the are not rated, please rate supplements, protien powders, powder mixes found in these isles such as pre-workout, and more! This app is awesome. But I want to beable to see what's in my protien and other stuff I take. I ha e found that most of the "healthy" foods I've been eating has been 30/100 or 0 which is crazy. I love the alternatives selections that's awesome. This app could take on the broken food system we have in the usa.

I love this app so much. I got recommended this app recently and as soon as I downloaded it I was obsessed. It did make me sad that most of my skincare products are actually bad or hazardous for me but I'm glad I know now. I haven't tested the food analysis yet but am excited to do so. I love all the features but I do have some recommendations. I wish it also included cleaning products. The alternative products could be updated, they are a bit inaccurate.

Started using this app in May 2023 and made some drastic changes to my food and skin care, part of a process I started almost two years but was missing something, it was an easy way to identify harmful additives and Yuka did just that. My skin is glowing, I feel healthier and lighter because I am not buying blindly anymore. The app may not be 100% accurate but it gives you pause and forces you to make more conscious decisions about what you put in your body and on your skin!
The best app for tracking food, wish they did also did things like protein powder tho. Would definitely pay for that feature

This is must have app if you care about your health and nutrition. I use it in everything and almost everything has an excess of phosphates which when you eat too much of, can lead to many of the most ominous health issues, like heart problems, cancer, and other things I never want!
Fantastic. Maybe missing some areas of information, but overall a fantastic help in considering what to choose. AND the article I read this morning that they emailed me was informative.

Thanks for everything. Yes, I am a member. Probably one of my TOP memberships. Your app has improved my food intake/shopping habit ways. I am not a diet/health nut, but more of a EVERYTHING IN MODERATION type of guy. This email/read is a prime example of how the Yuka team has improved/heightened my way of life. It is not cluttered with complexed wording that the average person is unable to understand or take in. Congrats to all involved.

Unbelievable. Great idea, very transparent and astonishing: a lot of products that I trusted because they were renowned and expensive, were simply just mediocre or even of bad quality. It finds almost everything and it is very reliable, gives lots of suggestions/alternatives. Concerning just the app: simple to use and get around, the free version has lots of stuff, premium feels good to contribute to the project. No crashes, no issues. I recommend everyone. Specially before going shopping.

Amazing app, first it started with what food I could scan, then reading the hazardous and bad ingredients, which is a awesome feature, saves me searching it online myself. Then it moved onto things I apply shampoo, soap, deodorant. Now as I shop I use this app. Maximum star rating to the team who made this.

I wanted to love this app, the graph and goal features are excellent, and I especially appreciate that it does not use GPS. However it's simply not accurate at counting my steps. Maybe it's just not sensitive enough to detect movement, but whatever the reason, it doesn't work for me. I've had the app installed for about 3 weeks and have had this problem from the second day. Once I walked 4 miles according to Google maps and it counted this as 900 steps.

This app would be great... if it didn't randomly erase the data. I'm doing a fitness challenge with friends and we're aiming for 2 miles a day. It recorded about a quarter of a mile while I was walking around campus to classes, then erased the other 1.5 miles I walked a few hours later with my dogs. This app cost me the challenge. Definitely don't use, it's unreliable and there are better ones out there!!!

I have had a very good experience with this app for years until lately, the battery drain have gone up massively. From a few percentage to 30% of battery.. To your eply: You did it understand the issue a D replied. Latest update increased battery drainage with almost 900% from earlier on my pixel compared to before. Before about 4% over a day, now 35%. I will now set rating to 1 cause this was a generic reply. I know this app use power, just not close to half the battery...

I reinstalled because it stopped counting steps and the new version is watered down without stretching and exercise features I liked. New version still not counting steps. Why can't they just leave a good thing alone?
Earlier this app was great. There were different types of physical and facial exercises available. Now , I installed the app again after a year and all those features are not available anymore.

App doesn't work. My steps aren't being tracked. The steps page is a generic screen which does not display my details / steps, i cant actually sign in, there is a sign in section but is not able to be interacted with.The redeem section has a tick on the PayPal option however nothing is actually displayed. My info section is once again a generic page which has a fictitious step count of 1234 for December.

This app is a joke! It's nothing but ridiculously long ads... barely has anything to do with walking!! Then, when I reached the point where I could cash out, it told me to walk for 2 more days with a minimum of 2000 steps and it crashed on me! It completely stopped working. Don't waste your time. It's just a headache.

The delete/restart steps button is somehow so easy to push, that my steps reset to zero unintentionally constantly! It is so frustrating. I finally set a lock on my phone just for this app and it still manages to reset. I guarantee most people don't ever even want to reset their steps to zero! Why is this feature even there, let alone located in a place that is easily accidentally selected?! I've contacted their customer service at least 5-10 times and they don't bother to help or respond!

I gave this app 5 stars because I have used it for 2 years, the best app but after switching to Samsung S23 ultra, the app doesn't work properly now, it doesn't registers the steps while my smartwatch does, app is allowed to run in the background, no battery settings are interfering with the app but still it's not counting the steps accurately, I do 10000 steps daily, it registers only 6000 to 7000, it's a huge difference, so please check the app, because it's the best app but it's broken now.

Same issues as others have stated. I gave it the benefit of the doubt but after walking for 3 hours straight and it on my recorded 4 minutes of walking and under 500 steps for the whole day, very disappointing. Uninstalling, do not install, this seems to be a common thing and it just fills up your storage and drains your battery life.

Works well, but the button to turn it off is well hoidden. Poor UI design. I cannot find it - found it once by accident. I believe it is draining my battery, even when I am not walking - is this a 'feature'? Not a good one. I want to use it only whenm I want to use it, not have my battery be controlled by the developer!

Not accurate. I just walked for 40 min and over 2 miles, I checked the distance on Google maps. According to the app, I only walked 24 minutes and 1.5 miles. I have sensitivity at medium, as high sensitivity counts small movements as steps. But looks like medium sensitivity does not even count my actual steps.

I've been using this app without any major issues for a few years. Today I opened it to find my entire history before last Friday has been erased! Went into settings and found 'backup & restore' but this has merely backed up the last three days. I'm gutted. Just returned from a 10 day walking holiday and have no record of my achievements.

I thought this app was great; I have been using it since 12/1/18. On 1/4/19 it said I'd taken 10371 steps. I thought it was accurate because I'd worked out for nearly 2 hours that day, so I was excited. I know the exact number because I texted my bf the miles, steps, and calories burned. But then on 1/5 I checked my timeline to compare and I saw the number had changed to 9489 and the miles, calories also changed. I feel that makes it trash. Plus I found other issues too. I am uninstalling it.

The application doesn't work well. For example: I walked for more than an hour, and my route, as calculated by Google maps, was about 6,5 km. This app measured around 2500 steps, and 20 min of walking. I had used the app before, and although it wasn't super correct - it's something quite impossible, it didn't miss everything by this much. So I'm giving it 1 star this time and an honest review, hoping that these issues will be resolved.

A small strip with ads at the bottom of the app is not enough for collecting the revenue. Sometimes they cover your entire screen with ads and you can't exit it. With been not very accurate I do not need this app. Uninstalling. .

I installe this twice. The first time I tried it, it didn't record my step wheather I hold my phone in my hand or in my pocket. Then when I installed it the second time, I adjusted the sensitivity. It's still didn't count my steps. Frustrating. I like the features but it's not working for me.

Received an update around July 15th with "improvements". Used to love the app and used it for three years...but going to uninstall it and go find one that's like this used to be. The new version is super laggy and bloated with unwanted workout videos and paid content behind pay walls.

The application's behavior is inconsistent. The application does count steps almost correctly however on several occasions all of a sudden the counter resets and all the counting for the day is gone. originally I loved this app, got me walking and I found it fairly accurate (not totally but that's to be expected) however the last week, it seems to freeze and won't count anymore steps. Very dissapointed as before this I was finding it great. I have tried uninstalling it and downloading again.

Like the app and it's features, but it often doesn't record walks and runs properly. In particular the app does not record steps for any walk or run that occurs over midnight. UPDATE: Still loses the last 5-10 minutes or so of steps before every midnight. Very frustrating. Still not fixed and same bug every evening. Bug still the same. Have not been fixed.

The step count is pretty accurate but the mileage is WAY OFF!!! I have another app that I've used for 5 years and has always been accurate but still tried this one a month ago because I liked the different features and found that it was horrible with mileage accuracy. When I took 29,390 steps today at work (meter reader for electric and gas) and my accurate app says 11.8 miles and this app tells me 7 miles something is DEFINITELY wrong!!!

I've been using this for a while now and never had any issues with it until the past week or so. The app will just stop. The apps icon is always on the top of the screen when it's working but I don't usually pay attention to that. It's 8 oclock at night and it says I only walked 8 steps. I hope this issue is fixed soon or I will be deleting.

Also app was last updated on nov19, it is time for a update. Will wait few days otherwise will have to switch to another app.

The app stopped counting my steps after a short time. I have a Galaxy S4 with power saving *turned off*. So why did the app stop counting my steps? I would be very satisfied with it otherwise. I like the features and interface. It just doesn't work.

Why it's not simply displaying in my notification bar,iam using it since 2020 but after the recent update,this app didn't count when iam walking, didn't show in my notification bar,i have to manually open app for every time and most importantly editing step count is a seriously astupid feature,any one can update or edit up to 60k steps,i don't think that will raise the value to this app,that will decrease the app value,make this app show in notification bar like how all these years it working
In the beginning it was great. But then I noticed it kept missing significant amount of steps. Tried changing the sensitivity but it still kept missing steps.

This is a great app except for one thing. The counter freezes... a lot. Sometimes in the middle of me walking. The only way the app says to fix it is to force stop the app (which takes entirely too long) and then sometimes that doesn't even fix it. Had to restart it 4 times yesterday and it has stopped again today. Other than that, very effective and easy-to-use app to track step progress! Please fix!

Great for when it wants to work. For the past several days, it will randomly freeze and stop tracking steps. Sometimes closing the app and/or restarting my phone will fix the problem but most often it's stuck. I suspect the ads on the bottom of making it drag and lag. I'm hoping it's an issue being fixed.

Distance feature is pretty accurate....The steps weren't however werent entirely accurate. I was walking a brisk pace and it was counting three steps to two in some instances. This is generally a good app, though marred by the frequent use of full-screen adverts. The smaller banner ads are much better, and I completely understand that the developer needs to make some return for their work, so I was about to pay the modest fee... But something's changed in the last update, which means this app is now using excessive wakelocks and is regularly appearing top of the list of battery-hogging apps, even overnight when there is no movement to record.
Does what it says very well, but the ads and requests for ratings are obnoxious and briefly hold you hostage just to see how many calories you've burned.

Great little app. Nice that the clock stops running when you are not moving. After several months of use I'm a little disappointed. The app does not always start and often misses many steps. Consecutive days on treadmill at same speed and time gave steps ranging from 0 to 4100. PS. Sensitivity is set at high. Because of its erratic and unreliable performance I would not recommend buying a plan. It's an amusing toy.
Not exactly accurate. Consumes too much phone power along the day. Switches off occasionally, missing quite a bit of data.
Why don't the widgets adjust?? None of them do and the two that are supposed to be colorful and 3x1 are small and colorless. I got this mainly for widget. Samsung
After walking half an hour it shows 5 mins. Earlier version it was correctly showing. Please check and correct. 5 stars for earlier version. Post update there are issues.

12-2: No response. The counter hasn't been counting steps accurately the past couple of months, and it just stops counting at times. I've given feedback several times & get the message that the issues will be resolved in the next update. When will that be? I can no longer trust the numbers. Are more levels & challenges going to be added in the near future? I completed most of them over the past year. 11-8-2022: I just lost all my Steps data from Oct 23 thru Nov 6 data. Why? Can it be retrieved?

Ive been using this app for 7 months now. I hadn't had an issue until today. It started glitching where the notification bar wasn't matching the steps and cal count when you clicked on the app. Also now the daily workout page is gone for me. I have a subscription for this so I'm hoping it gets figured out. I redownloaded but the app is still having these issues.

Does the job you want. I hate achievements/ fireworks for hitting benchmarks, though, and i cant find a way to turn those off... seems silly but it's true. Also a detail over the course of a date ie hourly, is a nice feature that could be added. Otherwise like i said, it works and seems to work well

For everyday walking, its fine, and does well at tracking those slower movements; but when I do a fast paced workout or a run, the numbers differ wildly. A 10,000 step workout yesterday resulted in only 6800 of those steps being counted. I adjust the settings, but its frustrating having to constantly go back and forth.

its a good app but sometimes it doesn't calculate the correct number of steps, for example if i walk 10000 steps but this app shows me just 4 to 5k steps only thats feel very frustrating on that time. so i just want to say a few words to the developers that pls do something with these issues, it will be great for you and for me also, pls put some light on this issue.

It's a great app for what it is, but for someone who works thirds (like me) it's very difficult to track how many steps I'm actually doing in one of my "days", because it resets at midnight. The ability to set the start and end of my day, in the app, would be a seriously great feature to have.

At first it worked perfectly fine. All of a sudden, it would freeze up and I was unable to get an accurate reading of how many steps I actually took per day. I walked for 3 hours one day and it only calculated 1639 for 17 minutes. I'm deleting this app smh.

Great app, but it's constantly freezing up on me & not counting my steps. Very discouraging to have walked for a while & then find out it hadn't counted any of those steps. Then their are times when it will start counting & freeze up again. Once I get this figured out I'll be up & walking.

The problem I faced with the app was that it won't calculate steps automatically. It's not like once you have opened and it will count steps in background, I have to open app multiple times so that the steps can be counted. No doubt it has many other good features but of use if its not fulfilling main purpose.

Would give more if the thing didn't add the commentary on my weight. Maybe it's just me but I've had issues with this all my life so the little bar saying "severely obese" seems like overkill. You can't accurately gage how healthy someone is by two numbers. My only objection is the bmi thing. Otherwise, works fine!
Does what it says very well, but the ads and requests for ratings are obnoxious and briefly hold you hostage just to see how many calories you've burned.

Loved this app at the beginning...now it lags so bad...not counting steps I take...about to DELETE.
After walking half an hour it shows 5 mins. Earlier version it was correctly showing. Please check and correct. 5 stars for earlier version. Post update there are issues.

This is a really good app that I've been using for a year. Then it crashed & stopped working, for no apparent reason. Before it crashed I would've given the app a 5-star rating. Now I can't use it anymore.
Haven't even used it yet and requesting to be rated!!!

Would be a great app, but has a bug which sometimes takes steps (up to 1500) away after midnight step rollover. I have lost 70lbs in 8 months jog/walking since I've installed this app. Update 9/3/19: My issues have finally been resolved, bug has not happened in almost 2 months. Some good features have been added. I've raised my rating back up to 4 stars. Also, would be nice if app had a provision for rest or sick days, to pause or disable step goal stats on "combo days" badge feature. Thanks.

The app uses the phone accelerometer to detect foot impact. So, if you shuffle there is nothing to detect. Further, some pedometers are sensitive to pace/cadence. The most accurate pedometers for slow walkers work best at 50 to 60 steps per minute. I don't know if this is a factor with this app. I do know that when I could take full paces without shuffling it was more accurate.

I wish I could get this a five-star but I have been recently having issues where it just stops reading my steps. I have let them know several times, I've even had to uninstall reinstall to start having my steps recounted again. Other than that this app is wonderful especially the little daily tasks motivates me and I look forward to accomplishing them. It's a fun easy way of getting in shape.

Easy to use and features I didn't expect which are useful. However, when I was away from my wifi for half a day I was concerned by a data useage warning on my phone. In 12 hours it had used 100mb of data and it had done nothing more than step-count.

I would give five stars, but for one annoying feature. The app keeps giving motivational messages and congratulatory messages, without any way to turn them off. If the developer adds that option, I'll change my review to five stars!

Ive only just downloaded and installed this app however so far i cam tell you that its a pretty straight forward app to set up with many features, settings and goals. I will update this further when ivevused it for at least a month.

So far I like it. UI aesthetically pleasing and simple. I haven't tried the exercises but I briefly looked at them. It's nicely presented and the small animations are a great touch. The 4 stars rating is because of the pause functionality. It should be added to the notification bar for easy access. It's a bit annoying to go back to the app to unpause. It's easy to forget and the steps count becomes erroneous.

I've been really enjoying the app so far and like the additional features it comes with. Two things I'm personally not fond of are that you have to round up or down your weight when you use kg, which makes it hard to actually track progressive weight loss. I'd also like to be able to toggle off the bmi view, I do resistance training so I'm heavier due to muscle. Not super into being told I'm overweight when I know I'm not. Still a really good app! Recommended it to some friends the other day

Good app. Loses 1 star however because since I downloaded it, I have an add that behaves like Malware: horrible alien in flying saucer with "Slide to unlock" message that interferes with my use of my phone: it freezes my keyboard while I'm typing messages, freezes browser. Very irritating. Don't mind adds, but I do if they stop me from using other apps. Edited 9 March 2021: very good app. They've imprived the way the adds appear. I like the newly added exercises

It works and keeps me on track. All the features are useful, and I like the milestone badges. One thing I would like added, though, is to set the calorie counter to calories, KiloCalories, or Kilojoules. It is a bit confusing to calculate when, here in Australia, we sometimes use the UK method and sometimes the USA method.

Helpful app for step counting, reminder to drink water, exercises, not too complicated. I updated my app recently and my reading now shows up in one straight line. I had liked the older version which had a huge green circle with waves indicating my steps and the number in bold and middle of the screen. Can that feature be returned? Thanks in anticipation.

Great at helping me monitor my levels of activity and kinda game-ify working out. My only suggestion is to make the rewards for the smaller milestones (1k steps, 3k steps, etc.) a daily occurrence. Celebrating Smaller milestones was REALLY motivating in the beginning but sadly it was a one time occurence. Also sometimes the app randomly stops counting my steps and I have to pause the counter and restart to get it working again.

Great app to use with your phone but as soon as I got a sport tracker band then since it can not be connected with this app to my knowledge then it became obsolete.... Would reinstall it if there was a way to do that. Also I have to add because I read many reviews saying that it doesn't track accurately, for my phone I had it on max sensitivity and for two days that I used it with the band it counted the almost the same steps with very small difference.

In India we use the Kms system. I couldn't find a way to change the miles into Kms on the app. I have to Google it everytime. Otherwise it's great. An additional feature that tells us how much we need to loose/gain to get an optimum body mass index would have been amazing as it calculates our BMI anyways.
Theirs a lag when I start to move, its bothersome. Otherwise, pretty user friendly.

I really like the app. Its easy to navigate, they give you rewards and it doesnt lag or cause any problem on my tablet. You can change the sensitivity as well but im still quite confused on choosing the level bc the fast level is the only one with a description. I suggest putting more description on diff sensitive levels. The only issue or problem I have is eventhough this app is sync with my amazon fit app, they give diff results daily and the gap is HUGE. 8k steps here = 13k in amazon fit.

Pretty good. Like the reporting features and water reminder. Doesn't always catch steps though. FYI You have to walk fast to get it to record anything even at max sensitivity. I'm routinely off by a mile+ and 1K+ steps. No way to add anything manually so just something to be aware of.

I used this last year then deleted to save memory space after I got my 365 days award it was great it keeps you motivated with confetti and text you congrats & all. I Loved when you reached farther steps than before you got a crown and each time you reach a goal a star that day. Though when I down loaded & tried it this year there's no crown. You still get stars, I hope they add it back again that was a nice goal. I tried another step program it was too confusing and came back to this one.Thanks

This app is what I was searching but there is a single small bug the developer can improve some features like like when we was cycling the counting was very less and when walking it was accurate they can add some options in app settings or modes like cycling walking joging for accurate counting than the only issue I faced and it's the best pedometer app I have used since

has the features I'm looking for and is mostly well designed, except for tiny pause button on main screen and lack of pause button on widgets. oh, and no dark mode. But it does track steps accurately, has nice stats and doesn't eat the battery nor the wallet.

Ive only just downloaded and installed this app however so far i cam tell you that its a pretty straight forward app to set up with many features, settings and goals. I will update this further when ivevused it for at least a month.
I would have given a 5 but the count is sometimes slow Nice app thoÃ°Å¸ËË

This app has only gotten better over time. It use to lag in counting, but at the end of the day would have a pretty accurate count, off by maybe 3 steps per 100. Now it's spot on, counting every two steps, with a slight delay for single steps. I didn't know I walked around the house so much. It helps keep me from feeling down for "wasting a day" when I can't get motivated beyond basic self care. Love the water tracker/reminder and that the notifications and tool bar aren't huge or in your face.

Works like a charm, very customizable with the ability to set your stride and instantly see the effect on the distance already recorded. Comparing it to, for example, the distance recorded by the treadmill it is very accurate. The only negative I have found so far is that, when it is connected to Google Fit, it reports a ridiculous number of small walks about the house. Very easy to turn off that reporting though. Overall an excellent app

Simple, effective app that does exactly as advertised. Nothing fancy just a step counter. You can set your own daily goals. And your statistics for...day week and month or tracked and visible overtime. There are different goal and achievement levels to help keep you motivated. Ads are present but unobtrusive. If you're looking for a fancy fitness app with lots of features, you probably won't like this app. But if you're looking for a good step counter look no further.

This pedometer works really well for me. It seems to be quite accurate and not only tracks your steps for the day but the total steps for the week in addition to tracking calories burned, distance walked and time it took. It's a great little device. One really great feature is the developers respect your privacy and will not go into your files!!! As advertised it doesn't use much power. I strongly recommend it to anyone who simply wants to know the aforementioned items it tracks.

Easy interface, no annoying ads, and does what intended. Keeps track of my steps better than any other app. Keeps count when screen is off; don't have to worry about constantly checking my phone to see if the app is still going. The water feature is a plus; no need for a water reminder app. Some see it as useless, but busy individuals sometimes need that hydration reminder; especially when on the move. Easy to pause the count, hydrate when reminded at my own set time, and continue.

This app is amazing. It helps me keep track of distance walked as expected but the other features is why I'm giving it a 5 star. The app also offers workouts for just about anyone. And even keeps track of calories burned, water intake, goals, and you can even set your own schedule in the app. Ads are present but at least they're not popping up constantly.

This app is exactly what I was looking for. I hate the Google Fit tracking so I downloaded this instead. All features are free, there are a few ads but they don't pop up all the time. I like that you can change the sensitivity of the step monitor and that it had a bar that can easily be checked in your notifications.

This pedometer works better than most. Unlike other apps, Step Counter stays running (even with low RAM) and I don't have to open the app every time I walk to get it to function. Also, Step Counter shows calories burned based on my height and weight and contains features like video workouts for free. This app does contain an occasional ad, but doesn't go overboard.

I love this app. It's simple, but it works well and I love the format. You can turn on notifications to tell you when it's time to drink water. As you go, you unlock goals and achievements. You can adjust the sensitivity of the step sensor and the length of your steps for more accuracy. It's great for people looking to be more active but need that push. Awesome! You gotta deal with short ads if ya dont want to pay for the supreme features. But hey, overall- great app!!

The app does what it is suppose to without endless promotions. If you leave alerts on it only reminds you to walk... not spend money, which as we all know isn't typical. I also like the achievements aspect to show you how your efforts add up. My only small issue is that it doesnt just start tracking my steps... if I dont consciously open it(even if it's already technically open) it wont calculate steps. So open it up before the walk or run you want to calculate and it works great.

At first, I thought the apps wasn't counting my steps, but I figured out that the display is sometimes delayed. After a few seconds the display began updating my step count. Now, I'm aware of the lag, so I give the app a few seconds to catch up - no pun intended. The steps counted seem to be very accurate once updated.

I've been using this app for a year and a half, and it's done a reasonable job at getting my steps for the day. I've used it to estimate the distance and time I walk in a day to get the calories burned for weight loss, and it's been fairly accurate. I do have to restart the app to get the tracking to respond, but I think that's more of an issue with my Galaxy S8 than anything. I dont use any of the app's extra features, but overall the basic step tracking has been solid.

I like this SO much better than a Fitbit. The interface is much more pleasant, the ads are super-easy to ignore and I hate wearing those things (icky bands). This is a huge improvement. Of course, all it does is count my steps, and the heart-rate report (on a Fitbit) is nice but that feature usually quits working after the warantee expires anyway. I don't want a whole new way of life, thank you - just something to count my steps. This is great!

For being FREE this app has the easiest & most effective tools to help keep track of steps. You can keep all notifications off & simply use the step counter, or you can use all the features & additionally keep track of numerous things (water intake, etc). You can also have it give you reminders or updates throughout the day (It's motivational without being annoying.) Another huge PLUS is almost NO ADS!
This app is very user-friendly while still offering many additional features to assist one in improving your fitness

This app is simplistic and efficient. I like its auxiliary features as well. For anybody who's always on the go, having a convenient workout selection that can fit in any schedule leaves no room for excuses. The fact that the app celebrates your accomplishments is a cool boost. Great job!

Hi, Great app & no issues at all. Some improvements to add on the goals would be: adding "25k steps" daily goal; on "Combo days", get rid of the 1X (not even a combo) & add 180X & maybe some other goal in the 200sX so that there wouldn't be such a large gap 'till 365X. Lastly, on "Total Distance", please add 2000mi & maybe 5000mi to aspire to. One more thing: Weight loss tracker should have an option from the beginning of downloading app, not just the last 30 days. Thank you!

Amazing appÃ°Å¸ââ. Been using it since May/June 2020 during the covid lockdown (when I realised how bad my weight gain wasÃ°Å¸â¢Æ). Really helped me on my weight loss/fitness journey. I can definitely say that it's reliable and seeing my progress, with the lovely layout, is very motivating! Plus there's a water intake feature, facial exercises etc such a rich, helpful, multipurpose app!

Accurate and free extras! This app has been more reliable than others I've tried. For me this has everything I would want out of pedometer. Excellent accuracy, user friendly, free health minded features. Guess what? It even counts when you dance, wow. Totally recommended!

Great app! Was using Trailsense to track my steps, but it drained the battery and overheated my phone. Love the achievements section, and that you can set goals. The report section is also helpful to track previous days/weeks, and months. Am using the free version, but you can unlock more features through the paid app (eg, sleep goal plans, weight goal plans).

It's a great app And I really love the exercises in it I deleted the app I downloaded for exercise and kept this Very simple menu and simple exercises Just problem The dev team need to improve the accuracy of counting Like when I am walking while watching in my phone it doesn't count those steps But when I keep it in my pocket...It counts Ã°Å¸Ëâ¦ Please fix this This is a very good app With multi features everyone should get to know this app! Thank you for reading my message Ã°Å¸ËÅ

A very good app so far! Installed in 03/23 as I was looking for a basic pedometer. I found I can customize the app to track whatever I wish. Currently using the app to count steps, track weight with the graph (great idea!) and keep track of water intake. ÃÂ¶ I have lymphedema in both legs, which limits my walking; the app is helping me to slowly increase my activity. It's currently set at 500/day. When I get 7 consecutive days of 500+, I will bump it up to 1000. ÃÂ¶ Great app. Thanks! Ã°Å¸â¢âÃ°Å¸â

I need to connect the results on Facebook feeds since I am participating in 62 miles challenge for St Jude Children's Hospital but I can't find this feature in the app, only when popping up by itself and it doesn't often. Can play music and doesn't stop tracking my steps , was looking for something like this because there are other app that stop tracking steps when I listening to the music in YouTube while I am walking.

Great app, easy to use, does what I want. Only feature I'd like added is a day log, where I could write a quick note about why a day's step count was higher or lower than normal (special event, weather, head cold, etc). Handy app, opens quickly, doesn't eat battery.

I downloaded this app around 1.5 years ago. I haven't checked it for about a year. I checked the history and it is very accurate. They have added feature where if I forget my phone. I can it my steps in app. Great app
Very good. I was given the opportunity suggest new features. I really like it.

After walking and running 24,901 miles plus a few more for good measure, my smart watch decided enough was enough. So I started to use your app. Easy to use, simple, accurate and a perfect companion for an ultra walker. There is no issues with the ads. I have it running 24/7 and have no battery issues and it never failed to work. I doubt I'll ever need to buy a replacement smart watch again as this is all I need - it's simple as that. Excellent and thank you - 1millionstepsman Ã°Å¸â¢âÃ°Å¸â

Straightforward and easy to use. Just gives you what you need. The steps, the daily, weekly, monthly records. Can chart your weight, and record water consumption. A few challenges, if you want them . I did the 100 day challenge, but the next one up us 365 which is too much. Would like a 200 day challenge to bridge the gap. I don't like fussy apps, with features you don't need. That's why I like this one, as it is not complicated. So 5 stars given !
Has all the data I need and the interface is well designed so really easy too use and worth the small investment just in appreciation alone
So far I am not using all of the features available .So I will say that section that tracks my daily steps appears to be very accurate.

Great app. I really enjoy it and the steps it counts seems very accurate. It motivates me to walk more. The user interface is easy to use and pleasant to look at with just the right amount of features. The only thing I would ask the developers- totally understand the need for ads, and overall there are not too many. But can you please make it so an ad does not appear when you "celebrate" your steps achieved for the day? When the confetti comes down? It slightly detracts from the celebration :)

It was very clear how to set it up as i first opened the app and once i got familiar with the layout it was easy to navigate. The app got better when the upgrades happened i.e. 1 change was i could add more steps that i missed. It works in the background and doesn't take much battery life at all, that's helpful when using the phone for other things. Overall a very clear and easy app to use if you just need simple and a few key features.

The app is so reliable, helpful, non-invasive. It is exactly what I was looking for. I've been using it for over a year now. It is so uneventful in the best ways... I haven't had any glitching or crashing. It also is very user-friendly and it offers targeted mini exercise programs. I wish it would synch with another fitness app I use, but its not a deal breaker for me.

I used to love this app, it's great at planning workouts for you and you can easily add in or remove new ones for the week or bump them to next week. For the food part, I wish it provided the nutrition facts. I'm so upset the see all button disappeared where you could see all the recommended workouts in a better view week to week and move them around. I can't believe they removed this feature. Or I can't figure out how to get it back, it happened when I chose I program, not liking this at all

The reason for this review is simple: I'm looking for an app that doesn't have any additional features that you have to pay for, or hidden add on things. If I'm going to pay for a workout, I'd rather go get a gym membership. Having to pay for extra features, like personalized meal plans and recipes for said meal plans, as well as offline download abilities and music choice options, is a complete turn off and disappointing.

DONT GET THE PRO!!!! I actually liked the free version but the pro version SUCKS! it doesn't cast the pro music to my tv. You know, the main the reason I got the pro version! Really frustrating that even when I workout on a web browser it has trouble loading the music and the workouts. It's just incredibly annoying to pay for a feature that only works on a super tiny phone screen. I have tried to voice my displeasure through the app but have gotten no response from customer service. Save your $

In order to stream to your TV, you need to pay for a membership right away. You cannot test out any classes and stream to your TV to even really know if you want to pay for a membership. It's really hard for me to try a dance cardio class while watching on a small screen. Guess I'll stick with the Xfinity workout videos and Open Fit free trial (always allows you to stream on TV)!

App is confusing. The trial version doesn't really do anything for you I'd you go to the gym. I searched around on the app and just doesn't look like it's worth the time or money. I deleted it. Update THEY DO NOT STOP SENDING YOU EMAILS. I've unsurscribed like 5 times already and they keep sending you emails. And now they send me alerts to make sure you work out and it's in my calender. I can't delete any of them. It'd all a big scam

Annual reminder of Unsuccessful transaction I didn't request. I used the pro for an year, then canceled. Now I'm getting an annual email of Unsuccessful transaction for two years in a row. I tried to log into the website only to find they redirect me to download the app. So I downloaded the app to stop them to try using my info. I FOUND THERE'S NO BUTTON TO UNSUBSCRIBE OR WHATSOEVER, because I already canceled! I use stripe for other payments, but FitOn is the ONLY one getting me this message.
I purchase premium service to have access to TV and smartwatch connectivity features. The watch fitbit app won't measure BM and calories if the TV is connected. I have Samsung galaxy watch 3.

Paid for the Pro Version subscription and promoted Watch feature !!! Since June !!! No Garmin 965 support.... Error: This app is not compatible with the selected device. Last Garmin App Update: May 30, 2023... Good Support looks different. Update: Nov.2023 still no support Ã°Å¸Ëâ

It used to be a really good app, still has great range of exercises and features but lately it keeps crashing and when I click to start a workout video it freezes or never loads. A lot of issues with streaming which really interrupts flow of workout. Sometimes I have spent up to 30 minutes restarting over and over. The fast and convenient is no more when that happens. I hope they can fix this issue as it used to be a great app

I didn't even get to a work out. I tried putting in my info and was interrupted by multiple ads, and I know its so you pay for the pro version but I didn't even get a chance to try to navigate the app before being constantly bombarded with different pop ups. Not something I want in a workout app, especially for someone like myself who already struggles with staying on task and working out. Also the app seemed cluttered while trying to navigate through it.

Really upset by this app. I used to be able to cast my workouts to my TV without needing a pro subscription and now they've locked that ability. Very disappointed. It was one thing to lock certain workouts or features of the app for the pro subscription, that I could deal with, but something as basic as casting to your TV? That defeats the entire purpose of the app for most people. Very very disappointed and will not recommend this app to anyone.

I purchased the Pro version of the app solely to be able to cast the workouts on my Samsung TV, and the whole experience is horrible. I am unable to control the workouts while it's casting: can't use the rewind 15secs feature if I fall behind, can't pause the workout, can't even get out of cast mode to get the workout to the steps I've missed and cast it again from that specific spot. This is literally the only feature I upgraded for and it sucks.

I thought I would give this a go because it keeps popping up on my Facebook and Instagram. The adverts say it is free and in the description on here it says "Stop paying for workouts" numerous times. After completing lots of questions it pops up to upgrade to get this feature and that feature after every page of questions. When I finally got to the first workout I went to cast it to my TV and it said you have to pay! I can't complete a workout while holding a phone in front of my face.

Not sure if the reviews are fake or paid by the developers.. ! It's a bit misleading to say the app is free! Just to clarify to others, you get very limited benefits from using the free features the app offers. You will have to pay to get the meal plans and other exclusive features. So yes the app is free but it's useless if you don't pay for the pro version.

Unauthorized Credit Card Charge. I signed up for FITON PRO. I cancelled about 4 months after as I subscribed due to the fact you could choose music to go with the workout. This feature doesn't work if you use Chromecast which is the whole reason why I subscribed. Today I got billed again for a whole year without authorization. My amazon account also shows that I currently have no active subscriptions. Warning do not subscribe as any reputable company would not charge once cancelled.

App used to be great but since they made changes in late 2020, the free version is absolutely useless (if you need to cast to see the trainers while you movr around work out - which you do - - I still haven't mastered using dumbbells AND holding my phone). Very disappointing. They want users to have to use the paid version and they have therefore removed all formerly free features for any new accounts. So this app really has no free version if you are a new user. Don't bother.

Even for a free app this is shockingly rubbish. It keeps pausing, not loading and sometimes just plain crashing... and I haven't even been able to do 1 workout yet! I was looking forward to doing this as many friends has recommended, but dear God, I'd be lucky to sign in at this rate!

False advertising Ã°Å¸Ëâ, all has a price and the app keeps always asking you to change your plan from free to pro, if you want to stream to your tv you will need to pay,this is a basic feature even on YouTube free classes anyway other things is that they don't change the base price according to the country which is really bad if you want to get the pro version for latam people.

Thought I'd give the paid version a shot, the app glitched and took the payment but I'm not getting any of the pro features. I've tried restoring purchases to no luck. Ive reached out to their support three times now and only got a response the first time which didn't resolve the issue and they stopped responding to me. The next two times I was ignored.

Spinning wheel of nothingness. Cannot delete account within app, it seems. Help page also leads to spinning wheel of nothingness. Infuriatingly cannot access website to delete or access the help page while using Android. Forces you to open the app or redirects you to amazon play, so a loop to broken elements. I refuse to use apps with such awful UX.

**Update** I'm so sad! I uninstalled this app because they no longer allow for casting your workout unless you pay for Pro. Unfortunately, that's just not something I'm able to afford right now and who wants to try to watch and follow along to a workout on a phone or tablet screen? There were already plenty of other features that required pro so I'm not sure why they felt the need to take away the casting ability, just to force those of us enjoying the free portions of the to pay!

I downloaded because the description says 100% free multiple times, yet i get into the app and there are certain features with "pro" on it that you have to pay a subscription for. Then as you are setting up your workout plan, it asks for your favorites. I selected specifically the types i wanted to do which did not include cardio or require equipment, and yet my very first workout is cardio and others require equipment. Whats the point of asking for favs when setting up your plan then?

I have un installed this yet it still continues to use my calendar. Reason for un installing was because when the Alarm went off and I pushed the x to turn off it didn't work. I had to turn off the screen and turn back on. I couldn't even use my phone to make a call. Don't use this broken app.

Privacy concerns. This app records and displays my home town no matter how many times I delete and save in my profile, and even with all permissions denied. Other issues listed in other reviews. Unacceptable, so account deleted and app uninstalled. Which is a shame, since some of the content seems varied and helpful.

I'm so upset the see all button disappeared where you could see all the recommended workouts in a better view week to week and move them around. I can't believe they removed this feature. Bought subscription for casting feature and it doesn't work. I want a refund.

Really upset by this app. I used to be able to cast my workouts to my TV without needing a pro subscription and now they've locked that ability. Very disappointed. It was one thing to lock certain workouts or features of the app for the pro subscription, that I could deal with, but something as basic as casting to your TV? That defeats the entire purpose of the app for most people. Very very disappointed and will not recommend this app to anyone.

It used to be a really good app, still has great range of exercises and features but lately it keeps crashing and when I click to start a workout video it freezes or never loads. A lot of issues with streaming which really interrupts flow of workout. Sometimes I have spent up to 30 minutes restarting over and over. The fast and convenient is no more when that happens. I hope they can fix this issue as it used to be a great app

Unauthorized Credit Card Charge. I signed up for FITON PRO. I cancelled about 4 months after as I subscribed due to the fact you could choose music to go with the workout. This feature doesn't work if you use Chromecast which is the whole reason why I subscribed. Today I got billed again for a whole year without authorization. My amazon account also shows that I currently have no active subscriptions. Warning do not subscribe as any reputable company would not charge once cancelled.
After setting it up it just keeps crashing

It was great...until they took away the ability to cast on your TV without paying. It's difficult to do a workout on my small phone screen which goes to sleep after so many seconds anyways...and I'm not changing my entire phone setting just so I can workout for 20 minutes on this one app. I feel like casting should be a basic thing with the free version. They're already offering so much with paid, let us at least have this one simple thing.

Kind of really frustrated with this app. When I let it set up training sessions at the outset, it picked a bunch of level 2 workouts for my first week as a beginner. I had to delete them all and then try to assemble a training routine that worked for me by myself. Which was very difficult given how confusing the interface is. It rarely seems that one thing links to another. The Fiton app I use on my Galaxy sport watch doesn't track much. Getting the app to cast to my TV takes 3 or 4 tries of stopping and restarting the session. Really frustrating.

I love so many things about this app but the technical issues ruin the experience. Can't rewind, can't pause and can't cast to TV before the workout so once you cast, the video starts while you're putting your device down lol. Why are these functions there if you can't use them? The workouts and the instructors are great. I would upgrade but I'm unsure these issues go away with the premium package. I'll be frustrated but will keep using in hopes this is fixed one day

I downloaded this app and for one day it worked great. Great features, smooth transitions, awesome workouts & an unbeatable price of 29.99 a yr. but as soon as I subscribed the app started to freeze & I could no longer open any of my progress or even update my profile. It was a total disappoinment. Rated two stars (requested refund) because good beginning concept just needs a lot of follow up work.

Love the workouts and the trainers, but privacy is now a huge concern. Other people can add you as a friend and they have automatic access to your information. There is no "accept friend request". Edit March 2022. This is still a problem, but someone from fiton manually removed the person after many emails. New bug: the app is too large and half way covers the notification/status bar at the top of my phone.

The workouts are female focused. Light weight, booty, toning. Even tried to customize my workout plan and was really disappointed about the workouts I was given. A lot of confusing movements and technical workouts. The app is designed well and free. It looks clean and relatively easy to use. not for guys trying to build muscle. I don't like that almost all these workouts are short and light. I could hardly break a sweat and felt like I wasn't being challenged.

Great variety of workouts but the now constant ads to upgrade to premium is taking the joy out of this app and reduced my star rating from 4 to 2. I get the point but don't keep wasting my time when I'm trying to get a workout in. The social features/updates aren't relevant to me because I don't workout with others so I wish those types of upgrades were optional. It would be great to add notes about a workout for yourself (i.e., warmup not included, used certain weights, etc.).

Seems like a good app but every time I try to workout, the video freezes like it's buffering every 5-30 secs, 1 min max. It's not my internet, as I have 5g with full bars and have no problem streaming movies or music from any other app. Can't download the workouts without paying. Seems like a scam. The 5 min workouts I got (took 15 mins to do due to the freezing) I would have enjoyed if I could have done it with the video.
I'm really unhappy with how this app is performing lately, even updated with full service wifi, workouts, stall app crashes! What has happened? it USEF to be incredible!
I used to be able to add my workout selections in the Recommended section for accessibility, but they removed this feature so I cannot bookmark the workouts I wanna do.

The app does provide a lot of fitness videos for free. When I first install the app a lot of the features were free but now they're locked behind a paywall. This alone is making me not want to use this app as much anymore despite having a good majority of the fitness videos available to me they are slowly moving everything behind a paywall.

The app has good content and tons of features, however, the slogan 'premium workouts. Always free' is a bit of a trap here. After I installed and registered, I only wanted to start a workout. Instead I was bombarded with offers, pop ups, things to sign up to and often no visible way to dismiss these notifications. That makes the overloaded and cluttered interface even harder to use. Yes, it is free, but it really, really doesn't want you to use it that way.

I recently bought the pro version just so I could cast my workouts to my smart TV, however every time I try to connect the app to my device nothing happens. It's frustrating that this was an advertised pro feature when it's non-functioning. There's no way to troubleshoot either. The app recognizes the devices nearby, but it doesn't connect to my devices at all. It did the same thing to my Garmin watch, which it was unable to connect my activity. Please fix this issue.

I love that this has plenty of options, but it's too slow to load and doesn't easily enable me to prview the workouts, because again, it's slow to load. I like previewing workouts to know what moves I'm expecting, especially when I'm dealing with injuries. When I do this, Fitonn records that I've done the workout (while all I've done is preview it), which isn't an accurate record of what I've done. Overall I find myself growing impatient while looking around for a suitable workout on this.

The app is good, but it's definitely lacking. The recipes are sometimes missing ingredients but it's in the instructions to use. The recipes don't tell you how much to eat or any nutrition facts. You would have to use a separate app to input food to figure it all out yourself. The workouts are good, and there are quite a few. I don't like that you already pay for the app but to actually get classes you have to pay more. I'm not super impressed. You pay for premium but it doesn't seem premium.

I wouldn't say the app is bad per se, but there is alot that isn't great. Signed up to Pro offer to try it out, now stuck in an annual reoccurring sub that requires an email to cancel. Beginners classes aren't beginners Low impact just means no jumping, for those recovering from injuries or with medical conditions "low impact burpees" are not low impact. 5 min classes are chaotic not meaningful Constant popups and feature screens Can't sync with smartwatch despite trying Music is bad

The app is great and I like the workout videos but I got tired of the videos stopping and loading slow so I bought the premium edition and I was trying to download workouts but it keeps stopping and I have to start all over so many times. Also, I having trouble with getting back to my week because last week is my first week and on my third day of working out it putz me on week 2 and I haven't completed week 1. This is a disaster.... Please fix this!

It says free yet you still need to pay for certain features (such as meal plans) yes the workoots are good but they don't tailor them to your prferences. There isn't a gym plan and it's quite confusing to know which ones will suit you and which ones won't. I wanted to do lifting and body strength. Still a good app for beginners but not for what I required.

Edit: SUPER pissed that I was just forced into upgrading AND THUS PAYING for Pro to be able to cast to my Chromecast as that's how I work out at home and use this app almost daily. I have zero use or desire for pro or few extra features or the receipies. Very upset. Just make people watch your darn ad more or something. Probs won't recommend it anymore. Love love love this app. Only taking a star off bc it needs to be easier to navigate and get out of one screen and back to your home page.

I absolutely love this app! Its been a total game changer for me. But since updating yesterday, all of the videos are lagging. I tried a 15 min workout yesterday that took 15 mins to work through half of it. I've tried different videos and even restarted my phone. Could you please look into that? Other than that this app deserves 5 stars

I purchased the Pro version for the ability to sync my Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 for the heart rate, a feature that FitOn vehemently flaunts. However, when trying to link them, I discovered that the FitOn app is no longer available in the Galaxy Store which makes this feature useless. I linked Google fit, but it does not sync the heart rate with the app. I can cast the app to my FireTV, but I could do this anyway with a Google Chromecast. Not worth the money to buy w/o the ability to link to watch

I really wanted to love this app. It keep freezing in the middle of workouts, and it kills the vibe. I haven't had disconnection issues, but when you are barely through the warmup before the app freezes or goes into buffering for 2 minutes, there no point in continuing the workout.

The videos on this app load slowly. They continue to go through buffering Cycles throughout the video. A 5 minute video can take 15 to 25 minutes to watch not worth your time or your money I'm stuck in my subscription until next year I suggest if you do want to try the app that you don't pay for it until they get their bugs fixed.

Any way to make this app have a less-bright option? I'm using this app, less and less, as it is too bright, even on the lowest brightness setting my device has. I like the app. Like the work outs. Have been using it for years. However, the brightness level hurting my eyes and the constant app changes, moving and removing useful/helpful features changed my previous 5-star review, to less over time.

It's ok. I like the app it does have some great features you know showing short easy workouts you can do at your desk or anywhere the only thing for me is they only allow you connect a Fitbit or a Garmin watch what about Samsung or Apple watches. Besides that feature there is no reason for me to pay for this service yearly

Would actually be a good app ifnthere were a few more free features and youncould control the music in free mode as well. I couldnt endure some of the terrible music playing while trying to do som pilates, nor could i turn it down so i could hear the instructor which i also struggled with.
