The app is good, but it's definitely lacking. The recipes are sometimes missing ingredients but it's in the instructions to use. The recipes don't tell you how much to eat or any nutrition facts. You would have to use a separate app to input food to figure it all out yourself. The workouts are good, and there are quite a few. I don't like that you already pay for the app but to actually get classes you have to pay more. I'm not super impressed. You pay for premium but it doesn't seem premium.
I'm really unhappy with how this app is performing lately, even updated with full service wifi, workouts, stall app crashes! What has happened? it USEF to be incredible!
I used to be able to add my workout selections in the Recommended section for accessibility, but they removed this feature so I cannot bookmark the workouts I wanna do.

The app does provide a lot of fitness videos for free. When I first install the app a lot of the features were free but now they're locked behind a paywall. This alone is making me not want to use this app as much anymore despite having a good majority of the fitness videos available to me they are slowly moving everything behind a paywall.

It's ok. I like the app it does have some great features you know showing short easy workouts you can do at your desk or anywhere the only thing for me is they only allow you connect a Fitbit or a Garmin watch what about Samsung or Apple watches. Besides that feature there is no reason for me to pay for this service yearly
I dislike the new feature where it chops up the workout to show you the next move. Make an option to turn this off
lots of features but at the same time, very difficult to keep track of things . for example how do you add your daily workout (custom)? im looking for 5 min and no clue.

I have loved completing the postnatal exercises! Unfortunately, as of today I am no longer able to see the weekly recommended workouts for my fitness plan. This is frustrating because I enjoyed this feature immensely. I hope this issue can be resolved soon.

I really like fiton, but I'm a big girl who tries exercising at home. Your programs made for skinny people. At least 2/3 exercises in each training I can't physically do because I'm big. :) that should be more plus size friendly I guess. Everyone who has downloaded this app have expectations so it's quite disappointing that you are not really plus size friendly :) at least I think so. I was much smaller in size couple years ago and Fiton was spot on. Now - not so much..
App keeps crashing lately. Even with a reinstall.

It was great...until they took away the ability to cast on your TV without paying. It's difficult to do a workout on my small phone screen which goes to sleep after so many seconds anyways...and I'm not changing my entire phone setting just so I can workout for 20 minutes on this one app. I feel like casting should be a basic thing with the free version. They're already offering so much with paid, let us at least have this one simple thing.
Disappointed that you now have to upgrade to PRO to be able to cast onto your TV screen. This was a feature I thought was important. Not happy and will not pay for this added feature

I recently bought the pro version just so I could cast my workouts to my smart TV, however every time I try to connect the app to my device nothing happens. It's frustrating that this was an advertised pro feature when it's non-functioning. There's no way to troubleshoot either. The app recognizes the devices nearby, but it doesn't connect to my devices at all. It did the same thing to my Garmin watch, which it was unable to connect my activity. Please fix this issue.

Great app until they took the casting feature off the free version I can barely see the trainer when using the app on my phone When I could cast to my tv, I found the trainers awesome and loved using the app

The app has good content and tons of features, however, the slogan 'premium workouts. Always free' is a bit of a trap here. After I installed and registered, I only wanted to start a workout. Instead I was bombarded with offers, pop ups, things to sign up to and often no visible way to dismiss these notifications. That makes the overloaded and cluttered interface even harder to use. Yes, it is free, but it really, really doesn't want you to use it that way.

Any way to make this app have a less-bright option? I'm using this app, less and less, as it is too bright, even on the lowest brightness setting my device has. I like the app. Like the work outs. Have been using it for years. However, the brightness level hurting my eyes and the constant app changes, moving and removing useful/helpful features changed my previous 5-star review, to less over time.

FitOn is beginning to hide basic functionality behind a paywall. For example, casting to a TV was previously free to ALL users. I can understand making new features PRO only - but why go out of your way to hide existing functionality and penalize loyal users?
Did an update and now the app keeps crashing everytime I try to play a workout. Super unimpressed

Edit: SUPER pissed that I was just forced into upgrading AND THUS PAYING for Pro to be able to cast to my Chromecast as that's how I work out at home and use this app almost daily. I have zero use or desire for pro or few extra features or the receipies. Very upset. Just make people watch your darn ad more or something. Probs won't recommend it anymore. Love love love this app. Only taking a star off bc it needs to be easier to navigate and get out of one screen and back to your home page.

Would actually be a good app ifnthere were a few more free features and youncould control the music in free mode as well. I couldnt endure some of the terrible music playing while trying to do som pilates, nor could i turn it down so i could hear the instructor which i also struggled with.

I purchasePro and I am very unhappy with the meal program. I have done other weight loss programs and Fit On Pro is not very educating. There is no nutritional information or any meals. The plans are not very detailed and it is confusing where to start and how to meal plan. For example how much protein and vegetables you should eat in a day. Are all meals equal? Most of the meals are not appealing and fancy. Not family friendly. Workouts are great. Meal plan is lacking big time.

This is app is very bad ., Interface is nonsense., It is so confusing., Too many questions, and no direct solution., I don't understand when company have that much money why they are not using that money in a good why , why making things complicated.

Love the workouts and the trainers, but privacy is now a huge concern. Other people can add you as a friend and they have automatic access to your information. There is no "accept friend request". Edit March 2022. This is still a problem, but someone from fiton manually removed the person after many emails. New bug: the app is too large and half way covers the notification/status bar at the top of my phone.

I REALLY like this app! There's a great variety of workouts and I got the Pro version and I'm looking forward to trying those features! My only complaint is that I cast my workouts to my TV, and when I finish one of the shorter timed workouts and I want to do another one, it won't let me cast 2 times in a row, even though the TV I want to cast to is showing. I have to close the app completely out and start it again. And even then, sometimes it still won't work. Can this be looked in to please?

Great workout programs app, but it has major issues with maintaining connections with other apps and devices. Seems every time I do a workout I have to reconnect it with Google Fit and Garmin Connect. It's extremely annoying that this app loses the link so often, and the developers have yet to fix these reliability and stability issues.

You can only use chromecast with a premium membership. This is a standard feature in every other app I've seen, shouldn't be a premium feature. There are some pieces of the app that I find a bit difficult to navigate. Also, if you make any changes to your program it automatically resets all your data (with a warning). Seems like it would make more sense to give the option to store prior work or remove it. I no longer have credit for work I've done just for having to change the number of workout

Good workouts, generally pretty short. Definitely able to pick your level. Unfortunately, there are some workouts that have bad cuts so you miss some instructions or the timing is way off (30 sec. on one leg, 60 sec. on the other), which makes for a bad workout. Months after reporting and the bad workouts are still there, with no way of flagging them so I can remember to avoid them.

New member feedback - the premise is awesome and initial buyin price was phenomenal. Now, it is not the most user friendly setup and feels rather clunky. A better way to toggle between what the app offers is very much needed (even a simple menu would be nice). Also, adding workouts to the calendar, while a nice feature, is not as nice as it can be. Why can't the classes for that day be accessed? It makes it so that building a calendar is not useful for accurate workout planning.

You can't rewind a workout and if you pause it doesn't start where you paused. The instructors go pretty fast with their movements cause they are super fit but for the average person it's way too fast. Anyway these strengthening moves are supposed to be done slower. Can't use the party video on a laptop when you used to be able too.

Things I love: many workouts to choose from, easy to filter, calories burnt estimation with every workout. Things I hate: many workouts feature the exact same moves from others, app constantly freezes upon loading. I used it for a while but then out of nowhere it stopped casting to my TV (all other apps still cast...) and IT didn't get back to me. Uninstalled.

The app it's self is the only thing I have issues with. They need work out a few kinks. I had some problems trying to cast to my TV. Also one of the workouts I did that was only 14 mins was some how recorded as 44 mins. So just little things. Apart from that, the instructors are amazing. Very knowledgeable people doing what they love it seems like. It's entertaining and encouraging Ã°Å¸Ë

Good but still a way to go. Lots of free workouts and very few ads. However, almost all the exercises involve some knee involvement, even the low impact. So it isn't a great program for people with knee issues. Very few instructors offer alternative versions for people with knee problems. Jeanette and Kenta are THE best and offer the most variety and accommodations while still providing a great workout. Danielle and Caroline are the worst.

Lots of variety in workouts and trainers. But there are issues. 1) missing some key filters: workout stage (warm up, main, cool down), or type (pilates, cardio) if you're looking under beginner, for example. 2) They think an easy thing for them is good for beginners. Sure, if the person is only new to that type of exercise but is already fit. Even with my experience and modifying the workouts, 2 days of LI beginner stretch have me seeing chiropractors and massage therapy due to back pain.

I like the workouts on this app and have been enjoying it very much. This review, however, is for the premium version, which I payed for to get the meal plans. I think this feature could work well, but it is poorly executed. The shopping cart feature is smart, but then you realize you'll be buying many things that may not get used more than once. I think certain meals which utilize many similar ingredients in different ways should be populated together each week, as many people shop weekly.

Updated review.....they took away the ability to stream unless you pay for it. I get if you add a feature that costs money, but to take away something that was already part of the app? That just sucks. I definitely find I use it less now that they took away the casting feature.

I love this app, but it's always lagging and bugging (I have good wifi, so it's not my fault). Lots of the bugs include: workouts going blank whenever I press on them, all my previous achievements disappearing, all previous data (like recent workouts, calendar, and weight) disappearing... How can you fix this?

The content is good with nice workouts for all levels. The issue is with the PRO content. I've paid the PRO just to be able to have the videos offline but the download is a joke (usually stops before the end of download and if it doesn't it still takes 1 minute for every minute of video on a 100 Mbit/s connection). On top of that once you've managed to download a video it will give memory issues if you have more than 5 stored and will cancel them (even with GB of free space available)

I've been using FitOn since the start of lockdown and I am a massive advocate, but I feel that some of the new features have made the app very difficult to use. I love that courses and programs are available, but I really miss being able to plan and see my workouts for the coming week in one place. It's all become really disjointed and hard to get an overview of your activities. This was much much easier before.

I love fitOn. However for the last month I've been unable to play vidoes at home with my slightly slower internet, as they won't load. All other streaming apps (YouTube, Netflix etc) work fine. This is pretty frustrating as I then have to remember to download videos at work everyday. And if I backtrack a video 15 seconds the music will appear/disappear.

Free was ok but as soon as I bought pro for 39.99 the app stopped working. However, the response from Fiton was fast and they did help me to fix the issue. It has been a couple of weeks and the workouts and trainers seem pretty good. Once I have familiarized myself with all the features my rating may change a little more. I am not big on the marketing of "70% off today only" as this is not a true statement. This is offered every time you open the app.

Looks like it could be great, buy have just downloaded and having an issue. I selected the program feature and after setting it up, realized I wanted to change the length of each workout. Even though it allows me to update in the settings and supposedly "reset", it did not change the workout times to what I had selected. Could you please tell me how to do that

great app! BUT you do sometimes need equipment. And you can't get some features without premium. And it lags a little. Some of the workouts are a bit to hard as these are professionals. But there are some great challenges and they post on social media ( eg instergram )...over all pretty good app i like it but I'm not sure if I would recommend it but that is just me try it out for yourself it might be good for you Thx for reading :^)
Sometimes it freezes up on me, but the workouts are awesome.

Free version: awesome video workouts for people who already have novice+ fitness and understanding of exercises. Weekly workout plans are varied and option to set reminders on your phone is a great feature. Paid version: 1 star. Only addition really is the 'Meal Plan'. Recipes are not well written, ingredient lists are often incomplete, and nutrition info is not provided. If you swap a meal, the app does not update your other meals for the day. Not recommended.

The app is great if you already have some basic fitness level. They introduced burpies to me on day one. Then single leg burpies on day three. The excercises are not beginner friendly. I like the reminder feature, but I don't like the fact that the app sends me workouts to follow that are far above my fitness level.

Update: They've changed it so you can no longer stream your app to your TV without paying pro prices. That's going to be a pretty huge detterant for people,especially if they're losing that feature. This app giveth and taketh away. My previous review: For a completely free app, it's absolute fire! Customer service is awesome too.

I downloaded the app because I saw a commercial on Instagram of this app with Gabrielle Union as the spokesperson. Unfortunately, I can't use it on the TV because even though it says the app is free, which to some parts it is, you have to pay to use it on the TV. My screen on my phone is way too small to use for this. I understand charging for meal structures or professional help, but .. really? Not the TV. Thanks, but no thanks. The inflation of our economy has gone up way too much right now.

I haven't done many of the workouts yet, primarily because you have to PAY in order to cast to your TV. They make it seem like it's this amazing, free app the you can cast to your TV when in reality your paying for that particular feature. It was disappointing.

Overall, great app for at home exercise. I just recently got the premium which allows you to track your heart rate and other features. My biggest issue with this app so far is that it does not accurately track calories burned. A typical exercise without the fitbit tracking will burn you about 150 calories. After connecting my Fitbit, I was suddenly burning 800-1000 calories for these workouts. Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£ I've emailed support with no response yet. No point in tracking if it's not accurate.

Really awesome videos. Love the app. However, the calorie count is completely off. And if my watch is connected to the app, then the calories don't work at all. So that's a bit lame.. Also would love to use the video call feature to train with friends, but you have to pay for it.
Sometimes it freezes up on me, but the workouts are awesome.

Updated review.....they took away the ability to stream unless you pay for it. I get if you add a feature that costs money, but to take away something that was already part of the app? That just sucks. I definitely find I use it less now that they took away the casting feature.

I REALLY like this app! There's a great variety of workouts and I got the Pro version and I'm looking forward to trying those features! My only complaint is that I cast my workouts to my TV, and when I finish one of the shorter timed workouts and I want to do another one, it won't let me cast 2 times in a row, even though the TV I want to cast to is showing. I have to close the app completely out and start it again. And even then, sometimes it still won't work. Can this be looked in to please?

Great workout programs app, but it has major issues with maintaining connections with other apps and devices. Seems every time I do a workout I have to reconnect it with Google Fit and Garmin Connect. It's extremely annoying that this app loses the link so often, and the developers have yet to fix these reliability and stability issues.

I love this app, but it's always lagging and bugging (I have good wifi, so it's not my fault). Lots of the bugs include: workouts going blank whenever I press on them, all my previous achievements disappearing, all previous data (like recent workouts, calendar, and weight) disappearing... How can you fix this?

Good but still a way to go. Lots of free workouts and very few ads. However, almost all the exercises involve some knee involvement, even the low impact. So it isn't a great program for people with knee issues. Very few instructors offer alternative versions for people with knee problems. Jeanette and Kenta are THE best and offer the most variety and accommodations while still providing a great workout. Danielle and Caroline are the worst.
I love this app until now. I can't start any workout - videos are laggy and can't cast on TV. Tried on different devices and switched wifi to data, and nothing works.

I downloaded the app because I saw a commercial on Instagram of this app with Gabrielle Union as the spokesperson. Unfortunately, I can't use it on the TV because even though it says the app is free, which to some parts it is, you have to pay to use it on the TV. My screen on my phone is way too small to use for this. I understand charging for meal structures or professional help, but .. really? Not the TV. Thanks, but no thanks. The inflation of our economy has gone up way too much right now.

I love fitOn. However for the last month I've been unable to play vidoes at home with my slightly slower internet, as they won't load. All other streaming apps (YouTube, Netflix etc) work fine. This is pretty frustrating as I then have to remember to download videos at work everyday. And if I backtrack a video 15 seconds the music will appear/disappear.
The streaming capabilities went down recently. The application hardly works with Google Home, freezes every 10 minutes and even gets the phone stuck until reboot. Very disappointing.

Fantastic workout app. Easily stream from your phone to a smart device, which makes workouts far easier. Wide array of instructors and styles. I have 2 drawbacks: when streaming to your tv, you cannot pause the workouts, which is annoying for beginners like me tht sometimes need a breather. And there is no search option for workouts, so you have to scroll through to find the one you want. But these are small annoyances for an otherwise fantastic app. Highly recommend!

I really love this app. It's been a great tool to have along with the gym. The workouts do seem to be geared more towards people who are already in shape and can do all the moves. I do find it challenging but it can be frustrating sometimes because the trainers don't give substitutions to do if a particular workout is hard. Also when I try to connect my Samsung watch it crashes. But besides these issues I love this app. I've lost 8lbs so far. Thanks Fiton

This has some great workouts. I love the app. It does buffer from time to time and when that happens the workout starts over from the very beginning so I have to find my place. Also, I cant always take my picture because the app seems to freeze up at the end. AND it doesn't always record that I've completed a workout. So I've completed some workouts and it still reads as an incomplete workout. When things aren't glitching in those ways, I love the app. The instructors and workouts are great!

This has been my go to workout app for over a year now. I really love the variety. Recently though I have been noticing some technical glitches with both the app and the desktop version with loading issues. Maybe take a look at that because this program is overall great and I'd hate to see it start going downhill. Also dial back on the ads please.

I love this app. It has a variety of workouts and great trainers! It is very easy to navigate, and you can filter through workouts by target areas, length of time, trainers, and different categories. My only complaint is that the workouts don't always load correctly and tend to freeze, even though I paid to be able to download them for offline use.

The app is great and I love all of the different options. But it needs some work. Tried to do a party workout which didn't allow us to restart due to sync issues. We couldn't end the party, only resume. Then when we reopened it, we were brought to an ad to pay for premium. It's disappointing since I started this app solely for the video calls for shared workouts.

For the most part this app is amazing! So many workout times frames, intensities, and trainers. That being said I do not love the pro version. I don't get how to use the new music feature for one. Also, I can't see my personally scheduled workouts unless I go to my friends chat area and it'll show the invite. On the bright side at least now I can cast it onto my smart TV... won't be paying $70 next year just to do that though. As for the free meal ideas, that's what pinterest is for.

The workouts are great and have a lot of variety. I absolutely love them. They are constantly adding to the workout library. I paid for the Pro version to get a meal plan. The foods that I have tried are good, however, sometimes the recipes don't list all of the ingredients or the amounts. It also doesn't list the macros and calories for each recipe. The TV app has less features than the phone app even though I paid for the Pro version and it's the same account.

Streaming works well, good variety of workout types and trainers, overall nice user interface... A few little things don't make sense or are less intuitive (i.e. I can favorite a workout, but then don't know what that does or where to find it again); but so far they are small enough things that don't cause a real inconvenience, just that fixes would only dramatically improve the app

I love the workouts in this app. It's extremely easy to search for specific workouts. It would be nice if we could organize our favorites by targeted area such as abs. I have to scroll through all my many favorites to find what I want to work, which wastes a lot of precious workout time. I've used other workout apps that have this feature and it's very helpful.

I use the free version and love it! Great workouts and variety. Signing up for challenges is a great way to help me with my goals. The only issue I have experienced is sometimes the workouts have an issue streaming (i know my internet speed is fine). The app for android is great. I do have an issue with the Roku TV app though. There is no feature on it to sign out once you sign in. Multiple people in my house use fiton to keep track of their workouts, so a sign out feature on Roku would be nice.

01/11/23 - Seems casting to your TV is no longer available on the free version. Turns out attempting to follow an exercise from a 6" screen is fairly difficult and not enjoyable. Also, an ad for PRO auto plays upon opening the app and it can't be skipped. Still lots of free content, but now a bit harder to utilize. 6/6/22 - Tons of content and variety. Really like the search/filter feature so I can find just what I'm in the mood for. Generous offering, especially at no cost.

I love it. Awesome routines. It really challenges the tightness in the body. Only thing that's frustrating is the meal planning. I have to pay in order to get access. I understand why they do it, I just can't afford it because I'm currently paying my way through collage. 2.99 is a real good monthly price, but I can't spare it. Maybe allow access for just a few meals, and then pay if you want more? The FitOn app is great!

The FitOn application is highly motivating and effective when utilizing the apps features offered! They have great trainers with effective workouts that meets your needs and time frame. I'm able to switch styles of exercise and try new ways of moving the body! I'm able to connect with friends and family that you can invite to do challenges over a set period of time and the chat room makes you aware they've completed the routine. I set an alarm on the app to motivate me to live healthy! Thanks Ã°Å¸ËÅ

Really nice app. Love that it is free, but there are some issues. I have it set for 4-5 workouts a day. I only want to do 4 since one of those day i do cardio outside. However when i am ready to start the next weeks schedule, the first exercise is counting for the week before. If i choose 3-4 it only gives me 3 workouts. I really would like more definite options for the amount of workout per week. Wanted to try something new, but may go to my previous workout app that was more customizable.

I love being able to filter workouts to target certain part of the body, timing, equipment, and trainers. Since some days are better than others, I make a point to stretch if nothing else on the days when I'm really not feeling it because stretching IS exercise. I'm meeting MYSELF where I am. I like that my workouts are tracked so I can see my progress. The only drawback is I haven't figured out how to work out via screen cast with friends. The phone screen is too small for that.

FitOm has been the perfect workout buddy in this pandemic, so much so that I get anxious on days I don't end up working out! But I really like their holistic approach. There is something for everyone here! One thing I would change is the layout of the app since it can get confusing navigating it. What seems to be my workout settings are actually my account settings and vice versa. I would also like them to improve the browse page.Basically, it needs to be more user friendly. But I love this app!

uploaded the app on my new phone, more ads than before. after a workout it would be nice to just go back to my main page. many options afterwards kind of interrupts the flow. also there seem to be some workouts that are missing. there were desk and seated one for work that I can't find anymore. overall cool app.

Love the workouts. I will often repeat one several times back to back. I use it as an add on sometimes to my home gym workout. A little confused about it tracking my workouts. Trying to do the WFH challenge but I don't see how it is being recorded as completing one. I don't like the camera feature.

Amazing workouts with lots of verity to keep me interested. They get into the small muscles. Only negative is that the app seems kind of messy. The huge verity of workouts makes it confusing to find a workout each day. I wish they would offer workout plans. However I have not found an app that has such a range of workouts and this is definitely my go to app

I love this app. I would like it better with one small change. I prefer to watch a workout all the way through before doing it. If there was a way to watch a video in preview mode (but seeing entire video) that would be great. Right now it feels like I'm cheating because the app thinks I worked out to a video that I was just checking out.

The workouts in the app are decent. Some instructors do a better job than others of explaining the exercise before diving in. There is a great variety of sessions, both in length and in focus (cardio, strength, abs, etc.). You can string a few together if you are up for it. One thing missing is being able to tell the app what equipment you have, as many sessions require dumbbells. But this is the best 'free' exercise app featuring instructors that I've used.

A great app, you can set reminders for all workouts and have the option to customize your fitness journey. Only given 4 stars because there layout of workouts is appealing, but very cluttered. Its difficult to see what workouts you have previously done. There should be a question with ability to give feedback if you want to leave an exercise class e.g. because you didn't like it or the trainer is not doing what you thought was going to be done.

Overall great fitness app with excellent connectivity to friends. Also offers a wide range of functions. Tailored exercises, meal plans and more. My only negative is that you have very limited control over the video quality. Combined with offline downloads being a premium feature, you've got a real problem in a country like South Africa (with limited data and electricity).

App is quite good, workouts can be really challenging if you are not cheating. But there is one minus for meal recipes- I found on quite a few recipes that is missing some ingredients, such as toppings or dressing. It says in process of preparation to mix all the ingredients for dressing, but doesn't say what are the ingredients. So, it's either you have to improvise or change the meal.

I like app, and my friends and I do use the party feature. But it has been quite challenging to use it. On several occasions when we click on start to start a pre-scheduled party, we ended up in our individual workout sessions rather than being in a party. Having to resend invite to start party immediately before it actually worked. That's quite frustrating. Other than that, the app is great to use, and the workouts are fun and really motivating!

Love this app. So much variety from stretching to weights workouts, as well as different trainers to choose from too. There are no add interruptions which is fantastic. Would rate this higher but I have to force shut the app at the end of the workout as it freezes. But otherwise this I may go to when I need some motivation or variety! Would highly recomend!!

I love the fact that all the workouts are completely free to access and there's so much variety on it! Only issue I have with this app is the Fitbit connection often plays up so it either takes ages to connect to the app, or it does connect to the app but the calorie counter shoots up to a very unrealistic amount burnt and it's unfair for those who are competing against you, for a feature that you pay for it's disappointing that it has quite a few issues, but apart from that it's a great app Ã¢ËÂºÃ¯Â¸

I really like this app. Navigation overall could improve, especially on finding workouts you love. I wish there was a monthly subscription rather than annual fees and an option to choose features based on what one needs. I would like to sync my fitbit but I don't need some of the premium features.

Fantastic app. Recommend to all! 4 stars to reflect slight disappointment with premium version (music feature does not work - I am in Canada?, not loving the recipes). I would like to be able to indicate limitations for movements so I could get tailored workouts or modifications. Also disappointing to lose plan history when you switch the slightest thing like no. of workouts per week. Would love to get a recommendation for rest days too.

Love this app. Kenny, Breann, and Vytas have helped me get into the best shape of my life in my 50s! You put in the work but the excellent guidance and helpful encouragement and jokes make it so much easier. I cannot give the app 5 stars right now though. It used to sync with Google Fit and that is now broken. Without the sync, I have to manually enter everything to sync across the rest of my trackers and that's suboptimal.
Love the app, in general. One thing I don't like is that it can add people as friends without it requesting their permission. Surely that's a privacy breach?
This is an amazing and encouraging workout app, but it's streaming will sometimes just keep lagging and it has some adds. Other than that, THIS APP IS AWSOME!

01/11/23 - Seems casting to your TV is no longer available on the free version. Turns out attempting to follow an exercise from a 6" screen is fairly difficult and not enjoyable. Also, an ad for PRO auto plays upon opening the app and it can't be skipped. Still lots of free content, but now a bit harder to utilize. 6/6/22 - Tons of content and variety. Really like the search/filter feature so I can find just what I'm in the mood for. Generous offering, especially at no cost.

Love this app. Kenny, Breann, and Vytas have helped me get into the best shape of my life in my 50s! You put in the work but the excellent guidance and helpful encouragement and jokes make it so much easier. I cannot give the app 5 stars right now though. It used to sync with Google Fit and that is now broken. Without the sync, I have to manually enter everything to sync across the rest of my trackers and that's suboptimal.

Love FitOn. Great instructors, wide vareity of workouts, great recipes and advice. Love how FitOn thinks about busy lives. Only request hence the 4 star is I can't preview workouts within a program without selecting the program. Otherwise 5 star

I've been using this app for 2 years and I love it and am so thankful for it. It has a variety of workouts, meal planning and shopping list, education, and ways to connect with friends. I share it with everyone! The short workouts really help get my momentum going. The paid version is super affordable imo too. My requests include organizing the shopping list more to group the same ingredients and separate them into categories, and fixing the glitch where you can't change or turn off the music.

I really like that they have a wide range of workouts for free and they're actually great quality. The articles are a plus too. Sometimes I have issues casting it to my Firestick but I'm not sure if that is the fault of my Firestick or FitOn. With that said, they can improve the paid version. The recipes are fine but sometimes they are missing portions of the recipe and it would be nice if they gave you the calorie break down & nutritional content. I wouldn't upgrade to the paid version again.

I've been using the free version for three weeks, and I love it! It does take quite a bit of tweaking on the user end to find workouts that fit individual ability level, but the workouts themselves are easy to follow and trainers are excellent. I'm on the fence about the pro version, though, only because I don't actually need any of those features. I use a tripod to perch my phone up to watch the videos.

This app is phenonmenal! It is tailored to the individual brilliantly. You can customize your fitness goal, plan length, workout time and so much more. My favorite feature is the "daily fix," which is a mini workout to keep you feeling great even if you don't have a lot of time. This app is perfect whether you're a beginner or you've been exercising for a while.

Love this app. So much versatility. The trainers are all equally great in their style and motivation to keep you moving. I've tried things I wouldn't have otherwise and helped my body with mobility and stretching. The way to search for a workout via time, body part, trainer, style makes it so easy to find something you're looking for. The challenge are great to keep you accountable as well as the invite your friends feature. I've turned my sister onto it and we can do long distance workouts!

ACTUALLY FREE. No ads, no "premium memberships", and super helpful in building a routine. I have limited time to do an actual full workout, so it's nothing to fit in a couple 10 min workouts everyday and a 30 min one 3 days/week. The stretches are great after a long, busy day. So many workouts, keeps me motivated with reminders. The app runs smooth, I haven't had any issues with it shutting down or freezing.

Overall, this is a really good workout tool. At least in my opinion this is way better than workouts by yourself. The trainers are knowledgeable and push you further than you want. You can either go with their plan or customize your own workouts. Streaming has paused on me a few times but it has never crashed on me. Workouts are so varied, with lots of options for targeting, intensity, and time limits. Overall it's just a lot of quality for a free app. Really recommend anyone try it out.

I don't usually rate apps, but I had to give this one five stars. The workouts are awesome and slowly build up from a do-able pace for beginners, which I can't say for any other workout app I've tried. There's a huge variety of workouts, stretches, and more. The videos are great quality and they're very encouraging to help keep you going. I would definitely recommend this app, especially if you're someone who has struggled with keeping a good workout schedule with other apps.

I love it. This is is perfect for beginners that are having issues to stay motivated. It is not just a workout app, it is a communnity. You can join live workouts and be competiitve or you can make your own session with your friends and have a some fun. Personally for me, the instructors always make the workouts feel possible to achieve no matter how hard the workout really is. Plus it is FREE!!! They have a variety of workouts ranging from beginner to expert and with or without equiptment.

I appreciate that while pro is definitely worth it, the app is still absolutely usable and with many workouts and features available for free. Some of the trainers do explain things better than others but there are a lot to choose from so I was able to pick the one I felt is the best for for me after trying a few videos. They have a lot of workouts that don't require any equipment which is awesome, and also a number of low-impact cardio videos which is so helpful.

I LOVE this app! It's easy to use, and has great workouts of all kinds for all levels. It allows you to set goals that are actually attainable, so you don't have to set a 30 day challenge and then feel bad for missing a day! I have mine set for 2-3 workouts a week, at 5-10 minute lengths. It then suggests workouts that meet my criteria, and they are different each week. You can also search through their databases of workouts to find the perfect one. Ã°Å¸Â¥Â°

I love this app! It makes fitness accessible to everyone. You can set small goals or big ones. You can choose high energy or low impact options...AND the workouts are broken into categories and are easily searchable. The trainers are personable and encouraging. My favorite part is the 'at work' workouts. These are short, less than 5 mins, that help you stretch and move during your work day. You can have the app send you notifications to remind to move. And it's free!

I have never left a review on anything before but I have to say that this is a great app! I have truly hated working out and could not stick with anything for long. FitOn is different than any others I have used before. Completely customizable for your own workout needs and has challenges to keep you motivated. Can even join with friends remotely. I have used it almost every day for the past 3 months and still don't hate it :) There are glitches at times where it freezes but it isn't often.

Haven't explored all features, but I like how the app keeps track of workouts & badges. Also like how you can filter through workouts to find just the right one. Also able to seamlessly access my account through Roku. Only two negatives at this time - 1) if you've favorited a lot of workouts & try to access on phone, it takes a long time for them to load and to scroll through them 2) I wish you could preview workouts without it looking like you started then stopped a workout.

Most likely this is the best free workout app available. Supposedly it let's you customize according to your goals, but I found that to be more of a gimmick than a real feature. In reality it is heavily geared towards women. So if you are a guy that is trying to build muscle than look for something else. If you are trying to lose weight, build endurance, and experience whole lot of different workout techniques than this app is perfect for it.

I have the free version & love it. I am not an exercisefan. I needed help introducing exercise into my life. This app did it. I started slow picking a few workouts each week with low intensity. Slowly added more in and following suggestions from FitOn with new types. Its been 2 months now, I look forward to my daily workouts. Its free, easy to use and the instructors are fun and upbeat, even if watched it before. You won't be disappointed!

This app is an absolute must! It is all free, the workouts are great and it is super easy to use. I did have some weird issues with it synching, so I deleted it, and with a quick install, I was back. I have never been into work out apps, or really work out classes, but this app is super awesome. Definitely do it, you won't regret it!

Love the format; love the positive attitudes of the instructors; love the variety of the workouts. Being free is an absolute amazing feature! Update: What is really awesome is that this app meets you where you are in your fitness journey...beginner, no prob; ready to kick it up, they have programs ready on demand. After taking a month off due to illness, it was nice to be able to jump back in and restart some of the easier programs to build myself back up. Love this app!

Love the coaches and the workouts. A lot of coaches to choose from which I love and all the different program options make it fun. There are also a multitude of modifications for all levels and ages available. I have the paid program and highly recommend it, but if you're not able to do that, the app alone is great too that's where I started. I'm 56 years old with all kinds of structural issues and I use this thing 5 days a week!! No excuse is a good excuse. Eat well, BE active, BE well

This app is perfect for me. So many different workouts and instructors, search by type, length, or intensity of workout, strength training, low impact, small spaces.. it really has everything. I do something new almost every workout so I don't get bored. It tracks them for me so I can track them in the Noom app. Between this and Noom losing weight as never been easier!

I now love exercise because of this app. I work out now 3x a day. I love the many options I have for variety. There are a few issues with the app though. You cannot see what you've scheduled. You cannot see what you've done, beyond that current week. It connects to a fire stick but not Roku. Even with these flaws, I look forward to working out using this app. Now if it would sync with Fitbit, I'd be a happy camper.

I love this app. I don't use it as much as I should. But it has so many options for the even the free version. I love that the workouts are shortand very descriptive based on what intensity and the body area you're targeting. I love that there are options to do live workout as well as on-demand workouts. I know that they have moved to creating a premium version. But I hope they do not eliminate the features that are there for people with the free version because I have referred many ppl already!

Garbage. Tracking randomly crashes and, if you're unlucky, your progress will reset to 0. I've had multiple evenings where I'll walk 8-10 miles but because of these crashes and lost data, it tracks 2 miles or fewer (once is an accident, twice is coincidence, three times is a pattern). If you want an accurate activity tracker, look elsewhere.

After seeing this app included on several Best app lists, I installed the free version in order to get distance and pace info for my daily walks, but this app was disappointing. I walk varying distances on a riverside bike trail, and there are mile markers along much of my route. The app displayed distances that tended to be about 85% of the actual marked distances, and the pace data was wildly inaccurate (often much slower than actual, sometimes much faster). I guess I'll keep looking.

Was a great app, but after an update in September 2022 or so, it frequently loops back into the "save workout" menu. When it does this it won't let me save the workout, and it won't let me discard the workout - just repeats the"save workout" menu. I have to delete the app and reinstall it to get it to work properly and then it fails within a day or two. It started with a pixel 6, and continues to do it with the new Pixel 7 as well. I have submitted multiple support tickets with no resolution.

Even after two years and numerous updates, this app is still slower, more glitchy, less accurate, and overall less user-friendly than Endomondo. There is no way to change which stats appear at a glance in the list for past walks; it defaults to distance (which is displayed twice actually) and average pace. If you would rather know your average speed, for example, you have to click on each workout individually. I still miss Endomondo and wish they had never replaced it with this.

I used it once so far and it worked great. It tracked my walk, told me how far I walked and how long it took me. When I stopped at home to rest and forgot to turn off the app, I was able to use the easy to read graph and see just the part I walked. I believe this app has something wrong with the voice portion. It sounds awful too slow.

Was a great app until last update. Went from accurate tracking to worthless tracking. I walk the same paths daily and am now getting under reported results. The mapping doesn't even display the rout accurately. Voice prompts are no longer on the mile intervals and the split times are really goofy. Calories burned are no longer accurate. About all it's good for now is tracking overall time and a date. Very dissapointing. Update: Switched to backup phone and unreliable results about the same.

I've used this app for five years on the free version. It helps and syncs well with other my fitness apps. Not too many advertising issues and it is accurate 99% of the time. Now this app sucks!!! I've reached out for help. You get customer contact and send in all kinds of evidence and it's nothing all radio silence. I even uninstalled and reinstalled trying to make sure it wasn't my phone. Now it's money over health. New...I have sent in several support tickets as said above no help!

Began great when I started 3 yrs ago. I'm disabled & it was only app that recorded my slow walk. For last 6 months it has: sporadic recording; deleting recordings that have been saved, especially over 5 in a day; quit recording miles on shoes (being diabetic, I need this); & won't record accurately. It doesn't even stay updated on shoes available. I've uninstalled & reinstalled twice, this is the last time.

I have used the app for over 10 years and very happy with it. After a couple of small issues I reached out for assistance and was advised to uninstall and reinstall the app. When I tried to reinstall I was unable to as the app now states it is no longer compatible. I would have been quite happy to continue with the app as overall I was happy with just a couple of 'blips' I requested help installing an older version and was told it could not be done. A VERY UNHAPPY LOYAL CUSTOMER

App is slow and unresponsive, and now unreliable. After ten miles, it logged a route on the map, but shows as 0.00 miles. Starting and pausing a route takes about a minute. It used to work great and be snappy. Over the last six months, it has gotten worse and worse.now it's unusable.

Ever since the update, it does not save a workout. Once it goes to the save workout page, it freezes. Then, I lose my work outs. Tired of having to uninstall/re-install to try and get this app to save workouts. This used to be an excellent app. However, I'll find another app.

the actual routes I walk isnt being counted. The map only shows the furthest points one time and if rewalk the exact area it chops the path off like I didnt walk the area. The furthest points are connected to give a generalization of the area but does not really show path walked. False lower milage is obtained which then shows took longer to do fewer miles.....ridiculous. Complete waste. When had app year ago, it showed every place walked on a path, no matter how many times walked it.

This worked perfectly (5 star) till i got a new phone, Samsung s23 ulta. Now the GPS only catches a small part of my walk. A 2 mile walk had a straight line from the starting point to a point about a half mile out. Registered .28 mile.

The last 2 updates have made it slow and difficult to 'save', before these updates there was a 'save' in the top right corner, press that once and it would save, perfect. Now, the update needs multiple presses on the blue save area, takes ages, and this last update is even worse. All I want when I finish, is to finish, not keep interacting with it to finish. I am patient and will wait for a fix on this, but if the next update is not an improvement, I won't be using it anymore.

Slow to load anything. Different WiFi networks, mobile networks, doesn't matter. It's slow anywhere you are, all of the time. 45 seconds to pass the black splash screen when you open the app. About 30 seconds to load your workouts. As for being able to see local routes, forget about it, nothing appears.. Unusable app.

I am so disappointed with this app. I first used it to collate all my workouts, with good results, for over 4 years but changed to Endomondo when I started having problems. I liked the accuracy, simplicity of access to stats and layout of Endomondo. I have now been forced back to Mapmywalk, but despite following all the troubleshooting instructions, it is totally unreliable in tracking my walks. Not having auto pause means having to remember to manually stop and start. Bring back Endomondo!!

This app was amazing when I first started using it, then after a couple of months I lost the ability to share my workout with friends, so I had to screen shot and send which was annoying, but I perceived, now this week its become unbearable!!!! Its started to stop tracking me halfway through my walk, even though I have normal GPS and data on, and it decides when I'm finished. I used to be able to do 8- 10 miles a day 5 days a week with no issues at all, now I get to 2- 3 miles and fails awful

Okay now I have the paid app and I will not be paying for a second year. This app for my Apple devices is completely different and is far more polished then the one for my Android phone, it is truly a second rate app compared with the features for my Apple devices. On top of that I cannot get it so sync sometimes a for several days, I need the data when I get home not days later. Now yesterday I did a long 32 km's (20 miles) and it did not record the last 12 km's where all the hills are so now I have no idea of my elevations gains for the walk as well as the time it takes in that heat, It was 41 C. (106 F) and it ruined the data that I cannot easily replicate, I went out specifically so I knew my times in the those conditions, I will not be renewing, Not acceptable. I was willing to put up with many of these short falls but not fully recording my data is what has made me finally hate this app.

I switched to this app from "Endomondo", which I have been using for walking since 2012. I really miss the auto stop feature. It would also be nice to add the ability to select the average speed (km/h) instead of pace (min/km) on the main screen and in the statistics. Mostly I walk with the dog and tried to choose a "Dog Walk" instead of a "Walk", but did not understand the difference. In general, the score is somewhere 4-. the "Endomondo" was easier and BETTER.

Very clunky app, what is the use of advanced features when even the basic ones don't work smoothly. The biggest issue is the splash screen, sometimes while resuming a workout if you minimize the app, be prepared to stare at the splash screen upon maximization for upto an hour!! And this is one a One plus with 8 gigs of ram, other issues include app randomly getting killed even in foreground, app suddenly deciding to stop measuring distance traveled but continue to keep tracking time! Uninstall

GPS is terrible. E. g., walked 2,5 km, but app only counted 0,5 km, simply connecting farthest points in a straight line, and missing part of route. Once ran along with Endomondo (E) - on it path was corresponding to the real one, also E app can be faster opened and operated. On this one yet did not find option for automatic pause; GPS fail doesn't motivate to use it.

Keep crashing and can't open app tried to reboot phone and app picks up right where off and crashes. Can't open to stop my tracking and save. Find another app. I do the same walk just bout every day and it tells me the miles but I could be .1 miles from the spot it said yesterday. Not accurate. Was good enough though when it work as a baseline but now just useless

What happened? I have been using this app for ages witj no problems it's perfect for what I need it for. Now all of a sudden when you finish a walk and the stats are being loaded it crashes my battery. From 60% charges to 30% in less than 30 second and I can watch the battery drop. As an app it's great just don't save if you don't have a charger to hand. Anyone else have this?

Before the latest update it would have been 4-5 stars, but now it's no longer a good app for exercise. Why did Map My Walk remove the feature to PAUSE while on locked screen? Removing this feature is archaic. Now, when I need to pause the app during a run, I have to reopen my phone with passcode and locate the app to pause. And in order to resume my activity I have to do the same, unlock phone, locate app, resume. Removing this feature was a mistake, as it was my favorite thing about the app.

After seeing this app included on several Best app lists, I installed the free version in order to get distance and pace info for my daily walks, but this app was disappointing. I walk varying distances on a riverside bike trail, and there are mile markers along much of my route. The app displayed distances that tended to be about 85% of the actual marked distances, and the pace data was wildly inaccurate (often much slower than actual, sometimes much faster). I guess I'll keep looking.
Keeps crashing lately. Useless
App hangs half the time I open it and generally is very unresponsive.
Used to work great and I loved it. Then it started crashing horribly and it wouldn't let me see my statistics or anything at all so I had to delete it and lose all my data. Ugh.

This worked perfectly (5 star) till i got a new phone, Samsung s23 ulta. Now the GPS only catches a small part of my walk. A 2 mile walk had a straight line from the starting point to a point about a half mile out. Registered .28 mile.

Garbage. Tracking randomly crashes and, if you're unlucky, your progress will reset to 0. I've had multiple evenings where I'll walk 8-10 miles but because of these crashes and lost data, it tracks 2 miles or fewer (once is an accident, twice is coincidence, three times is a pattern). If you want an accurate activity tracker, look elsewhere.
Tried twicw to sign up and both times it couldn't create an account due to technical issues.
This app freezes and several times did t track my miles!!!!
Says, an error occurred, account not created, then crashes.

Used to work great, but now it constantly crashes during my walk. It will either just close completely or freeze until I reopen it. Problem is when I open the app again, it will still have recorded the time I've been walking, but not the distance. For example, it crashed during this walk at 9 minutes and 0.6 miles recorded. I opened the app a while later and it has me at 16 minutes, but still at 0.6 miles

A really flaky app. Works sometime. Most time not. Totally unreliable. Sometimes it will record part of your walk/hike but not all. Sometimes it just stops recording a minute after you start recording. If you're in a city with tall buildings I think it loses the GPS signal and fills in the missing info with a path that is totally incorrect. I.e. through solid objects - building. I would pay for the "Pro" version if it was more reliable.

Pretty good app. Very convenient and easy to use. One very frustrating thing is that the step counter is inaccurate. I thought it was GPS issues at first, but noticed that if you set your phone down or have to stop (waiting at lights or for traffic) the counter keeps on counting with absolutely no movement. I do like that it connects to the MyFitnessPal app and records miles, calories, and steps there as well.

MapMayWalk has some excellent features which I would love to reward with a 5-star rating. The mapping feature is superb. I can even see the detail where I had to walk around a parked car. The distance and time walked are great and a voice tells me when I've walked a mile and how fast I did it. However ..... The lack of any instructions or documentation is maddening. I still haven't been able to activate the step counter. My goal would be 10,000 steps on a walk. But when I finish the walk, the step counter is still zero. Saving a walk is awkward. I don't think I've lost a walk, but it could easily be done. Battery drainage seems to be heavy. That's the price of the beautifully detailed walk maps. I love those maps, so I'll accept that my phone needs to be charged soon after I finish a walk. I would love to be able to use the app as a daily step counter while I'm not walking for exercise. Count my steps around my house and yard, but don't add time to my exercise record. Can that be done? That would be ideal, but without app instructions, I have no idea whether it's even possible. I lost my first days of use of the app. It pauses and resumed my 'walk' while I was walking, thereby making my time/distance stats worthless for those days. Later I found a setting by which I could turn off 'Auto-Pause'. That seemed to be On by default. Now if someone can find me written instructions and a way to activate the Step Counter, I'd be delighted. I'd be rating MapMyWalk more a 4+ than my present opinion of 2-.

Unless I'm missing something obvious, there is absolutely no information anywhere in the help pages or the FAQs, within the app or on the website or anywhere else, about where on your phone these routes are stored. I've managed to find one binary file called "cache_vts_com.mapmywalk.android2_default.0" , but it seems too small to be storing all my routes. The upshot of this is that (unless you clone your entire phone) there is no way to back up your routes in case your phone ever crashes, gets lost, etc. This is unfortunate, because there are a lot of positive things I could say about this app --- but those positive things are of little value if all the useful info you've stored is unprotectable.

I had been using the free app for a few months with no issues. Then suddenly, I went to use it and was prompted to begin a trial period with the for fee program. That isn't problematic, and had that been the only issue, I wouldn't be writing this review. The problem is that the app will not allow you to go back into the app and use it once it has opened the prompt to sign up for the paid version. I had to restart my phone once and then delete and reinstall in order to use the app.

Always very slow loading track. Hopeless if you ever want to edit a workout. Not impressed. Following a route will only give you the route as the finished track, and not the actual track you walked, which is pretty useless. Hasn't recorded my last workout. Getting worse.

This app doesn't rlly work for me. It says I have lost 4 calories right after I did a 3 hour dog walk. It just doesn't rlly seem to be any good. Update. I went on a 1 hour slow walk with multiple breaks around town with my mum. And apparently I have lost 32.8k calories uhh something is broken

This app used to be great but it's become so unreliable. I often go to start a walk only to find it still hasn't saved one from the previous day. I pause a walk to jump on a tube and when I restart, it credits me with part (but not all) of the tube journey. You have to press SAVE numerous times. I did a long walk a few weeks ago. At one point, it was showing 10 miles but when I finally went to save it, the map and time were showing correctly but the distance was 0. I also hate 'spit' pace.

App has various features Inc edit options and add photos. However, it is missing the most important. Reliable and consistent GPS tracking and distance tracking. Have used app few times and it always stops tracking after a couple of Kms. My last walk was 11km in 2h, it recorded 3.2km! Tried to renew the location multiple times but didn't pick up at all during the 2h walk. Shame, it looked promising.

A few bug issues. Namely, the subscription process - it doesn't matter which payment type, whether monthly or yearly, it still fails to process. Great that I can also take images, however, it would be great to add a gps lock on each one of them of where they were taken exactly. The trail line seems erractic in its locations - I understand that in built-up areas, the gps signal would be weak, again, it would be great to edit these trail lines afterwards to make them more accurate.

Disappointing. Was super exited about finding walking routes that you can use to guide you while seeing your GPS coordinates. I installed the app to be able to use the routes, which I had found on the website. Unfortunately, after initially opening the chosen root fine, the red guidance line disappeared as soon as the screen locked. I had to go back to the website each time to re-open it. Due to unreliable internet that meant that orientation was rather difficult. Luckily locals provided additional information. Giving two stars rather than one because it may be more useful for other purposes.

This app works well if you babysit it. But if you pause and forget to turn it back on, you just lose your track. If you forget to turn it off, your average speed drops like crazy. And you can't edit the end time afterwards. I need it to auto-detect pauses. Without that feature it just doesn't cut it for me, and I might as well use amazon fit.

The app used to be great but recently I've used it and it's no longer suitable. It doesn't accurately track distance anymore, it recorded 2 miles as 0.6 miles. It also lags so badly so when starting it up it takes ages to open, and trying to save a workout takes such a long time as well. I'm uninstalling it now

Can't edit walks. Originally it was possible to edit walks, but the feature was removed. If you forget to stop the recording you can't correct it. I now use another app which has a really simple correction method, is free and doesn't have annoying ads.

There are a few issues. The GPS isn't accurate. I biked a 10 mile bike trail 4 times in a row and only ended up with a 37.43 mile ride according to the app. I even rode beyond the start and finish lines each time. And when I have it announce my quarter mile stats, at some point it changes to .23 mile stats and decreases additionally the longer I ride or walk. And now it takes way too long to load stats after a walk. Also, I walk in Saegertown, PA and it says I'm walking in Cambridge Springs.

Got it as it connects to my virtual mission, worked great for about a week then started noticing that the GPS would show I walked across the sea or a field adding hundreds of meters if not more. I thought might be my fault as I live in a rural area but went to try apps I have used in the past and had no issues tracking my distance and location. Its free gives you a rough measurement but as I'm training and competing its not accurate enough for I want.

So far the app is recording only part of my walks so not giving accurate information. I am disappointed so far but will try another couple of times. I have just used the app on a walk in part of my town where I used the pause feature a couple of times and it all worked perfectly fine today. I will use it a few more times to see how it goes.

Unable to find follow roads in the settings for instant workouts. Am I blind or is it really not available? The auto-pause feature refuses to recognize when I begin walking again; it requires a manual restart.

This app worked great until the most recent update. Now the map feature itself is wildly inaccurate and does not property count mileage. Walked tonight with my wife and her apple watch counted 2 miles. This app only counted 1.25 miles AND the map showed us walking in a straight line where no roads even existed and completely omitted other parts of our route. I used to love this app but this is NOT ACCEPITIBLE.

I am new to walking for ezercise. I DL this app because I liked the routes to walk in my small town. However, when you try to walk the routes, you get directions to the route, and all of them say its a 5 hr walk to the route, and they all end at some fred neyers llcation. Add that dissappointment to the fact, most routes/users are from 2013, nothing listed for current years, 2018-2020. Which means this is a DEAD app. Ughh. Uninstalling due to inabiluty to use the routes thru direction feature.

It works but has not been updated from what I can see in years. It is limited in many ways, I cannot add a walk pic after the walk and the features are pretty basic. But it does a good job, would be better if a bit of development effort was thrown at it

Not a bad app and it's easy to use. But when I look at my history, it gives two different distances for each walk, and I don't know which one is right. It also cuts out partway through a walk sometimes and I don't know until I end the walk and see that half of it is missing.

I had been using the free app for a few months with no issues. Then suddenly, I went to use it and was prompted to begin a trial period with the for fee program. That isn't problematic, and had that been the only issue, I wouldn't be writing this review. The problem is that the app will not allow you to go back into the app and use it once it has opened the prompt to sign up for the paid version. I had to restart my phone once and then delete and reinstall in order to use the app.

This app doesn't rlly work for me. It says I have lost 4 calories right after I did a 3 hour dog walk. It just doesn't rlly seem to be any good. Update. I went on a 1 hour slow walk with multiple breaks around town with my mum. And apparently I have lost 32.8k calories uhh something is broken

Always very slow loading track. Hopeless if you ever want to edit a workout. Not impressed. Following a route will only give you the route as the finished track, and not the actual track you walked, which is pretty useless. Hasn't recorded my last workout. Getting worse.

Used to work great, but now it constantly crashes during my walk. It will either just close completely or freeze until I reopen it. Problem is when I open the app again, it will still have recorded the time I've been walking, but not the distance. For example, it crashed during this walk at 9 minutes and 0.6 miles recorded. I opened the app a while later and it has me at 16 minutes, but still at 0.6 miles

A really flaky app. Works sometime. Most time not. Totally unreliable. Sometimes it will record part of your walk/hike but not all. Sometimes it just stops recording a minute after you start recording. If you're in a city with tall buildings I think it loses the GPS signal and fills in the missing info with a path that is totally incorrect. I.e. through solid objects - building. I would pay for the "Pro" version if it was more reliable.

Unable to find follow roads in the settings for instant workouts. Am I blind or is it really not available? The auto-pause feature refuses to recognize when I begin walking again; it requires a manual restart.
Awesome app. Having issues with tracking stops shortly after I start.

I've been looking for and app that'll be as accurate with it's GPS as possible. Unfortunately, this app was not it. I was using the Samsung health app at the same time. I supposedly walked my normal 7 mls, but I noticed that I had to walk a 10th a mile longer to get that milage. I walked 3.5 miles and did my turn around. I walked the exact route back and only walked 3.44 miles. I didn't even complete the 7 mile trek even adding the extra 10th mile. Meanwhile, the Samsung app logged 7.5 miles.

Used to work well. Recently I've had a lot of issues - doesn't log all of my walk, doesn't register distance, doesn't show route map. Also intermittent problems with syncing with conqueror challenge app. Annoying as was good before.
Terribly innacurate when measuring distance was out by more than 200m in 2km causing me to think i was running really slow. Have switched apps since and had better results.

As others have said, it's not saving data properly anymore. I submitted a support request but was fobbed off with "yes we know about this" & no further support or a fix. Will be happy to remove this if the issue is fixed, but new users should be aware that the app is not reliable at present.

This app used to be great but it's become so unreliable. I often go to start a walk only to find it still hasn't saved one from the previous day. I pause a walk to jump on a tube and when I restart, it credits me with part (but not all) of the tube journey. You have to press SAVE numerous times. I did a long walk a few weeks ago. At one point, it was showing 10 miles but when I finally went to save it, the map and time were showing correctly but the distance was 0. I also hate 'spit' pace.

So far the app is recording only part of my walks so not giving accurate information. I am disappointed so far but will try another couple of times. I have just used the app on a walk in part of my town where I used the pause feature a couple of times and it all worked perfectly fine today. I will use it a few more times to see how it goes.

From 5 stars to 2. Lately the app has started freezing on my Google Pixel 3a. I've reinstalled both Map My Walk and Map My Fitness multiple times, but it still crashes. I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 out of nostalgia for how well it worked before it went haywire.

This is a good app in many ways. It seems accurate and it's easy to use. I really like the features and ability to save the data on every workout. However, more than once I've had to uninstall it - losing all my data! - because out of the blue it just stops working! It won't open. Nothing works to get it going. All you can do is uninstall and reinstall. That means you start from scratch again with setup & no data saved. So with that in mind four stars for use, two for reliability.

The app has a lot of useful features and does an excellent job of tracking walks. The full screen ads are why I only gave 3 stars. The timing of the full screen ad can cause the app to get into an inoperable state requiring force close to fix. I don't feel compelled to buy the app given the poor testing. I get the impression that I'd be purchasing a buggy app.

Accurate and helpful information. But it crashes every time I use it. It still works but insists on telling me it needs to clear all stored data. Actually it doesn't do that, bur makes me log back in. Today it froze at the end of my walk and lost all the data. I've tried re-installing it several times and updating Android, all to no avail. Great app, but not reliable. I need to find something else.

I like the layout of this app, and it seems like a good way to track workouts. However, the whole reason I downloaded this was to more accurately record my walks and transfer the data to My Fitness Pal. I kept getting an error message saying "Invalid API request (unhandled server error)" when I tried to connect the two. Turns out my walking estimates weren't far off anyway, so I think I am going to uninstall this one.

I've used this for a week along with the Pacer Pedometer app and I find that for me at least, the gps map tracking is pretty inaccurate, and a lot of the other features are inaccurate or just dont work properly. I keep my phone in my hand instead of my pocket and that helps a little but sometimes the information is still wildly inaccurate. I don't like that there's not a pedometer feature either, I'm unsubscribing and uninstalling this app, but I see that a lot of people like it and ot works fine for them, but it's just not for me

For me this works great. I appreciate verbal readouts of 1/2 mile splits for my 4 mile walks. My main complaint is that it is annoyingly slow to connect and start a walk. Also, at the end, there is an annoying delay to PAUSE and END the workout. When it is time to start my walk I am anxious to get started so it is annoying having to wait around for 20-30 secs for the app to load and initiate. On the plus side I have never seen dropped data or a ailed session on the app.

I use this free version alot for walking & it's generally good & fairly accurate. I don't like the new 'save' facility which arrived via Jun 2021 update & seemed to require information input before it would save. Waste of time. Just keep it simple please. App is always slow to sync edits such as naming the walk. The new 'save' is really annoying. I want to just save the walk & get home, not start adding details in order to be able to save it. I prefer to do that when I'm home. Sort it please.

It's a wonderful App, hence without prejudice, my 3 stars AWARD. I think it offers a fantastic companionship to ones training regimen. However it's biggest impediment is it's inability to initiate the next workout whilst offline or off internet connection! Ã°Å¸ËÂ¢ Further, the recent App Software Updates have NOT only absolutely slowed down saving and sincing Workouts, they've interfered with start-up slowing it down considerably! Also most disturbing of ALL is removal of the "PAUSE Workout" ButtonÃ°Å¸ËÂ°

Reasonable tracker, if it weren't for spurious duplicate workouts appearing in my history, and the disappearance of the 'route genius' feature a few weeks after I subscribed. Also, I could do with losing the popups telling me I should set up a "plan" every time I use it. I *can't* input my plan, because "map my WALK" only accepts plans for RUNNING. And it seems that even if I set workouts to 'public', I can only share my map with people who use the app.

General has been really good but lately the GPS tracking is way off and keeps stopping on all the Under Armour apps. The voice coach is note accurate anymore either since the GPS is off. It all started when the apps started to request for "paid upgrades" for these features instead of the free apps they have been in the past. The milage trackers are the main reason I use these apps, it they aren't accurate then what's the point of them. Other than that the apps are generally very user friendly.

Used to work great mapping my evening walk, letting me know how far I walked. In the last week or so it's gotten flakey. Once my walk is done it has a hard time finishing and registering my datas... Sometimes it freezes and if I try to go back it tells me if I do I'll lose this workout. Not sure what changed but there's some bugs now.

Keeps crapping out if you don't check it every quarter mile. When it does lose track and you haven't checked it for a while, then it extrapolates your distance straight line from last known point to current known location. Very annoying, so I only use it to get milage on an unventured route.

App has many good features, but since the last update the elapsed mileage is way off. Over a measured 2 mile course this app shows less than 1.4 miles. Using the same phone GPS another app shows the correct 2 miles within a few hundredths of a mile, as do my smart watch and Fitbit, which have their own GPSes. The previous MMW worked fine.
Had syncing and saving issues.after third upinstall/installs it appears to be working. ...for now.

One of the most useful features, auto pause, has been removed. Without this feature, average speed is totally meaningless. Please can we have it back? Would otherwise have given four or five stars. UPDATE :Auto pause has been reinstated. Yo! Now 5 stars. Thank you. UPDATE: Auto pause has been removed again. What us going on here? PLEASE can we have it back!

been using this app for very long time, always been horribly slow but all in all served its purpose, until the past month. absolutely refuses to acknowledge i exsist after i "save" & record my workout. go back in to check things out and all history is gone! friends included! i just uninstalled it today, whats the purpose of it taking up space if it doesn't work!

I have recently been having issues with the gps tracking, as it doesn't track correctly. it looks like I'm walking or biking over houses. it used to be fine, but it seems the most recent update is messed up. I loved the app before, please fix!

I love the challenges in this app and it has some fun features but it is constantly crashing. It often takes 20 minutes to get the tracking started and randomly crashes during workouts. Today it crashed 3 times in a 30 minute walk/run.

I've been using this app for the last 5-6 years, and it has gotten increasingly bloated with useless features and is overrun with ads that were launching Google Play Launcher in the background. It takes almost a minute simple to stop and upload a ride. This app used to be much faster and efficient a few years ago.
Had syncing and saving issues.after third upinstall/installs it appears to be working. ...for now.
Good app if you want to see where you walked. Milage is off. It says I walked 3.31 miles, where as my smart watch clocked 3.68.
