Used to be perfect for giving you the time, distance and mapping your route but lately doing the same walk it stops measuring the distance and then stopped altogether asking me if I wanted to save my workout while i was still walking. Shame but after having issues during my last 3 walks I have uninstalled it Ã°Å¸ËÂª
Walk with map is slow And does not allow you to edit and record notes. App takes forever to log results and mispronounces misspells words when you use voice texting.

App is crashing to much. I try to reset and then ask for password. Says pword is invalid. Go to try and reset pword. Never get an email. Try to set up new account with new email. Says app is unavailable

Works very well, except during slow walks with frequent stops (for example, birding) where the GPS is less that optimal. Reacqisition of the location while stopped is only accurate to 10 meters or so, resulting in routes with many tight loops that add to longer incorrect distances.

The MapMyWalk App works really nicely and I am certain I am not using 10% of it's features. It was cool to see "old" walks after logging back onto the App after a prolonged absence. (I could have been using MMW the whole time over 3.5 years of DoorDash delivery work if I had not been worried over battery drain and mobile data use!) If MapMyWalk had a minimal mobile data use "profile" and could sync or update ONLY ON WI-FI after returning home, I would love that!

I use this to track hikes in relatively rugged terrain using a Note 9. I'm not sure it is pinpoint accurate but comparative distance and elevation across various routes is what I use it for. I also keep it in a top pocket of a small backpack so I'm sure that affects accuracy. Elevation details are difficult to match up to the reality of the hikes, but I still like it. It lets me know where I've been relative to landmarks on satellite images. Pretty cool.

I have been so frustrated with this app. It freezes during walks, loses parts of my activity, and today it failed to sync and lost my whole walk. It's very discouraging to lose a whole workout. Edited: It works much better now than it used to. Occasionally I still lose a workout, but it happens very rarely. And it hasn't frozen in months. Great for tracking walks.

Keeps track of time, distance, and pace. The Settings give pretty good control over details displayed, as well as the voice feedback. I've found the slower voice to be more understandable. Since turning off the Pause/Resume voice notification, I can handle the mileage report on a half-mile basis, but now I have to watch out for an accidental Pause. I don't usually save my records, as they aren't comparative workouts. I just track my hikes on a one-off basis, and want to know how aggressive I am.

I've used this app for years on both iPhone and Android. In the past few months, it's been glitching on me. Froze on one workout and I thought I lost data only to find it decided to log part of my car ride after the workout when it finally unfroze. Then just yesterday, it logged a workout but didn't add it to my feed. It shows in my workouts, but not as unsynced, and won't show me any of the split data. The auto pause feature is useless because it won't auto restart when moving again.

Love this app. It works well. You can use it to keep track of many different activities. Couple of issues, its not super clear how to go from one screen to another. Wish it waa simplified. I dont like that when I write notes new sentences dont automatically start with a capitol letter. Not big issues, especially for a free app. I like seeing my routes as I travel and after.

I'll give this app 4 stars. I wish the distance would actually measure the overlapped distance when I walked and not just the ground coverage. I dont know if there is a way to change that or not. Then when trying to record the workout, if you try to take a picture after writing your experience, you have to retype your experience because it deletes itself. But other than that it is a great app. I'm excited to use the route feature for future walks because I have been looking for places to walk.

I just love the MapMyWalk app. It tracks our timing, speed and duration really well. We have used it for a number of yrs and the only request I have is to set the lock screen view back to how it used to be before the pause button was shrank down. We often pause when the pup needs to sniff and now the app tries to open each time I attempt to pause it instead of Just Pausing like it used to. My keyboard comes up to enter the pin and a great deal of time is lost while the app is still running.

Nice easy to use app for logging daily walking. I like that it shows you the distance, rate, elevation change and map. You can work to improve your rate as you build up endurance. Also can take note of a slower rate if you were doing a lot of hills on that route. It's great for logging your exercise without expensive equipment or complicated programs.

Decent app, could use improvements as far as ads go. It's understandable, that to get more features, i would have to o pay for the pro version, but sometimes being "full-screen shocked" the with unwanted ad content can be a little frustrating. Other than that, the app works great. Could use automatic start/stop based on your physical movement, as opposed to manual starting/stopping workouts. Also, when biking, would be nice to see the screen at all times for stats like current speed & location

I like the app and it's great that it syncs with the my fitness app. But when I'm midstream in a workout the time/distance shows up on my home screen with a pause button. If you're not careful, you can actually pause a workout or keep the time going even when your done so it throws off your actual workout numbers. I tried to find a way to disable the home screen feature because this has happened several times now and it's really frustrating.

I have used the free version for several years for my goal of walking 10 miles per week. The app does an excellent job of tracking my walks. Unfortunately after using it for several months it slows saving my walks eventually locks up. I then have to delete and reload the app. Fortunately after logging in all my previous walks and data is still there. I wonder if I paid for the MPV version this problem wouldn't occur. Overall I'm satisfied and have recommended the app to many fellow walkers.

Wish I could give a 4.5 or 4.6. Love the ability to track walk, see the map and streets, and get total distance and even elevation change. Main thing I'm missing is ability to exit start time & place. (Though you can replace it with record of a saved walk and I may have missed some edit capability as Im still learning the app.) The advertising is pretty non-intrusive.

I appreciate that this app respects my privacy, having moved here from one that didn't. The features work well for me and the app is easy to use. I especially like being able to record which type of workout I did, and add photos and notes! I wish I could track all my steps each day instead of just workouts, though -- and could track steps as well as miles ...Then it would have all the features I need.

8 Feb. 21 App continues to work well. I have had it freeze up so it wouldn't connect with my GPS but is better after uninstall/reinstall. I continue to find it to be the best free option for me. 13 Feb. 20 This app provides accurate GPS mapping of my route, note of my miles, split time, total time at each mile. I like it. Many options as to types of walking or trail work. I use Nordic Walking. Fun!

Pretty good, but little control over settings. Auto Pause is useless because the tracker responds to small GPS variations and constantly thinks I've stopped and started when I'm steadily walking. When stationary it racks up distance based on GPS variations as well. There is no track edit function like I have on my ski app, to clip the end if I forget to finish and save right at the end of my hike. Location seems to have more problems than my other location-dependent apps. Also slow to load

Good app that I very much enjoy, but one problem. If burning over 1,000 calories it says 1k in my workout summary. It rounds the number. You could burn 1,022 cal and it would still say 1k or if you burn, say, 1,332 it will only say 1.3k. I saw no option to change this annoying feature. These numbers are important, it would be nice to just have the exact calories burned displayed so I didn't have to do workarounds to figure the number. Very annoying, so -1 star. Otherwise, it's an amazing app!

So this app is really good and has a lot of features that make it a great aid to keeping track of your walks. Unfortunately over time it becomes extremely sluggish; clearing its memory doesn't seem to work. It also has a couple of other idiosyncrasies that can be kind of annoying, like talking over an audiobook with no way to shut that off; generally, though, it works extremely well.

Geat app but sometimes it seem to lag a little. Otherwise it's great. This is still about the same. Still lagging sometimes. Other than that I like it. I don't know why calorie count changed but i speed walk for 5 miles and i used to burn over 1 thousand calories. But now after the calorie adjustment i'm still walking over 5 miles but calorie count now 7 to 8 hundred. I've uninstalled and reinstalled app twice to fix this problem but it's still not working properly. Is this something to be fixed?  This app is good but not as good as when I first started using a year ago. The problem that I previously mentioned is still not fixed.

Today has been the first time that I've had issues with the app, and I've had the app over a year, or maybe around a year now. First problem was it starting saying "starting workout" every few minutes, then after a while did it said it again. Second problem it's not allowing me to share today's walking stats, to my social media like it has let me in the past many times before.

Overall, a good app with a lot of great features. You can't plot a route ahead of time, but you can save routes you've already walked if case you forget to start the timer for a similar walk. It's a bit laggy when it comes time to pause and finish a timer, but otherwise no issues with it crashing or failing to log a workout.

Only thing I would like to see differently is a street view of the map. Overall a great little tracker. Just wish it would let you pause it without having to restart it. Went to pause it at gas station and it didnt continue my route after I left. It just kept the milage and time going. Map track didnt work.

I've used this app to record my daily walks for over 2 years now. It well serves the purpose I want it to -- which is only to time my walks and track my distance. I have no complaints other than the occasional crash or failure to save my statistics (but this observation might be due to my phone's system and have no association with the app itself. I do have a rather outdated device - Samsung Galaxy S3. Ã°Å¸Ëâ)

I use this to map my walks with the dogs in the wooded hills of Oregon. It's nice that it keeps track of distance and all that, but the best feature for me it's that it has somewhat decent maps of the trails, not just the roads. It's been great for exploring, since it can always help me find my way back to the car (so long as I don't lose my phone!). I am only giving four stars because the trail maps are only about 80% accurate.

This app works rather well and charts my runs well enough. The real good point are its stats. You get readouts for your mile by mile run/split time and includes rise and decline in elevation. Overall the free version is a very well made and comprehensive app that is easy to use. Its only drawbacks ive seen are its obviously fauls adds and its slow start time.

It works well must of the time. Occasionally when I have to stop for a protracted period, I pause the walk but something in the system keeps counting; when I hit "resume," it chokes and crashes and I lose all the data from the walk. Other than that, it's great.

The app is so helpful! It seems to accurately find my distance and speed. I also love the feature where you can add notes and pictures! The notes I add help me see my growth over time in terms of how I feel afterwards. Only con is that you can't edit the photos (like adding more) to a workout/post and you've posted it.

So Encouraging! Knowing how much you're doing in real time - and with the app providing feedback at milestones - is so encouraging that I just don't want to stop! Update - 1 month later: I wish that I had the option of requesting when to be notified - I would prefer to be notified at the half mile instead of just at the mile completed. Ã°Å¸Â¤Â·Ã°Å¸

For the most part it seems very accurate and tracking my stuff so I've been walking every morning at a certain location and just trying to get some exercise and it seems pretty accurate so it's pretty good app I like the elevation tracking and speed tracking and distance tracking so it's a good app I use a free version only right now I don't have money to pay for a monthly or yearly subscription for the premium features but free version works just fine

Update: after a couple updates, I can say that the app is much much better. My go-to tracker when I go for walks... A behind the scenes tracker for number of steps taken and distances covered when going about one's daily life would also be a great data set to compare against. Sometimes slow in capturing data

it works great sometimes other times not so. Crashing more and more. Support fast but constantly uninstalling and reinstalling. And it continues now third reinstall this year. If it wasn't used by my health provider I would have dropped a long time ago. Can I go to zero stars! KEEPS CRASHING ZERO STARS. 1/15/20 update-still crashes every few weeks. Have clear cache and data. Probably one of the Worst apps I've seen. Why do I keep using it's the only app my health insurance supports.

First try - works great. Only issue was that tho' I could magnify the map (+ button), I couldn't find a - button to to widen its field of view. Also, the home-pointer icon should logically set a scale so the whole route is shown, rather than an arbitrary scale. Apart from these small niggles, an excellent app.

For what I needed, just walking, showing me distance, speed, it worked great. Although when my pace is very fast the distance measures about a tenth of a mile too long on 2 miles. Not sure why it would do that unless its dropping satellites in the woods and estimates those missing pieces. I would recommend.

Really am enjoying the app. It isn't always accurate on the mileage but is super close. The voice feature is a little off some times too. For example, I'll hit a mile and be at almost a tenth of a mile past before it tells me I have hit a mile. But overall it is a great app that I use often.

(From 2020) Works like I expected. Would like the distance that you walk to be broken down by the half mile or even the quarter mile as an option with the free version. The mapping on the free version is pretty accurate also. 4/29/23.... still love the app, and I'm still using it all of the time, even on the really short walks!

This used to be a good app. For at least 2 years I had zero issues with it in this phone. Then they decided to "improve" it. Now it's utterly useless. I just walked for nearly an hour and it mapped exactly zero miles. The walk before today it tracked me, albeit inaccurately. So I uninstalled & reinstalled, thinking maybe there was a newer version. And today it functioned as nothing more than an egg timer. After I post this I'll be uninstalling it again. Permanently.

10/28/22 update. The longer I use this, the more features become unfriendly to use . Now it takes several taps to save a workout, and the route doesn't show up on the save page. I would love it to notify half mile increments. Sadly the updated ap doesn't have an option to post with the route in the corner of the picture.

Like it for the most part. It does have some bugs that can be a little frustrating. It would be nice if it had an override even if my screen is locked I could pause, resume and get stats without having to slow down to unlock phone first.

I love this app! I have been using it for 3-4 years. However, recently, it has gotten very slow at logging workouts. Sometimes it takes hours to upload after a workout has been completed. UPDATE: the app has gotten faster in the past few weeks, so there must have been an update. I'll up my rating to 4.5 stars.

I do enjoy your app... I would love to be able to customize it a tad to tell me every 1/2 mile instead of only every mile. I also wish that the auto start and stop feature worked better. There seems to be a randomness it how long it takes to recognize movement. But other than that it works fairly well for me.

I like it keeps running, even when it crashes. Good app and I love that it links with my fitness pal. App crashes multiple times a day. They also need to have it designed to differentiate between walking, running and driving. Obviously no person is walking or running over 20 mph

I've been using this app for over 5 years.i like that you don't need to sign you for anything of you don't want to, yet all major and necessary features seem to be present. It's been improved lately and I like the analysis and data points. Also you can add a picture for quick reference. All in all a stable easy to use app.

I use this to track hikes in relatively rugged terrain using a Note 9. I'm not sure it is pinpoint accurate but comparative distance and elevation across various routes is what I use it for. I also keep it in a top pocket of a small backpack so I'm sure that affects accuracy. Elevation details are difficult to match up to the reality of the hikes, but I still like it. It lets me know where I've been relative to landmarks on satellite images. Pretty cool.

Works very well, except during slow walks with frequent stops (for example, birding) where the GPS is less that optimal. Reacqisition of the location while stopped is only accurate to 10 meters or so, resulting in routes with many tight loops that add to longer incorrect distances.
Just started using this today & I had no trouble. It seemed to be accurate & I like the map feature. Will continue to use it.

I haven't walked in quite some time due to health issues. Although diagnosed and on meds for atrial fibrillation and ongoing back issues, I still consider myself a fairly fit 73 year old female. My goal is to lose 25 pounds to improve my blood pressure and overall health. Your app is the perfect inspiration and measuring guide to reach my goal.

I am a 67-year-old retiree, that has had total knee replacement about a year and a half ago, with a 8-month-old puppy. I love using the application in the dog walk mode, it works really good to record our walks. The only change that I would request is that when the GPS senses that you're not moving anymore, I wish the app would automatically pause and then restart once you got moving again. That would be a nice feature for dog walks.

I just use the free version, but I've been very happy with the performance of this app. It has all the features I need; total distance hiked, elevation gain, maps of your hike, total time, and other features. These all do an accurate job when comparing to trail maps. My only complaint is that it doesn't have automatic pause. When taking a break it continues to add time. If I pause it I often forget to restart it and the total time isn't properly recorded. Overall, a great app!

Intuitive, easy to use. Gives me the stats I want: total distance, total time, overall (average) speed, as well as foot speed in real time. Pleasant voice announces each mile marker along with time so far and foot speed. Love the clear mapping. Many more features available if you're into it, but the simple functionality and stats mentioned above are all I was looking for. Highly recommended.

I'm fairly new to this app, only been using it 3 or 4 days following heart surgery. I'm extremely happy with it so far. The distance seems to be quite accurate, which is the biggest feature is was looking for. Like that it also counts paces, which matches the pace count on my fitbit pretty well, so I'm assuming that's fairly accurate. I don't get bombarded with email ads either. Well made app.

I hike a lot, but need to know the exact distance and time each trail or bushwhack experience is, for future reference. This app is perfect for that. Now, if I only have 2hrs of daylight left, I can see exactly how long each hike takes, and can pick the perfect trail for the time. It's "calories burned" feature is pretty accurate, and it has tons of options and features that I may try out one day.

Simple to use, seems accurate for time, distance, altitude, map over lays onto Google showing your route. Pause feature is a plus if you are needing to take a break or if you are going to be relaxing at the park in the middle of your workout. You can post to social media and share with your friends. You can even enter and track weekly goals. I don't have a device, but I like that it will integrate with heart rate monitors. Not bad for free!

Great tool to keep track of my workouts and calories burnt. In conjunction with My Fitness Pal it's helped me shed the extra weight. It would be good to add the heart rate to the free version. The only problem lately is that it records the workout multiple times or it takes a while to save, just occasionally. The past few weeks the app crashed a couple of times, but it's not worrying yet.

Easy to use, and lots of workout options Edit: after 2 years of using it, I still love it, but one thing that really annoys me is that there's not an auto-shutoff feature when you've been still for too long. There have been so many times I've forgotten to pause or turn off the app and it just ruins my stats. I just wish there was a feature where if you've been still longer than say 5 minutes, it'll automatically pause your workout. Other than that, it's a great app and I use it all the time

I use the"free" version. In app ads a bit annoying. I have found that using the dog walk doesn't give as accurate results as just using"walk"setting. Dog walk has tendency to automatically pause but has to be manually restarted. Wish there were more choices for logging a gym equipment workout. Overall very happy with free version. Update : step cadence apparently only works when running. They used to send a monthly report of how many miles you've walked. That feature has disappeared which is sad

I turned the app on when you started our walk and put my phone in my pocket. I took it out once to check and make sure it was still running. It calculated our distance through a neighborhood and our speed. I love the log feature. I was able to say how I felt anecdotally about the walk. I want to see an improvement in not only my distance and speed, but how I feel during each one. It's perfect for that

It's not a super complicated app to use. I do think that amazon fit does have a couple of features that are better but overall this syncs with my fitness pal. The app is easy to read and understand. It does freak me out though that it randomly starts giving you stats and if you are walking and have ear buds in it startles you. I recommend this for people who don't want to invest in a fancy fitbit or apple watch.

I like many people have a fitbit, so I used the app to do the tracking of my distance and route. I was always disappointed. The route they would show would never be the route I had actually taken, which ment the distance was off as well as my pace. Walk with Map my Walk doesn't have any of those issues. I finally see my actual route tracked and am proud of the distance and pace I'm seeing. This is definitely a new favorite for me.

Works perfectly every time! I wish there was an option for it to pause on its own when I pause. I always try to remember to hit the pause button, but sometimes I forget. I also like the "Load Route" feature that has already mapped my walk and my statistics. Then I can compare one set of statistics to the other.

Easy to use and accurate! I am using the free version and it has been awesome! I walk dogs and walk for exercise, so I love being able to label the workouts. I love seeing how many miles I walked over week and I especially love seeing elevation gains. I have not had any tech issues with this app at all! I am using it on an Android device. It has a great pause and resume feature, which is great on the dog walks. Great app! I recommend giving it a try!

Works great for what I need. My favorite thing is that it opens up right to the map, so you are not fumbling around as you're walking out the door trying to find the start button. I also like that it tracks elevation changes, and that it keeps up with my step count. Still learning more of its features as I continue this health journey!

Simple to use to track and record a walk. Haven't tried anything more complex yet. Pause sometimes triggers when getting a phone call, causing a shortened workout. Sometimes forget to pause then stop at the end causing a lengthened workout. Other apps recognize when you stop and startup again; this one doesn't. Continues to work well without any issues. Works for me.

This app is great for beginners, like me, that are either in the beginning stages, or those already in an exercise routine. I haven't been actively exercising due to the issues of Covid 19 this past summer, but in doing so, I became lax and complacent. I recently bought a beach cruiser three speed bike to get me going again. I set the app to my specific bike, and the app not only gave me the distance, speed, caloric burn, and route, weather, it also allows you to pause & save the tracking Ã¢

I love this app. It's easy to use, it works well, and it does what I need it to do: record my distance, pace, and heart rate. I wish there was an option/feature that would automatically pause your workout when no movement has been detected for a while, bc I forget to pause or end my workouts all the time lol. That's a me problem, though lol.

I really liked this app. Did what it said it was going to do. All without bombarding me with ads. I liked the verbal cues of telling me of Every mile I walked and how fast I was walking/running. It was a fun little challenge to beat my logged walk of the previous day. Lost 30 lbs. It was really nice to enjoy the free features the app provided. All without a constant trying to sell me something. Letting me get into the groove of my workout. I plan on buy a full version if there is one.

I use it to keep a visual record. I also use it for statistics. It is easy to start. Unlike other pace count and tracking apps, it has never crashed and lost all my data. I use it in conjunction with two other apps. because although any two of them might agree on Pace for distance or calories. I have never seen all three of them agree.

This app has just the right features to keep me motivated. There appear to be no bugs. The user controls make sense. The stats are nice. Walking seems to be the best overall exercise ever and this app helps give some sense of accomplishment along the way. I don't think I could have done a better job myself in creating a walking app, nice job!

This app is very easy to install and to use. For each walk it tells you the distance and rate you walked. You can see your route on a map I plan to use this feature to identify routes that cover the distance I want and are the desired length. I'm really enjoying my ability to try new walks, taIor them to the length I want and see how many calories they burn. A year later and I'm still loving this app.

It accurately tracks my walks and other exercise. While this might seem like a basic feature it is far more than strava is can to do with regularly. It also lets you do online account stuff, like looking at your exercise records. It is always to be able to have a real screen to look at the data.

Overall it's been a wonderful app. Not thrilled with a subscription just because most people can only afford so many subscriptions a month and everything's a subscription now. But I use this one enough that I pay for it. I love the ability to add photos. All I use is the walking timer and the photo app and I keep everything private. I know it has a lot of other features but that's all I need and it does it great. :-)

I was using Runkeeper for several years but started having issues with their audio cues not calling out my distance or pace. After trying to figure out the problem and not getting anywhere, I got frustrated and started looking around for another app. I found this one and it works perfectly for my needs.

Excellent way to keep track of workouts. Decent navigation utility when Google Maps are kept updated. Elevation change portion of distance measuring utility is wildly inaccurate, but pure distance covered is very consistent over the same routes. Recommended. T'Day 2020. The app will crash hard enough to require uninstall, then reinstall, if your mobile device tries to multitask when loading the app. Always set device permissions and desired volume first, then load app. Still highly recommend

Love to Track my distance, speed, and route. I don't understand why elevation is shown in negative numbers. Clearly, I'm above sea level, since I am walking above the level of the Gulf of Mexico. I love to see the record of where I've walked (routes) and being able to add missing workouts.

I have only used this app a few times, but so far it is great. All the features I want is in there. The ability to pause the app, for water break. Also, the announcement of milestones. Those are only a few of the great options in the app. If my opinion changes I will update.

I'm barely using all the tools. With GPS on... the highlighted route is off a bit on the map. Maybe my phone being in my back pocket may not have helped either! It has a lot of features to explored, looks like fun including your elevation.
It is a simple app that does what it says. No issues accurately mapping my walks and has basic stats to help you plan the walk better. For my use case, that's all I wanted. Recommended for sure!

Just started and I like it. My other app had issues with the GPS system and this app even let's you pause when you take a break. That's important to me because I walk the zoo and if I stop to watch an animal for a period I don't want my stats messed up.

The features in this app make it easy to log my activities. I especially like the "walking the dog". Ã°Å¸ËÅ  I love being able to record my walk. The longer I use it the more I like it. It helps me push myself a little bit more when returning to trails I return. A year or more later and I am very happy with this app. Thanks
I've been using this app for nearly two years now and it's been excellent. I'm often in remote areas and I appreciate the fact that the app continues to record my milage and route when off the grid.
Works well for time, distance and average pace. Max speed must be a premium feature, but is no great loss if you don't want to pay for it

I love this app. I use it twice a day whilst walking my dog. I love that you can add photos & comments to your walks. It's a really good diary of my walking journeys. It's never let me down or crashed, so I'd give this app 5 stars!
I use the free app and I'm very pleased with the features. I mainly use walk, hike, and interval walk and the details provided have been very helpful in tracking my progress

A lot of people were saying good things about this app so I had high hopes. Unfortunately, after trying it several times (different symptoms each time, being very detailed and adding several symptoms each time I tried it) it kept giving me 3 generic responses for my "possible" conditions (such as migraine or flu). I felt the app itself is beautifully designed but that's it. I've downloaded a few other apps that are much more detailed and give you more than just a couple basic answers.

Terrible. Downloaded the app only to have it all be so slow and it doesn't show that anything is loading when you press a button. It won't let me sign up and says something is unavailable but cuts off half of the message at the top of the screen.

I have downloaded it in past. This app is good at that time. Now, after installing this app, not only I can't login, during this login process, my phone becomes weird. My phone becomes lag and I can't use my home button. I repeat, only after trying to log in into this app. When I use other apps, everything is fine. After uninstall and reinstall, same thing happens over and over again. Hahaha. This app is nut now. Please fix this app.

I've been using this app off and on. I know it's designed with intention to "check in" regularly, but I find it more useful as a "should I worry about this" app. However, now it won't start at all. App "crashes" before it's even open. I've cleared all its data, updated it, restarted my tablet, it still won't open anymore.

Works great, pity it doesn't do anything after you create an account and sign in apart from going round and round in circles loading (sarcasm at first since it doesn't open to add profile so waste of time on useless apps again) I hate waiting for 5 minutes with a small circle going round and round forever...

Was good but no more privacy, this literally shares your medical history and they do not disclose where to (read their privacy policy) It says that it's not possible to asses the symptoms without processing the data. That's not true at all. all I want this to do is use proven medical data (NOT data collected from this app) to give an assessment I want to see what the app THINKS is wrong, that is all Sure it's needed for OTHER features, but let me use the app without accepting that privacy bull
Ada has been very slow in responding lately. Plus all of my assesments are GONE! It gets stuck after assessing and never shows the report.
This app is literally impossible to use, every single time I click on something It bugs, its lagging and It keeps asking me to confirm the same thing over and over again.

Wouldn't recommend for psychiatric issues. Gives nonsense feedback like "I am depressed" - "you might have depression!" and due to a lack of symptom options pretty misleading stuff on top. App crashed while selecting feedback options on why I consider the results not helpful. Confirms my opinion :-)
It was working but now it just freezes or slows between questions. Uninstalled and installed again. Now it does not even allow me to enter at all. Deleted app

I did not open the app as you have to create an account and that means more information can be harvested about you, not only your personal details but also now any medical issues or problems you may have. There are other apps that don't require your personal information that do the same job.
It's good but it should also provide the medicine guide for making feel good to the Patiant and it is slow I think we should make it fast in asking questions and giving advices
This app only contains some medical issues. For instance, i tore my hamstring but this app kept suggesting i broke my hip. Disappointed.
It's sucky because it keeps crashing!!! I'll give a better rating and I'll reinstall it when this is fixed Ã°Å¸âÅ½
I think ada should be more specific.... The list of possible conditions for one's symptoms are too many and too confusing

When Ada works, the medical guidance is excellent. But very basic app controls are missing (standard in similar alps); there is no "back" button and no "restart" button. This causes users lots of effort when a small mistake is made on answeting questions. It also causes inappropriate Ada requests for button clicks when restarting after a crash. And if Ada crashes just after you ask for a report or while you are reading a teport, say goodbyw to the report. You just have to start again --- ugh!!!

Because I entered a lot of the health symptoms my body is going through, the app mainly focused on "Depression." If you are a woman going through menopause there is only one option "bleeding." You are not given other choices like "hot flashes," "weight gain," etc. Although on a few questions you can click on "explain more" which may or may not help you answer. One question let me write in my own answer to "appetite" I feel this app will best help others who's health issues are in isolated areas.

The reason why I give this three stars and not five is because I think this app has alot of wasted potential. I think it could be very useful to chronically ill patients, for instance if its symptom tracker was a bit more user friendly, or if they had reminders for when to take your medication. I understand that this wasn't the purpose of this app, and it was more so made to be like a webMD. But it's a shame that it already has alot of the features of a health management app, but not all 9f them fully implemented.

so far so good. This app should still be in BETA though. There should've been more questions asked to get the full picture. EX I gave facts about my left leg. It did ask about upper or lower and about numbness a nd pain, BUT never asked if I had broken it in a fall, or if it was bleeding due to an exposed compound fracture. Just my 2 cents worth.

Its great but it needs tweeking like it needs question about your environment and needs to be more accurate with what you could have like i checked up on why i was weezing and everything the app only ever came up with one answer and that was asthma but i went to the 24 hour docs closest to me and they said it was not asthma at all but just a small minior infection i was checked for blood clots and asthma just to rule them out but despite the infection im healthy.
The app is great for small problems, but sometimes I have trouble figuring out what my symptoms are. Ada is great at helping me diagnose other minor issues, though.
I like the idea but it just keeps telling me i have different diseases and the questions are confusing and irrelevant. I wish it helpedÃ°Å¸âÅ½hopefully it gets improved
it should be more comfortable in use with its interface and its features only symptoms checking is not enough.
it covers most issues but not the non common ones. i have not used it for long so at most i can only issue a less descriptive view point
It is interesting because, there could be a whole host of problems that would have shown up to explain my symptoms, including heart disease. The questionnaire didn't include any cardiac issues.
more data required to be more accurate, symptoms are confusing and differential diagnosis is important...it will improve
very helpful, i already know wat my health issues is..but dis app also shown me the same result. must have dis app in everyone 's phone.
Good app with good clarification on your need based health issues. Good suggestions and advice on what to do
felling satisfy with the assessment report but only need to improve the version which can be used in slow network also

It is interesting because, there could be a whole host of problems that would have shown up to explain my symptoms, including heart disease. The questionnaire didn't include any cardiac issues.
Great App for your health issues

This app has gotten progressively better since it launched. It's a pretty easy to use, straightforward way to narrow down possible issues based on symptoms. A lot of the terminology seems based on British English but it's easy enough to know what they mean when it's something different from American medical malady names. The symptom tracker is nice but it's very slow and difficult to use. It only presents a few symptoms at a time, so trying to update a litany of issues at once is a slow slow slow process. In fact, the whole symptom assessment setup is fairly slow. I'd love to trade some fancy animations for faster performance. Another thing I'd like to see is a daily reminder to do the symptom tracker. Maybe if I did an assessment daily I could have some useful information on ongoing issues?

Finally something all included list, needs saving, sharing, printing abilities. Offer more questions to get more inclusive analysis, all inclusive health issues. We're all causes offered? Thank you. Looking forward to updating, improvements.

Very informative app. It gives you way more infor than other symptom checkers. I'm sticking with this one. It not only tells you possible causes for your symptoms, it gives symptoms for each illness , tells you what symptoms you're missing for a specific illlness, gives prognoses for each diagnosis, treatments, etc, as well. It shows graphs of your symptoms vs a diagnoses symptoms so you can visually compare what you have vs don't have. I just wish it asked for more medical history.
Very informative. The animation and transition speed is a bit too slow to my liking - I hope there's an option of disabling animations.

As someone who has been told they're a bit of a hypochondriac, this app is EXTREMELY helpful in sorting through symptoms! I had a bunch of medical issues growing up, so this was helpful in figuring out what is "new" and what's from an old problem cropping up again! Their symptom list isn't exhaustive, and the questions for the assessments could use some refining, but it's been a super helpful tool nonetheless! It's very refreshing to see something like this available for free use, too!

I've long struggled with symptoms sucking out my quality of life. It's been years of medical trial and error. The medical system is a slow one, and symptoms between conditions can greatly overlap. It's a difficult and disheartening journey. Ada allows me to form my own hypotheses that I can bring to my doctor. This allows a more narrowed down search and gives me hope. My biggest gripe is that Ada is sometimes limiting in the answers to the questions it asks. Otherwise invaluable. Thank you, Ada.

This app is really good and it really helps me with all my health problems and it's really interesting to learn about all the different kinds of health issues that a random person can encounter or that exist. There's no ads in this free app and I'm very happy with it because my screen is not overwhelmed by thousands of ads.

Really helpful for doing the opposite of Googling symptoms and calming my anxiety when I'm convinced I'm dying forty different ways! It would be helpful to be able to input things already diagnosed with though... Like mental health issues that could cause issues 'just in your head' so to speak, or more serious problems that need to be seen by a doctor or something. It's good to know the background information, I'd assume.

Ada has been very helpful to me each time I have any issues with my health. The recommendations are always straight to getting my health challenge solved. However there is room for improvement. I have been following and using the app and each time i have cause to change my mobile phone, I usually download the app so as not to have any gap with the app. I have recommended the same app to many of my friends who are of same age bracket and who need to watch out for their health just like I do

Very helpful and easy to use. I'd like to be able to tell her about chronic illnesses though. I have chronic bronchitis and heart problems due to birth defects, and I know the difference between those symptoms and when new symptoms arise. I've used this app multiple times, checked back with my mother and god mother (both doctors), and they've given me similar diagnoses, so I know the app is very trustworthy. I only recommend adding a chronic illness feature, to get a more accurate report.

I love this app! It has helped with issues for myself and loved ones! There is a downside that some of my symptoms are not recognised on the app which is rather annoying but other than that it has helped me with things that are worrying me but Ada has solved them! I'd say download it and try it out. I also enjoy this app because of it's logo. It makes me pretty relaxed. If the company is reading this, my feedback is to maybe add a few mental health issues to it. Anyway, if you get it, enjoy it!

I'm always worried about my health, especially when my body seems to be doing something new. Ada has actually been very helpful in hinting me on my issues and I honestly feel better. The diagnosis' have usually been right like the last time I went to get checked out, BUT Ada is mainly accurate when you KNOW what your symptoms are (can appropriately identify them). So sometimes I have to go back, if I didn't understand a symptom and choose the right one. UPDATE: THE APP GOT BETTER.

Try it for the first time after visiting and getting results from doctor and the app gave me several diagnosis but only one stood out that I felt I had and believed to be the issue. Will follow up with doctor and mention if this is true to my condition. Love this app cause with all the issues I'm having, I was able to pin point my closest probability.

Pretty darn good! Probably one of the best symptom analyzers out there. Walks you through a series of related questions and provides a clear report of possible causes. You can also print or share the report. The report looks different and is quite impressive. It shows correlations between each symptom and cause, plus frequency among people. Recommend to anyone who likes to check family health issues online before calling the doc.

This is a great app to try and figure out what you could possibly have, and not get cancer or death as the first result. However you do need to be honest, and specific with the symptoms you are entering to get a semi accurate guess as to what is going on with who ever you are searching for. There is also a feature where you can track whatever symptom you wish to track.

Helpful app. However, I would like it to be more specific on which symptoms indicate that the user requires "urgent medical care" or "emergency care." It can also be buggy, slow and unresponsive sometimes.

Can't download the symptom tracking logs. I can download the symptom assessment but I have a chronic condition and I know what it is so I just need to log my symptoms. Also I don't think it tracks the time of day that symptoms occur so it is kind of useless for some of my problems. I would give it 3 stars for being not super functional for chronic issues, but symptom apps all suck and this one is decent, it actually got my condition right which is a first (WebMD always tells me I have lymes)

Useful app! Certain descriptions of symptoms aren't recognizable outside of preset choices that it makes available. Does however try to resolve any underlining issues that you have queried. A virtual assistant dressed like a nurse would be nice! The doctor, whom is part of that intrical team, concerned about my well-being, looks at me bending his head down then the report. That would be kinda awesome. Maybe the nurse could be shining surgical tools, different each time you interrupt! Maybe

Quite useful and accurate, however I could identify some symptoms and illnesses missing. Other way, cool app for those who would like to get an understanding of what they go through, as well as possible treatment
The app is a bit useful but questions are too confusing. It doesn't focus on the patient's concern. It would be better if it could provide things that would satisfy the patient.
1st time using the app. So far no issues, lots of questions but overall satisfied

Good, but need more detailing and more pictures regarding the mentioned questions by showing al types of example if possible, i like the quickness of moving from one to the next question, doesn't feel slow at all

Finally something all included list, needs saving, sharing, printing abilities. Offer more questions to get more inclusive analysis, all inclusive health issues. We're all causes offered? Thank you. Looking forward to updating, improvements.

The diagnosis' have usually been right like the last time I went to get checked out, BUT Ada is mainly accurate when you KNOW what your symptoms are (can appropriately identify them). So sometimes I have to go back, if I didn't understand a symptom and choose the right one. UPDATE: THE APP GOT BETTER.

Absolutely wonderful. The app is very helpful, there's not much it doesn't know, and its word choice and question phrasing is very kind and caring. Excellent improvement suggestion feature. Extremely user-friendly, and easy to navigate. I've put all of my improvement suggestions into the in-app feature, so I'll spare you review readers my thoughts on what I'd add or change (suffice to say Ada has already heard them).

Highly recommend! This health assessment is thorough and informative. You can choose to track your symptoms over time, which is very convenient for communicating with your doctor. Also, you can create an assessment profile for family/friends; this feature is especially helpful if you have a sick family member or if you're trying to console a friend with illness anxiety. Ada is clean, easy to use, & has no ads. :)

I never stop to review an app. Ever. But this app has been something special. It's thorough, its incredibly easy and has helped pinpointing issues with myself and a few loved ones for a year or so now. It doesnt claim to diagnose ANYTHING, however its been the best tool to know where to start when something wasn't feeling or looking quite right. Thank you so much for this thoughtful and beautiful tool.

Very easy to understand and accurate, in it's health predictions. I put in the symptoms three different times for three different health issues I've already been diagnosed with and it predicted the correct health condition each time. This is very nice and great for people to bring to their doctors. Or seek help if they're not sure.
Ada separated my symptoms and streamlined the causes. Identifying the source accurately. With multiple issues, I have been unable to focus on one area. Ada's recommendation made me immediate action.
Tells me a possible cause of my health issues before i go to the doctor. The app makes me be aware of what i might be going through so it doesn't come as a surprise when i go to the doctor
Great app for everyone with some medical issues or suspisous feeling on your self .

Definitely spot on and correct with confirming that my symptoms were due to a condition I have had but was a little different then in the past. Confirmed my suspicions. Thank God for this wonderful app.

Correctly hypothesized my illnesses, which took me years to figure out haha. Will def keep this app long term as I have a lot of medical issues. Thank you Ada developers for coming up with something so awesome and much needed :)
Very helpful, even knows the more obscure conditions. It's solidifying my growing suspicion for my condition but I've already got a doctors appointment lined up.

Great and innovative app with extensive features and a wide array of well presented information. I have been using it for years and it has never let me down. I highly recommend this app to replace frantic symptom googling with a more nuanced way to check your symptoms. Cannot replace a doctor, however, it can guide you in the right direction and alert you of any possible emergencies.

Ada is a very efficent, great and easy app to use for home diagnosis and to check over things that don't feel right. Although you can't compare Ada to a professional doctor and/or medical assistant, i'd say it's very accurate and has a variety of options for possible health issues. Ada has helped ease my mind a little when it comes to my Health Anxiety (Hypochondria) and Different anxieties I have, which has helped me sleep and night and feel mentally comfortable. I fully recommend it.

It's by far the best app of it's kind out there, sure it's not the same as an actual doctor, but the list of symptoms you can select is endless, and it gives you a pretty comprehensive report at the end. One of the best features is that it actually saves your previous potential diagnosis so you can go back to them.

So far, so good. Impressed by its diagnostic abilities so far, though I am not medically qualified. Has correctly identified polymyalgia rheumatica, an eye condition I'd never heard of and a dental abscess. May also have picked up a specific voice condition. No false diagnoses. Lists possibilities, but don't assume it necessarily covers all possible diagnoses. Answers can always be unreliable, and the questions can never be so perfect as not to be open to interpretation. Obviously very complex.

So far this app is so good, its helped me determine my illnesses without constantly saying I have cancer like amazon does. I love it! It also gives you good examples of any symptom or medical issue and explaims in case you dont know what it is! It isnt glitchy or laggy, runs smoothly and doesnt mess with any other apps, I totally recommend if your someone that gets sick easily and doesnt always know the issue!!! Ã°Å¸ââ

So much better than any online symptom checker!!! You'll love this! It's easy to use, easily transfers coloquialisms into medical terms, helps you track your symptoms, and will suggest things both short term and long. I can't tell you how frustrating it is for symptoms chefs to constantly tell me I have a short term virus or a broken bone when I've been having the same symptoms for over 2 years and know it's something more. I love this app!

this is a great tool if for people who are especially nervous about health issues i use this all the time and its been very helpful. the questions are thorough and they keep an account of past issies to try and see if theres a connection between any of them. great app

I am honestly blown away by the accuracy of this app! Is it perfect? No. But it actually has suggested something that I was able to take to my doctor to discuss. It helped us narrow down some of the issues I was having and pull them together into one overall diagnosis. I wouldn't have known to ask questions about the issue of it weren't for Ada. I'm very amazed at how it. Keeps growing too and how the clarity of followup questions is. Love Ada!!

Ada is an intelligent app. It is a sure guide to the identification of possible causes of people's health issues. It is a veritable instrument of medical advice especially at this covid-19 pandemic time. It is a near- perfect effort which all the users of android phones must identify with to help themselves and their loved ones get useful advice concerning their health.

Edit: Still feel exactly the same! Excellent, in-depth symptom questions to try and assist in figuring out what may be happening with the body. Great app that has good, up-to-date information. It works well with no lag or force closing. Ada is my new health BFF!

Great app that's easy to navigate. Wish there was a way to input the degree of different symptoms so the diagnosis can be all the more accurate. But otherwise, I use it quite often for minor health issues

Although this app may be missing a few conditions, this app really helped me figure myself out. Sidenote, I'm 15. I've been struggling for years extremely lost in my mind searching for something that sounds like my symptoms, but I couldnt find anything for months. Eventually I came across this app and it helped me a lot. I could finally explain what my symptoms were to others and my family member. Eventually I was diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder and schizophrenia. Thank you, Ada.

Worked well, but the updated version freezes at start up or returns error at log in. Now it's solved, so I change from 2 stars to 5 stars. It's really useful to know the links between several symptoms and several affections.

Insightful, this app helps me whenever i am under the weather, it could use a couple features about seasonal/local diseases that are going around but it thoroughly checks your symptoms and tells you what it could be, along with a rating of how severe it could be, treatable at home, medical advice needed or go to the emergency room. It is nice to have a better understanding of what i could be coming down with and what actions i can take.

This app is really cool and useful. The features are nothing short of the description. The AI takes in a lot of questions regarding the symptoms of the issue just as a doctor would and finally makes a report card which enlists the possible reasons for the issue.

I love this app! It has been very helpful & so easy to use. I've never had any issues or problems using it. I actually wanted to test the accuracy out on a medical issue I already knew I had by putting in some of my ailments to see what it would tell me & "bingo" it in fact said the one thing I could check with my healthcare provider about was the very thing I had. I highly recommend this app & give it ALL the stars!!

I paid for the annual subscription during their flash sale in December. The features lasted maybe a month, then disappeared. I tried to contact their support and have heard nothing back since I sent the request two weeks ago. If you use this app, never upgrade, you won't get any of the extra features they advertise and no one will help if you have issues.

I contacted their support the day I signed up for the premium trial and never heard back. Now that the trial is over and I'm signed up for a full year, the app is even less functional. It will not sync with my fitbit. I can't get up to date information. And clicking on any of the "premium" features simply pulls up a popup message asking if I want to sign up for the premium version. I AM SIGNED UP FOR THE PREMIUM VERSION. And I STILL haven't heard back from your support team.

*Update*I understand needing to make money to do your thing, you can still make money having a free option with getting more if you subscribe. Check similar apps and you'll have what you need to keep your user base up. Making this a paid service deserves the 1 star. No reason to have to pay for something that's been free for years with no real new information being provided. Revert back to free accounts with the option to pay for those "new" features and you can have your 5 stars back.

You literally can't use the app without paying for the subscription... I have Fossil Gen 6 and that requires this app for some reason so only reason I have it is because of my watch and my watch keeps track of everything on its own so this app is literally not necessary. I don't understand why they don't give you ANY features without paying for it. I'd be fine if only thing I saw was heartrate and history that I already have access on my watch. Smh.

A paid app to access a very basic function of a smartwatch. It's a shame that after purchasing high end item they still expect you to continue to pay for each feature. No thanks, other brands know how to do it correctly.

Phew. - Instantly tries to connect to Facebook on first startup (edit for clarification: that's a network connection, not an account connection) - Account creation mandatory (already bad practice for health-related apps) - Account creation *only* possible via Google account (even worse) So yeah, three red flags before I even get to see the app in action? That's a bit much.

There is no more free feature. I loved this app. I had 5 stars in it. I don't want to pay for the app. What I got for free was sufficient enough just to give me my heart rate and monitor my sleep. Everyone needs money these days. Subscriptions are so stupid.

Trying to setup my new Pixel Watch ...at no time, ever did I subscribe to or authorize a $28.00 charge for this app. Did not even know it was installed until I saw my $28.00 charge. Have requested a refund through Google. Be very careful even looking at this app.
It just wants me to sign up for the paid service and I don't want that. So, it prevents me from using any features at all. If I can't use features that just confirms that it isn't worth paying for.

Get ready to receive email spam, Even if you never opted in, and even if you haven't used the app in years. I used this app a long time ago when it would simply measure your heart rate, eventually they added features for storing your previous heart rates in their cloud service, then they added a whole bunch of extra features that probably only serve to harvest your information. I stopped using it, and now more than 5 years later, they are sending me spam for their subscription "service".
WAY way too expensive! And features aren't worth what your paying, not when other applications do the same and more for free!

As the developer said themselves, to access the app's features, you need to sign up for a subscription. That's not a free app with in-app purchases. It's a paid app masquerading as a free app. It came preinstalled on my watch, but after the sham of trying to sign up to use it for free, only to have the same experience as everyone else who had the door slammed on them when they declined to pay, it's uninstalled from my watch and my phone.

Paid money but didn't get more or different information for a year, then they want me to pay again. Nothing changed they just want more money. Before I paid there were info 'cards' never saw one after I paid. Total SCAM! Everyone should get their money back!!!! Just read in review response they put some people that paid into special test groups that didn't get all the features.

Was good until it wasn't bad customer service. I used this app daily as I have heart issues however paying for premium I was very disappointed when all of a sudden there was an error and it wouldn't work customer service had me delete/ reload/ resync as if I hadn't already tried that nothing worked. Then they said they would have tech ppl look at it. 2 weeks later I emailed again to be told there was no update...now its been over 5 months I've emailed several times with no reply.

Worked great for about 2 days. Very useful info, great idea, but it crashed yesterday, and I can't get it to even open now. I had to open my Garmin connect almost every time I opened those app, to resync my data. I was only trialing it, but I hope I didn't sign up for open join, because now I can't even get into the app to opt out! Ã°Å¸Â¤â

App on amazon watch notifies me to open it on my phone. I tap the notification to open on phone. Phone tries to open a url that is either broken or gone. So I search for the phone app. Got here to find a lot of complaints, and that the app doesn't do anything useful that I don't already get free from fitbit, and that the app can't even do what I expected. Don't know how this could have ended up as an app recommendation from Google for their new watch.

One more trial but still same old problem! Not improved and your last reply didn't help! Review of May 30, 2019: Not accurate and unreliable! Installed in an Android Wear (TicWatch S) and smartphone. Nice interface with heartbeat tracking. With Google Fit installed but no way to get sleep tracking. My Peak BMP you recorded is 140! Everyday the same 140! Fitbit surge reported it from 99 to 124 over the same 4 days. For Resting BMP you recorded 75-84 while Fitbit 63-64.

The app has not connected to Fitbit since last week. Unfortunately, this was not the first time that the connection to Fitbit broke, the previous time lasting about 2 weeks. Unfortunately, upgrading to Premium only guarantees responses to support requests with 4 business days. This is Premium service? I want to like this app, but it's too problematic and lacking adequate support response.
Lol you broke my watch and want an annual subscription to put back the features it already had? Lol! Never uninstalled anything faster

feels like whole app is designed for data gathering and not functionality for the end user. Doesn't automatically set timezone so all my workouts appeared in middle of the night. Is invasive and attempts to *label* absolutely everything including sex. Graphs are waaay too small and fiddly to see easily, pinch zoom, pinch zoom ... yawn!! Ã°Å¸ËÂ´Ã°Å¸Â¥Â´Ã°Å¸ËÂµ "maybe" useful if you have a condition that needs medical 24hr monitoring but for fitness or general use forget it. uninstalled.

Extremely disappointed in the app. Soon after I purchased the premium upgrade the additional features that I paid for, were locked out. I've tried to contact the developers twice and haven't received any response. Extremely disappointed.
Lol you broke my watch and want an annual subscription to put back the features it already had? Lol! Never uninstalled anything faster

Get ready to receive email spam, Even if you never opted in, and even if you haven't used the app in years. I used this app a long time ago when it would simply measure your heart rate, eventually they added features for storing your previous heart rates in their cloud service, then they added a whole bunch of extra features that probably only serve to harvest your information. This has been marginally useful in the past but now refuses to sync with my Fitbit Versa 2 despite disconnecting and reconnecting. The app has no trouble-shooting features and there is zero support from the company even if you pay for a subscription. Overall this is a pretty poorly written piece of software. The UI is opaque, once you sign up for Premium there's no way to check on your status, the sync function is very flaky. Overall a great idea with a lot of potential very badly implemented. NOT RECOMMENDED.

I appreciate the idea, but the implementation is flawed. Apart from a confusing UI, it failed to read data consistently from my smart watch. It would collect a heartbeat every 6 hours, regardless of what I told my Android smartwatch to do. Sometimes it would work briefly, then go back to 6 hours. Sadly, not worth the price of free.

Cardiogram is a great app, but suddenly removed Cardiogram Care last week without alerting its users. The help pages online still have all the information about Cardiogram Care, but no explanation as to why it was removed. This was one of the main benefits of having a Fossil watch; now that the feature is no longer available, I may make the switch back to Fitbit without using Cardiogram at all. It's a rather disappointing change of service, especially when it happened without warning.

Had it less than 24 hours and the app has crashed and won't open now. Tried uninstalling it and reinstalled it but same issue. Can't even use it on my watch now. Very disappointed considering I signed up for a paid subscription. Update: The app is finally working again but is very sluggish and slow. I was meant to get my risk report score last night but as I type this it's still not ready. Again, I am paying for this app. Happy to give more stars when this gets fixed.

They require you to enter your birthday, but the only way to do that is to swipe backwards through the months. I'm currently swiping through the 1990s 1 month at a time, and hope the app is monitoring my elevated heart rate as I complete this EXTREMELY STRESSFUL EXERCISE as I still have a ways to go.  Edit to add info requested in the comment: Fossil Sport Smartwatch, latest gen; connected to a Pixel 3 running up-to-date Android 9. I work in tech, and my husband's a sr. UX designer for an app dev company. We were both completely perplexed as to why you couldn't tab through the years in the date pickerÃ¢â¬âthe only way to get back to my birth year was going back through every single month between now and then.

This app is great except for one big flaw. The data it collects on my watch, and the way it presents it in the mobile app are top quality. However, it will not feed heart rate data to Google fit. (other reviews here have mentioned this, and responses suggest this is a amazon fit limitation, but the "heart trace 2" app, and the "marine commander" watch face can both feed this info to my Google fit account) Unfortunately, for me, that's a core feature, so I'm out.

Won't update my results from fitbit to cardiogram. Even though connected with full Internet, keeps saying no heart rate. When it worked it was confusing for the layout but the information presented was useful.

Yet another disappointing, useless 'health' app. Cardiogram promises insightful information but delivers nothing of use. It doesn't interface or integrate with accurate HRM devices such as the Polar H7 or H10, relying on notoriously unreliable optical HRM devices. The GIGO (garbage in garbage out) rule applies to this app; it doesnt matter how good your algorithms may be if they're using garbage input data.

Keep having trouble with this app. It's not tracking my steps consistently and keeps flagging high heart rates when I'm working as tho I'm laying down. And I work in a fast paced restaurant, so it should register way more steps than it does.
Not great so far. Created account and linked device easily enough, but seems buggy as the program now consistently crashes with either a "database error" or the even less helpful "{}".

Oh God... if it just did what it says on the tin I'd be fine: but there's all this trash about sleep and steps which I can access already. And I can't see any way to get rid of those "add a friend' buttons. Someone save us from this soc net with everything feature bloat, purleeze!

Battery drain... Signed up for a free trial. The fees after are expensive considering it is one app. 41% of my battery was used by this app alone. Some good features and info but not worth the battery drain or cost.

Purchased the premium after adding to my Fossil Gen5 Carlyle HR. Cannot access all of the "premium" features. Emailed support on 9/2, tried again on 9/4. Have received no follow up. Considering requesting refund and uninstalling.
It has some compatibility issues with Galaxy Watch 4 as mentioned in my previous review. But they did directly activate a refund when Google was stalling, so I wanted to update the review.
Worked great till you put add a friend. Not recording now. How can I get rid of that feature?

Battery drain... Signed up for a free trial. The fees after are expensive considering it is one app. 41% of my battery was used by this app alone. Some good features and info but not worth the battery drain or cost.
I don't understand why you don't integrate this app with Google Fit. So beyond confusing.

Had it less than 24 hours and the app has crashed and won't open now. Tried uninstalling it and reinstalled it but same issue. Can't even use it on my watch now. Very disappointed considering I signed up for a paid subscription. Update: The app is finally working again but is very sluggish and slow. I was meant to get my risk report score last night but as I type this it's still not ready. Again, I am paying for this app. Happy to give more stars when this gets fixed.

Error occur tried to get premium they charge me first month and still can not use premium features

Charged for what was advertised as a free trial and it's already having sync delays. I had the app 20 minutes. Update: Got refunded. So, I uninstalled the app. It was just slow in updating the readings taken with my watch. I don't need this for medical reasons, just for fun, but if I did, reliable readings would be pretty important. Hope you guys can improve.

The design and features of the app are well curated, definitely above the average when it comes to other heart measurement apps around. However I can't seem to find a way to sync my measurements to Google Fit. New measurements don't appear on my Google Fit account, and I can't seem to find a way to perform automatic measurements each n minutes or sync the data to Google Fit each m minutes, like other apps do.

This app is a great idea but it does need some updates. I have managed to set everything up but the Fitbit says connected but sadly no information is being gathered by the app. For the people who's moaning about the age just tab Top Date and then a new window will open up. Giving it 1 star for your own incompetence is just sad. I sure hope they do get round to sorting out the issues.

Kind of defeats the purpose if I have to manually take a reading everytime I want my HR to be logged. Automatic logging is inconsistent, infrequent and often unreliable. Came pre-installed on my Wear OS watch so was stuck with it until I found about Heart Trace 2. Now I don't use Cardiogram at all. Would give it a try again if the devs fix the existing issues and improve the fidelity of the recorded data if at all recorded.

You need to hire an interface designer and a graphic designer REAL BAD. It's one of the worst interfaces I've seen in a while and you just spit in the face of interface standards. This app should be about saving lives and not about struggling to find features and guessing how to enter data...

App is supposed to track the steps you take but as it's linked to location and actual arm movement, it keeps logging me as moving even when I'm sitting still watching tv for an hour or more at a time or even asleep in bed for maybe 6 unbroken hours, during which time I've apparently taken hundreds of steps.. also, with actual travelling it goes by road distance as shown on Google maps etc and if you walk and take a big shortcut it thinks you ran or cycled.. needs looked into and fixed please
I like the resolution of the measurements this app takes. However, the UI is very slow to respond, and sometimes the app doesn't load at all. Closing and reopening it works.
I really like the features of this app, but when I attempt to upgrade to premium I get an error immediately. I tried emailing support, but they are unresponsive.

I have used this for 2 years with my Pixel 2+ Fossil Gen 5 watch. I recently replaced the phone with a Pixel 6. Now, cardiogram is no longer usable. I've had to uninstall it from my watch and phone. The app was labelling sleep multiple times per day, draining watch battery and the watch was freezing and resetting the date to April 15. Removing the app has eliminated watch issues. I was a premium subscriber. I'm sad to leave cardiogram.

App flickered and was jumpy at installation. Took a few days to create the journal feature, provides a nice snapshot of information, vuitt baf yet to talk sleep. Does not do anything my Fossil Venture does not already do. Not tracking sleep, which was the reason for downloading.

Regarding resting heart rate. I earlier had fitbit and now i am using wear os (fossil sport). My resting heart rate in fitbit as well as amazon fit has always been between 45-55 bpm. But cardiogram always show 60. Never 59 never 61. It always shows 60 bpm as my resting heart rate even when for the same day amazon fit shows 45 or 47 or 50. The cardiogram resting heart rate never fluctuates. I feel the functionality is broken.

I don't see what this adds over other (Garmin) apps? As for the social media links, no thanks... The Garmin app is far more detailed and flexible. I thought this implies this app added more, it's doesn't, just keeps promoting to upgrade to unlock features that are FREE on the Garmin app, and many others.... App Deleted.
It's ok but not brilliant. Frequently fails to update when requested to. Like the tag option on the graphs & the notes section.
It looks app has good features but unable to sync with amazon fit is lacking one. Also not sure how badly its impacting watch battery, I would observe it.
I definitely like the gragh better than the amazon fit app HOWEVER there are consistently large gaps and missing bars in the heart rate data and it never detects when im sleeping.

We bought Cardiogram Premium so I could monitor a family member's heart rate. Her heart rate is showing on her Cardiogram app (apple), however, on mine (android) it had a 19-hour delay. We were under the impression that it would be a continuous and real-time monitoring. Would love to get more information on what the expectation is on how this feature functions.
Nice features and diagrams, but there is no way to sync the data with Google Fit.
Deleting the app untill it fixes the data write feature on amazon fit. So far, it can only read data but not write
The health score part needs a full upgrade. It is kind of confusing
Was good now crashing. Tried to reinstall but still not working.
Was working well but now it just freezes when you try to open it.
Having trouble seeting up the bp feature on the samsung watch 4

Garmin partial integration: HR, sleep & steps, yes; exercise & pulse ox, no. Some "apparent" useful analysis: compares data with others to identify potential risk factors like diabetes, sleep apnea & hyper tension. Identified a 31% apnea risk but Garmin pulse-ox sleep levels are fine - doesn't look like this is accounted for in assessing this - not making most of Garmin data? Trustworthy? Reports not updated as often as they say they will, habit history lost in recent crash but back now.

Finally fixed the workout and sleep issues on Garmin devices, but the app really funny doesn't provide any additional value above Garmin connect. Basically you're giving them your data for zero return.

App crashes when try to insert profile photo.There's no metric option and 
you need to convert to US centric units for height and weight.

It was alright until now. Keeps crashing on start up and I've uninstalled 
its as well. Can you have a look at fixing this... Expedia XZ premium
